No comment
No comment
No comment

Ordered a burger rare and it, along with every other medium rare burger at the table, arrived grey throughout. Was still tasty, and the service was good, but I'd rather not be given an option if they can't act on it.
A neighborhood staple for us. Delicious comfort food, consistent service, and cozy space. Love the grilled cheese, great burger and the mussels are a highlight.

Wonderful friendly staff, excellent food, extremely cute decor, charming lighting, welcoming great service. Not sure which aspect of our meal to rave about first. Every dish was simply delicious, and the whole atmosphere makes you really feel at home. We began our meal with a very fresh burrata complemented by apple and arugula. The breads which come are dangerous as they are so fresh and good that you may fill up on those alone. The mains of beautiful pasta, lamb burger and cucumber tzaziki, and a wonderfully presented steak were delicious. The cocktails were very nice, and there is a good beer selection. Most of all, we enjoyed the food, cozy atmosphere, and the kindness of the staff. The owner(?) even ran down the block, without a coat, in the NYC winter, after us to give us a bag we accidentally left behind. This place is definitely a gem and the best place I've been to in Williamsburg!
I have been coming here for years, the service is amazing backyard is great to sit on. Lamb burger is to die for, It really is one of my favorite places in NYC..
No comment

A lovely laidback but polished vibe offering a quality menu. The spinach cannelloni and gnocchi were great. The outdoor area in the back looked really nice, I'll be remembering to come back here on a warm summer night.
I have yet to find a flaw with Sweetwater.  Lovely decor and staff, delicious cocktails (perfectly shaken Martini and wonderful Brooklyn), mouth-watering ribeye steak with chimichurri sauce.

I knew we were in for a great night at Sweetwater when our very nice (and cute) waiter Matt recommended one of my favorites, truffle gnocchi. Mmmmm... My friends also really enjoyed their meal, and we all loved the Malbec. The atmosphere was lovely, would make a great date spot, but served me well for a night of reminiscing with old friends. Thanks again, Matt!
No comment

I've been going to Sweetwater for about 11 years & it is a decent spot for drinks. Went in recently and ordered the kale salad, burger and fries. Kale salad had nice flavor but was too light on the kale and too heavy on the cheese. The burger and fries were busted, way too much salt and the texture and tangy flavor of the beef were not hitting me right. My boyfriend, who ordered the same thing, felt the same way.
No comment

Sweet Water used to be one of my favorite bars and is now one of my favorite restaurants.  The food is French bistro-y with great burgers and awesome fries.  The prices are low and the booths are cozy.  Plus they have a great deck in the back to enjoy in warm weather.

Excellent food, great service.  The menu is a bit small and esoteric, but as long as you can afford the bill, you shouldn't be disappointed.  Don't bother with an appetizer;  you get free bread as soon as you sit down.
No comment

I die for the Gnocchi!!!! It seriously just melts in your mouth. Its probably my most favorite meal in brooklyn. I think the ambiance of the restaurant is great. they also have a patio open in the summer. Only bummer is its cash only.
Decent bistro grub if you don't mind eating inside a jet engine. I spent the night screaming into my friend's ear. Afterwards I was hoarse.

A good enough neighborhood-y joint that is likely a go-to for those who live nearby.  We met friends out here for dinner and since none of us lives near the restaurant, it was perplexing as to why we trekked out to Williamsburg for what seems to be very run-of-the-mill pub-style food.  That said, the quality was excellent and the service was good.  I wouldn't recommend going out of your way for it, but if you find yourself in Williamsburg with a hankering for a burger, this is a great choice!

It was the first place I ate when I visited NY and everything else after that was a letdown. I love the atmosphere and that they use old glass bottle for water. If  you order wine, they put a pail (literally a pail) of ice on your table. The food is great and it gets you satisfy, but not too full. The Food of the Gods dessert was so decadence...it was just swimming in chocolate. I like how small and quaint the place is and definitely one of the highlights of my NY trip.

had a great feast here when i was visiting NY last week. The half chicken and veggies were amazing, and portions were huge. my buddies girlfriend had the mussels which she said were great. We ordered takeout and they forgot our calamari which we realized when we got home, called them and they said sorry and a credit is waiting for my buddy next time he eats there...Overall a great little spot. Glad i got to try it out
No comment
LOVE Sweetwater.  Always a nice spot for a meal or a simple glass of wine at the bar, they also have a cool backyard deck for warmer months.
Consistently good food served by nice people. You can always count on a comfortable meal in a nice location.

Had a lovely experience at Sweetwater last night.  They staff is incredibly nice & helpful.  They do a great job with the food.  I had the mussels which were excellent.  Great fries.  Bruschetta appetizer was yummy.  We all had a variety of cocktails that were great.  You cannot leave w/o any dessert.  The dessert is off the hook!  Try the desserts that are like a chocolate molten cake and banana cream pie w/ an oreo crust.  mmmm.  Love the decor - cozy.
No comment

Two words: quinoa burger. AMAZING! The food is always great - although I only come for brunch. Do yourself a favor and get one of the daily scones. They come from a nearby bakery and are to die for. Comfy atmosphere. You can sit in the back, or up front in the leathery booths next to the bar. The only negative thing I will mention is that the service is lacking. It seems to be a consistent thing at brunch - there's a lot of waiting for water and coffee refills. Maybe they need more servers?
No comment

Eat here every so often. Went this Sunday night got a great booth seat super sweet waitress and host. I am always happy when I eat here. There is reason why this place has been around forever! great service, good food and atmosphere other Williamsburg eateries should study this place.
No comment

I love this place, been coming here for years. Owners and waitstaff are lovely. Amazing wine list. Food is always right on. I love their watermelon salad in the summer. Brunch is good, can be a bit crowded but it's nice to sit out back. Great vibe and atmosphere.
I love the spot, the outdoor and indoor seating areas are great, and the  food is great (but whenever I'm there I only order mussels and scallops)

Sweetwater is one of my favorite restaurants in Williamsburg.  Their burgers on english muffins are amazing, as are their drinks.  The back room gets a little crowded and noisy, but the outside seating is great.

This is my favorite restaurant in New York.  The cocktails and onion rings (yes, onion rings) alone deserve five stars.  The entrees are awesome, and if you are very lucky, they'll give you a complimentary pastry from Bakeri as an appetizer!  Plus, when the weather is nice, the outdoor seating in the back is adorable.
Incredibly friendly staff, great vibe, perfect drinks, good food. A total neighborhood gem.
No comment
Adorable decor, thought out menu, a genuine bistro surrounded by too many cliche Williamsburg restaurants.
No comment

Where do I start?  This is my neighborhood go to place.  The four cheese gnocchi is just about the best I've ever had, and the burger melts in your mouth.  Love the tin ceilings, the back patio, the sweet wait staff and amber glow that permeates the restaurant in the evening hours.  Don't forget to try the extremely decadent 'Food of the Gods' chocolate cake swimming in thick, creamy chocolate sauce! UGHHH.
No comment

Sunday brunch...they accept reservations! Good fresh food, well spiced, well priced. Music is notable, but able to hear each other at the table. Not crowded in. Good service, fairly priced. Sensitive to special requests (e.g. dietary issues). No pressure to leave. Highly recommended.
A nice quaint date spot. Cant speak for the food because I didn't have it but the drinks were nice and it had a decent ambiance.

Weary from travel and empty stomachs, my boyfriend and I wandered into Sweetwater on the evening of Thanksgiving in search of a meal and some drinks. For the holiday, they were busy but sat us at the bar right away. The staff were so friendly, they were sure to say "Happy Thanksgiving!" To all who entered and again  as they left. The bartender that served us at the bar, I wish I remembered her name, was incredible. Our drinks were made perfectly. I got the Thanksgiving dinner which was exactly what I was looking for. So good. Just like home. My boyfriend got the gnocchi and it too was delicious. As the night wrapped up the bartender asked if she could buy us a shot for thanksgiving, she made us a delicious and unique shot and did it with us. The staff all seemed very close, like family. Spending our Thanksgiving meal here made it feel like family, not so far from home. I love this bar and the energy from the staff. The place could carry itself on the quality of the food and drink...but the staff are what makes this place extra special. I'll be back next time that I am in Brooklyn!

We sat outside on a Thursday night and their back patio is gorgeous and cozy. I had the lamb burger on the English muffin with their Sweetwater amber ale. The burger was great and the beer was pretty good for a 5$ draft. I would definitely recommend the patio for a summer date or a casual dinner. Total for drink & entree & tip was 24$.
No comment

A cozy dinner spot in hipster williamsburg, this features delicious food (I got the steak, ordered medium well and cooked to perfection, the meat was so tender it melted in my mouth), my girlfriend got the Sweet Water Burger (served on an english muffin, ordered medium rare, emerging medium well and reportedly delectable in spite of this) and our companion for the weekend ordered the chicken breast, which she described as just what she needed and certainly looked perfectly edible. Aside from great food the atmopshere was perfect, romantic, cozy, yet at the same time a very scenester place. The pricing was somewhat misleading (the $9 burger turned into an $11 burger once cheese was acounted for, the $16 dollar steak became an $18 dollar steak once my request for onion rings instead of fries was processed) and somewhat blaise service from waitresses and waiters that were only too obviously working there to be "scene" rather than for a living, the bill including 4 drinks came to $100 even, inluding tip $125, my one major complain is that once we were finished eating we were hurried out of the place somewhat in order to accomadate others waiting for their dinner, instead of repeatedly asking us if we were through or if we needed anyhting else in a rushed tone, they could have asked us to move our conversation over to the bar, a minor complaint was a lack of a dessert menu.
No comment
Fantastic place,  great staff,  great owner.  Went with a group from work very happy all around.  Lamb burger,  and banafi cake amazing.

Absolutely a fantastic breakfast/brunch. I arrived hung over, which was quickly remedied with some of the best coffee I have ever tasted. I got the eggs benedict and it was superbly flavored and textured with a portion large enough to satisfy, but not overwhelm. the waitress was a bit aloof, but she was cute so it all made up for it in the end.  Hallelujah!

We had dinner at Sweetwater last night and our first clue that it was going to be good was that there was a pretty good crowd in there when we looking for a spot around 6:30, unlike most of the other well-rated eateries in Williamsburg that were all mostly empty. The place just filled up and got busier as the night wore on. The food amply justified all this patronage and the wait staff was helpful, friendly and attentive. Nice neighborhood bistro ambience, albeit busy. Not really the call for a quiet romantic evening, but a warm and friendly feeling and a charming atmosphere. Waiters working hard to make it work, floaters pitching in to keep it going. Our table sampled the fried calamari, which was pretty darn good and we're picky about that; light, fresh and tender; the surest clue that a restaurant has a high quality bar. We also had the onion soup with gruyere which won a strong nod, the sausage and bean soup was terrific, and the rib eye steak was outstanding. My wife and I shared the pork tenderloin and the beet and feta salad, both excellent. Fun evening in Williamsburg and we will go back to Sweetwater.

Bad, snotty service, but good solid food at a good price. the place is noisy and cramped but if you are looking for a place to have dinner in williamsburg, this is a good choice. for some reason this did not seem like the cleanest place to me....
best spot in willy b ! customer service is on point for everyone they are a good crew ! and the food is a+

Came in on two occasions, the first time for a brunch. The brioche french toast was delicious and the bartender knew how to make a mean bloody mary. The next time came in for a quick bite, ordering the cured meats and some cheeses, and after trying it with the suggested barolo, decided to stay for dinner. I was not disappointed! The Pork Tenderloin wrapped in proscuitto served with green apple & potato mash, yes as good as it sounds. Didnt have room for dessert, but next time I will.
No comment

Went here on a friend's recommendation. Had the watermelon salad, the sea bass special, and the mussels special. The food was great, but the sea bass took forever to come out. Our waitress made up for this by offering us a free coffee (him) and a free glass of wine (me). Really enjoyed this place overall.
Solid lunch place. Good service, fare portions. Home style cuisine, comfort food done right. Good wines, good value.
mmmm, i remember sticking my fork into the lamb shank i ordered there and the meat falling right off the bone.  i love meat.  i may have to go back there tonight...
brunch is packed.but the food is just alright.wish they will be better
such an awesome restaurant with great prices / vibe. completely underestimated gem.
Really love this restaurant.  They have the best burger in the neighborhood.  I've been here 6 or 7 times, and the food is always great.  I highly recommend checking them out.

There are many good restaurants in Williamsburg, and this one is one of the best.  Good food, service and atmosphere.  The latter is the best, and maybe the attractions.  Sit inside or outside in good weather.  Enjoy the experience.
love the atmosphere of this place. get the truffle cheese gnocchi, a vodka lemonade and the "banafi" pie with hazelnut ice cream for dessert, you will be in heaven.

I've eaten here twice and the food is okay - nothing that blows you away and both times I have been a bit stuck with the menu - nothing that really grabs me.  I had a steak on the first visit - not bad, second visit the canneloni which was okay, as others have said it was swimming in oil and something missing.  The service is attentive, except the one waitress must have had her boyfriend positioned at the bar, she kept coming over to rub his back and kiss him.  At one stage she leant over to kiss him and I had a full eyeful of her knickers.
No comment

This is a cute place, and the mussels I had were delicious. However, the service really detracted from that. The waitress was brusque and kind of rude, and kept trying to clear the table before I was finished. They had a good selection of beers on draft and they were cheap, and the mussels were addictively good.

I love the look, the food and the service.  It is a beautifully old feeling restaurant and bar.  The food and drinks are a not cheap, but worth the money because the food is soooo good, and it's good across the board.  The salads are complex and fresh and wonderful, the french fries are great, and I've tried and loved so many of the main courses that it is always hard to decide.  Inside or outside, it's always fun to eat there.

This used to be a cool punk bar, then it was a romantic little restaurant. Now the food is pretty gross.  I had calamari app, which had some pieces of quill in it. The gnocchi was greasy mushy slop.  The cannelloni was a soggy mess sitting in a bowl of oil.  Hated the food.  Two stars because the dirty martini was great.
Yummy food. Authentic Taiwanese. Highly recommend. Nice service. Sausage is delicious. Everything is delicious.
No comment
No comment

This place is amazing! Hidden gem! If you happen to go to a fair or bazaar and find this stand, definitely give it a try, you won't be disappointed. The woman serving the food was so nice and answered any questions. The food was delicious and made the experience come full circle. Give this a try! They have pescatarian options as well.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Savory Tofu - flavor mixture was tasty; texture variety was great; wish it were served hot instead of lukewarm; felt the toppings were slightly too much compare with the tofu.
No comment
No comment

This is my go-to place at the heart of Chinatown where I buy their popular tofu pudding. It is one of the best tofu puddings. You can choose either savory or plain. I usually go for the plain. They make it in their shop as well as with their other food products. I love their grass jelly as well. I normally order plain tofu with honey, grass jelly, rice cake, and herbal tea to help with my yeet-hay. It is a small store so many people buy it to go, but they do have outdoor seating with a small table and chairs.  Definitely check it out if you are craving for some dessert.

I was pleasantly surprised how much I enjoyed this tofu. Fong On has tofu with two main flavor profiles, sweet and savory. I ordered the savory tofu pudding, which comes with the following toppings: dried shrimp, pickled radish, fried shallots, scallions, sesame oil, and chili sauce. The combination of these flavors should be as pleasantly tasting, but it is surprisingly. The tofu is creamy and slightly warm. The only thing that may freak you out is the dried shrimp, which has tiny black eyes that you can see. Definitely a place that you should try. They have outside seating if you want to eat your tofu there, which I totally recommend because the toppings will get soggy in the tofu after a while.
No comment

Tofu pudding so good taro balls so glutinous red beans so deliciously textured paired with everything 10/10. I wouldve taken a better pic but i was so ready to dive into it. Soy milk bottled 10/10. unsweet and sweet available

Can see why this is the oldest family owned tofu shop in NYC. The tofu is so fresh and delicious. I have to say it's better than the one on Mott Street. Also recommend the soy milk drink here. Will definitely come back to try their other items. Around the corner is also Hak Box with their rice rolls.

we stopped by after grabbing lunch nearby. It hits different when you see the giant tank of fresh tofu being  brought out. We ordered a small tofu pudding with ginger syrup and #3 with ginger syrup. We also got soymilk and a block of tofu take home. The tofu pudding was so smooth and yummy on a cold day. Service is super quick and everything came out to be $20! Definitely will be coming back in the future!

I've been wanting to try Fong On for a while and was excited to finally go! I got a small savory tofu with all the toppings and then a rice cake box mix with the brown and white rice cakes. The tofu was super delicious and all the topping were yummy & blended well together. Tasted super authentic! The rice cakes were also pretty good but a bit too sweet compared to some other ones I've had. I liked that you could mix the box with different flavors. Definitely recommend stopping by! I want to try the sweet tofu next time.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

We got a large sweet dou hua with toppings here. It's extremely pricey for the small portion size and average tasting dou hua (but dou hua is pretty "normal" dish - I don't expect large variations in quality). We got boba, ai yu jelly, and grass jelly as the toppings. The dou hua and syrup tasted like your typical dou hua, as did the jelly toppings. The boba was a bit hard, but not too bad. One issue in general with getting toppings is that it partly masks the taste of the dou hua.
No comment

Cute little shop that a friend recommended and it did not disappoint! I love dou hua or the soft tofu custard and theirs is great! I got it plain with ginger syrup which is like the og and it was great! Nice and warm, silky texture and with just the right amount of sweetness.  My partner also got the soft rice cakes in ginger and original flavor which was also good! Would def recommend!
So happy to see Kelly! So efficient, kind and sweet! Had another big order and she was so organized!!! Thanks so much for the fresh tofu, soy bean milk and rice cakes. Stay safe and stay well
No comment
No comment
Their rice cakes and soymilk are so yummy and fresh! I want to go back very soon. The employees were so nice and helpful.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I saw this place randomly on a Tiktok video and decided to trek down here to try it out. Oh my goodness, the brown sugar rice cake was the best. It's so fluffy and soft but not too sweet, I can't stop eating it and even drooling now as I'm writing the review. If I'm ever in Chinatown again, will definitely come back. You gotta try this. Matcha was good too, not too much matcha/butter taste.
The pudding was very smooth and it was not too sweet. The red beans and grass jelly together added an nice earthy flavor. All together it gave it a nice texture.
No comment
No comment

Love tofu pudding, but I was not a fan of the price when I first saw the menu. Then I took a bite of the tofu pudding both sweet and savory version and the rice cake...that was enough to change my mind about the prices. I mean you can't really blame me, I'm use to seeing a much lower price for tofu pudding but dear tofu lords...their tofu pudding was the most silkiest I've ever tasted. Enough for me to say take my money!!!! It's for the amazing craftsmanship and supporting Chinatown businesses!!! Heart you guys!
No comment

Best, freshest rice cakes in Chinatown -- bar none. The staff is also really friendly and helpful. I also love their hot tofu. When I make the trip downtown, I buy as many of these rice cakes as I can and freeze them. I steam them in the microwave and they're good as new.
Got the "can't go wrong" with cold tofu and ginger syrup. Soooooooo delicious and refreshing!  Will def come back again when I am in the area.
No comment
No comment
Love the tofu with ginger honey. Its one of my nostalgic favorites from Chinatown. There are only a few places that make tofu and even fewer that are considered good. This is my spot for dessert.
No comment
No comment

Everything here is really good. Especially the savory tofu pudding! The sweet one is also good as well. You can add whatever toppings you wanted. I like it the traditional way with ginger syrup. The rice cakes is also yummy it definitely brings back childhood memories and there's no other place I know that still makes this. My favorite will always be the original rice cake. They also have brown sugar, matcha and ginger as well. Oh and not to mention they have fresh soy milk too!
I have been missing great Chinese-style soy milk, and was happy to find it for cheap in Chinatown. Ordering process was simple. The milk was good and tasted fresh.

Tofu pudding was a treat that I enjoyed during my childhood. Each bite stirs up fond memories of enjoying this treat with my family. It had been years since I'd last enjoyed tofu pudding before I stumbled upon Fong On. Their "Can't Go Wrong" tofu pudding combo (taro balls, grass jelly, and red beans) with ginger syrup is my go-to order. They have combined each of my favorite toppings in one simple to order item. If sweet is not what you're feeling, there's also the savory route. You can chose one of their pre-set combos or chose 3 toppings from their list. The tofu is silky soft and falls apart in your mouth. The quality of their tofu is top notch. I also recommend trying their soy milk.

I can't believe this place exists! I used to eat savory tofu puddings as breakfast when I was living in China, and ever since I moved to the US, I only occasionally had them when I go to China to visit family, so I was thrilled to find out about Fong On on Instagram. My friend and I came here to try the savory tofu pudding on a Saturday after our long run, and it did not disappoint! The toppings were different than what I had growing up, but I still loved them. The pickled radish and the hot sauce were great sides for the hot and soft tofu. We sat outside and finished our food almost right away. I would come back again and again.
No comment

The first time I went here, I got my savory tofu pudding and standing on the sidewalk outside I opened it to taste a spoonful. I ended up just eating the entire thing right there. It's one of those things that is greater than the sum of its parts, and each of the parts is pretty damn good to begin with. The tofu, obviously, is fantastic. That combined with the textures of all the toppings is a perfect breakfast or snack.
No comment
No comment

I love their "bak tong go" (white sugar cakes)!!! They have different flavors too -- matcha, brown sugar, etc other than just plain white (although plain white is still my fave). Their tofu pudding is also sooo good and fluffy.

My favorite tofu pudding place!!! I crave this place all the time and would come out to Chinatown every Sunday morning from Queens with my parents and wait for it to open. They sell cold and hot tofu pudding and have optional toppings as well as different flavored sugar/syrup. My favorite is hot tofu pudding with no toppings and ginger sugar. Absolutely delicious! The tofu pudding do not come in the regular large plastic pints but round paper bowls. They also sell various flavored rice cakes including matcha which comes in a box with 6 cut pieces. Additionally, they have bottled drinks such as herbal tea and soy milk. Herbal tea is on the sweeter side but still very refreshing on a hot, summer day. They have three small tables outside if you want to sit and eat. .

0 for the service and attitude. What an awful experience at this place. They ignore their asian patrons. They had two people servicing just one non-Asian lady, while my mother and I were ignored. I don't like to bring up the race card, however every person that walked in after us were Non Asian, most likely due to social media following and they  were greeted with respect and a friendly smile, while the two of us were ignored.  We were transparent to them except for the non Asian customer mentioned earlier prancing around. Be kind to everyone.  Whomever walks in to your store is a paying customer. What ever race or people that walk in to your store, treat everyone with kindness, equally and with respect.  Your employees clearly have no respect for the elderly and for people of their own community.
No comment
No comment

Was in the mood for tofu dessert and heard good things about this place. Overall i wasnt that impressed. Ive had silkier tofu desserts before. This place was just average. We tried both the sweet and savory. The savory smelled good but the ingredients weren't that great. The rice cakes were good. I had brought it in the early afternoon and by the evening the brown cake started to taste a little sour. I put the cake in the fridge but it got hard the next day. Hubby did get the sweeten soy milk and enjoyed it.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

SO GOOD. Took my none asian and vegan friend here and she loved the soft tofu. We got the savory and sweet and we both preferred the savory. The rice cake was also so delicious. Highly recommend coming down to Chinatown and trying this place!

Love their herbal drink and sweetened soy milk! Recently tried their silken tofu with red bean, grass jelly, and taro balls and it was so good! Opted to try the almond syrup that literally tastes like the boxed almond jello (SO GOOD) and the employee gave us a brown sugar syrup too in case we didn't like the almond syrup! So nice of her! Definitely coming back next time we're in Chinatown! Love Fong On!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Underrated and one of my favorite things I had in New York! Everything about this was perfect. The tofu was the perfect texture but when mixed with all of the toppings, these textures were immaculate. Such a simple dish but done perfectly. The chili oil was the perfect amount of spice. Everything just worked really well and this dish was perfect harmony. Definitely check it out if you're in the area. I would even go out of my way to come here. I regret sharing the large with 2 other people. Wish I had gotten my own. I took it down to pier 35 to enjoy and watch the sunset. Perfect evening.
No comment
No comment

They have a variety of sweet and savory flavors to choose from. The line was not too long. I enjoyed the regular tofu with ginger syrup. The rice cakes were a bit strong in flavor for me, but I would come back for more tofu pudding.
No comment
No comment

I arrived near closing time so we missed out on the popular taro ball and boba toppings, however the tofu is really the star of the show. It's very silky and light, many places tend to make it denser so it's not as easy to enjoy. The staff was very nice and gave us a box of rice cakes on the house. They were flavored  the same as the ginger sugar syrup you'd normally pour over tofu. Do yourself a favor and get the ginger syrup for tofu as well!
No comment
Incredibly delicious, super fast and friendly service, I could very happily eat their savory tofu every single day!

Family tradition really is a thing. Taken on by one of the sons this multigenerational shop specializes in some great chinese dishes. The soy drinks are wonderful along with the herbal drinks. The tofu desserts are always a must. You definitely have to get it with the syrup. Wonderful friendly owner and a great shop. I will be back.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place SLAPS. If you like tofu, you need to stop by and get a sweet tofu pudding. This place reminds me of my childhood. I get a large or extra large sweet tofu pudding plain with ginger syrup. Their tofu is so silky smooth and soft (unless you get the dredges at the end of the day, don't do that). They give you just enough syrup so that it's pleasantly sweet. It's a great cooling dessert in the summer, surprisingly so. If you want to spice things up a bit, adding some red bean is a great idea. Please come here!! Some of the best tofu you'll ever have, for a very affordable and cooling snack.
No comment
No comment

Great tofu (in all its varieties)! With toppings or by the block, they do tofu very well. The only downfall is the inside can feel a bit stuffy and disorganized but I think the space may just have an odd layout. Great tofu nonetheless.
No comment

This place reminds me so much of childhood. Cold, sweetened soy milk is just perfect for a hot summer day with no appetite. One sip and I was in tears:') Got the rice cakes too, a mix of white and brown. I grew up with these but couldn't find them anywhere in NYC. The texture of the two are very different. The white one has a more pronounced wine smell & taste and is quite dense and chewy. The brown one is much lighter. Both were good and sweet. And frankly for $5 you get a generous portion (it's quite heavy). I ended up saving have of the box in the freezer to enjoy later.

This is an old school family owned Tofu pudding place on the edge of Chinatown in the Lower East Side . I rode a bike down Allen street to get here . I got the cold Tofu pudding a small one. You get to choose toppings and a sweet syrup to go on top. I chose the ginger syrup but I think they also had almond and another flavor. For topping I got the Aloe balls and rainbows jelly pieces. Very tasty ! Not too sweet but just enough. I think that combination is good for a first timer .Was like $5 and they have tables outside. They also have fresh soy milk and Chinese herbal tea and rice cakes but I will try that next time . Recommended.

Was commuting home, & happen to walk by. Saw a crowd inside, & wondered what it was all about. I'm not a big fan of tofu dessert, but the my other half is. She decided to try, & ordered the tofu pudding (S, $3.75). It tasted silky, & smooth, but on the bland side. Not sure if they added syrup, or very little. I can say the product was made well, but wasn't my thing. This is another one, & done, although, i'm curious to try the savory tofu option. That's something I've never had before; &, i like to try new things.

I have been going to Fong On ever since I was a kid.  I love their soybean milk and soft tofu with syrup.  This sure brings back memories of my childhood.  They have since added a whole lot of new flavors to the rice cakes and the green tea was my favorite.

The tofu is amazing.  I had the sweet combo with azuki beans, taro balls and grass jelly and brought home an extra plain tofu, plain grass jelly and a rice cake.  I paid $22.  Seems pretty pricey for what you get. The old spot is much cheaper but does not offer the trendy flavors and I'm fine with that.  Leave this for the tourists.
No comment

column3: William Penn Annex West, Philadelphia, PA
column6: No comment

I've been here a few times now and typically get the savory tofu. It's quite good for what it is. This time around, we got the sweet tofu pudding. The place is clean and gives off a lab vibe. The staff upfront are friendly and efficient. I'd definitely recommend coming, especially if you enjoyed tofu pudding as a kid.
A family owned business that has been around for generations! Handmade and local tofu snacks and drinks.

I really love the interior of the new location. Looks super refreshing and inviting. I got the tofu fa (tofu custard) and sweetened soy milk to go. The tofu is super smooth and fresh. Next time, I must try the savory. Still nice and hot when I got home. I requested the ginger and brown simple sugar and it is divine together.

If you grew up in the 70's and 80's and remember the location on Mott St. this new version is very different. Its modern and more on the upscale side. You won't find the older chinese folks shopping here. The clientele is teenagers, Millennials and Foodie folks. In my opinion the location is not ideal. Its on the out skirts of Chinatown a part of chinatown that is now disappearing to getrification and is more LES. Its also more of a desert place rather then coming here for Chang Fun and Tofu. Prices are a little higher. The Bak Tong Go is really good. It is very fresh, soft amd not too sweet. The Soft Tofu traditionally is served with a drizzling of sumple syrup. Here you will find a variety of toppings. They also serve a savory version with various toppings. They also have Grass Jelly but only comes in the small Pint size. They also have Soy and Grass Jelly drink and of course Chang Fun and Tofu.

Wow, and I thought that my kids would never rice cakes like I did when I grew up. When they tasted the White and Yellow versions they asked why they never had them before.  I told them that I've been searching for something 'above' what tea houses have. The ONLY thing that I missed was having them in a white take out box as I experienced while growing up in the LES.  A new fave for my family!

If you love white sugar rice cake and tofu fa, you will love this spot. Has a trendier vibe than the average mom and pop tofu shop but does not lose in flavor. The catch is a noticeably pricer menu. Tofu pudding or known as tofu fa is $4.50 for a large, which is actually really small in size and can be compared to a small in regular tofu shops. The white sugar rice cake which also comes in brown sugar or matcha flavor is $5. The texture is so good and chewy and has the perfect level of sweetness. Space is really small and meant to be grab and go.
No comment

I have been wanting to come to this spot for a really long time and finally got to go. Honestly, I've been eyeing a lot of their menu items and wanted to try everything out but settled for their tofu with herbal jelly, red bean ad taro topping (believe its #1). It is a rather large dessert for one person- I shared this and felt super full after! We ate the tofu with just the toppings first, without the ginger syrup because the toppings were sweet enough. The flavors work and I couldn't stop eating the taro balls and red bean toppings. I think the herbal jelly was just okay, maybe because mine felt like they were scraps from whats left of the batch. Either way, the tofu was really good and super silky. We added some ginger syrup to the leftover tofu (a good half cup) and it was very satisfying to eat. I ate this on a rather hot day and the tofu itself is served hot but it was too good to give up. I think next time, I'll buy it and have it cold because that's my preferred way of eating it. Definitely will be back for more tofu and for they rice cakes!
A Chinatown mainstay serving delicious various tofu foods and desserts! You can taste the quality of the tofu which is made fresh on premises with lots of classic toppings.

The store is on the east broadway area and take's me a couple of different train transfers to get to but it's well worth it. The white, brown, and ginger steam cakes are so good and fresh. The best, better than dim sum place or bakery's. They remind of of childhood comfort food. I'm so glad you can still find it in NYC. I've also had the tofu, decent. During covid reopening they are available for takeout, but on fri sat sun. Go support your local business!!

Ever since covid, I don't know where to get tofu flower but I'm glad to find this hidden gem. It's unfortunate that it's only open Friday-Sunday so I'll have to wait to get some. I prefer the original. I did try one of their special with muchi, red bean and herbal jelly. There's just too much going on for me. Overall, it's a great place to get your tofu, sticky rice cake, herbal and soy drinks.

NOW THIS IS EXACTLY WHAT I NEEDED IN CHINATOWN!! I'm from San Jose, which is a predominantly asian community and when I lived in NYC I felt right at home at Fong On! Their hot tofu reminds me of my favorite Filipino dessert Taho and love that everything is vegan friendly! I always go for the ginger syrup, EXTRA red bean, and grass jelly or boba! Need to go back for their fresh AF soy milk too! SUPPORT SMALL AND SUPPORT FONGON because they need to be there when I move back!!
No comment
Tried a melange of rice cakes and found each one lovely. I preferred the mouthfeel of the plain white, but the coconut and matcha were deliciously flavored.
No comment

Large portions for a decent price. We had the sweet tofu pudding with three toppings. Definitely worth the price because even their "small" is a pretty large portion that two people could share and still be full. As for how they're operating during COVID-19, they're definitely taking serious precautions by only limiting to only two guests at once. This is a place to check out if you want some tofu pudding or a moderately sweet dessert!
Love this place! It's so good and fresh. Love the traditional white bao tang go. Green tea one was interesting idea but the white one is the way to go. Delicious!

I got the rice cake box with white/brown sugar and they were really fresh. The rice cakes are fluffy and not dry unlike some other places I've tried in chinatown. Also I tried the sweet plain tofu soup (dau fu fa) which you get to choose toppings. I got it with almond syrup and it was so good. Fong On put a modern twist with these authentic dishes. I'll definitely come back and try more on their menu!
Tofu pudding, rice cakes and fresh tofu are all amazing. Quality and freshness truly shine through. The store is clean and well staffed with people who are willing to explain the menu.

These rice cakes were so fresh and delicious. I grew up eating the white and brown sugar varieties. I love the matcha rice cake. I was wondering how do you reheat them after they've been refridgerated overnight?
No comment

Everything is amazing! The sugar rice cake reminds me of childhood at home in china (very east southern dessert). Best to eat fresh. I had a few pieces left for second day and they got sticky. The tofu pudding can be customized in the sugar level, which is way better than meet fresh. I also get herbal grass jelly 仙草糊. Again I got a syrup so I can adjust the sweet level. This gem also accepts credit card/Apple Pay. Only . Ifs hard to find places to eat at the spot (nearby) so be prepared to bring to eat at home.
No comment

I've always like sweet tofu desserts growing up but my husband, he said it doesn't taste good enough for him to risk of having saggy boobs lol. Well, this  dessert places have his fav dessert toppings such as red beans and grass jelly on top of the sweet tofu pudding. It was surprisingly good, we wish the toppings were warm like the tofu (it would've tasted much better). We also tried their matcha rice cake, not bad but a bit too sweet. Also got a no otter if the soy milk drink, definitely needs more filtering. They also have salty tofus too, we will definitely come back to try those.
No comment
Awesome grass jelly, tofu pudding, and sweet rice cakes! Brings back memories of my childhood. Happy to support this family-owned business!
Dou fu fa!!! So good. My favorite topping is the ginger syrup. I always get a the white and brown sugar cake. Will try match next time. Brought some fresh beautiful tofu to make dinner this week.
Hands down the best place in NYC for steamed rice cakes and soft tofu. Nothing comes close. I don't live anywhere near this place but I don't mind the trek. The staff are  always very nice.
Alright I changed my mind. The white rice cake is pretty addicting. I give this place an 8/10 now lol!

I love this place so so much. I always get the "can't go wrong" combo. It had taro balls, red bean, and grass jelly. Really, you can't go wrong with this one! Everything goes so well together especially with their ginger sauce.
No comment

Food was delicious ! Got the brown sugar rice cake, sweet tofu with toppings and savory tofu with toppings. The rice cake was fresh and chewy. Savory tofu was definitely something new, it was really good. I love how with the tofu dishes we were able to add toppings. They have a good selection of toppings. Would definitely come back :)

Wow, Fong On was truly superb. Gets a little too crowded, but has great ambiance and service. I like their menu and it includes variety of items. The workers are extremely attentive and kind and they're very good at giving recommendations. Fong On is a must go, wonderful spot I am so glad to have found.
No comment
No comment

Food is okay, the tofu is not smooth enough like I had in other tofu stores. The worst part is the girl who made my order in front of me was unbelievably rude and inpatient. She asked me all of a sudden "ginger sugar or white sugar " with no explanation what it is used for, as a first time customer I asked her what is that for? She gave me a get-out-of-here face saying "for your #1 order". I didn't argue, paid and left the store cuz I'm not coming back anyway. When I opened my to go order there was no spoon/folks or napkins, totally ruined my mood.
Tofu is good, kind of expensive for what it is but this is Manhattan. I personally would go to flushing for it as it's cheaper, but Fong on is still decent. Wish they had cold tofu pudding.
No comment

I heard alot about this place ..it seems more modern and more choices than last shop @ Mott street ..This time we try these yet I know I will go back to get the Savoury tofu pudding...one day...Friendly staff and happy to be there...

Excellent tofu. Rice cakes were a tad too sweet for my taste. Shop is clean and neat.  I was disappointed that they did not sell fresh bean curd skin as it is wonderful stuff that you can serve as an appetizer with hot sauce or make fake chicken with it.

This is such a staple of the Chinese culture. The tofu was fresh along with the selective amount of toppings. The rice cakes were so delicious - not dry not too moist - just perfect. Had to try the soy drink and I'm glad I did because it tastes like how my mom used to make it at home. As per the environment, there are no seats but just a tall table you can stand by and eat your snacks really quick. Everything about this place is awesome, and a must go in Chinatown!

Unique concept, affordable and well executed. There is certainly no place like it in the city! Definitely worth a visit for tofu die-hards but those sensitive to food texture may not enjoy. An acquired taste for sure. Rice cakes are del fluffy and moist, with a yeasty flavor.

I was in the area recently and stopped by to try the tofu pudding, after seeing an article about this place in the NY Times. The serving sizes here are huge! I got a small with taro balls, red beans, and grass jelly toppings, and only finished about half. It was a very satisfying warm treat and made me homesick. I want to come back to try the savory tofu pudding, as well as their soy milk and rice cakes.
No comment

I'm glad that they're back! However I do miss the old place which had a more homey, hole in the wall feel. The new facility definitely has a more modern look and feel. The new locals can even be called chic. The prices have gone up a bit, but I can totally understand given the new location looks far more modernly equipped and I'm sure their rent isn't cheap. Tried the savory tofu for the first time. Had all the toppings and I must say it was very good. The classic white sugar cake felt a bit denser than I recall, but maybe it's in my head. I'm thrilled they're back, even if it cost more for me to get my sugar cake fix.

Great service! I brought 3 soy milk and thought they miss giving us two bottles! The staff apologized fast and give us the soy milk without hesitation! But right after l took everything out of the bag, found the soy milk lol. It's at the every bottom of the bag.
If you can't decide over savory or sweet tofu pudding then I recommend ordering both. Both hit the spot, good portions and affordable.

Omgggg their rice cakes 白糖糕 are life!!!!!!! As a Cantonese, born and raised in Canton, their rice cakes absolutely remind me of my childhood. I appreciate how they incorporate new ideas into the traditional recipe, and no joke this is my first time I've ever tried matcha rice cakes. They curate a very concise menu to control the quality, which is another thing that I appreciate. They offer tofu pudding (both savory and sweet - looks so so delicious) and soy milk as well. The decor of the place is absolutely unlike any other typical Chinese resto in Chinatown. Very modern and clean. This is my new favorite place in the neighborhood. Recommended!!

So happy they reopened! My mom had no idea they reopened and was excited to come here with me to check out their new place. My boss had wanted me to buy a ton of bai tang gao for her and grass jelly. Those are the things she lives for, so it was only appropriate to come here. I purchased six boxes of bai tang gao and 2 boxes of the other ones (brown sugar and matcha). My boss loved them and thoroughly enjoyed the sweets. Also bought two grass jelly's for her. For myself, I purchased some soy milk that was delicious and refreshing! My mom enjoyed the one I bought for her too. All in all, very happy they reopened. They even accept credit card which was fantastic since all I had was my company card on me!

Yummy rice cakes! I can't wait to try the rest of the menu. The ginger rice cake was very gingery and the sweet-white one tastes great as well. Heads up though- if the ginger rice cake is placed in the same box as the white rice cake - you're going to taste the ginger on the white rice cake as well. For those who love the ginger ones- it's like getting double ginger with a slight variation. Otherwise, if you are purchasing the ginger rice cake for the first time- you might want to order separately.
Lovely rice cakes. From Original to Matcha, they have a great selection of them. Herbal Teas and Tofu pudding a great combination. I would come here again. Highly recommended.
No comment
Fong On is really a hidden gem. I ordered the sweet tofu with 3 toppings (taro ball, tapioca and aiyu jelly) and it is super good.
No comment

Besides freshly tofu. Personally i wont' recommend their toppings here especially, boba and taro round which is flour like soft that has been kept and saturated overnight (soft sponge fat), and the taro too flavorless (nearly all is flour). I throw away the toppings and left only the red beans after few bites. Sugar syrup is light sweetent and its very watery; ideally the syrup should be thick and honey like.
No comment
Best tofu pudding and grass jelly in the city..  Place is squeaky clean and service is friendly. Not the cheapest but I let them take my hard earned money over and over again

We came in today after a big lunch and even though full this place was a perfect after-meal dessert for people with either a savory or sweet tooth! We ordered their savory pudding which I was excited to try as the only other time I've had it was in a visit to China many years ago and have never been able to find it here. It did not disappoint! The savory had a nice kick with the spicy sauce topped over and a good blend of toppings that complemented the tofu flavor without overpowering. The sweet one lived up to its menu name of "can't go wrong." Loved the mix of grass jelly and tofu pudding. Would definitely mix the toppings well before eating any of their tofu puddings!
No comment

I love tofu pudding and I'm glad to find this place in Chinatown. I had the ginger syrup and it was the most unique and best tofu pudding syrups I have ever had. The tofu was very smooth and silky too. I would definitely come back again.
Family vibes, great customer service, and quality desserts. Fong On has really good rice cakes, tofu desserts, and grass jelly. Basically, everything they serve there won't disappoint!

Everywhere has slowly come back to some form of normal, so Fong On was one of my expeditions yesterday after my mom decided to try their sweeten rice cakes after hearing about their renovated sweet spot.  We went with a box of their classic white rice cakes- $5 for a 6 pieces, pretty descent in taste as it does remind my mom of the classic taste she had before.  Service in prompt, interior is clean and efficient.  Great place to visit for some traditional and non-traditional Chinese treats.

Love love love the tofu pudding here ! Only place in nyc that makes it sooooo silky smooth and with flavor. I usually get it with ginger syrup. Love the cakes also. It comes with 6 pieces/slices in one box. White or yellow ! I love them both !
We ordered savory tofu, sweet tofu, rice cake, and soy drink. Everything is fantastic! Just like what I used to have in Hong Kong. Savory tofu is our favorite!

I love the tofu pudding and white rice cake. It is my must stop by shop on my Chinatown trip. The tofu pudding is light. It taste the best when it is warm. I like the #1 option dessert pudding with ginger syrup. But it doesn't have long shelf life, it is better to eat it right away. The white rice cake is delicious too. It taste like sweet rice wine. We always steam rice cake and pair with the tea, it will melt all your stress away at night.

The tofu pudding is very firm and has a smooth consistency. I like how there is sweet and savory option for the tofu, which isn't offered at many places. The steamed rice cakes are also very spongy and not too sweet, which I like. My favorite is probably the brown sugar rice cake. I heard their soy milk is also very popular, but never got the chance to try it, so I will definitely be returning. The prices are also very cheap, the large is around 6 dollars and you get 3 toppings of your choice. It's pretty big and I usually have to share with my friends. I only gave it four stars since the pudding is great for sure, but it's not the best in my opinion. However I still highly recommend coming here!

I love tofu soup, like really love love. This shop makes American style tofu pudding soup, it is hard, like jelly, not the super soft that I expected. So disappointed. The toro ball tastes like powder inside, glass jelly is weird... overall, I won't go back, kind of waste money, this is not the traditional soft tofu soup. The store is nice , so I give a star.
No comment
Yup.  Savory tofu pudding, I could eat you every single day.  And bonus, get my fresh tofu to go.  5 stars for keeping it simple and being so excellent.
Overpriced, The worst 白糖糕。White sugar cake.   in the World! The worst Service in the world, no thank you no smile , looks like something happened to them !
Tried the sweet tofu and savory tofu. I'm not a fan of the toppings, there was small dried shrimps in the savory tofu and I didn't like the taste of it in the tofu.
No comment

I've had their soy milk, tofu blocks and rice cakes several times, but never had their savory tofu pudding until today. Incredible! So much garlic and dried shrimp and ginger. Can't wait to try a sweet one.

Authentic traditional tofu and rice cake.  This place is for purists to enjoy how tofu, soy milk, and rice cake was made the old fashion way.  Their rice sugar cake taste perfect. Good texture, balanced sweet taste with the right amount of moisture and no powdery taste.
Delicious just like the original from back in the day of my childhood! Their tofu and white cake is my favorite! Thank you for re-opening!

The tofu with ginger syrup is soooo good. You get a lot of rice cake so just get one to share with friends. We made the mistake of getting all three different flavors and cloud to finish. But they all taste delicious, I personally recommend the original.
So happy they reopened I love the sweet white rice cake, everything is delicious. Can't wait to go back for more.
Great service. Ordered a bunch of stuff. The service is so quick. The desserts are delicious.

I was very intrigued with hearing the back story of this place. Upon entering the store it was exactly what I had anticipated. A family owned business that decided to have a limited menu and provide the best/freshest product available. It was clean and modernized inside. The staff was very accommodating to us and even let us sample some different products. As a chef myself I'm very happy that places like this exist. Best of luck to Fong On.. Will be back!!

Everything was delicious and not overpoweringly sweet can't wait to come back. I got the number one and a sweetened soy milk drink. Can't wait to come back and try the other options, and the savory item

Don't go. Extremely bad service. I ordered one item and was still looking at the menu and wanted to order more. The cashier kept pushing me to pay. I told her that I was not done ordering. She asked me to pay what I have ordered so far. Her attitude turned me off and walked away from the store immediately.

Visited for the first time during quarantine, and ordering was super easy and quick. I got the sweet tofu pudding with the "can't go wrong" toppings (red bean, grass jelly, taro balls) which is vegan, as is the majority of their menu! Really enjoyed it as it wasn't very sweet, and the portions were way larger than I anticipated- even though I got a small. Would definitely go again!

Came here after reading the reviews. Everything  looked delicious. Tried tofu pudding with almond syrup, white rice cake and brown rice cake. Honestly, the sweet rice cakes weren't my favorite. I definitely had better (and cheaper) ones from my local bakery!!! I tried one of each and gave the rest to my family (didn't want it to go waste) The tofu pudding was very delicious though
White sugar cake is too soft and didn't taste as I expected! The tofu is not silky enough compared to other shop! It taste ok , but not good . Suggest to try them first before buying

Went in to get rice cakes and saw there were four flavors - white, brown, ginger, and matcha. Was able to mix and match - one box of white/brown and one box of ginger/matcha. They are a tad sweeter than I would've liked but the texture is amazing. Perfect chew. Totally recommend as desserts for sharing.
Awesome spot for quick grub. Small savory tofu definitely fills you up. Service is friendly and affordable place. Can't wait to try to sweet tofu pudding

This was the worst I spent $77 on this. I got 7 large of there pudding but all of em was half full. Which got me pretty mad because you are telling me I went for a 1 hour car ride for it and have it half full.

I can't believe there is a 豆腐花 place in NYC. I got one right away, and wolfed it down. It was a $1.50, a little pricey, but the pleasant surprise was worth it.  Besides the豆腐花, they had four kinds of 糭 and lots of other noodles & rice/bean based products. The 豆腐花 is the only thing you can have on the spot. Everything else is to cook when you're back home.

I went in to try some sweet tofu and was really impressed by the customer service. The young man at the counter was very helpful and friendly, as well as very forthcoming with samples. The tofu was great.
Delicious fresh warm tofu and grass jelly! So good! Loved all their stuff and tofu wasn't too sweet. Perfect combination of flavors.
No comment
Been here a couple of times, the silken tofu is great and reminds me of how it is in Taiwan. Staff is friendly as well!

I'm so excited to find a tofu spot!!!! Fong On sells fresh soy products--they sell sweet tofu pudding and they also sell tofu blocks + soy milk + bak tang go + grass jelly. I really loved the taro balls, they're different from Taiwanese ones--more pillowy and a stronger taro flavor. All the toppings were great--not too sweet and freshly made. The ginger syrup was also so yummy. Can't wait to go back and buy some fresh tofu and soy milk.

I saw a clip online, it was an interview of the owner of the store. Long story short, the clip made me wanted to come check the store out and holy mother of God!!! I had the tofu pudding with grass jelly, aloe and aiju jelly, with just a hint of ginger syrup, it was freaking delicious!!!! I realized I should have taken a picture after I took a bite but came to a quick decision to not to cos I don't want to waste my time on anything else except this insanely yummy thing. The tofu pudding is the smoothest I've had!! This is going to blow up. Tofu 2.0. absolute genius!!

Saw this place in a NYT article and suddenly had a craving for savory tofu pudding. So we travelled all the way from jersey to try it out, and it did not disappoint! My husband, who never had savory tofu pudding before was speechless. He also kept saying how the flavor of the (unsweetened) soy milk is inconceivably pure! The (white) rice cake is a  little bit too sweet for me but my husband thinks it's amazing.
Amazing soy milk and rice cake!! Highly recommend the brown rice cake and the unsweetened soy milk!

Amazing sugar cake. Tried matcha and ginger flavor both great. Fresh soy milk is amazing! Wish I live closer so I can get the fresh tofu, worry it will spoil in the heat before I make it home. The sweet tofu dessert is also delicious, but surprised to know it's served hot rather than cold in this August NYC heat. Great local business with amazing soy products!

Drove to Chinatown for their rice cake, and it did not disappoint. Fresh and moist. Got the original flavor. Also got the tofu pudding with ginger syrup. Didn't realize it was going to be hot, but it was silky. I like that everything is not too sweet including desserts and drinks. The soy milk had a less concentrated soy flavor. Herbal tea's good too if you're into that.

This place is great. My girlfriend and I had the tofu pudding with ginger sauce, red beans, taro balls and grass jelly. Delicious. The staff were super friendly and offered us free samples of steamed rice cake. We can't wait to go back for more.
No comment

It is a pleasure to welcome back the awesome tofu and soy milk products of Fong On after disappearing from Chinatown the last few years.  The bai tang gao, a steamed, sweet rice cake, and dau fu fa, a silky tofu pudding, are still the best in Chinatown (probably the world) and have been for all my life which spans over 50 years!!!  No other establishment was able to replicate the quality and superior taste of their products during the long years they were in business and during the few years since they closed their Mott Street location.  I hope the current generation enjoys and appreciates their delicious products like my generation and the generation before me.  Here's to the next 100 years of success!!!!

Not a quite good experience. We came in this place and ordered three bowls from the wall menu. When the girl scooping the ingredients (red beans and green beans) to the bowl, a guy came out from the kitchen looked her and said "oh you are being very generous!" And he repeated at least twice in front of me and other customer waiting on line. Seriously!? It was not even a full scoop. Also, paper containers and brown bags they use are cheap and not durable. The bottom got wet and soft after 10 mins leaving the shop. Tofu itself tastes good but the green beans are actually rotten and smell.
Tofu is super silky and just naturally breaks apart in your mouth without you even needing to chew. The toppings are very good also.

This gem has recently reopened after closing at another location. I was so sad when it closed. But now, I'm so delighted that it opened in a new location. They added expanded their menu of beloved childhood items. Their specialty is tofu, but I love their drinks. Must try!
I LOVE their tofu pudding! It's simple and delicious and the staff is very friendly. I would recommend anyone in Chinatown to stop by here.
Its official! Grand opening in 8/17/2019. The tofu custard station is delicious with its assorted condiments. There's freshly made soy milk and tofu blocks as well

We stopped in near closing time and ordered delicious tofu pudding with an array of toppings (ai-yu jelly, red beans, grass jelly, and more). Wonderful treat. We tried some of the sweet rice cakes and loved hearing about their grand reopening and the continuation of their family business. Great hearing about testing their family recipes out with their family as guinea pigs. The store has a very modern aesthetic - we'll be back!

Amazing sweet rice cake. This is the only place that makes it the way it is supposed to. It is soft, sweet and just delicious. Other places don't even come close to this taste. It is a tad expensive at $6 a box and there about 6 pieces, but it is worth it because not many places make this type of cake. And for those shops who make it, it is very flourly and hard. No shops can replicate Fong On's recipe. Excellent service here too. The cashier greeted with a smile. Nice cool and modern layout at the shop too. Definitely will be returning!

I read about Fong On in the Sunday New York Times arrived. I didn't know about this family tofu story before but the article was fascinating! Before I finished reading it, I set out to visit the store right away. The trip to Fong On was totally worthwhile. I bought a white rice cake, plain soy milk, tofu pudding and fresh tofu bricks. Having  tried all but fresh tofu, I can tell you the rice cake is light and chewy and not too sweet. The ginger pudding is smooth and silky--next time I will definitely try the savory pudding. The soy milk is creamy and light and has a lovely aroma and taste when eaten. We will go there again very soon! Thank you Paul Eng and your family for bringing back such a great traditional food that is loved not only Chinese and other Asians, but also by westerners! Thank you for not giving up on fighting for your family's integrity! You deserve to win the battle and win not only among the Chinese who know your family business, but also all vegetarians. Your future will be brighter than the people who tried to steal your family's business from you!

Very popular Persian restaurant in Brooklyn, and I've heard great things about them. However, I'm guessing the quality is inconsistent since me and my friends were disappointed. The food wasn't amazing and both the lamb and chicken were pretty dry.

Sofreh has been on my list to try for quite some time and I wish I had made it here sooner because it was one of the best meals I've had in a while! The service was so great, the ambiance is lovely, and every dish we ordered was delicious. We started with the date salad and the flat bread - both were good but the date salad really blew me away. The entrees are huge and so we split the lamb shank and got an order of the herbed rice on the side as well as the cauliflower. The lamb was so tender and paired with the rice so well. We tried the dessert special that night which was some kind of orange cake, and this was the only dish we could have done without. I can't wait to come back to try more of their apps and entrees! Highly recommend this spot, it is worth it!

I absolutely love this place. They are consistently great every single time. No matter how busy they are the servers are always attentive. The ambiance is electric yet homey at the same time. You cannot go wrong with the sweet & sour meatballs or the pomegranate beef ribeye kebab. Both are fantastic. Oh and don't forget the Persian ice cream sandwich for dessert. My only critique would be the tahdig as it is a extremely small portion and often oily. Other than that, every menu item takes me back to Iranian home cooking.

The food was great, however I wouldn't return as the service was so off-putting. My friends and I enjoyed a meal here, ordering a round of cocktails and wine, as well as a large food order +dessert. There were several blips in the service (bread forgotten, pushy on ordering drinks/additional food, forgotten drinks without any sort of apology) all of which we were willing to overlook as we were having a great time. However when it came time to pay the bill we noticed they had charged us for one more item that we were told was included. NBD, we thought, right? Just remove the $5 extra charge on our $300+ bill and move on? Instead, our waiter decided to fervently argue with us over such a small charge, and refuted us, even raising his voice instead of removing the charge we all agreed hadn't been correct. I'm sorry but is it really worth it to argue with your table over $5 on a large check? It left such a bad taste in my mouth, I wouldn't return. Sure the food is great but so are a ton of other places that wouldn't treat you like this, spend your hard earned money elsewhere.

It was a while back so I'm not sure what I ate there, but it was one of my favorite culinary experiences ever. The cocktails are also great, and the place is very aesthetically pleasing. Def need to repeat.

The only way I can describe the food at Sofreh is soul nourishing. There is something so comforting about the sandy-washed interior, incredibly generous staff, and warm food that makes the eating experience at Sofreh one of the most pleasant you'll find in New York City. The staff is beautiful in the way they make you feel at home and It's simply a pleasure every time I eat at Sofreh.

The simplest and most straightforward thing to say is: the food is outstanding. We started with the roasted eggplant appetizer and the flatbread with herbed feta; both were great. That was followed by a roasted acorn squash salad, with a sweet and savory sauce complimented by pomegranate seeds and greens; excellent! The braised beef and dried lime stew was a remarkable set of flavors that I could happily have kept eating, with a side of saffron rice and also a side of tahdig (which, if available) you should not miss. The semolina cake with rose water and orange blossom was the perfect end. Drinks were also great. And the service was fabulous: friendly, efficient, but we did not feel rushed at all.

No comment

We had dinner at Sofreh a few weeks ago, and it was good but not great. We ate: a baby red gem lettuce salad with Mejdool dates, radish, tahini and honey dressing, and toasted sesame seeds; maitake mushrooms with sunchokes and whey; kofteh made with beef, tarragon, rice, and split peas and served in tomato saffron broth and topped with yogurt; half duck Fesenjan: braised leg of duck in pomegranate walnut sauce served with pan roasted duck breast; a side of saffron rice; and a side of tahdig. We also had some drinks: a Tehran dirty martini (TIto's and pickled almond brine), wine, and Persian black tea. The food was good overall. I did think the duck breast was overcooked, but the braised leg was good. The service was a little confusing, too. I'm not even sure who our server was, because several different people stopped by our table but no one ever really introduced themselves as our server. We had to try to get staff's attention a few times to order food and to order more drinks, and we weren't really sure who we were supposed to ask. They were definitely busy, but service was not attentive. Overall, the meal was a little bit of a letdown. I had made sure to get a reservation during the long holiday weekend we were going to be in New York, and I had really been looking forward to the meal. Maybe because of how much I had been looking forward to it, the experience was a little bit of a letdown.

Finally got to go here in June when traveling with friends after having tried for like 3 NYC trips to get a res. So worth the wait! Plus we had a larger group which was perfect because we could try more food! This meal was a whole experience. We sat on the back patio which was lovely, the owner was around and came and greeted us and told us her story and explained the food, and the food was amazing!! I can't recall everything we ate, see photos. The apps and ice cream were all of our faves. We took the advice of the waiter about what to order and weren't at all disappointed. Definitely get a res and try this place! You won't regret it! I miss that saffron rose pistachio ice cream, it was heavenly!

Uhhh...the food was good. But, I admit they are super hostile here. I mean I saw a worker tell me he brought a friend together to be interviewed & only the feminine guy got rejected , the manager left the feminine guy waiting forever in a dark room never came back So the feminine guy left after waiting thirty minutes. After a while he asked the owner where the manager went, she said " The manager is not going to see you" In a very condescending tone.   I feel like they are rushing the tables down and even if you trying to enjoy your meal. They care more about the next upcoming table. But I was told Persian restaurants are more welcome, this place was the opposite & shady.
We had a wonderful time at Sofreh. The staff is very warm and welcoming. We made a reservation one month in advance. Food was great, we especially loved the Ghormeh Sabzi and pomogranate steak.
Amazing place that brings a great balance of traditional Persian food for Americans like never before.

Truly one of the best meals I've ever had. I was only visiting NYC for a week and my friends insisted I make the trip out to BK for this experience and they didn't steer me wrong!!

I would recommend eating at this restaurant even on the worst weather day of the year where it is cold and rainy. The hot toddy is sublime and delicious. But the food is absolutely off the charts great. Nestled in a cozy restaurant and providing wonderful service. Yes, you definitely want to try this.

There's not a single item on the menu that you can go wrong with. The Lam shank is one of my all time favorites. Melts in your mouth. Great appetizer choice. And the staff are extremely friend. Make sure to check out their newly opened Cafe in Bushwick too!

Yes... I returned for the fourth time... why not? Consistent hospitality and delicious food. Friends were visiting from Colorado Springs... and I did not need to give a second thought about where to dine. Lamb, duck, steak... which was better would be hard to decide... each one perfectly cooked. Cocktails beautifully balanced, and the appetizers were the perfect set-up for the amazing entrees. Be willing to allow the hosts to lead you in ordering... you will not be disappointed.

Second visit, first pre-Covid, second early October 2022. Food is still excellent, service charming, and location ideal.

Super yummy Persian food in a chic setting. The lamb shank was falling off the bone delicious and I also really enjoyed the herb rice and squash appetizer. Left satisfied and would make a return visit.
No comment

Perfectly represents the fancy but low-profile restaurant niche. The outside of this place is so inconspicuous, I missed it the first time I walked by. Reservations are extremely hard to come by and require a 24-hour confirmation or cancellation or else they will charge you for a no show ($20 a person). However you don't wanna miss the opportunity to eat here. The food is really high quality and flavor profile is unique. The lamb was my favorite dish. So tender it fell off the bone. It also still had a ton of flavor. The tahini and date salad has a nice and spicy tahini dressing. The stew was a lot lighter of a meal than it looks. The rice is a classic and very tasty. The food is on the pricier side, but ordering family style is the way to go.
No comment
The best staff, great food,amazing atmosphere! Visiting from Los Angeles and had a blast!!! The host himself was so friendly...!

Sofreh, was a wonderful experience. I decided to go here with my brother, and we absolutely loved every dish that we ate. Both my brother and I have ate Persian food growing up, and the dishes that we had here were 10/10. The Bademjan, Ghormeh Sabzi, Ash, Sholeh Zard, Faloodeh were all so wonderful, and really gave my brother and I a nostalgic trip to our childhood.  I highly recommend the Bademjan, as it was the STAR of the show even with everything else tasting exceptional. Don't forget to drink the Persian Tea before you leave!
No comment

Sofreh is so cozy and homey! Its such great ambiance and food!!! The chef/owner is so lovely and friendly and makes sure everything is run to perfection! The food is high quality and one of the best Persian foods I have ever tried! Highly recommended
Pretty solid for vegetarians, but I imagine it's near amazing for the meat eaters. Very hearty and good ingredients. Solid service.

Was craving a taste of home! Glad I got to enjoy a Persian meal in Brooklyn. The steak was my favorite dish - the sumac added the perfect tang to the meat. The eggplant starter was everything and the bread was so fresh. The drinks were so unique with a Persian twist. Can't wait to go back.
I love everything about Sofreh - ambiance, cocktails, the evolution of the menu over time - every dish is exquisite.

the food is excellent. but they won't let you order additional dishes out of fear that you'll stay too long. the restaurant is unnecessarily bureaucratic. they seem more concerned about future tables than present ones. with that kind of attitude, they won't have tables before too long.
No comment

I will say that the food was incredibly delicious. However, the reason for my low rating is due to the customer service and hospitality. The waitress (who was incredibly nice, warm and respectful) accidentally forgot a few of our dishes during our order. When we notified her, she of course put in the order. However this meant that a bulk of our dishes arrived late. We didn't have a chance to order dessert yet, when one of the managers (it was a man) came over and in an incredibly rude tone said we were nearing the 2 hour mark on our table and that we would need to pay and leave. We of course were behind because the main dishes came out much later than expected. This manager took our plates and we didn't even get a chance to order any dessert. I completely understand a 2 hour limit, however, when the delay is due to the mistake of the restaurant, you should not take that out on your customers and secondly, do not express it in a rude way. This completely changed my view of the restaurant. One of the main aspects of Persian culture that is well known in the whole world is for its incredible warmth and hospitality and the leadership at Sofreh are in exact opposition of that quality of Persian culture. Its incredibly unfortunate since the food was delicious. However, the way you treat people is important aspect of the food industry and unfortunately they did not treat us with kindness.
Unbelievably delicious. From start to finish the meal was a 10/10!!! Can't wait to come back and try everything else on the menu!
No comment
Great food and a beautiful space! The chef has added a fresh twist to traditional Iranian dishes. Fun place, welcoming and warm staff.

Would have been five stars but I don't appreciate waiters trying to upsell me when I say I want to just order a bunch of appetizers, or imply that I can't place additional orders if we're still hungry, especially when I ended up spending the same, if not more, than if I had done entrees instead. Ambiance downstairs was great, food absolutely delicious (cauliflower, feta flatbread, kofteh, date and lentil rice, tahdig, ice cream) with the exception of possibly the worst baklava I've had in my life, very dry.

Love the food here and the ambiance is nice as well. But please (if ownership is reading) please please stop upselling. I've been here a few times and every time this one server is very pushy and insistent that you order more dishes. She doesn't take no for an answer and makes you order more food than you really need. It's uncomfortable and ruins the experience. Other than that it's a great restaurant - let us enjoy it in peace!

Two of us ordered two appetizers: the mushrooms and sunchoke, and the kofta (meatballs). Both were fabulous but the mushroom dish was particularly scrumptious. We had the half chicken and saffron rice as a main course. The service was impeccable and the food was absolutely delicious. Wish it were closer to our home and not so hard to get a reservation! We'd be here all the time.

This was my second time visiting Sofreh and I had just as much of an enjoyable time as the first time. The owner Nasim was there and she couldn't be more accommodating and friendly. It's also great to see Iranian food in a different "upscale" way. Highly recommend the lamb, the steak, the eggplant app, meatball, feta flat bread (w0w the flavors). Will definitely be back!
