Had such a wonderful experience at Sofreh and it was my first time trying Persian grub. All covid precautions were taken.  Food was excellent, Great ambiance, and drinks were great as well.  Service was top notch.  Will visit again soon.
WOW!  A most delicious dinner. Really tremendous food. Well spliced, flavors to die for and service to match. Could not have asked for more.
Beautiful place, exceptional attentive service, the food didn't disappoint either, wish it was easier to make reservations, would definitely come again.

Food quality was amazing but not the most convenient dining experience. The hours are limited so you have to rush ordering and eating. They have added more seats so more people can be served. This has led to a tiny seating area that is noisy and crowded. The menu is overpriced too. You pay for a luxury dining but you don't get a luxury experience. The food quality alone would get five stars, the best Persian food in New York City hands down but not worth the price and service.

For all the hype this place had I was frankly disappointed. The service is good although definitely on the pushy side as other reviews had noted. The eggplant appetizer was good but not outstanding. The bread that came with it was original and great. But if you wanted more it was $8 for one little piece of bread which is absurd. $8 for a plate of rice. Again nothing was terrible but for the price the portions were tiny and the taste underwhelming. I had the braised beef as the main dish and it was just ok. In hindsight I would not have minded skipping the main dish and ordering more appetizers. Good ambience and clean restaurant. However overall there's something more to be desired from this place and not sure I will be back anytime soon.

Returned to this foodie gem after trying to land Sat night reservations for the past 2 years!  Food was just as delicious & appreciated the personal touch of hospitality.  All dishes perfection although not enough tadigh!!!
No comment
No comment
amazing flavors, atmosphere, and service. the eggplant and whey dip, lamb shank, and pomegranate beef ribeye kebab were my favs--impressive and delectable. i will be back for sure
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
All the food was of course delicious, but what really caught me is how friendly and accommodating all the staff was. We had a wonderful time!
Truly disappointing! The host and hostess who answer the phone are extremely rude. I guess being popular isn't synonymous with good customer service. Will find another Persian restaurant.

Everything from start to finish was absolutely amazing . Let me just start by saying my server was lovely. I forgot her name but she knew the menu from start to finish and her recommendations were on point. The runners and manager that supported her were attentive as well. The bartender made my 2 year this cute lil non alcoholic apple cocktail which I wanted myself. LOVED! The cocktails virgin and non virgin were all tasty and flavorful and mixed well. Please try the mint/cucumber cooler!! The food was just delicious. now please be reminded, Persian food is not for the faint and the flavors and sauces are a bit heavy but I guess coming from a Caribbean background I can roll with it. The cauliflower was perfectly done and the accompanying pickled vegetables were so good. Meatball delish.. the side bread was fresh and warm and lightly crisped.. So I knew I wasn't going to be a fan of the rice because Im not a fan of seasoned rice (hella picky) but everyone else enjoyed. The lamb was super tender and perfect. I would've preferred the butter beans to be cooked a bit more as they were a bit on the hard side. still a great dish. We also had the ribeye which my daughter enjoyed.. a bit fatty but I'm sure it added to the flavor. For dessert, the saffron cake wasn't really a hot for me me but it wasn't bad. I absolutely enjoyed every minute of dinner. Thanks to great staff and great food!
No comment
My fifth time here and they're better than ever!  Chef Ali and team are not only consistently crushing it night after night, they're actually getting better!  Everything was out of this world.
No comment

This was a disappointing experience. The food good, the service bad. The waitress was intensely pushy about taking our order. She asked us what we wanted three seconds after we sat down and came back another two times. We asked her about the menu, asked her about the portions of the starters and how many we should get because my friend and I like to share and get a variety. She told us the portions were very small and showed us with her hand the sizes of the various starters (looked tiny) so we ordered based on that and she said it wouldn't be enough, and we could not order more later if we wanted (why I don't know) so she advised us to get in addition to what we ordered a rice dish and a main course which we did, based on her suggestion. The whole time she was very impatient with us and rushed us. All of a sudden everything came out en masse- piled up on our table one after the other- and the dishes were not that small- in fact the portions were generous enough. We clearly over ordered! It was way too much food so we quickly told her to cancel the main and she came back and said it was too late. So we were shoving this food down our throats, feeling rushed and couldn't really enjoy what would have been good food and a nice culinary experience. We had to ask the waitress to box everything to go because we couldn't eat it fast enough and we needed more space on the table as things came out. Then two minutes after the last dish came out (the main course we could barely eat), a man came over gave us our bill and told us we had to leave the table because there was someone else with a reservation waiting for the table (they didn't even ask if we wanted dessert). We were finishing our food and glasses of wine, and he came over to us again, telling us to pay and finish our wine at the bar. Ok, I get it but we weren't there that long (maybe a little over an hour) but in the meantime, two guys who sat down next to us at the same time were not kicked out of their table. We went to the bar to finish our wine, and noticed those guys were sitting leisurely, finishing their food, and never left their table, nor were told to leave their table. All in all, this was a bad experience. The food was good- and the type of unusual and nuanced spices and variety of food on the menu should be savored and enjoyed- not thrown in front of you and rushed like McDonald's. I would not recommend this restaurant.
AWFUL CUSTOMER SERVICE. Stay away!! Spend your money elsewhere. I will never dine at this establishment again. The staff is rude, unprofessional, and condescending.
No comment

Service was rushed and chaotic to the point where waitress was knocking over glasses and slapping our hands over the table. Also pushy about how much and what we need to order. We weren't asked how we want our ribeye cooked, and it came out medium, which none of us was excited about. Appetizers tasted like messy frozen meals from Trader Joes. Beets and lamb main were ok.

Finally dined at Sofreh after reading all of the positive press in NY Magazine, Eater and Thrillist. Overall, I thought the food was pretty good, not sure I would go  there frequently. Our server was just ok - we had a late seating and you could tell. We started off with the eggplant dip and roasted cauliflower. The roasted cauliflower is amazing. For the mains, we ordered the lamb and half chicken. The lamb was very very tasty.

The place seemed nice so my partner and I decided to give it a try. The hostess promised us a table so we waited one hour. After waiting for an hour, the "manager" informed the hostess that they will not be seating anyone. No matter how good the food is, this is no way of treating people.
No comment

This place is omg delicious! Being off carbs its always hard to find something that will captivate my pallet as I m constantly thinking about what would happen if I cheat a little...but that steak made my night! The food is very well prepared and with a beautiful presentation. Great service and a cozy atmosphere. What else does a girl need
No comment
Fantastic spot! Amazing food and ambience. The drinks were delicious and you definitely need to order the lamb shank. Also, if you get Caitlin as your waitress, it's going to be an awesome night!

everything we ordered here was amazing. Our server, Caitlin, contributed so much to our memorable experience. The cocktails are also really good! basically, order everything you can, especially the lamb and the bread options and the dips
No comment
No comment

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment

Writing this review because of the horrible customer service I received from this restaurant. I was very excited to try this place as I am Iranian and want to support an Iranian business. I left an email to postpone my reservation because my friend was not feeling well (later I found out she had COVID) and a woman called me back saying that she will cancel my reservation without charging me $20 per person. I ended up still getting charged $40 and no matter how much I explained my situation via email, they would not accept a refund. They also replied back in the rudest way and then proceeded to stop replying all together. They are a money hungry institution ( also proven in the other reviews I am reading below mine) and coming from an Iranian foundation, I am shocked because the culture values generosity and hospitality. I had to call my bank to dispute the payment because there is no way they are getting any of my money.
Delicious food . Very Friendly and welcoming staff . A little expensive tho but it's not like something you go every night for dinner. Well worth it .

popular persian restaurant i was lucky enough to get a seat at the bar last minute. it was absolutely decadent and had such unique flavor - i had the eggplant dip, shiraz style salad, saffron rice  with the beef stew and saffron rice pudding - all recommended by the waiter. glad he did it was delicious!
No comment

Absolutely delicious and fresh flavors served here. We had steak kabob and eggplant with feta bread. We were welcomed warmly and the wait staff were very attentive and seemed happy to be there. Will certainly be back!
No comment

You'll no doubt read about how great the food here. I can attest to all the glowing reviews. But I can emphasize enough how you must must get their Persian ice cream. I wished they would sell it by the pint so I could have it all the time: it's THAT good. Hints of saffron and amazing spices - simply beautiful.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

One of NYC's most popular persian restaurants does not disappoint. The ambience is clean and bright with thoughtful touches.  Sofreh serves delicious cuisine in an intimate setting. The dishes are fairly priced and loaded with flavor. Would recommend to anyone looking for something fresh and new, but be sure to make a reservation well in advance.

I have a thing for exposed beams, so right of bat I was impressed with the ambiance and look of the place. This is a good place for a date night. The friendly staff are also incredibly knowledgeable about their menu. I recommend the Koofteh as an appetizer, which is essentially a tasty meatball with nuts inside of it. The Persian herb stew with lentils was a blend of perfect seasoning and was only outdone by the duck entre which comes with a side of duck (breast with a side of dark meat!). You should get a side of rice to complete your meal, and dabble in the unique cocktail list. Overall, may be one of the best dinner restaurants in Brooklyn.
Owner and her brother were amazing, so homely, everything was delicious, staff was so nice and helpful. Incredible and unique drinks. I could go on and on.

This place lives up to the hype! The flavors in each dish and drink are so incredibly delicious. We got a bunch of small plates (the carrots, potato pancakes, cauliflower, beet and ricotta salad) and then the smoked eggplant and carrot rice. Every item was better than the last.

The food was so so delicious. Inventive and inspired- unlike any other cuisine I've ever eaten. Don't miss it! I loved the carrot/cauliflower  appetizer, and the tahdig and the Ice cream. Well worth the money- they could have charged more. Noise level is a little high for me in the restaurant. But overall it was one of the best meals I've had in a long time.
No comment

Incredibly delicious and incredibly expensive. When you go, make sure you're prepared to spend a lot of money and ignore til the bill comes. Highly recommend the feta & herb flatbread, mejdool date & lentil rice, and the ribeye. Finish off your meal with the traditional Persian sorbet, you won't regret it.

I was in the mood to try something new decided to stop by Sofreh. I was impressed. They got a nice variety of different dishes and I gotta say their quality is good. Price is decent and the restaurant is nice and all. Good service. I'll be back again
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Amazing food. All the rice side dishes are flavorful. We ordered chicken entree, steak (which we enjoyed the least) and two-three other dishes to try family-style for a group of 5. We would gladly go back.  Make a res in advance if you can. The chef is hugely talented and clearly well regarded since this restaurant has been written up in the NYT and at least 3 of her recipes are shared. Very charming restaurant and authentic cuisine.
No comment
We love the food. Although not necessarily traditional but very tasty and creatively curated. The experience of reserving and seating could be improved.
No comment

Breath taking persian artistry to bring an interplay of tastes you have never experienced before. As a person who has been eating and cooking authentic persian food for the last 20 years , I was very blown away by the different dishes prepared! It can definitely have better management and a need to invest in umbrellas as it was raining during our stay. Kudos to the chef. Dont forget to try chicken and kabob
No comment

Beautiful, delicious food. Went with friends and we loved the eggplant dip, fish of the day, meat stew, saffron rice, yogurt, date and tahini salad.... The food was all so complex and balanced and was comforting, like a hug. My personal favorite dish was the date tahini salad. It is unexpected, spicy, complex. Definitely a lovely place to go with friends or family to share a special meal. It felt like all our birthdays. We each had cocktails and loved them. The Tehran dirty martini is very unique. The only negative to our experience was a server who was very pushy trying to get us to hurry up and leave, even though there was no reservation after us and we were not the last ones at the restaurant. We ordered a lot of food and drinks and spent a sizable amount of money, so it was disheartening to be pushed to leave in a hurry. Unfortunately this server's attitude put a damper on an almost perfect meal.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

A welcome addition to the neighborhood! Friday and Saturday night reservations are harder to get but Sunday night reservations were relatively open. We reserved through Yelp online, which has you confirm the reservation the day before. The space inside is pretty intimate, great for a date night or nice dinner with friends. I saw they have one high chair so they are baby friendly. I loved the decor inside: white, crisp, clean lines. We got the eggplant appetizer, the traditional herb noodle soup, the chicken with plum sauce, crispy rice and herb rice. The soup was my favorite. The flavors were amazing and the crispiness of the fried onions was great. The crispy rice was a little bit too hard and crunchy for me but the herb rice was great. I also tried their bourbon, beet reduction with egg white cocktail and it was fantastic. For dessert we tried the rose custard and the persian ice cream. The ice cream was better as I felt the custard texture was a little bit pasty, although the flavor was great. I would definitely come back and try the lamb shank, fish of the day and the vermicelli noodle dessert.  Those looked great on neighboring tables.

2nd time eating at Sofreh and it was better than the first which I didn't even know what possible. This is hands down the best Persian food in the city and a perfect spot for a date or just to bring friends.
No comment
Lamb was great (better to share), chicken was good too. Skip the crispy rice, basmati and seasoned rice were good. Next time I'll save room for dessert! The staff was also lovely and attentive.

my friends and I went to sofreh last Friday. The food was really good quality. They told us they have some new food in their menu which is the first night they serve it. We have order their sour kabob which was one of them and it was amazing! The portion was huge, almost enough for 2 people. I love the drinks. They are so creative with the cocktails to make it Persian style! The owner came to us few times and make sure we are satisfy with the food. I will definitely go back to this restaurant!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Was so happy to try this relatively new Persian restaurant- the appetisers were fantastic especially the eggplant dish. My favourite dish was the chicken - there were so many flavours, my taste buds were in over drive. And the staff wore proper PPE.
No comment

Great food and wonderful hospitality . The layout seems small yet airy and the service was excellent . The food is the main attraction of course and I must say I loved all the desserts we had . We tried them all. My fish of the day on tamarind sauce was spectacular. As were the various rice combinations we had.
No comment

We were pleasantly surprised. The food, cocktails and service was superb. The owner is such a classy lady, came to our table and asked us how everything was. I am a very service oriented person and I really enjoyed the service I received. We ordered the steak and fish. The steak (Kabob Toursh)was beautifully charred on the outside and perfectly cooked on the inside. The fish was extremely tasty. A very pleasant experience all around.
One of my favorite Persian restaurants. Meat was so tender and flavorful. The Persian ice cream was unforgettable.

Took my boyfriend as a Christmas gift 2 years ago and we now go regularly (at least once a month). We make a point to try other places but this is hands down our favorite Persian restaurant and no other spot compares. Whenever family or friends visit, Sofreh is the first place we make reservations for, and each time everyone leaves raving about how great it was. Incredible food and such nice service! It's somewhat pricey but it's 100% worth every penny. It makes for a great date spot as it chic but also has a warm vibe. Note: don't pass on the cocktails, they're to die for (the saffron vesper is my personal fav). I wish I had pictures to show how lovely the presentation is but like any true millennial, they go on Instagram... oops! Highly highly recommend!
No comment

The food was delicious.  i got half chicken.  There was one server named Kianna, she was totally awesome and  shout out to her. The other server we had, Sophia,  had major attitude. She really killed our good mood.

Sofreh came highly recommended, plus I really was in the mood for Persian food. I was told that it was tasty but a little shi-shi and somewhat overpriced. The food was good, though the menu limited and not very creative. I imagine if you went there more than a couple of times the menu would get old very quickly. There are no daily specials. The decor is a bit chilly, I would almost call it anti-ethnic, as in, wanting to really signal that this is a cut above your ethnic food joint. But it somehow leaves you cold. As for value for money, for a Brooklyn restaurant it is way overpriced. I give it a three-year shelf life.
Been wanting to go here for a couple years and glad I made it out to Brooklyn. Food was great - I'd call it elevated Persian. They were taking good COVID precautions so I was comfortable eating here.

This was a solid meal. For starters, we got the eggplant spread ($10), which was probably the best eggplant I've ever had. I highly highly recommend getting it! Paired this with the sofreh bread ($4). I wish they gave complimentary bread, or paired their spread with bread though, since the spread is so flavorful and really should be eaten with bread. We also got the yogurt and shallot dip  ($7) which was good, but not spectacular. We also got the kofteh aka meatballs ($12) which were good, but unfortunately kinda forgettable. For the entree, got the stew of butter beans and dill ($18) which came with basmati rice. It was good and not too heavy. We ordered the tahdig ($5) as well with it, which is basically a crispy rice dish. That tahdig I think is also something that's well worth it.. it was very addicting! Overall this place was priced very fairly, and I would definitely recommend it! It's healthy, yet filling!
No comment
No comment
Incredible meal and service! I can't wait to return! I strongly recommend anything with eggplant and the lamb. The soup was also really great.

Amazing ancient Persian cuisine. Try their tahdig (crispy rice) and any of the dishes. Family-owned. Great space. Elegant. The bathroom shows you what Iran was like back in the days. Get some culture and home-cooked food--isn't that what living in expensive ass NYC is all about??
No comment
No comment

Great ambiance less than mediocre food unfortunately!   We tried several dishes and none were good .  Chicken with zeresh was average ghormeh sabzi was the best dish !  Roasted eggplant was terrible !  Overall experience was below average .  Will not return nor recommend this restaurant !
No comment
No comment

I came here before COVID hit and still can't stop thinking about the incredible food, drinks and service. The perfect menu - everything is wonderfully thought through, and is an amazing addition to the area.
Great food. Great service. Everything we ordered was delicious. I highly recommend. Quiet. Nice. Great ambience. Will go again.
No comment

Very unimpressed....but what ultimately lead to the 1 star review was the waiters pushiness to order more food (mentioned in previous reviews) which ended up with us ordering way too much food. The rice was mediocre. Their version of gormeh sabzi was not good (beef stew with kidney beans).  Many of these dishes are not traditional Persian dishes. The waiter forgot our drinks Then you get your bill and they give themselves a And had to be reminded to bring them. Then for our party of 5, they give themselves a 20% tip. If you are not Persian I could
Fantastic food! The owner/chef also went out of their way to make our meal special. Came by and was extremely nice and personable! 10 out 10. Will be back soon!
We've been trying to get in here for months and finally got a reservation. Absolutely worth the wait. The meal was delicious, the space is beautiful and the service was excellent.

If you have not eaten here yet you are missing out! The portions are large so it's best to share. There are so many great options for both meat eaters and vegetarians. My husband loves the lamb and I get the eggplant with poached eggs. The cocktail program is inventive and well-balanced! All of the wines are picked with care. The is an authentic Persian restaurant with such care paid to all of the ingredients with warm and caring owners! Worth the trip to Prospect Heights!

Came here for my birthday. Where do I start . The restaurant has such an amazing and beautiful atmosphere. Our server Samantha was very friendly and knowledgeable about any questions we had. I definitely recommended sharing entrees so you may try all the delish foods. Everything was so delicious. The lamb shank and half chicken is a must! Can't wait to come back
No comment
No comment
Food was quite disappointing and not "traditional" as advertised. Way overpriced for the quality of food and service they provide. Rude servers and hosts.

My lovely daughter treated me to dinner at Sofreh for my birthday. I live in California and have found one or two good Persian Restaurants, but none not quite as good as Sofreh. We ordered to share the eggplant and whey dip, beet and feta salad, saffron rice and lamb shank. Each dish was outstanding! Saffron, rosewater and pistachio ice cream was a wonderful dessert to add to an already delicious meal.
No comment

At first Sofreh seemed to be a warm place to dine and the hostess was very welcoming. We sat on the outside and were already eating when we were approached by a woman who said that we had to leave in 30min because she had a reservation that was coming. We definitely felt racially profiled because we were the only ones of color sitting outside and on the property. We were told outside seating was for walk-ins and we were taken aback by how we were approached and treated.  She made it clear she was the owner; assuming that was her tactic to push us out of our seats. We will not be coming back here again because FAIR SHOULD BE FAIR.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Most awesome food. It is not your usual kebab and khoresht Persian restaurant. The chef (who is always going from table to table greeting everyone) serves more interesting Persian dishes with a modern twist. They are new to restaurant industry and still need to work on timing of service, but well worth the trip.

Came here on a Saturday night with my friend and let me just say wow! I absolutely loved this place. Everything was perfect, from the ambience, the food, and the customer service. Our waiter was extremely friendly and was always there to help when needed. The big star of the night was the owners brother, I believe his name is Amir. He was a delight! He really made sure our night was perfect. The food was just DELICIOUS. I come from a Persian family and i can attest that the food here definitely lives up to mom and grandmas cooking. I highly recommend the eggplant starter, lamb shank and the Persian stew (ghormeh sabzi). If you have room for dessert, definitely try the Persian saffron ice cream sandwich. You wont regret it
No comment

One of the best restaurants in NYC! Service was spectacular! I ordered a drink that I didn't like, the waitress noticed and took it off the bill! Get the duck, the date salad, the eggplant app (best eggplant ever!). Save room for the best ice cream of your life. I guess some ppl are like... why is this food so expensive, and portions so small because they think this type of "ethnic food" should be cheap or something. But this is elevated Iranian food using high end ingredients and done in a tasteful manner in an elegant setting, which unfortunately, is very rare and Americans just aren't used to it. Also, this is where all my Persian friends go to eat, so haters pls stay away.

I'm in love with Sofreh! I grew up with many Persian friends as a kid,  and in college and have been spoiled with spectacular meals over the years. Sofreh brought me back to those meals with a sense of refinement. The owner and chef Nasim is a wonderful host who has been so welcoming to me and my family. People who are saying things like, "you can get middle eastern food cheaper"....just stop. Your credibility is garbage if you are comparing Persian cuisine to its regional neighbors. (Different people, different culture, different food) This is not kebab palace or meat over rice! This is beautifully well thought out Persian food, the best I have ever had in a restaurant.

We had a really fabulous meal here and I wish people would not leave poor reviews for a place that either just opened or demonstrate how little they know about how crazy it is to work out the kinks in a new restaurant. I started with the bourbon sour cocktail. It was beautiful and well-balanced. Objectively, the food is fantastic--we got a flatbread with feta for appetizer, the saffron rice, half chicken, lamb kebab, another bread for mains, and the ice cream for dessert. We couldn't finish the chicken and left full--I thought the portions were more than enough. All had incredible depth of flavor and were obviously well and lovingly prepared. The ice cream was so unique. The space is very modern while the plates and food feel homey. It was a dichotomy that I loved. I would definitely return.
No comment

The Persian food is authentic, the staff are nice, and the owner is lovely. I had a great time at a family dinner and the food was amazing. It is family style, meaning you can order your own dish but they are huge and really for sharing- just FYI. My parents were in town visiting me, so they didn't let me pay; therefore, I cannot comment on the price, but the menu items seemed very fair for the high quality of food and ambiance. It would also be a really great place to take a date.
May be one of the best places I've eaten at in Bk. Fresh, delicious Mediterranean food and excellent service.  You must try the bass- unreal.
Service is super, super slow but eggplant dip (sort of) makes up for it. Wine selection could definitely use some improving upon. Ambiance good.

I really wanted to like this place, but it was terrible. The food was mediocre and the service was very poor. The owner ruined our evening with her attitude; she seemed friendly but was so inflexible on our orders. Food was not good either. I would not come back. For such a nice looking place, it was such a disappointment. Really overpriced too.
No comment
No comment

By far the most inventive and thoughtfully made Persian food we've had in years (and we've been to more Persian restaurants than one should). The in-house yogurt, the  beef Lori kebab, the fish with the spicy ghormeh sauce, topped off with saffron and faloodeh ice cream. Damn. People on Yelp seem to complain about the service - sure, it's not impeccable, but it's fine and the owners add a personal touch. More importantly, the star of the show here is the food. Eat it.
Horrible service and very rude staff.  Avoid like the plague.  Food is ok but this doesn't make up for the aggravation of dealing with the staff
No comment

So happy to finally see someone in Iranian cuisine be creative and modern. For the first time I had to actually look at the menu and ask questions from the server. Our crispy rice wasn't very crispy, but otherwise the food was exquisite. Highly recommend the chicken, and lamb shank. Also the bread was heavenly and I only wish they gave a little more. Very welcomed addition to brooklyn.
No comment

I love this place. It's refreshing to go to a persian restaurant that isn't so typical! We were a big group and were able to order a little bit of everything! My favorite was the fish! I've never had that dish before. Very very yummy! The ambiance was amazing too. So fresh and modern. Super clean lines and airy! Yummy drinks! Overall a great experience! I love Love Love that there is a persian restaurant near me now! Thank you!

The food was excellent from appetizers through desserts. The cocktails were innovative and tasty. The service was attentive. I would eat here regularly if I lived nearby. I read some other reviews and I'm highly suspect of most of the negative ones - random Persian names with hardly any reviews living in California. It makes me feel that the owner has some enemies, and it's really sad that people would tear down their own kind. I think that the prices are fair for the portion size.

I am very surprised by the negative reviews on here. Yes, this place is more expensive than your typical kabob-style Persian restaurant but the prices are on par with any other nice mid-range NYC restaurant. It is modernized and different than any other Persian restaurant in NY, in terms of the menu, presentation, and cocktail menu. I have been here twice and really enjoyed both experiences.
No comment

The food is lovely but it seems they are still working out the kinks in the service. We ordered a bottle of wine that had not arrived by the time our main course had. We cancelled that bottle and ordered by the glass. Half way through our main course the wine by the glass had not arrived either and we had to call over the manager to expedite that. They offered to comp us the glass of wine but then didn't actually do that. There was a real sense of disorganization. After our main course was cleared our waitress came over to put down plates and was genuinely surprised to hear we had already eaten our entrees. I hope they sort out the service because we thoroughly enjoyed the honey roasted beets and the sea bass with the tamarind sauce.
No comment
No comment

I really enjoyed my meal here. Everything we had was delicious, particularly the honey roasted beets, smoked eggplant and the lamb shanks. I appreciated the emphasis on less typical Persian dishes, or modernizations of classics, and was so glad there were a number of items my vegetarian friends could enjoy.  The service was quite friendly and the owner stopped by our table to discuss our meal. It is a little annoying to have to order bread and rice but that totally aligns with Brooklyn dining trends and also the anti-carb landscape these days.

Terrible. I can't believe some people liked this place. Food was cold, over cooked and without flavor. Nice surprise was the price; very high.  The ambiance is nice and the drinks are decent, but the food and service was terrible. We spent over $150 (two people) and we could've had a much better meal.
No comment

I have no idea how people have a poor service experience here. The owners are here. They make sure everyone is having a good time and love the food. We basically ordered the entire menu. Everything was hot. Delicious. Well seasoned. Great authentic presentation. Drinks are strong and unique. Can't wait to come back Chef Ali and Nassim Joon.
No comment

This place was a hot mess. The host was curt. I felt like he was attempting to impress by affecting greater importance, talent, and culture than he actually possessed. I felt as if I was not welcomed. I had to pay for rice. The service was substandard.

This lovely restaurant was a real treat. A new take on Persian cuisine, while still with the traditional flavors. The Tah dig was the most delicious I have ever tasted. The rice with carrots was amazing and thankfully not sweet. My husband and I both had the lamb shank, which was quite salty. Other than that, everything was delicious! The cocktails were excellent and so was the service. It was treat to meet the owner Nasim and hear the story of the restaurant. A bit pricey for Persian food, but it is an upscale restaurant so it merits the price bump. We will return.

I eagerly awaited the opening of Sofreh and even managed to make a reservation but then something came up and I had to cancel. Right around that time the New York Times review raving about Sofreh came out and I had as much a chance of scoring a reservation as the Mets had of winning the championship this season. So I bided my time till the week between Christmas and New Year and showed up with my hubby on a weekday night when they opened at 6 p.m.--luckily, we scored seats at the bar. Christopher, our charming and attentive server, took very good care of us. We began our feast with cocktails: Shirin and Sour for me, Alloo Joon for hubby. (Vegans note: instead of egg whites, cocktail are make with Aquafaba, which is chick pea water.) Both were scrumptious. We shared the eggplant spread accompanied by warm homemade bread, shiraz style salad, and Persian spinach and prune stew with saffron rice. I'm not the biggest fan of eggplant, but the eggplant spread at Sofreh is some of the best eggplant I've every eaten. All the food was rich in the best sense of the word. Next time, I'll be sure to order less so I'll have room to try their alluring desserts.

It is no surprise to me that many diners have left poor reviews based entirely on the service.  We were forced to wait an excessively long time for our appetizers (of course, there is no complimentary bread), and then again for our main courses.  This was not the end of the world, but when we politely complained about the wait times, the owners/managers were extraordinarily condescending and defensive.  Not only did they refuse to apologize, they blamed us for our choices from the menu, falsely claimed we had been complaining since we walked in, and told us we didn't understand how restaurants worked.  I have never encountered a worse understanding of customer service in New York.  The food is not nearly good enough to merit this level of service.

A fabulous time for a special occasion, the space and the food is incredible.  Its hard to find a restaurant these days that still provides such a personable touch and warm service and homey-yet-elevated food.  I'm looking forward to coming for another special night.
No comment
No comment

My first visit was with two friends for dinner - overall, excellent experience. Pre-dinner cocktails (some virgin!) were excellent, and the owner who chatted with us while we waited for everyone to arrive was wonderful. They had a few hiccups with service - apps took quite a while to come out, and a bit more - but that's not unexpected in a place that's only been open a few weeks. One difficulty: if you have nut allergies, you're out of luck with quite a few apps and some mains - but there are great options for vegetarians! I, being not a vegetarian like my friends, had the lamb; it was amazing. Pairs well with the herb rice. The rose water Persian sorbet we shared for dessert was an acquired taste, shall we say.... a lot more lime than rose water to my and one friend's pallets, but the third friend seemed to really love it. Heh. Anyhow, I will definitely be back.

Amazing! I can't stop thinking about my dinner at Sofreh. We had summer squash and feta, smoked eggplant, meatballs, and The Bread! Oh lord, this bread was beyond. So fresh and delicious. I couldn't stop eating and I was so full. I 'll have to go back and try more dishes. Great staff-friendly and fast. Decor is light and airy and you'll want to stay forever.

Mind-blowingly good food.  I've had great persian food before and this place is really exceptional.  I've been twice now and am excited to go more this year with new friends and out-of-towners.  You should really eat here.

Loved this spot. Had such an enjoyable evening. The service was great, and the food was excellent. I also appreciated not feeling rushed but being able to enjoy our meal. I'm a huge fan of Persian food, and it was a great experience trying less traditional dishes. Would definitely recommend and hope to come back soon!
No comment
I have lived in NYC for 23 years, at last we have a great Persian restaurant. This place is unlike any other--authentic, delicious, and gorgeous to boot.
No comment
Best Persian in NY.  Built out to the nines.  Warm service.

New Persian restaurant in Brooklyn that opened lat week.  Super friendly service.  Food was amazing.  Great yogurt, lamb, chicken, smoked eggplant, bread.  Fish was ok. Dessert was a but underwhelming.
Hands down, The best Persian restaurant I have ever been to in the states. Not your typical kabob house but delicious homemade Persian taste from all around Iran.

My boyfriend took me to this place and we were so fortunate to have a owner's guidance and recommendation.  Lamb was mouthwatering delicious!  You must try this place and it literally worth the price!

We came from Manhattan with our friend who was visiting from Florida.  What a lovely experience!  The warmth we we shown, attention to detail and the delicious food made the trip so worth it.  There was not a crumb left on our plates each of us reaching into each other's plate to taste their choices as well.  We weren't familiar with Persian food so the Owner/Chef Nasim came to our table and explained what each dish was and suggested dishes to order for our group of 5.  She was on point!  Making us feel as if we were in her kitchen and treating us like family.  I will keep coming back to Brooklyn and to Nasim many times in the future!

My first experience of Persian food, and what a wonderful introduction! The website promised adventures in just the tastes I love, fusions of tart and savory using ingredients such as pomegranates, cherries, saffron, cumin, nuts, mint, garlic, tamarind, lime, lemon in amazing complex presentations. My opening night meal of spicy white fish (spicy was more a slow burn than the fiery spice of other cuisines) sent me to text friends to come back with me the next night, and the owner remembered me from my friend's telling her my name! Appetizers of meatballs with cherries, lamb & lentil patties, and olive tapenade preceded equally excellent chicken with plum, saffron and barberries and slow cooked lambshank. The rosewater sorbet was a perfect finish. Wine is available, a crisp rosé goes really well. This place is a must go.

I made a reservation for two at 7 PM but a family emergency caused me to cancel the reservation at 1 PM that same day. I phoned the restaurant repeatedly that afternoon, but got voicemail every time. I was charged $40 for the cancellation, a rather draconian policy that even most of New York's finest restaurants do not have. Sofreh is always fully booked, so I doubt the restaurant had trouble replacing my missed cover, and therefore this shameless and heartless policy is little more than an additional source of revenue. I will never make a reservation at Sofreh again.

Brava! An incredible dining experience. Took my partner here last night for his birthday & we were blown away smell taste & flavors popped every which way. Started with eggplant dip similar to eggplant carbonara - the veggie stood out, making you want to go back for more. Pomegranate salad (1st time I had the fruit which I never quite understood) whipped feta added nice tang to pomegranate vinegarette. We had rib eye, chicken, rice with carrot & orange zest, crunchy rice. Just go! I promise you will be blown away. Thank you!
No comment

I want to say upfront that the only reason I'm giving this restaurant a 2 star instead of 1 because the wait staff was great and very kind to every one of our needs. I also want to say that as a Persian American growing up with Persian food I've been to many Persian restaurants and this is probably the most over priced and weird restaurant that I have been to. The yogurt and shallots were subpar which was disappointing because it's my favorite Persian app when I go out, and this particular restaurant charges so much so I figured it'd be good. The thing that really set me off is the fact that I had to ask for sumac (which every Persian restaurant usually has in a salt shaker on the table) which they gave me a pinch of. When I asked for more the poor waitress said "I'm not sure if I can they got mad when I gave you some in the first place". What kind of authentic Persian restaurant is this? I know that this is something very petty to be upset about but when my family is about to spend almost $200 on our dinner I'd like to at least have a spice I always put on my rice and not feel like I'm robbing the kitchen. I'd rather pay a different overpriced restaurant in Manhattan than ever come out to Brooklyn to this place again. Again, nothing against the wait staff they were awesome.

Walked in on a friday night around 730pm, the restaurant was half empty but the hostess told us that the only available seating was at the bar because all the empty table had reservations. So we decided to give it a try and took our seats at the bar.  We ordered wine and then asked if we could order some appetizers.  The bartender replied that he had to take the whole order at once so if we wanted something in addition to the appetizers he had to know right away.  We decided to just do appetizers and said that it was fine we would just have the appetizers and not order anything else. He took our order and then my husband went to the restroom. While he was gone, the manager approached me and asked if I was with someone and a party of 2. I don't know why he was asking this. Then he began to explain that I need to order the whole order because they kitchen had to time everything specifically.  I said I understood and that I would just have the appetizers.  About 5 minutes went by and the bartender reappeared to ask me for my order again. Apparently he never bother to take it. At this point I was so fed up that I just said that we would pay for our wine and go. When we left the restaurant was practically empty.
No comment

Food was excellent, and if you don't often eat Persian the touch of spice/ unusual tastes  is deft. The decor is chic (if a more Miami than NY vibe). I was under dressed so the hostess damned us to eat in the cellar at the community table. Unless you are eating with a group and want some privacy this second class dungeon is no place to enjoy such special food. If the service was just a bit friendlier, over all, I may have rated it five stars.
The team of great Iranian chiefs bringing an unforgettable experience to NYC.  Highly recommend it
No comment
No comment

I am a fan of Persian food, and been meaning to go to Sofreh for a while. It is a culinary experience par excellence, each dish was special. The atmosphere is lively but not too loud, waitstaff is amazing. They were attentive and helpful. We had the lamb shank, chicken, Ash Reshteh, cauliflower, potato pancakes and eggplant appetizer. Lambshank and Ash Reshteh were my favorite, the sauce on the Chicken is also noteworthy. Try the ice cream, it's SOOO GOOD. I will come again for sure.

I've been trying different Persian restaurants in NYC for a while, and being a full blooded Iranian, they were all disappointing. Ignore the uncultured and ignorant 1/2/3 star reviews - this place will serve you an authentic Persian cuisine. The bread took me back to my childhood years because it tasted exactly like how my grandmother used to make it. The place is exceptionally clean, service is outstanding (they even guide your orders so it doesn't mess with your wine) and the food is so well made that you think you're dining in Iran. Thank you for bringing our culture to NY and doing it properly. This place should be ranked as the best Persian restaurant in NYC.
Delicious food served in a beautiful space. Owners have always been in the restaurant the four times I've dined here. One of my favorites in NYC.
No comment
The food was so wonderful  and delicious ( jyro and chicken kabab)I will come back to try more food.
No comment

Welcome to a fusion of home cooking with the elegance of fine dining. This is Persian food made with love not the traditional kabob joint but a melody of childhood flavors right down to the ice cream and faloodeh ( they call it a sorbet I think) it's a lime juice infused simple syrup served cold over super thin rice noodle. It's a flavor that you will not soon forget. It's a simple menu with complex flavors of home.

had a beautiful date night at Sofreh tonight. their outdoor seating. area is magical-- covered in vines and fairy lights. every dish we had was perfection and the cocktails the waiter suggested were the perfect pairing. we had the eggplant and whey dip to start-- creamy, savory perfection-- then split the plum chicken and the ribeye kebab, with some of the date-and-lentil rice as an accompaniment. the kebab was literally one of the best meats i've eaten recently. we also got the zereshk cooler, the saffron vesper, and something with sour cherry  that were all incredible and perfectly complemented the. flavors of the food. sofreh is not cheap, but it's absolutely worth the price for amazing food, strong drinks, and exceptionally attentive service. we will be back!
No comment
Would go back again soon, the staff are very welcoming, the food is amazing (probably best Persian food I've had in NYC) and the place has a good vive

This is a 2019 highlight meal. The food was so good that I forgot to take pictures of most of it. We got the eggplant dish, which I expected to be more like the traditional bademjaan dish, but this was definitely a unique twist. The cauliflower is so flavorful that I actually remembered how good it was even weeks later, which I feel is hard to do when cauliflower dishes are on so many menus. We got the lamb shank and the half chicken, both of which were delicious. I expected the chicken to have similar flavors to the traditional fesenjoon dish, and in a way it did, but it was so much better. The chicken was so juicy and tender and flavorful, and the saffron sauce on it was truly out of this world, but the lamb shank was the real standout. I think we were all fighting to get more and more of this dish before it finished. We also had a side of rice and the feta flatbread, so I'd say we maybe over ordered on savory food. Everything was delicious, but it was a lot of food. Despite this, I insisted on ordering dessert and got the ice cream sandwich. It was truly spectacular. I love the flavor combination, and the delicate cookie used as the sandwich was such a good addition. Even those who do not have a big sweet tooth with love this.

Was really excited to eat here based on all the reviews but was definitely overrated. Went a few weeks ago and disappointed with the service and the food. The server was rude and not an enjoyable experience. While the concept is cool, don't waste your time trying to get a reservation here.

I am a big Persian food fan. I finally found the place and was so excited to eat there even knowing it's SUPER pricey comparing to what they serve. We walked in, after a minute, the host told us we have to wait 45 minutes because they don't have any tables. We looked around and so many empty tables inside and outside. We realized we were not wanted so we just left. The host is very rude. I don't think I will ever go there.

The restaurant is so beautiful and chic. The food made with LOVE! The quality and taste is like home made Persian food which is so special. The menu items are all from different parts of Iran. The fish and lamb are to die for. I cannot recommend this place more!
The only authentic Persian food you will find in NYC. Beautiful place great friendly staff.  I am deff going to be back soon.  Food made with love
No comment

The food is both sophisticated and boldly flavored.  Everything we had was just delicious, from the eggplant spread and cucumber yogurt dip to the Persian chicken and beef + potato kebab to the refreshing but subtle ice cream.  This is definitely one of those places that feels more "New York City" than Brooklyn--open space, minimalist décor, reservations not only available but practically required.  If you're entertaining folks from out of town (or across the East River) this is a great spot to provide something original.
Very rude staff.  Not worth dealing with.  There were at least 20 open tables and they turned us away because we had an infant

Service was fine but food was a mixed bag. Lamb shank lacked flavor. Smoked eggplant mediocre.  Ash stew was tasty but more like a thin soup. We've eaten in many Persian restaurants in NY and LA and found this one uninteresting. Prices too high.

Have been wanting to try Sofreh for months, finally got to try it for Father's Day.  The food was delicious.   The eggplant starter was the highlight of the meal, really great flavors and the bread was so good.  We ordered more.  The main courses were also good but I could have eaten the eggplant starter all night.  For mains, we had lamb shank, ribeye steak and smoked eggplant entree -  all very good.  The lamb shank was perfectly cooked.  The ribeye had a walnut pomegranate marinade.  You could really taste the pomegranate molasses, in a good way.  Also perfectly cooked and with a side of delicious grilled onions.  The smoked eggplant entree is like a shaksuka, it has two poached eggs and served with the amazing bread.  We also shared a salad and saffron rice.  The ice cream sandwich dessert was fantastic.  The ambiance is calm, the restaurant design is very minimal and chic.  We happened to be there on the restaurant's one year anniversary so there was live music and free shots after dinner.  All in all, a wonderful experience.  We will be back!

From sassy service to disastrous rice, this place is quite the experience. We ordered a traditional Iranian rice with raisins and we had to use a magnifying glass and Sherlock Holmes to find the raisins. The servers said they couldn't add more raisins because they rice was premixed. Gotta be real the kebab was good.

I've been to all the Iranian restaurants in the city and Sofreh is a refreshing change. It's a modern update to Iranian cuisine that still nails the basics (especially the salad shirazi and the most-khiar) and even offers good tahdig, which is nearly impossible for a restaurant. We didn't have any problems with the service and definitely plan to come again.

I had a very enjoyable dinner at Sofreh.  The service was very good, they must have taken the harsh service reviews to heart, which is great.  The eggplant spread is a must - I would skip the cucumber yogurt as another reviewer said there is little to no cucumber or raisin.  It was more like eating a plain greek yogurt spread.  They were out of Tadig which was a huge bummer, so it may be worth getting an earlier reservation just for that - as well as the mung bean soup.  The ash was good, but I preferred Taste of Persia's version to be honest.  The flavors there are more bold.  I had the tamarind fish which was great.  Perfectly prepared and really unusual (to me) flavors.  The server suggested adding a rice side which I personally felt to be unnecessary - especially at $6-7 each.  Expensive rice!  I'd skip the rice unless you're really hungry.  One minor gripe is that we ordered 2 spreads, but were only given 1 piece of (very good) bread.  I asked for another piece of bread and was charged in full for it.  I didn't see them doling out half pieces of bread to tables that only ordered 1 spread, so what is that about?  Shouldn't you get 1 bread with each spread?  Minor, but still.  We got the frozen vermicelli noodle dessert which I wouldn't order again.  All in all I'd definitely come back.
If you don't mind feeling like cattle, being rushed through your meal, and average food, this is the place for you.
Service was quick and attentive. The kofteh and eggplant and yogurt dip were both outstanding starters. Lamb entree was fall-off-the-bone good.
No comment

I was very excited to try this new restaurant.  The feta cheese and bread and the yogurt appetizers are good.  The entrees have been inspired by Persian dishes but they are far from "Persian".  The chicken was very dry but the fish was better made.  It is overpriced (charging for rice???) but the restaurant will do well among those who prefer ambience over authentic Persian entrees.  Too bad they are not open for just desserts and coffee/tea, since their desserts are the best part of the menu.

So happy this restaurant opened near my home. I am Persian and the food here reminded me of my late uncle's amazing cooking. The cocktails were great as well. The place was packed so we sat at the bar. The owner came up and introduced herself, and she was super charming and hospitable. The decor is tasteful and a bit whimsical--there was a vintage pre-Iranian revolution art film projected in the bathroom, which was fun and unexpected.

Fantastic spot in prospect heights.  Fresh and vibrant flavors, warm room.  Interesting menu with multi-layered Persian flavors.  Many vegetarian options and healthier choices without sacrificing flavor.  Certainly a good dinner date choice or good for sharing plates with a group.  Cocktails were also nice. Will make this a regular stop for dinner.

Incredibly rude service, the worst I've ever received in NY which is an impressive feat. It's like the owners and the staff don't understand that to keep business in a place like Brooklyn you have to actually treat people well and not with utter unwarranted disrespect. Staff is also inexplicably arrogant. If you like to pay to have people be rude to you, go here. Otherwise go to any other restaurant in Park Slope where the service is generally full of nice and kind people.
Great choice for a very different dinning experience in Brooklyn. The choices are limited but they're all very good and tasty.The cocktails are very different and excellent

Old world, authentic dishes which are rarely ever found outside of Iran!! Some ingredients might be different, those are very specific to some parts of Iran, however they have substituted others to keep the taste very similar! The drinks are out of this world, the ambience is magnificent! The music is Persian and they are extremely down to earth,  mirrored exactly from the grace of the Persian culture. An absolute must!!

Goodness gracious. Don't even know where to begin. Many of the dishes are too complex for a simple palate. However, the food they have is IMPECCABLE. Everything hit perfectly. Recommend the eggplant/cauliflower appetizers and the lamb duck or fish for entree. So good!!!

I seriously cannot recommend Sofreh enough, it is AMAZING!  I specifically went into Brooklyn to check this place out and was so glad I did.  When I stopped eating meat, one of the things I missed most was Persian food.  I could not believe how many great options they have, from various veggie salad and sides, to an incredible eggplant entree, to a different fish option everyday.  Don't even get me started about the huge CRISPY TOP on my Tahdig or the rose custard . . . Cocktails, vibe, staff, etc., were all amazing.  I'll be hitting this place up every time I'm in NYC, so jealous it's not on the West Coast!!

The stew and the smoked eggplant were highlights. Great service and nice atmosphere. Would highly recommend trying it out. There were three of us and we shared 4 vegetarian dishes, 2 rices and a dessert.

The food is amazing and the décor is very nice. High end Persian food with a twist. Especially loved their eggplant special, the Persian herb & noodle stew, and the half chicken. Sides of their bread, assorted house pickles, and crispy rice are a must.
The food is elevated Persian but still authentic, and of course tasty.  The cocktails are amazing.  The space is beautiful and the owner is warm and welcoming.  Will definitely be back!

i'm not from the Middle East so not sure what comfort food is in that region, but for me, Sofreh provides what I'd call the highest quality comfort food prepared with care with amazing touches of special flavors. The lamb was outstanding, the eggplant dish wonderful, and the fish was cooked perfectly with a great tangy sauce. Will try to stop by whenever we've in NYC from the West Coast.

If you want a very unique taste of Iran, this is the place. The food is very delightful and creative. It really makes your taste buds come alive. We were pleasantly surprised by the great assortment on the menu. Well worth the price and we will come back again. Service was also outstanding.

Be very skeptical of five star reviews. What could be a good restaurant experience is mitigated by the expensive overpriced menu. I wish Sofreh the very best and realized they may be a victim of the very high rents and high costs of doing business in Brooklyn.

Went here when they first opened a few weeks back with my parents and it was phenomenal. The lamb fell right off the bone and all the yogurt dips were very refreshing. The owner was walking around introducing herself and she was warm and appreciative. I was going to recommend this place to some friends and I came across the yelp page, so I figured I would share the positive experience I had at Sofreh.
Food was great! My partner and I kept getting interrupted though.  The owner/manager kept coming over and basically read the entire menu.  It was a bit odd and annoying.

Exceptional food, phenomenal cocktails and the most lovely management and staff. Everything we ordered was to die for and everything we didn't order makes us want to come back. If reservations weren't so hard to come by I'd be eating here at least once a week!

Ambiance is clean, hip and contemporary. Drinks are overpriced and tiny. Food is OK, portions are small and they charge for rice something I've never experienced in a Persian Restaurant. Service was slow.

Great food and calm, eleqent atmosphere. I had (shared with a friend) meatballs and sour cherry, lamb shanks, chicken with plum and saffron sauce,  crispy rice, house pickles, and rose custard. I'm so glad this restaurant is open.The service was excellent and there were no noise level issues. So very pleasant. The owner is also the main chief. The care and creativeness she puts into the food pays off.

I recently tried Sofreh for the first time, after reading rave reviews. We had a larger party and they sat us in the basement literally right next to the dish pit where all of the dishes are washed (that's what the manager referred to it the first time I mentioned it was unbearably loud to her). The entire evening we had to raise our voices to the loud clamoring of utensils, dishes, and the dishwashers. It was constant. They only thing they could offer was a tiny table to switch to which one of us would be sitting in the main entrance area. Point is, you should not make a table next to a "dish pit" and I think its particularly unacceptable at the price point to do so. When I mentioned this TWICE to the manager, she then said "well no one else has never complained about it", the equivalent of "it must be your problem." CUSTOMER SERVICE 101. She should have come downstairs, and apologized especially since I said twice it was my friends birthday which should be a special night. And PS i was there with an Iranian friend, who said the food isn't even that authentic. In a city with amazing food and service choices this should not be tolerated.
No comment
Delicious! Everything was so flavorful and interesting--from the cocktails all the way to dessert. The space is very beautiful and inviting as well. We will definitely be back

Far and away the best Persian food I have ever had. Came in with a group of 4 and was seated pretty quickly on a Sunday night. We ordered a bit of everything and didn't have a single dish we didn't like. The smoked eggplant and the plum chicken were my favorites. Highly recommended.
No comment

Wow. This place. Utterly delicious. Complex, layered dishes that I'm still dreaming about. I already have a reservation to go back with a friend less than one week later. The decor is such a refreshing departure from traditional Persian restaurants. Sofreh is minimal, chic, yet warm and inviting. The owner, Nasim, is a gem and I could listen to her wax poetic about herbs and spices for hours. If you are Persian and used to your traditional Persian restaurants, go in ready to be blown away by something new and different and lovely. If you are not Persian, prepare to fall in love with Persian cuisine and hospitality if you haven't already.

Great neighborhood persian restaurant. Incredible interior design, cocktails, and food!  We got an entire spread from Ash to Lamb Shank to the Rose Water infused desserts.  Warm and vibrant space, well worth it to try.  Cheers!

Excellent addition to the neighborhood! The ambience is very nice, the food is not only delicious but really with the Persian spices and flavor. The staff is very professional, kind and ready for you and your questions all the time. We had a great dinner and definitely we will be back.

This place is fabulous .  The food is so unique , delicious and flavorful.  We had the kebab , chicken in plum sauce and eggplant entree and we loved them all.   We were practically licking the sauce from the plate.  Each person had a different favorite .  The ambiance and decor is bright , sophisticated but unpretentious .  The owner and chef stopped by and described learning from her aunts through the years and preparing her kids favorite traditional dishes at the restaurant .  You can feel the heart and soul that she put into every detail of the restaurant and food.  I'll be going back soon.

Came to your restaurant with some Persians and non Persian friends being excited to have found a Persian restaurant in Brooklyn.. i have to say i will never go back again.. the food was great but the attitude of the managing staff was beyond rude... $650 later we walked out so mistreated and not welcomed.. first of all if you are Persian know they rather cater to non Persians.. the gentleman that is either the owner or manager made sure you know that.. he even whispered to our waiter's ear" can you tell them to be more quiet" sorry didn't know we came to meditation studio! Then half way through our dessert and tea they rudely asked us to leave cause people were waiting for our table!! Really?? You are in the hospitality business if you are not hospitable you will not survive in this city no matter how good to food is!! Also be careful on how you treat people, in this day and age "reviews" can make or break a business! Best of luck!

The food was stellar. The lamb shank was the most delicious dish on the menu and by far the best Persian food I've had. The staff were also extremely friendly and welcoming. The cocktails were unlike any I've tried and are definitely worth a return to the bar.
Amazing Persian food. The lamb shank was definitely my favorite and Ann made some of the best cocktails I've had.

This place is absolutely amazing. Everything about it was wonderful -- from the design aesthetic to the atypical Persian menu to the hardworking family style owners and staff. We always longed for a Persian restaurant in our Brooklyn neighborhood and this one has really outdone itself.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Cozy cute bistro with food that tastes like home cooking. Favorite was the pork and scallion dumplings which had lots of flavor. Would love to have more vegetarian dumpling options. The veggie pan fried dumplings were a bit bland could have more umami. The cream cheese scallion pancakes were unique and heavy, like an Asian pizza. The cucumber salad was refreshing to go with the noodles and dumplings. Owner was very friendly.
No comment

The food was delicious and the service was even better! Our first time having the pancakes they were ooey gooey in the best way filled and topped with multiple types of cheese. The beef noodles were spicy, perfect for a blustery day. The wonton soup was the best starter, the broth was packed with flavor. Don't forget the boba; chocolate for the little ones and milk tea for Mommy! The ambiance was inviting, it felt like eating in someone's beautiful home.

I love trying new restaurants especially women owned. My friend and I got a sample of different dishes. The dumplings were the most unique I have ever experienced- the vegetables were finely diced and the dough was plump and soft (not rubbery like most dumpling places or more dough and less filling). Even the vegetable filing was not your typical cabbage-carrot filling, oh no this was vegetables I do not even recall because they blended in so well. The spicy oil is lovely on dumplings as well. The peanut sauce noodles were a bit too sweet for me. Cute spot with limited seating, good location.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here with the fam cuz we definitely craving for an Authentic Chinese Food! The menu is creative, vibe is trendy and every dish we ordered have a unique taste and flavor! We ordered a couple- hub and I shared the shrimp dumplings (eye popping good!!!) , bokchoy with oyster sauce, dan dan noodles and our daughter got the Sister Lin's chicken noodle soup! She devoured it! Oh and they also have cheesecake bubble tea! YUM! Overall a great experience and wonderful addition to the village! Staff was quick and efficient!
No comment

Yay dumplings. Thin skinned with a lacy edging to finish - just the way I like it. Spicy wontons and cucumber salad are light but fiery. Chef came out and gave us a sample of fresh out of the oven beef brisket which was on point - smoky BBQ vibes with Asian flavor. I didn't love the pho noodles used for the chicken broth but hubby was all smiles on the peanut noodles. I've been craving this place ever since we paid the check!
No comment
Lovely new dumplings, noodle, and bobo place. Nice staff, clean restrooms, good food.

This is a cute and cozy little spot in the West Village serving delicious handmade dumplings, noodles, and soups. They also make their own chili oil in house and it's divine. Recommend popping in for a quick dinner or taking out and enjoying in the comfort of your own home.
No comment

Chef Becky Lin's food is delicious, healthy, and authentic! Her attention to details is truly remarkable! Among other things, we ordered her world-famous Grandma's Peanut Noodles, and thought they were the best we'd ever had! Also, the dumplings are to die for! We are very grateful to have found her and her restaurant and can't recommend her enough! 5 stars all around!

Great neighborhood spot! My sister, kid and I tried the beef noodle soup, shrimp dumplings, cheesy scallion pancakes, curry chicken dumplings, cumin beef dumplings, cucumber salad, and the chocolate boba tea. Everything was delicious! The beef noodle soup felt so comforting, the shrimp dumplings have a southeast Asian twist, and my sister loved the scallion pancakes. We loved their twist on traditional dishes. Adding this to our rotation!

Our first time here, at this little gem. Friendly staff, clean and cozy, and absolutely wonderful food!! I loved everything I tried: 2 kinds of dumplings, chicken noodle soup, and the scallion pancakes?? To die for!!

Quiet. Quaint. Clean. Not overly complicated Chinese (Cantonese-ish style) food. We had tried the classic dumplings. It was very good. My kind of neighborhood place, no over the top service or frills. Space is small,  counter top seating and tables for 2.
Great food and friendly service. Tried the peanut butter noodles and the shrimp dumplings. Extremely yummy and well made. Looking forward to trying other menu items.
So, so good. Generous portions, convenient location, and the food is EXCELLENT. Highly recommended!
Love this place. The food is fantastic and the ambience is very warm / welcoming. Tried a variety from the menu and everything came out tasty. Definitely going back soon!

Tiny little restaurant with amazing homemade food. We were hesitant to come as there were few reviews, glad we took the chance. I highly recommend the Pork dumplings, Dan Dan noodles and scallion pancakes with cheese (sounds odd but we're tasty). We met the young owner as we were leaving who checked to see if we were happy. You won't regret a meal here!

DELICIOUS! Stopped by here after a visit at The Whitney Museum and tried a few items on the menu to share. Everything was fresh, well made, great flavors. My favorites were the chicken noodle soup and the cheesy scallion pancakes. Service was prompt, staff was lovely. The interior is so cozy and welcoming. Stop by here for good vibes and tasty comfort food!
We found this spot as soon as we landed. IT IS SO CUTE!!! don't even get me started on their playlist. ITS GREAT. makes brunch even more fun. The wild mushroom toast is BOMB

Every single thing on the brunch menu was something I wanted to try.  Went with the mushroom toast and loved every bite.  The servers made a crowded restaurant feel easy breezy.  The soundtrack was also great.
No comment

Ambiance is chill, dim lighting towards end of night, good for date nights. Service is decent, food came out in a timely manner and they took our order fast. As for food, it was pretty good. Got the parm fries it's really good. We also got the burger which was ok, for the price I've had a lot better. Needs a new bun. Shrimp pasta was good. Price point is good for midtown. I also ordered 2 glasses of Pinot noir. Honestly would just go w the bottle next time as it tasted like it was not preserved correctly and left for too long. Overall a 4.0/5.0 star experience

Delicious food, good service, great drinks. Don't have much else to say filling in space

Great cute, casual quick brunch spot, food was okay but nothing extraordinary. Mostly there for a nice ambiance to chat and hang.

The food tasted great and everything was very well cooked but the price for this makes it not very good value. Come here for a casual date or a meet up but don't expect them to go to the nines.

Yum! Perfect eggs on top of my eggs Benedict for $19. Steep price but filling. The toast is terrific. The beets to the side add great flavor. The meat itself is truly terrific. I loved every bite! Good service as they constantly refilled our water jug for the table. Seating outside was perfect.

At a glance it doesn't look like much but as I entered I was greeted by the Chef who told to grab a seat and enjoy his limited Australian menu which was great!    Great place for a quick bite and delicious food. Must Go!

I recently visited this restaurant for brunch and the food and atmosphere were great. The food was delicious and the atmosphere was inviting and comfortable. However, the service was not as good as I expected. The waitstaff was not as attentive as I would have liked, and it took longer than expected to get our food. Despite the service, I still enjoyed my meal and would recommend this restaurant for brunch.

A really good weekday brunch. We had the Pulled Pork Benedict with a generous portion of pulled pork-- fans of pulled pork would love this. We were asked if we wanted to add avocado or bacon, and we chose avo which was a good choice-- the coolness of the avo balanced out the heat of the pulled pork. We also had the Brekkie Roll which was a delicious breakfast sando. I had the espresso martini which was dark and coffee forward. The presentation of the drink is excellent. My dining companion had the Flying High, which was also good. The interior is nice and unassuming. The service was friendly, attentive, and excellent overall. Would return.

Nice outdoor patio and good food. Portions are on the smaller side but high quality.  Only improvement would have been hot cappuccino. Two of us ordered the drinks and they were delivered lukewarm which is a bummer for a breakfast joint.

No comment

We went there on Wednesday and it was a very unpleasant experience. 2 stars for the food. That place was freezing. They said the HVAC was broken. So my friend and I had to wear jackets when having our food for the entire time. Then, around 12:05 pm, the back door opened and the construction started. It was loud and there was some weird smell coming from the backyard sitting area. BTW, the lettuce of the Chicken BLAT Was bad. To be honest, when your HVAC is not working especially when the whether is around 32 degrees, and when you have super noisy construction going on inside the dinner room, please don't open the business if you don't have any solutions.

We went to try the fried chicken sandwich I was seeing in their yelp page but unfortunately they changed their menu which is seasonal. We still decided to have the mushroom toast and smoked salmon lox with a poached egg. The mushroom toast was very savory with a little kick. The lox had layers of flavor with the lemon cream cheese, pickled onion, dill, cilantro and smoked salmon. Both were very tasty. The only challenge with the lox, was it was hard to cut while leaving everything in tact since it was toasted but just needed to reassemble after it was cut and the egg could have been a little bigger. Also had the pinot gris which was a nice glass of wine.
No comment
No comment

Brunch at this place is the best. Lots of varieties of open toast. The yogurt bowl also changes style according to the season. Usually there are not many people in the weekdays. Good place to sit down and just chill.
No comment

Best brunch spot in Williamsburg! It wasn't too crowded even in the weekend I guess because they have both outdoor and indoor seating available. We tried the classic avocado toast and their signature chili scrambled eggs and they were delicious. Everything was on point; flavorful but not overwhelming. Their toast was thick but it's still soft overall. Highly recommend this brunch spot!

Was looking for a breakfast place close to our hotel and this one had great recommendations.  When we arrived, there wasn't a wait and got sat right away towards the back of the restaurant.  Our server was really nice, and she was funny when brining our drinks and there was a slight spill.  We joked that we needed $0.13 taken off the bill for this and she joked back with us.   Ordered coffee, espresso and mimosas along with Smoked Salmon Lox Toast & Avocado Smash with a side of bacon.  Neither disappointed and, both were the right amount of food to not be stuffed buy satisfied.  They have a pretty extensive brunch menu for weekends and if I lived closer would definitely come back to try other items....particularly the Bloody Mary.

While the term hole in the wall my make you think of a dingy place, the actual restaurant just has small real estate. Perfectly lovely and modern restaurant with a great drink menu and really great pasta. It also helped that the outdoor seating was very nicely located and the night I went had live duo jazz. Definitely an added bonus. While I could tell there was a staffing shortage, the service was still good and very fast. I got a Bee Knees, which was particularly delicious. The cocktails weren't overly sweet and really refreshing. I went with the sausage and orrechiette. Absolute YUM. The portion was plentiful and the ratio of cheese to pasta to sausage was really delicious. That slight bit of spice was quite a kick that wrapped the dish together. I will give even larger props to this restaurant as I accidentally left my work bag and it was still there when I returned - gotta love that. Great place for a date, really great food and the drinks were on point. An unexpected gem in this neighborhood.
No comment
No comment

Honestly such a hidden gem in the area! Loved the decorations/ambiance when I walked in. The food here was really good and I loved the plating. Very photo-worthy for your social media! It was actually pretty spacious here and my party of 5 were seated right away for Sunday brunch. Our host and server were a bit busy so it was a little hard to get their attention but they were still friendly.
The food here was pretty mediocre and overpriced. The ambiance was okay, but it was pretty quiet for a Friday night dinner.

Love walking in here Saturdays for lunch! Great service and lots of menu options. Can be a little pricey for what it is though. Just basic egg dishes and salad in my opinion. Fries were delicious though. Lattes were okay. Overall good spot to go with friends

Wonderful service. Terrific ambience. Pretty laidback vibe. Thoroughly enjoyed brunch and have every intention of going back.

Breakfast was great! Small place but quaint, indoor dining with outdoor dining space as well! Great waffles. Eggs! Bacon! The best, hot fresh coffee ever! Service was great!

Good food and great ambiance / not great service / had to walk in both to get a menu, and then to find someone to pay the bill with
