Came here to pickup lunch. We were the first ones to place our order. But still took about 15 mins to make a break sandwich with eggs and fries. Got grapefruit juice and orange juice. Saw it being poured out from a carton. Expected better quality. Orange juice was normal. But grapefruit juice tasted so watery. Sweet potato fries were good. The sandwich is mediocre.

I wish I knew this place for brunch earlier. I was looking for the best brunch around flatiron area for having a weekday brunch and this place comes up. We ordered market salad, brekkie roll (no bacon), chili scramble, and sweet potato on the side. We love everything we have, We finish all the food and not even single crumbs was left on our plates. Gotta be our faves brunch spot!

Not bad, not good. Just a very average brunch that left us feeling "whelmed." Service was nice though!

Two words: Still hungry. Wish they offered a side salad or something for the price of this entire avocado toast meal. I do feel as though the food lacked seasoning as well. Ambiance and vibe of this place was nice, drinks were good too.

Hmmm, I have to say I was pretty disappointed by this place. We came here for a late lunch and it was pretty empty, which we thought meant would be more attentive service and less wait times.. it was quite the opposite. We ordered all our drinks and food in the first 5 minutes and the drinks slowly started coming out within 15 minutes. But we waited nearly 45 minutes for the food, which I thought was ridiculous, considering we were the only ones there at this point. Now, I know that the servers have nothing to do w kitchen wait times, I'm very patient usually but what disappointed me was that nobody seemed to do anything about it. He didn't really care nor did he even pretend to check w the kitchen LOL. Things like that lower the experience for me and overall lower the quality of the food. I ended up getting the pulled pork benny & the mushroom toast. Both were ... eh. I honestly wish I got the plain breakfast roll instead. Overall, I had high hopes for this place bc it is really cute inside and the menu had a lot of potential, but better luck at another place...

Honestly I did not have high expectations after reading the reviews on Yelp. We were seated right away for brunch on a Sunday. I ordered an iced latte - was a bit too sour for my taste? (Also I didn't realize they charged 50 cents separately for ICE?). Other than that, I must say the Shrimp Reginetti was the star of the show. It was such a perfect mixture of Pesto/ String Beans/ Pea Tips/ Shrimp/ Pasta. My sister got the Chilli Scramble Egg and it was not that impressive. Service was fast and the servers were very nice. I'd definitely come back for the pasta!

Rafael was our server at this chic brunch establishment and he made the whole experience. Fast, attentive, and hilarious commentary. Food was delicious, I got the avocado toast which was refreshing. My friend was obsessed with the pulled pork Benedict. Thank you Rafael!

We weren't overly thrilled with the food. The blistered Brussels sprouts were good but the pork roll was undercooked (the puff pastry was still half raw) and they were cold. The entrees were okay not great. The cocktails were good. The service was okay.

Went here yesterday for brunch and it was so cute!! I had the Market Salad which was amazing and everyone else enjoyed their meals too. I love how the menu changes every so often and they mix things up!

AMAZING. The vibe is amazing. Definitely recommend the espresso martinis. The staff here is always so friendly and personable. Will be coming back.

The best meal I've had in awhile. The egg was cooked to perfection. The waiter was so nice and caring!! Highly recommend.

Came in last weekend for brunch. They have a nice outdoor patio. I was very warm even though the weather was chilly. I started with a flat white with almond milk. It was a good size and very tasty. I really wanted a smoothie, but they said they were out of bananas so I was pretty bummed. But I ordered the avocado toast and a chocolate croissant (balance right?). The avocado toast was absolutely amazing! The balsamic drizzle really just kicked it up a notch. The croissant was nothing special. Overall a good meal! Some good brunch options!

Decided to go out for a quick lunch with my friends and Hole in The Wall definitely did not disappoint. We got seated right away for a group of 5 and our food came out very quickly. There were so many options from their menu and all the waitresses were so kind. I got the Impossibly Good Burger and I can indeed say, it was impossibly amazing! It was quite messy to eat but they really do give you a lot in the Burger. The fries were too salty though, sometimes it felt like I was just eating salt. However, everything was good. Had a great experience with my friends and would definitely come again to try the rest of the menu.

Love, love, love the bartender and drinks she served up. The staff was super friendly and are a joy to talk to throughout the meal. I safely can say the experience was stellar in terms of service. However, the food is shy of that. If you were to swing by here, it's best to stop for the booze and go somewhere else for the food. I suppose for what's it worth, the establishment probably serves mostly hotel guests for the convenience and yes, the charm. In all honesty, the drinks were amazing so come by to wet your whistle!

No comment

Good coffee but it took over an hour to get the mushroom toast. The bread wasn't toasted and the fried egg turned out to be a hard boiled poached egg, no runny yolk. It was barely warm. The only thing that kept coming out of the front were drinks but the food was ok for the price; the wait made it impossible to recommend.
THE BEST FOOD! staffs are very welcoming too and they have very nice ambiance :) This will be my new fave brunch place after!
No comment

Came here for brunch on a weekend and had a great experience. The food was delicious and well priced. Service was relatively good but not great. The environment was nice and warm with heat lamps and plastic dividers between tables. There is something on the menu for everyone with a lot of diversity in choices. I'll definitely be back! 5/5 stars for a great all around brunch spot
It's always good at Hole in the Wall. I enjoy the whole menu and family dinning
We came here for brunch. Great staff and delicious food, coffee was good too. 5 stars!

Amazing food.....I just had to post this photo of this tasty burger and fries.Loved the services. One my favorite places to eat. Real chill and they are pet friendly...Love this place.

wait time wasn't too bad but hostess was rather cold and unwelcoming, came here a my dad for brunch and while our waiter was wonderful(!) we did initially get dirty water glasses :( food was alright! My fried chicken was a lot more fry than chicken and the mushroom toast was good but let's be honest how much longer are we gonna consider one slice of toast to be a 15+$ meal? No matter what's on it... anyways the vibe of the place is pretty chic but there are def better options nearby

Extremely Rude Service. That's it. Good luck.

This place is super amazing for brunch! I recently went here with my best friend and fiancé to enjoy some mimosas and burgers! The staff are super sweet and attentive to us while we placed our order. I highly recommend this if you want a cute place for brunch or dinner! The mimosa was not strong but very good and the burgers are cooked to perfection! I will gladly be coming by next time for other menu options!

No comment

I came here for brunch with my mom on a Wednesday morning. I saw on their website they don't accept reservations for breakfast/brunch but since it was a weekday morning, i figured that would be ok. We went around 10:30am and only 2 other tables were occupied, but that quickly changed after we were seated. By the time we left an hour later, the place was mostly full. I liked that their menu wasn't too big so it was easier to order. We both got green teas when we sat down, and I asked our server for a few recommendations. She suggested the pulled pork Benedict so i ordered that and my mom ordered the spring bowl with salmon. Both dishes came out quickly and were so incredible. The pulled pork itself was marinated perfectly, it was mouth watering. The spring bowl was also a good size and the veggies were seasoned well. I'm definitely coming back here next time I'm in the neighborhood!
Hole in the Wall is okay. Not many vegan options. Coffee is good. Super long wait time!!! 1+ hour. Once seated, food and coffee took a while to come.

Sat outside on a Thursday night. Service was absolutely awful. Waitress had no idea what she was doing and had to ask for water after 20 minutes. Ordered a hanger steak and then they were all out of it. Honestly a pretty shitty time and wouldn't recommend

Ambiance was nice, inside of the restaurant was super cute. Avocado toast and the waffles were lackluster, both came out kinda cold. Mimosas and service were good. Would go back for happy hour and a cute insta pic.

No reservations but they allow you to add your name to a list before you get there. Happy we found them on a Sunday not much open for brunch that we could get into or wanted to. Service was pleasant and attentive until we needed the bill, then nobody was around. Otherwise food was great. Pulled pork Benedict was killer. It was on a piece of toast with a huge portion of pp. the chia bowl was so yummy. The sammie's were eaten up quick too as was the side of fries. Sammie's came with herbed mayo and an another dipping sauce. Would return. Oh the hotel henri provides the bathroom but it was not maintained and badly in need. You've been warned.
The food here is okay, but restaurant seemed to be understaffed. Not sure if that's a regular occurrence. Drinks were great!
No comment

Went here for Sunday brunch and got there early so avoided a wait. I'd recommend getting there early because it got pretty busy as the day went on. We got the OG burger, the Impossible burger, and the fried chicken burger. All three were delicious and came with a huge portion of perfectly cooked fries. We all also got the watermelon mimosas which were delicious and very reasonably priced. The ambiance and service were excellent, and this is definitely a spot I will be coming back to!
Amazing service,food,drinks and staff! Best espresso martini I've ever had. Niesa and hector were the best, so friendly and fun! Niesa also made the espresso martini and it was so amazing.
Niesa and Hector are my favorite people ever! They made my night the best ever I love them !
Cute place with yummy food. Ordered a matcha latte but it wasn't as flavorful. Good stop for a quick breakfast!
No comment

I have been here several times and have always had a great experience! There is a nice outdoor patio in the front if you would like outdoor dining, and the inside is quite spacious as well. I've been here for brunch, dinner, and happy hour, and all the food has always been great. Love their truffle fries! They also have good happy hour deals before 7. If you're in the area you should definitely check it out!
Had lunch with my friends, spacious indoor/ outdoor seating. Great location and ambiance! Friendly stuff and delicious food!
Had a lovely breakfast here. Cute place. The chili eggs were delicious and so was the mimosa. I have celiac and they were very accommodating and the food was still great! Would recommend.
This place is a Gem, is super in the middle of a dark street in flatiron, not really a hole in the wall, very nice ambience and and great food.
No comment

Wonderful! The food was so fresh and delicious! They also have brunch on the weekend with mimosas was so delicious! Only gripe is they charged me $6 for OJ! That's crazy. I mean I'm already paying too price for food.. don't need to take it to the next level with over charging for non- alcoholic beverages. Place is cute as well
No comment

Adorable little restaurant, loved the interior and there was plenty of space inside. We got sat right away and our server was super attentive the whole time. The chili eggs was pretty good but the impossible burger was MUCH better! Love that they use kewpie mayo and the cheese was so melty. I ended up stealing most of my fiancé's impossible burger instead of finishing my chili eggs. The fries were also perfectly crispy!
Such a cute lovely place. Good for alone dining or lunch date type of spot! Service was on point as well

I loved the atmosphere of this place. It was nice and peaceful, but maybe because it was a Monday afternoon. The food was good, some dishes were a bit small but definitely tasted really good. I got the chicken sandwich which was a little bit more crust than it was chicken, but the flavor was there. The iced coffee is a no-go but the sweet potato fries were so good.

It's a known fact that any Hole in the Wall restaurant is a hit and miss. The Williamsburg location is great for brunches but not for dinner. This one follows the same, but today's surly barista pretty much made it a miss in my books. We ordered a Nutella mocha with nary a chocolate or coffee in sight (or smell or taste). Plus it also took forever to get her to acknowledge us let alone serve us
Awesome spot for chitchat and cocktails. I ordered pork Benedict and espresso martini. Also the latte was great!
Great food and good service. Went for brunch with a friend and had a wonderful experience!

Our group of five had a very nice brunch today.  Lots of breakfast items, as well as salads and burgers.  We had an assortment of items--the breakfast sandwich (egg, bacon and arugula), scrambled chili eggs, and avocado toast.  Everyone enjoyed their food.  The atmosphere was comfortable and service good.  Definitely recommend, but come early because it gets crowded later in the morning.

Had an overall good experience. The food was delicious.  The shrimp spaghetti was a bit spicy but was soooo good. My daughter loved the cheezey burger, and so did I although I only had one bite. They give you fair portions, and I definitely took home a doggy bag. We had brownies for desserts, which was just the right amount of chocolaty. Only complaint was that it felt like the A/C was on full blast so it was chilly (some people were wearing their coats while eating even though we were inside).

The fries have been for sure frozen and burned. The hamburger was average. The only thing that worked was the service. Maybe was not their best moment of the day, but guys, you cannot screw this up so bad.

Came for dinner and it was good! The burger was a little bland but the fries were solid. The whipped feta appetizer was our favorite by far. So delicious! Roasted carrots were only okay. Service was good but our server wasn't wearing a mask, which kind of threw me for a loop. In NYC we are just so used to all servers wearing masks so that made me slightly uncomfortable. I'd love to come back for brunch when covid calms down!
No comment

Just had brunch here. Ordered avacado toast and waffles. Best toast I had it a while with poached egg and fresh avacado. Waffle was very good , came with a banana , strawberries, caramel, ice cream and some jam. Only thing If I can change is to have them put the jam on the side as it was little overwhelming. But over all good was good and fresh
No comment

Fantastic! Great for a hangout with friends or a date night with your partner. Fantastic food. Small plates perfect for two people. Entrees are delicious as well, and let me not even go into the cocktails. Everything was delicious and staff are accommodating and friendly. Had a wonderful time and already scheduled to come again!
No comment

This is such a perfect location. The patio space has a great ambiance and the brunch menu was delicious. I wanted to order everything but I had self control. I really enjoyed the avocado toast because you can never go wrong with such a classic. They waiter also recommended the chilli scramble eggs and I couldn't not get the dish their known for and it lived up to all the hype! The other dishes were also amazing. They came on time, the hosts were attentive and I had an overall great experience! I'm so excited to go back for the dinner menu.

Ni'esa was the best server I've ever had! Great drink recommendations and so friendly. The entire staff was prompt, friendly, accommodating.  The Brazilian Sunrise was delicious and I could drink them all day. The OG burger was cooked perfectly with the right amount of lettuce, pickles and special sauce. The fries were perfectly cooked and I highly recommend a side of their chipotle bbq aioli. Will definitely be back, especially for the great music playlist throughout our meal. Definitely come check them out

Brunch for two was $40 and it was definitely not worth it. I found a hair in my drink as well...
No comment

Everything we tried was delicious, the service was great and all tables were comfortably distanced from eachother. Loved the ambience and greenery.  Highly recommend the brekkie bagel, avocado toast, shrimp rolls, and fried chicken sandwich. Both Waffle fries AND normal fries were amazing.

Awful service. With the place maybe half empty, it took about 15 minutes for our server, who was outwardly unfriendly, to deliver us water. Our food arrived before our coffees, which we had to remind them to retrieve, and the food took ages. The food was basically cold, but we'd been waiting for so long by then that I scarfed it down. My wife ordered a hot chocolate; whoever prepared it needs to be advised that there is no such thing as "unsweetened hot chocolate"; i.e. a mug of hot water with cocoa powder is not a hot chocolate, it's a hot gross drink. At no point did our server ever acknowledge any of this. No apology when we had to order our drinks again after receiving our food first. Never asked how anything was. Never thanked us. I have no idea why i even gave him a lousy tip, he deserved no tip. I got the sense that they were understaffed but come on, at least acknowledge that, be nice to your customers, ask for their patience...any of those things and i absolutely don't mind. But when you couple major service problems with a rude, totally oblivious server, yeah, don't go to this restaurant.

Was looking for a quick place to eat on a rainy and cold day, saw good reviews & stopped in. During covid they have covered outdoor seating which was so cute and well lit. We were famished & asked for bread and butter and was sent out...sliced bread and butter. Any respectable restaurant has this basic. Shrimp parppardelle was BLAND and extremely spicy. I tired to doctor it up with salt/pepper but it was literally inedible. I sent it back! My sisters had the cheesy burger and the fried chicken sandwich. They were both okay at best. Ended up ordering in once we got home. Waste of time and money. Skip this.
This gem continues to knock it out the park! Fantastic coffee, service and vibe. Can't wait for cocktails on the deck in summer.

This is an amazing restaurant. We just stopped in for happy hour on a whim and there was safe live music! The performers we phenomenal and the food is delicious. 10/10 recommend for heated partial outdoor dining. Share some of the menu options and relax!!! It's the perfect spot.
No comment
This is a great place to eat. We sat in outdoor seating which was nice to have amidst covid. The food is rich, but definitely delicious. I definitely would recommend their fries.
The food was delicious & Rafael was such a good server! Had us laughing the entire time, definitely recommend!
honestly it took a long time to get our food and their menu is not very long. very few things to choose from and everything was overpriced even for new york. cute place, but not my favorite
Really great fries. Well cooked. Accommodating staff.  Interesting combos on appetizers.
Excellent gnocchi and delicious salad. Little over priced though. Flatiron district has so much to see. Harry potter was near by.

Came here after a long bike ride around Manhattan. The restaurant has a lovely outdoor seating area and the ambience is awesome. I ordered the Vietnamese fried chicken which was delicious. The chicken was juicy and crunchy, paired well with the pickled carrots and radish. The shrimp pappardelle my friend got came with a ton of crab meat. Our drinks, summer smash and pink 75, were good too, and strong.

Whether you're looking for a perfect breakfast, lunch, or dinner spot - this is the winner! This new location is nestled between 5th & 6th ave at Hotel Henri and offers such an relaxing ambiance you almost don't feel like you're in the heart of Manhattan. The food is second to none - my favorites would be the summer bowl (pictured) and the impossible burger. They offer endless vegan, gluten free, and other allergen-free options. Quick & friendly service too :) Love this spot!

Loved this place! I visited this restaurant while I visited the city this weekend, it was so good!! The avocado smash was soo delish and hands down the best espresso martini I've ever had! this is a must visit each time I'm in the city!

My wife and I were super excited to try this place... waited over 45 min for a table... it was a Sunday, so okay... but felt like others were taken care of before us... finally got a table... service was sub par... had to get up to ask for our drinks after our food arrived... food was ok... nothing we would come back for... my smoothie was Luke warm ... taste was good... just disappointing but I'm sure how busy it was played a role.
No comment

Despite slower than expected service, I was in love with meal. We came by for brunch and I am so glad that I ordered the pulled pork Benedict. Everything about it was so delicious! I will be back, for sure, next time I'm in the city.
Cute outdoor seating area. My dish was a bit cold but tasty. The pork had some kick to it that I really appreciated. Eggs were poached perfectly.
Looks like the Hole in the Wall team have done it again! Great location, awesome service and the food was fantastic. Recommend the Aussie Iced Coffee and Chili Scrambled Eggs to everyone!

Food and drinks were amazing the gnocchi was to die for also gluten free!! And to top it off our server Jonathon was fantastic great vibes from him super chatty and very attentive!! Would be back just for him!

column3: Fort Lesley J. McNair, Washington, DC
column6: Went to this restaurant today. I had the OG burger and it was perfectly made. I also got the Brazilian Sunrises drink and it was delicious.  However, the highlight of my eating experience was the guy who served us. Not sure if he was the manager, but he was awesome. He gave great recommendations and was overall pleasant to be around. The establishment was clean. Would highly recommend and I plan on coming back.

I haven't written a review in a long time, but this place kind of blew me away. The seating is cute and quiet (not next to a busy street). The service is amazing!!! Our server offered to swap out our drink for another since we didn't end up liking it. The food is also great, got the shrimp papardelle and vietnamese fried chicken sandwich (the fries were so good!) Will definitely come back! Also a tip- happy hour is from 4-7p where there's $5 beer, $10 cocktails, and $20 sangria jugs.

Came to this place for brunch and did not regret it! They have a small cute patio with some tables and really focus on COVID guidelines with contactless menus and contactless payment. The portions were huge and the prices were very appropriate. The pictured summer bowl is a great light way to start the day and the fresh fruit was delicious.

I went for breakfast and really expensive for one avocado toast 15,25usd , here is the picture , could be ny prices but if you charge this unless the portion should be bigger , I think to add mushroom but the charge will be 4usd more!!! One box of mushrooms are 2usd !! Definitly I dont come back! Good servicen

The brunch menu is simple yet complicated. Has a variety of choices to pick from, but each dish is served with a wide range of flavors.  I tried their Pulled Pork Benedict and it had the right amount of sauciness and saltiness. The savory flavor of the pulled pork mixed phenomenally with the smoothness of the yolk spread on top. Definitely coming back here for brunch again!

I've been here before and really liked it but I must say this place has the dumbest system I have seen ever. There is no hostess, just people crowding the door. A waiter will come back once in a while when a table is empty but don't give any idea of how long the wait will be. I feel awful for the staff- working hard but definitely strained. There is a bar in front but you can't eat or order drinks. Just fix your system to be like every other restaurant or allow reservations for the sake of your staff and patrons.

Nice place to go for brunch. Rich set of gluten free options to choose from for me - I picked the pulled pork Benedict and was very pleased! Pork had a slightly sweet barbecue flavor which meshed well with the savory eggs and hollandaise. Coffee was really good too - husband commented on how good it smelled at arrival. He went the lunch route with a fried chicken sandwich that he enjoyed (not rave review but good). Enjoyed the covered outdoor seating space on this temperate day.
No comment
The food is delicious. We came 11am on a rainy day without a reservation but got seated. Nice experience.
No comment
This is a great spot, in a great location. The manager Lisa there is awesome. She is super nice and professional. They have a great happy hour as well.

We came here two days in a row. The food was fantastic but most importantly Lisa was amazing. Incredible service and personable. Also just tell her what type of drinks you like and she will customize one to your liking. 5/5 recommend. .
Waited an hour for food that never came. They did seem to not even realize that we were missing our food as we stood to leave. Never coming again!

Amazing cocktails and great food!! Made reservations for two on a Saturday night through Yelp same day which was awesome. Their outdoor seating arrangement is actually very nice and almost feels enclosed. I hate being cold while I'm eating and I was definitely fearing this but luckily they had their heating lamps on full gear and made it feel nice and toasty. I will say their menu seems a bit limited and would love more options, nonetheless the food was delicious. I had the Vietnamese fried chicken sandwich and my boyfriend had the shrimp pappardelle which he loved so much! He couldn't stop talking about how good it was. Their portion sizes are also perfect! My only complaint which really had nothing to do with the restaurant was about the front desk staff at the hotel that it's connected to. When we left, we walked in through the hotel to use the restroom and told the woman that we had just came from the restaurant and she said that next time we need to go through the restaurant inside so that it doesn't look like we're random people just trying to use a bathroom. I just found it to be a bit rude, other than that-- 10/10!

My new go to place for happy hour deals. What's not to love? The friendliest staff (love them!), great food, cute outdoor seating, no complaints! Looking for recommendations? I would order the truffle fries and the impossible burger.

Great place for happy hour! There were heaters spaced out and the setup looked great and very modern! Music was great as well (throwback r&b) I got the Vegan Bolognese ($15) and truffle fries ($11) which were amazing and filling. Definitely recommend this place!
Excellent staff, service and food. You can't go wrong on your expectations and experience.

This spot is phenomenal. The drinks and food are amazing. Ordered the crispy pork dish (recommended by employee here) and fried potatoes with crispy chorizo and they were amazing. The burger is everything.
Good food. Not too loud. Lots of seating. Good service. Kind of expensive. We had the brekkie roll and pulled pork Benedict. The portions were large, so we were plenty full. Coffee was good, too.

This place is amazing. If you're looking for a truly amazing brunch that's low key, relaxed, and catered by an amazing staff: this is your place. Honestly the service is top notch. The GM Lisa is a delight and Andrew does a marvelous job of balancing a large amount of tables at once, both are experts in creating an experience that is personable and genuine. The food has great portions and the cocktail list is truly inspired. Dill, grapefruit, basil, Negroni spins...anyone who appreciates good mixology will find their niche here. This is now my go to brunch in NYC and I can't wait to see what the dinner menu holds!

They did an adorable job of being 2020-friendly at the flatiron location! Feels like it was always meant to be a chic indoor/outdoor vibe. Good food, but VERY good drinks :) when we were last there, an acoustic music act was playing - fun ambiance.  Staff is delightful (especially Susan!), and you can tell a lot of guests are regulars because of such good service and the neighborhood vibe :))) will be back!

Delicious food, creative menu, wonderful outdoor patio and great service... what a great combination!  Addition of "Yelp Waitlist" makes it easy to secure a table, even with a wait. A great brunch find in the neighborhood!

Horribly slow service for a weekday lunch. They should just call this place avocados and eggs. I think they buy eggs and avocados in bulk. Every dish is served w either an egg or avocado. Large portions of mediocre food.
Good brunch spot, but overpriced.
Good atmosphere but service was slow. Out of Gluten free options. The fries and fried chicken tasted like they were frozen not fresh but everything else good.
AMAZING truffle fries and burgers!! Pasta was ok, but everything is affordable and their outdoor seating is well-heated. Extremely polite waitstaff. Would come back for dates or dinners with friends.
No comment
A newly opened oasis in Flatiron! The food, coffee and drinks are delicious. Decor and ambiance great for a date or large group. Plus perfectly located. Highly recommend!
We love the service and the atmosphere, thankfully at 10am it was empty so it was also safe and relax to be there. Food was delicious  thank you!

My husband and I had the spring bowl and chili scrambled eggs for brunch. There was a hiccup with our order, and the staff was very proactive about correcting the error. We enjoyed the food and will be back in the future.
Great service. Avocado toast was good. I'm still writing because Yelp yells at me for my brevity.

Place is super cute. Service was great! My pasta was just ok, but my friend ordered the fried chicken sandwich and that was really great. The fry on the chicken was perfect! What made the experience great was the staff. Everyone was so nice and their vibes very cool. I would come back in a heartbeat
Had the chili scrambled eggs, avocado toast, and a side of bacon. The food was good and portions were large. Service was friendly and quick. Good stop.

Oh my God, Hole in The Wall - Flatiron was certainly cool. The atmosphere was casual and friendly. After reading through the reviews I bought Chili Scrambled Eggs, and it was so fantastic, it is now my favorite dish. All of the staff are incredibly polite - you truly feel welcome and looked after. It was seriously an amazing experience.

Waited a long time for our food, and when my $14 avocado toast arrived, it was only a single tiny slice. The drinks are super expensive as well for the tiniest glass. They also charged an absurd 11% tax...of course dining is expensive in this city, but this was just ridiculous. I left hungry and pissed off at both the restaurant and the friend who suggested it. The menu isn't anything special - go somewhere else and save your money.

I was really excited to try this restaurant because I had read pretty great reviews and I loved the decor! I'm giving them one star because the drink I had was incredible-- I highly recommend the Brazilian Sunrise, it's light, not too sweet, and just delicious! I also suppose they tried to impose a gesture of hospitality when everything went awry with dinner. I came here with a friend and we ordered the roasted cauliflower to start which tasted amazing, but took a relatively decent amount of time to come (perhaps 20 min) and was lukewarm. After waiting another 30 min for our entrees (2 hanger steaks medium rare with steak frites) we had to stop the waiter and ask where our food was. He said he'd check with the kitchen and then came back to report that there had been a "miscommunication and our orders would be out soon". We had waited about an hour for our food at that point, so he was kind enough to comp the entrees. We continued to drink and 15 minutes passed, then 20, then 30, then 45.. and still no steaks in sight. We stopped him AGAIN to ask where our food was since it had now been 2 hours since we ordered, and he said he'd check with the kitchen and then in about 5 more minutes, our entrees come out. My friend and I immediately looked at our brownish grey steaks, and not only could we tell that they were WELL DONE but they were essentially cold. The fries were also cold and tasteless. We asked our waiter why it took 2 hours to get the wrong steaks and by this time since it was 10pm, we were starving so we just wanted to send our steaks back and get them cooked the way we ordered them--medium rare. His reply to us was that they " just ran out of steaks for the night". As a New York City restaurant on a Friday night, I couldn't believe that this was true and I have never heard something so absurd in my life. The restaurant was barely at half capacity! We immediately asked for the check and we left. The service was abominable Our initial waitress checked on us once after giving us our appetizer snd drinks, clearly never put in our entree order and then she just left without notice and our new waiter only spoke to us when we flagged him down which was once every HOUR that we waited for the wrong food. I'm happy that they comped us for our entrees (again, probably the only reason they're getting even 1 star) but we still had a nearly $120 bill for drinks and our lukewarm cauliflower appetizer. I take choosing restaurants very seriously and as a native New Yorker, I was so disappointed and embarrassed to bring a friend to this establishment. I'm writing this review to warn others that maybe they were having a bad night, or maybe this restaurant simply isn't worth going to. I sincerely hope someone from management sees this review and works diligently for this mistake to never happen again.

Truffle fries have become my favourite side! I had it here for the first time! We went during happy hour and in all honesty their cocktails were pretty average but the ambience and restaurant itself was gorgeous. If you're walking by it, definitely stop by to try the fries.

We came in for brunch around 10am which was not a busy time for them, the waiters were nice and friendly but they did a poor job checking up on us. They didnt check up on us once, and we were out out water. Service was pretty bad and the food was okay nothing great about it, somewhat bland. There's better brunch spots in NYC dont let them 4.5 stars fool you.
No comment
Amazing service and mimosas! Also, location was great and very cute inside. Will be coming back soon!!!!

Went here for a quick dinner with some friends, and it didn't disappoint. I ordered the Shrimp Pappardelle but replaced the pappardelle with the gluten free gnocchi and it was amazing! The waitress was very attentive, sweet and efficient. The seaside distancing drink was delish, very refreshing and the coconut milk wasn't overwhelming at all. Would def recommend this place!

column3: Downtown Jersey City, Jersey City, NJ
column6: I've dined here twice in the past week. The service is spot on, and impeccable. They frequently ask if everything is ok, and if anything is needed. The food is good. The staff is warm-hearted and courteous. Kudos to whomever the manager is. I will definitely be coming back soon!

This place was so great! I went here solo for a quick drink. Their happy hour deals were so affordable. The patio seating was spacious and comfortable! I got a cocktail and a glass of white wine - both delicious. I also got their impossible burger. As a vegetarian, this bar was so accessible. The burger was amazing, and the fries that came with it were perfectly done. I will definitely be coming here again! The server was so sweet and attentive. Thank you, Hole in The Wall!
No comment
Great service and Amazing food! The Impossible Burger and the Pulled Pork Benedict was an absolute delight!! Would definitely go once again!

The food was exceptional,  and everything was cooked well, but I do have to say that the service was a bit lacking. Our meal took 45 minutes to arrive, and the waitresses messed up our order. Overall i'd say that this restaurant was a solid 4/5
No comment
The service was just as amazing as the food. I work in the area sometimes and this was the best food i had in Manhattan in a very long time. Thank you to the staff for the service.

Almost an hour for just my latte, still waiting on the food.  They forgot our order, blamed their ticketing system in the back, but supposedly that had nothing to do with the delayed latte.  They brought someone else's food to the table, then brought my latte to someone else. The food finally came, the toast was burnt on the pulled pork Benedict, they only provided a dull butter knife to cut it. The poached eggs were hard boiled. Over all the taste was good, but was an unpleasant experience.  The wait staff kept saying they would check on the latte, wAs told it was being made, but that apparently was someone else's. They were apologetic, but I'm just not sure I believe them.  Will need to buy coffee elsewhere. The latte was tiny.

Really liked it here, surprised that I worked in Flatiron for so long and have only tried this recently! Great drinks, service, and let us stay as long as we pleased if we were ordering. Would certainly go back.
We had a late breakfast and it was great.  I had chili scrambled eggs. The service was good. The coffee was killer what more can you ask for
Service was friendly and helpful! Location ok! Food nothing special, typically simple American type!
No comment
No comment

amazingggg food!! i had the impossible burger so yum! we got to the restaurant at opening around 10am and already had so many people there :) always a good sign! did take awhile for us to be given the check when we were done eating and just sitting there for 10 minutes till i flagged the waiter down and asked for the ticket. but they were getting a rush so understandable!! definitely going again soon
The best new spot in Flatiron! Great setup in a great location, and the food was especially awesome - loved the shrimp pappardelle and burrata. Yum! Cannot wait to be back.

Hole in the Wall's new location at Hotel Henri is amazing. There's an airy, open outdoor seating area and everyone is seated at a comfortable distance away from each other. Staff was super attentive and wearing PPE. The food was 10/10, I highly recommend the Chicken Ragu Penne and wings!

Had a reservation for brunch today and was really appalled when I arrived with my friend to find that this restaurant is actually indoor dining in a very tight space in the lobby with 95% capacity full. From pictures and recent reviews, I expected an outdoor deck with plexi glass and socially distanced tables, but that was not the case. The tables were about 1-2 feet at max from each other, and there were no opened windows, except for the open entrance, which was insufficient. There was plexi glass installed to the tables left and right of you, but not behind you. There was a group of 6 people dining 2 feet behind me with no plexi glass divider. Given how tight and uncomfortably close the tables are, I felt extremely unsafe with the underwhelming COVID-19 precautions taken here and would not recommend anyone coming if they're not comfortable catching COVID. I'm not sure why they didn't have outdoor dining today but would not return until the pandemic eases up.
Visited a couple of months ago. The entire experience was awesome! The food was delicious and the service was good.

With a large, outdoor patio, friendly servers (I've had multiple great experiences with Susan especially), and delicious food and drinks, Hole in the Wall has been my go-to spot since outdoor dining re-opened. It's in a hotel, but with the lack of tourists in the city, it feels like a local hang. You can even catch live music on some nights, but the outdoor ambiance is perfect even on a regular night, since the patio is set back from the (not very busy) street. They take COVID precautions seriously, and do so in a way that feels unobtrusive and puts diners at ease. I'll keep coming back as long as the weather allows!

Came here after reading the reviews posted here on Yelp and they are all accurate.  Atmosphere was good, food was good along with the service.  I really wish I could have experienced their regular menu instead of the COVID menu.  I guess this just means I will have to return to get the full experience.

I wish I could give more than 5 stars. The food was delicious, the impossible burger was one of the best burgers I've had in a while. The service was excellent. Veronica and Lisa took care of me and made sure to answer every question They were very helpful and very polite definitely will be back.

I'm staying at a hotel a couple blocks away and I'm so happy I came to this breakfast/brunch spot! The avocado toast with a poached egg on top was AMAZING and the perfect size. Both my latte and mimosa were perfect. My server was a sweetheart, very warm and welcoming. :)
Outstanding service and superb cocktails. The food is excellent, highly recommend brunch or the burger. This is officially my new favorite spot in NYC!

Visited back in October for dinner with three friends and sat outside. Sat right by the heater so we were warm. Ordered the wings, truffle fries, the burrata, impossibly good burger, and one more dish (I forget). Ordered drinks as well. Drinks were tasty. The burrata and the wings were good. But they only give you five wings lol. Other dishes were just ok, not memorable. Service was ok. Our table was too small for 4 ppl. But other than that it was a good experience. They had live music which was nice, but keep in mind this was in October.

I came her with 3  of my girls for a little Friday brunch. 2 of us arrived before the rest! Jonathan was our server, he was so nice and assured us it was okay to wait for the rest we felt so bad our friends took forever to come! We asked so many question and he was so Patient and answered all our questions been the annoying picky people we are lol! He was so nice and pleasant, and the food was amazing! The food/Jonathan is the reason We'll be back! The burrata was sooo fresh and creamy we got 4 different dishes and shared them all with each other! All in all! Great spot for brunch or lunch with your friends!
The food and drinks are 10/10, would recommend to a friend! And when you go just hope you have Jonathan as your server he is A1
Staff is friendly. MUST get the truffle fries, best truffle fries, my mouth is drooling thinking of it. The price is reasonable for the food.

What a night. If I can give 100 stars, I would. Food and outdoor seating of this restaurant are fantastic. Everyone should try their truffle fries, OG burger, and shrimp pappardelle. I was blown away with the quality of service I had tonight. After my friend and I signed our checks, I was ready to leave the restaurant when my phone slipped and fell through the crack of the patio. While I was flabbergasted, the staff of the restaurant remained calm and tried everything to get my phone out. They first used a hammer drill and other tools to get my phone out through the crack of the wooden patio. The waitress brought us frozen margaritas as we anxiously waited. It seemed like it was an impossible task without breaking the patio. However, Lisa saved the night. She used cake knives with mastery just like how you would play the Operations game and was able to get my phone out. I was really touched by the amount of care and dedication from every staff-- while it was a stressful situation, they mediated the tension with a sense of humor and kindness. Thank you so much Lisa and the entire restaurant staff who rescued my phone tonight. You guys are the best and I will be coming back soon! Promise I won't drop my phone next time!!

The food was great the Vietnamese Fried Chicken Sandwich was a bit too spicy for me, but i still enjoyed it and the bomb fires that came with it. I definitely recommend getting the brownie which was also really good. The workers were super nice and so was the vibe.
Great drinks, food and service. Seriously, great! Especially the recommended drinks from the bartender:)
Yesterday was my first visit to Hole in the Wall, and it will not be my last. The food is delicious and the service is outstanding. Lisa the manager is an absolute doll, very attentive and friendly.

Great outdoor seating and great food and cocktails, no less than I expected given reviews. but I felt compelled to write this because they have genuinely the sweetest most helpful staff. I've never written a review but they deserve a shout-out!
This was a perfect outdoor dining set up, awesome happy hour drink specials, truffle fries were amazing and Susan & Juan took great care of us!
Great food, consistent service, would recommend this spot for any occasion.

Honestly it's so nice to come to a place with great service, and makes you feel super comfortable in these times, can't stress how much I recommend this place. Food is absolutely delicious! And cocktails are even better (Seaside distancing is on point) will definitely be back!

So today was my first experience at hole in the wall. I had high expectations since I was visiting with a friend of the restaurant, and let me say the service was beyond memorable. They welcome you as one of their own. Lisa in particular, she works so hard but never hesitates to bring warmth to your experience. Sami was there from the beginning with open arms. We'll be back soon no doubt.

Big fan of the Hole in the Walls' work and their new Flatiron location does not disappoint!! Amazing deck to relax and enjoy arguably the best brunch, coffee and cocktails in the city. You won't want to leave!! Definitely add this to your hit-list and go and check it out.

My first time trying this place and I'll definitely be back. The food was amazing and full of flavor. The servers were very friendly and attentive. Lisa and Veronica answered all of my questions and made the experience even better!
No comment
No comment
No comment
Really cute spot tucked away in west village with the usual charm of the area. Nice upscale brunch spot with delicious brunch choices and fast service. Also great for big groups!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

2nd time here was even better than the fist. Here is a pic of my wife (on the right) and our neighbor enjoying the wonderful food at Mino for New Years Eve. The staff was excellent with the right amount of attention. The complimentary glass of champagne was a nice touch. My wife and our friend had the scallops and I had the steak frites with a delightful pulpo appetizer. Everything was fresh and expertly prepared. For authentic French food at its best, highly recommend. Merci Beaucoup!
No comment

Went there with a big group for and had a great night. One of the only downsides is they do not sell liquor only wine and Champaign so limited cocktails. We tried a lot of appetizers and  even a couple of mains to start. We tried the Tarte Tatin D'endives, Burrata, grilled Octopus, and then the Mussles and Gnocchi from the mains. Everything was really delicious my favorites were the Gnocchi and Octopus. The Gnocchi was in a delicious creamy sauce and the Gnocchi must of been pan fried as well because it was a little crispy as well which i loved. Octopus is one if my favorite things and this came with a yummy pure, the octopus itself was a little tough but veryy flavorful. For the Main I got the Filet De Boeuf Rossini and it was great! It has a really beautiful presentation and the foie gras was a great compliment to beef when you ate them together. For dessert we tried the apple tart and creme brulee both were delicious. Definitely will be adding this to my go again list.

After a warm November weekend in the city, the temperature finally dropped come Sunday. Mino Brasserie was a perfect dinner spot for a meet up with friends from out of town. The candle-lit dining room and menu of french staples were fitting for the chilly night. We ordered a bottle of Cloudline Pinot Noir, Burrata Des Pouilles, Gnocchi Aux Truffes, Boeuf Bourguignon, Potage de Saison (Potato and Leek Soup), and a side of frites. The highlight was the Boeuf Bourguignon with tender, generous pieces of beef and deep, complex flavors. To finish, we ordered the Mousse Au Chocolat. The service was swift (a nice surprise with a mostly-French restaurant crew) and the food tasty. I would highly recommend this new West Village restaurant.
Another excellent outing at Mino Brasserie. Food was just as expected and the service glitters. Wish the group would open one on the UWS and Morningside Heights.
Food is amazing Filet De Bceuf Rossini is my Favorite! Must try it! The staff is very friendly and nice.

The food is really delicious. We ordered octopus for appetizer, the sauce, which is made of sweet potatoes, is so creamy. Filet De Beef is a must order. We ordered the medium rare, the meat is so tender.
No comment
Really enjoyed the food here. Cute and cozy places for a nice date night!! Plus their steak is amazing!! Highly recommended!

Mino Brassiere is a new French-style brassiere in the West Village. It appears to be suffering from becoming too popular, too soon and the staff may be having some difficulty handling it. That said, the food is good and the atmosphere is terrific. If nothing else Mino Brassiere will survive on the business from the overflow crowd from the always completely booked Don Angie across the street. Mino Brassiere is a welcome addition to the neighborhood.

Just ok. Prime location and good service but pate was sorta healthful tasting and lacking in flavor. My hanger was really medium rare and a thicker cut than I'm used to but it was ok. Jus was good. Fries were ok. Very ok place if you're seeing a theme.
Mino is a cozy and fun neighborhood french restaurant. The ambiance and food were perfect, with the portions being definitely more generous than expected!
Great restaurant. My friend and I both enjoyed the filet de boeuf Rossini! Highly recommend it!
No comment
The food is so amazing. The vibe is very chill. Highly recommend. It's a great new restaurant in west village!

First time here and was not very impressed. The atmosphere is probably the best part. Lively and warm. The salmon tartare was mostly avocado and not much salmon. The burrata was standard. And the burger was lacking flavor. The wine was great. Service seemed slow and had to flag folks down multiple times to order.
No comment
No comment
We loved our meal! The creme brûlée and chocolate mouse were to die for! Will definitely be back!
Excellent service. Delicious food. The savory endive tarte was fantastic. I love that is this is traditional French but not old and dusty. Beautiful atmosphere and lighting; lovely spot
No comment
This new restaurant is such a gem in Greenwich! The server is super nice and I love the food. The menu is eclectic and everything worked so well.
No comment

We decided to try out this new bistro on a Friday night. The food and atmosphere both way exceeded our expectations. The waiters are very friendly as well. We enjoy this meal very much and would definitely come back!

We have a wonderful dinner tonight. Our server Ali provides us the greatest service and recommends  us the best dishes. Ribeye steak and the risotto are the must to try. Ofc the dessert toooooooo. They are incredible!!!
No comment

It's not often where you get excellent food AND service!!!Our hostess and waiter were both super sweet and had superb recommendations! We ordered the octopus as the app and it was cooked perfectly (not chewy!!). My friend and I both got scallops and they were SO smooth and actually a good portion that paired well with the truffle purée. All in all amazing and I would 100% come back! Such a good atmosphere too!
Beef stew reminded me of my days back in France! The servers were very nice and the Octopus was easily one of the best octopus I've had in my life
No comment

Great restaurant. My wife and I dined there, outdoors just this week. We'll be sure to come back. Though we ate outside they were very attentive. I liked my beef stew (don't know how to spell the actual dish), she had the scallops. The best part was the desserts. Overall a great experience. We would definitely come back here again. Highly recommended.
No comment

We had such a lovely date night at Mino Brasserie. It felt like we were dining in Paris, from the beautiful food, to the decor, to the server with the french accent, to the many customers conversing in french on all sides. The onion soup had a deep, rich flavor. The salmon tartar sat on a layer of creamy avocado alongside a lemon wedge for extra acid and crispy crostini to scoop with. The boeuf bourguignon, served in a little round pot, was heavenly. I wish I had the stomach capacity to try more of the menu. I'd love to sample the deviled eggs and the burrata appetizers next time. This is a truly authentic french brasserie, a very welcome addition to the West Village!

We had an amazing dinner at Mino tonight. The wine list, food, and service was phenomenal! The restaurant also had great ambiance and in a great location in west village. Authentic, high quality French food. Highly recommend it for a date night or night out with friends!
We had the Beef carpaccio and grilled octopus, they were delicious. And the waitress were attentive and nice. Will definitely come back for more.
Outstanding food, great atmosphere, very friendly. We had mussels, cod with ratatouille, leek tart, profiteroles and loved them all!

I want to love this place. A block from my house. A brasserie. Super cute interior. But it is a big miss on most fronts. Entrecôte was tasteless. I asked for salt to try and add some life to it and I got a shaker of Morton's iodized. Didn't help. Fries were mushy. Beef Bourguignon was one note. Nothing seasoned. Busser kept hovering over the table to try and remove single plates as individuals finished ("Done? *whap!*) including asking me if I was finished with one plate after they had already picked it up. At one point there was one person with a small salad plate in front of them and everything else was cleared. Just awkward. Someone who has actually spent some time in a real brasserie needs to go and set these folks straight or they will need to hope they have a short term lease.

Cute environment! Awesome Service! Tasty food! We ordered octopus and foie feas poele as appetizers. Both are good and authentic. Love the apple marmalade. I ordered scallops as main and it's so special. Recommend this place to everyone.
Having a good night here with my friend. Two of us just walk in without wait arriving at around 8:30pm. The service is nice and the food is delicious.

My boyfriend and I had the most delicious meal here. From the friendly staff, to the prompt service, to the delicious food, I cannot recommend this restaurant enough. We started off with delicious oysters and a charcuterie board. Our main meals were the scallops and the mushroom pappardelle, which our waiter highly recommended, and they did not disappoint.  It was a fantastic meal of traditional French fare that felt new and bright.
Great French restaurant addition in the West Village. We loved our meal! The Filet de Buf Rossini was the star of the show. I will definitely be back to try more dishes!
Delectable French cuisine in the heart of the West Village. Thoroughly enjoyed with a group of old friends - couldn't ask for more ambiance on a lovely Saturday.
Very delicious. Will definitely come next time. I highly recommend Boeuf bourgignon to everyone.
No comment

We love the food and the service! We were recommended by a French friend to come here. We're not disappointed. The ingredients are fresh and served with both good taste and aesthetics. Definitely recommend! Personally hope that not too many people know this place but it is definitely worth my recommendation wholeheartedly.
Great new French Bistro in the west village.   Wonderful staff and food.
Food, service, and ambiance were all amazing! Would definitely come back for lunch or dinner!
Delicious meal and 5 star service! The food was flavourful and fresh and they had a great wine list. Waiters were very knowledgeable about the menu and went above and beyond! We'll be back!
The food was stale and burned  called the restaurant and the manager just didn't care - et voila never again

WOW!!! Service, Food, Ambiance. Everything was absolutely perfect for my 30th birthday dinner here with 22 people.The Owner and Manager thought of every single detail and made sure that every minute of my birthday was perfection. Everyone is still raving about the food and level of service that was provided that night. Thank you again to everyone that helped make that night what is was. If you are planning a large or small dinner I would 1000% recommend you do it here!

This place was absolutely amazing. The pasta dish was amazing. They where so accommodating at everything that was asked. If you need a place to eat in west village, THIS IS THE PLACE!! Also you have to ask for Ali he was a phenomenal waiter!

I've been to multiple French restaurants in the U.S, and I specialize in reviewing them. Mino is not your typical French restaurant. They are not here to just sell the idea of French cuisine to you. They are here to immerse you into it. Their menu is very diverse from the red meat to the white meat. They are excellent at both. They do scallops like you have never seen before. I hate giving 10/10 because a dish is never perfect, but I cannot think of another way it could have been better. So I give their scallops a 10/10. Their poulet suprême (chicken) is not your typical chicken dish. It's an fusion of art and cuisine. By the time you are done with your meal you feel as if your palette has increased. Their lemon tart feels like a childhood memory. You will wonder if they stole your grandma recipe. It's a must every time you go there a 10/10. Presentation is excellent and the interior is splendid. The staff is very welcoming and the chef make sure every plate that goes out is a work of art. Mino is authentic French cuisine it's for the lovers of culinary cuisine that are there for the authenticity of the food and not just the French experience. It's the best French restaurant is NYC right now. I've been to over 30 French restaurant in the U.S, and Mino is my number 1 right now. No place I look forward to eat at all the time.

We had a delicious meal and wonderful service at Mino! Highly recommend the Mino Roquette salad, the risotto and and entrecôte frites as some of our favorites. Wine selection was lovely and served at the perfect temp. So happy to have this new gem in our neighborhood!
Beef capaccio was solid but the mussels entree was very bland and needed flavor and the accompanying fries were mediocre.  Good service and ambience but was unimpressed with food.

wow  where do i start ?  had a relatively nice meal here ..service unbelievably slow took 15 minutes for the server to get to our table ...everything took a long time    we were ok with that ...didn't complain even the waiter (from Turkey) apologized several times for the slow service . Had the Beef Bourgignon and the Steak Frites...a lovely bottle of wine . THEN.....as we are WAITING for someone to take our credit card to pay for the bill...a tall very unfriendly unprofessional man comes to our table and says "we need your table can you please hurry up and leave"...SO....i think I've seen it all but this tops the cake ...UNBELIEVABLE..really?   you all take your time and deliver slow service the whole time we are there and then have the nerve to tell us WHILE our credit card is on the table WAITING FOR YOU to take it ..habe the nerve !  i am a chief concierge of a major hotel in the city   ..live in the neighborhood..what can i say  ..horrible experience and NOT recommended...too many other restaurants in the neighborhood and the city that know what they are doing ..this place doesn't !!!

We were really excited to dine here. We made reservations on OpenTable 7 hours in advance. When I called to check in, the person on the phone said it didn't exist. She apologized but reassured me that the reservation was safe when we got there. When we arrived, they assured us the table would be ready in 5-10 minutes. After a couple minutes, the table was clean and ready for us to sit. When we check with them, they said it would take 2 minutes to sit. We waited for at least 5-7 minutes more and during this time we see at least two groups of people who get sat immediately. We check a third time and again, we received the "it'll take 2 minutes" response. While we were staring at this people-less, clean table, not one time did they apologize or even look at us. So, after the "2 minutes" of no acknowledgement - we took off and ate a fabulous dinner at Cafe Cluny, right around the corner. We got sat in less 3 minutes, no reservations. If you got this far into the review, don't waste your money at Mino, go get some Cafe Cluny - the salmon is wonderful.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Overall food is good with nice service. Rotisserie chicken is the highlight of meal! Skin is crispy and meat is tender.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Finally went to The Four Horsemen and was not disappointed. Walked in at 5:30 with one other person and was able to get a table. The service was really good and professional, and the staff shared great recommendations. Would recommend getting a little bit of everything and sharing, as the portions are quite small. Small plates but definitely big flavors. My favorite was surprisingly the celery salad: it had walnuts, dates and mint which went really well together. The scallop was DELICIOUS- so soft and melts in your mouth. Sweetbread was really good as well. The ambiance was great, candle lit and very friendly staff.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The flavors of the food were amazing, the sweet potato tiramisu is a must order. Ambience was really relaxing and well curated. A bit expensive based on serving size of salad but quality was worth it and they gave a good pour on the wine.
No comment
I went here with a few friends and we tried a variety of things off the menu. Everything was spectacular. Portions were small but I knew that going in. Highly recommend booking a reservation here!
No comment
Good for a quick bite, very quality and tasty food options. They change menu every week, alway have something surprised you. The only downside is the seats are very crowed.

A must see if you are in Brooklyn. Attentive and nice service staff, the wine service is excellent and the waitress helped us choose some great dishes as well. The Manchego critters are excellent and I hope they're still on the menu if I ever get the chance to go back.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I really enjoyed this space and would definitely be back. It is a small setting, emphasizing itself as a "natural wine bar". Very quaint with beautiful artwork. The wine was exquisite (hopefully not just placebo effect!) - I really enjoyed their selection of wine + how it was presented, as well as the service. The staff seemed to really care about my happiness + selecting the right wine for me! Just great ambience altogether. I was also very excited that this spot was featured heavily in Master of None (first date episode!!). The polenta was one of the mains that I could eat, and was recommended heavily to me by my roommate. It's not my favorite dish generally, so I wasn't wowed; but if you generally like polenta, the mushrooms on top are WOW-worthy for sure. I definitely want to be back to sample more wines + enjoy their space.

Blown away!! That's all I can say. I was absolutely blown away by the four horseman. I knew they were known for wine, so I expected that. But, the food is perfection as well. This hip yet inviting Brooklyn wine bar has changed the game. A novel of a wine menu, but don't worry the staff will guide you. Speaking of the staff. So helpful and efficient. Then the food. Every dish was great. I don't think you can go wrong. Everything is fresh, seasonal and made expertly. The trout was my highlight, closely followed by the pork chop. Also Tokyo turnips we're impressive. I could go on and on but why? Just go and try it!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came for Father's Day per my husband's request. Glad we did!! Food was delicious, so were the drinks. We had orange wine and beer, him mostly. They were able to make plain pasta dish for my daughters.  The home made pasta and fried chicken were on point. Staff was friendly and attentive. My husband already wants to go back!! #teamnirvana
No comment
I really love the cool, upscale but laid back vibe of this spot.  The wine was excellent and the staff was incredibly helpful in guiding us through their menu.  The food was wonderful!

Good food but not at all Michelin quality. Also, the service is complete chaos, I would have a given it a 5 star rating if they did not have a Michelin star. Wine collection is average, nothing special. Worth one visit, but I don't care to go again.
No comment
Amazing food! We went for a birthday party and the staff was great when I was booking for a group of 6.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

We had the most amazing lunch here. Could only get reservations at 11am but took them. What a great place. Wines were all amazing - loved the orange wine recommendations but also loved the whites and reds (we love all wines). Food was amazing - flatbread, scallop, parpadelle, squash toast and beef tartare was all amazing! Dessert and dessert wine were also amazing! Can't wait to come back!!
No comment
No comment

Simply the best. That's it. That's the review. Go, see for yourself! If you don't have a reservation, recommend showing up right when it opens at 5. Have been able to get tables that way nearly every time!
No comment
No comment

Fantastic restaurant!  I've had this on my list for a few years and thought it was more of a wine bar that served food.  But I would say this is a fantastic restaurant with excellent wine.  Got the citrus salad, polenta and sticky toffee pudding.  Paired each one with wine.   Will come back, an absolute must.
No comment

Amazing understated spot in Williamsburg and the best meal of the weekend. Perfectly balanced cocktails. The Fried wax beans amazing- we could have eaten a second plate. The best ham sandwich we'd ever had, I could eat that bread for every meal- it sounds odd, but that simple ham sandwich was the single best first bite of a weekend w 3 Michelin restaurants in the lineup. The tuna was so fresh and the sauce the perfect balance with it, as was the slaw that accompanied the fried quail. LOVED this place!

Ate here for the first time this weekend. Overall, disappointed. With 1 Michelin Star I would've expected more exciting things than a a single soft boiled egg covered with mayonnaise on it (partially my fault for even ordering it), very curious on how they arrived at the price of $19 (insult to injury they charged me $24), other than that had a scallop  crudo that was fine, rosemary fritters that were underwhelming, sweetbreads which were the best part of the meal, and a very average butter bean curry dish.  I know they change the menu often so hopefully this was just an off night. 1 star

This is a great spot to catch up with friends over wine and small bites. I wouldn't recommend it for dinner as the portions are smaller and the menu is a little limited. However, everything did taste good and the vibe is cozy (af). The staff here are also so sweet and helpful.
No comment
No comment

The Four horsemen hands-down is one of the best restaurants in New York City! The food and service are top-notch. We felt like welcomed to a family dinner where every little detail was well thought out, authentic, and salaciously delicious.

I think truly a 4.5 but I have a special fondness for it due to the wonderful, kind service. The burnt cheesecake is spectacular, my favorite thing on the menu - it's not too sweet and subtly complex due to the vinegar. The wine selection is obviously fantastic and recommendations from staff have always been great. I do think the food is a little overpriced, (don't expect to eat a full dinner here), but the pork chop is well-cooked. The tuna steak, on the other hand, was microscopic and overdone. Vibes are really good, would be great for a date even though tables are a little small.
No comment

column3: Downtown Jersey City, Jersey City, NJ
column6: No comment
No comment
No comment

Can this place be any more perfect? I'm obsessed with every single detail of this restaurant. The food is delicious, fresh, and delicate yet hearty and nourishing. The menu is always shifting with seasonal additions but it doesn't change too fast so there is always a familiar thread. Great for a date night, special occasion, or solo at the bar. Their desserts are exceptional. The staff is beyond lovely and clearly serious pros when it comes to wine and service. The lunch on weekends is delightful as well. Definitely top 5 in Williamsburg and #1 in my book.
No comment

Dinner is an excellent time to visit this restaurant. The food was really delicious. I ate here and placed a light food order. The beef tartare was quite delicious. Excellent menu options and a great portion. The restaurant has a great atmosphere and is very amazing. Excellent service and a fair price!

Great vibe; very approachable yet the staff is extremely knowledgeable and happy to pour you tastes of a range of wines. The food was exceptional! The scallop dish with ginger, chili and roe especially stood out. Wish I could call this place my Living Room.
Absolutely exceptional food and great service. A nice gem in Williamsburg. Loved the lively ambiance.
No comment

As shown on Master of None, a great spot to grab a drink with a date. On a Friday night had no wait, but a buzzy crowd. We didn't eat, but the food looked delicious. Note to self return ASAP. Great selection of wine, awesome pour, and an incredibly lovely bar tender.
No comment
No comment

I stopped by for my bday lunch quick and was blown away by the food quality here! How ham&cheese sandwich could be this good?! It was the best ever in my life. Wow. Just wow. The wine selections for winelist at lunch was great as well.

Food was delicious we had the oysters we had the halibut, the muscles, and a half chickens followed by the ginger ice cream with honeycomb. Everything was amazing very happy with the service very happy with the food a definite come back to

column3: Lower Nob Hill, San Francisco, CA
column6: The best truffle fries you'll ever have! And incredible cocktails. Highly recommend!!

Good place. Expected a little more after hearing about it on The Grape Nation more than once. Hard to focus on much else since my patio seat was so uncomfortable. Service was okay, but spotty. Have to say, the food was really good. Outstanding food. Just wish the seating could be improved. Wines are interesting, eclectic and great for wine nerds. Would love to return for an insider's seat. Cheers.
No comment
No comment

We had a reservation right at opening and it ended up being perfect. 11-12 felt early but you'll be able to take in the entire experience. Everything was incredible, timely and the staff were friendly

Friendly attentive service, very delicious food. Nothing not to like, really. Definitely a solid choice but the dinner times book quickly because the place is very tiny. Def. deserves its Michelin Star.

I've tried to get into this spot a few times and the one time I was lucky we just ordered a few glasses of wine (no food).  Service was great - really liked the waitress and we had a conversation of the plant on the window bar side. She was super friendly and knowledgeable about the wines on the menu.  Will be back for food+wine next time!

I wasn't able to make my reservation on a beautiful spring Saturday afternoon, and forgot to cancel. I was charged the resy cancellation fee, and very politely asked the restaurant to consider refunding. As I explained, I'm local and was planning to visit at a later date. After receiving a truly condescending response, I will not be taking my business to Four Horsemen. The manager could have easily stopped at "Unfortunately this sort of thing does fall within our cancellation policy" and I would have understood. Policy is policy, but please refrain from speaking to potential customers like they are children.
A friend and I stumbled upon this place after a GPS mishap. We were surprised we could get a table and honestly, we're lucky we did.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Professional and knowledgeable staff. Delicious food and wine. 5/5 can't wait to go back

One of my best dining experiences in NYC to date. The food and wine were incredible. The intimate vibe is great for a date. Hard to get a reservation but well worth it. If you're looking to impress someone, including yourself, go here. It's 100% the move.
No comment
No comment
This place is my favorite restaurant in Williamsburg. It's the perfect date night spot - and their menu never ceases to amaze me.

For brunch the food and price here are great.  $35 for three courses set menu.  Service is good.  The beef bourguignon, salad, and dessert were all very good.  Dinner is not a set menu, and I would be eager to return.
No comment
No comment

Delightful, simply executed and well constructed plates, think a bowl of perfect cherry tomatoes and a dollop of garlicky aioli, a plate of charred scallions with earthy squash and peppery pecorino, or a almond semifreddo with olive oil and flaky salt. The weekend lunch is kind of perfect. I love that they give you the time and the space to lounge away, get a couple of glasses of wine and enjoy the company. And the wine is great -- a lot of depth here. The service is warm and inviting. One of the best spots in the city and the perfect way to spend a weekend afternoon.
Love four horsemen! Amazing wine, food, service, and atmosphere. I'm giving them a 3 because I wish they would bring Daymoves back!

We ate there today, our first venture out during COVID. What a lovely late afternoon lunch. The sun was warm, we had a very nice table for two. The limited menu (who doesn't?) had Antipasti which was very tasty, loved the addition of anchovy. I had a cheeseburger and fries (don't laugh!) and it was delicious. They serve natural wines which I adore and I had a nice full bodied rose. They give you safety instructions as you sit down and the staff were as diligent as one can be. We felt extraordinarily safe. After this positive experience, there is no way in hel..I am going "Inside" a NYC restaurant and try to stay safe. Outstanding service too. Give this place some love, won't you?
No comment
No comment
No comment
Cute place, very good wine and food. The pork collar was very good. Outside seating was very well done for Covid. Be sure to make reservations, it books quick.
No comment
Love natural wines and the selection at the four horsemen did not disappoint. Fried green tomato dish was delicious, too.
No comment
No comment

The rudest service I've ever encountered in NYC, and I've lived here for almost 20 years. I went on a Saturday night, and it was packed - which was expected, considering the hype. The host informed me that she wasn't taking names, it would be an hour wait, and there was no space to wait, so she wasn't sure how I was going to handle that. In not so many words, she told me to leave. It's such a turn off when there's a host on a power trip for no reason - and ESPECIALLY in Williamsburg, there are many more places that can take my money. I will never set foot in this place again.
Extensive wine selection you get to try as many as you want. Food is great and pairs perfectly with the wine. Menu options are a bit limited.
No comment

Nearly all of the outdoor tables (with heating) were free, the hostess told me I had to sit at the table against the restaurant, the only table WITHOUT HEATING. I asked if there were reservations for the other tables, the hostess said no but she would do "whatever we can to keep you warm". Never again. In a time like this, why would someone turn down business? I was not rude at all. I've worked in the industry before so I know how to speak respectfully to staff. I'll never come back to this business.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Chicken liver mousse was stellar. Excellent wine list. A few overpriced dishes. The rhubarb galette was good but not worth $15.
No comment
No comment
Been here twice.  Excellent place.  A bit hard to get in but that is for a good reason.  Excellent food and very friendly service.

It was what seemed like a slow Thursday night. A bit rainy and the temperature had plummeted to around 40 degrees. But when arriving at the restaurant, it was bustling even though it was already 10 pm. The staff was moving about effectively communicating and we we're noticed within a few minutes. Once seemed we were treated to exceptional food, fresh and full of flavor. The oysters from B.C. were perfect with a small amount of accompaniment to not take from the flavor. The Montauk scallops were perfect and a highlight was the burnt beets. Full of flavor and with a nice crunch. Highly recommended.

Came here with my wife on a rainy Friday night and it's a perfect date place. Small and quaint, we sat by the window and had a great night.  Our waitress Sierra recommended a great bottle of Sardinian wine Meigamma Primo and walked us through the menu. We loved everything. Our favorite was the wild nettle malfatti but the crispy potatoes and mackarel are a must. We also liked the tuna and clams. Definitely going back soon.
No comment
No comment
No comment

The Four Horsemen is as good a restaurant as it is a wine bar. Regarding the food, there are no wrong choices. The Mackerel, the tuna, and home-made sausage are just as good as the cabbage, the fava beans and the asparagus. There are no wrong answers and the waiter will help you pick out a wine that goes perfectly with the meal
No comment
No comment
No comment

My husband was dying to come here for his birthday and so I obliged. I emailed them ahead of time to see if I could add something special for the occasion to which they offered a candle with whichever dessert we wanted and noted the reservation... perfect! The bread and butter was the best part of our meal while the other dishes were not memorable. Service was impeccable... but they forgot about my husband's birthday.
