Just before I was going to point it out, our waitress came back with the wine we had been drinking and apologized for not seeing the note sooner and offered us 2 glasses on the house, so they made it right! The bill was a hefty $300 and the food was unfortunately nothing to write home about.
No comment
No comment

This place is kinda swanky and super chill. The portions are smaller which is nice and the wine selection is crazy, if you're interested in buying a bottle. The playlist is amazing but I'm not surprised considering this place is owned by James Murphy and his wife. The wait staff is amazing and the lady who brought out my dishes kept complimenting my outfit and made me feel like everything I ordered was the perfect choice. This place is amazing. 5/5 stars.
No comment
No comment

Great selection of wine - tried orange wine for the first time, and it was delicious! Weekly lunch set menu. I didn't eat lamb so substituted the vegetarian option. Everything was delicious. Kind of hard to get a reservation though, and I think I know why.

Went back for brunch again yesterday and had a marvelous main of huge homemade elbow macaroni in a delicious vegetarian sauce, salads with yellow beets, cara cara orange arugula and shaved white cheese, and potatoes and broccoli rabe. Desserts were baked on site bambaloni filled with a light white cream.
No comment

Probably a place just for a glass of wine or two, with a snack. We made a mistake of ordering food and it almost bankrupted me! Three tiny plates with the cheapest beer and 1 glass of the cheapest red wine left me with an empty stomach and $150 out of my pocket.

Excellent service and food, always. I've eaten here at least a dozen times and it's a fantastic restaurant. Covid-19 measures make you feel safe, outdoor area has electric heaters. One of the best restaurants in NY hands down.

Tiny place! Great hostess and bartender. We sat at the bar and just had two dishes, but should have gone for main courses! The muscles were out of this world. Served chilled with a pickled onion salsa that was brilliant. Had the shrimp as well, with a delectable herb salad on top. Will definitely return.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Was told this is the best place in brooklyn for natural wines.  The list is not huge with big verticals, but are wines that me and you would drink. With very reasonable prices.  I assume the food was average but it was actually really good.  Very impressed overall!  Highly recommended
No comment
Tiny wine bar with great selection of wines, not only for neighbors but also tourists. I really love this place and the people in this place.

This place is such a treat! The server was so kind and friendly and offered great recommendations, offering us different wines based on what we said we'd like. They had a great selection, too. The real star of the show was their food, particularly their snap pea salad with ricotta, I was close to ordering seconds! The ambience was great; we got a cute little window seat with candles and plants around our table. It was a little pricey for me, with $6 for bread and butter, but overall worth it!
No comment
No comment
Amazing food. Very light and fresh dishes. Delicious combinations. I will definitely come back there again and again

I like this place. Excellent raw bar and the decor makes it a quaint place for either a date or one-on-one meet up with a friend. The two choices of rose they had available were a bit too sweet though and also would've liked the option of hard liquor.
No comment
No comment

Ate at the Four Horsemen on Friday evening.  Loved it. We had seats at the bar and ate delicious food from a perfectly sized menu.  Every food item we had was delicious. The wine list is heavily French oriented (which I prefer!) and the wine pricing is very fair.  Good wines by the glass at not excessive prices.   The service was excellent and and the ambience was fantastic.  Definitely will be revisiting.
The best restaurant in nyc hands down, coming from an avid yelp user (although I rarely review...)

Truly disappointing dinner after so much hype   Think the best thing I can say is that we were seated on time 10pm! Go for the wine & not the food because it's good but minimal. Ungracious staff   We spent time studying their extensive wine list & found a delicious gem but were asked to turn off our reading light in middle of reading wine list

Tiny digs, tiny plates, bad wine (no cocktails) and severely overpriced. I don't understand why this place gets such good reviews other than to favor the ownership. I'd rather be any spot in Manhattan any day over this place in the middle of nowhere with such limited everything.
No comment
No comment
No comment

This is place is probably one of the better places I have been to in BK.  It's tiny and they don't have a huge staff but they work the room well and that wine list is unreal.  Food is simple and innovative.  Get the potatoes.. they are insanely good.
Razor clams small flavorless. My sister in law cooks them better. Raw scallops not good either.

Very small place but it definitely had the local vibe for the business meeting I had with someone visiting from out of town.  The pasta with asparagus was delicious and the dessert I had was awesome (I know it was chocolate as I'm a chocolate fiend).  I wasn't sure if the meal would be filling but I think that dessert made it such.  Staff was very friendly & even let me charge my dying phone; I'm not a drinker but my guest liked the wine she had.
Review is only for food. Pretty legit ribs. Fall off the bone. Cooked for 8+ hours. You'd think they sous vide'ed them for longer  they're so dang tender. Decent portion. Nom nom!

Okay I only came here cuz several articles said it was good. My bf later told me while we were eating here he chose this place because the guy on Parks and Recs are here. I like this place a lot because their menu changes frequently. We came at 2:30pm and there was no wait. There's a set lunch menu. We also ordered a cheese plate that had the best cheese I've ever tasted, very flavorful and kinda salty but not too cheesy. It came with Branson pickles....SO GOOD. I was irked because a waitress (not ours) insisted on clearing this plate from the table a hurried me to put the rest of the pickles on my last piece of cheese and toast. The baked bean flavor was amazing, sweet and salty, good enough that I ate it and I usually don't like baked beans. The cabbage was okay. I didn't like the cheese that came with it, but I don't normally like cheese. The crunchy red things on top were good. The cabbage tasted very raw and fresh and crunchy. Okay I did not know that "Nashville hot" meant spicy. I thought it meant it was popular in Nashville. So disclosure: THE SANDWICH IS REALLY SPICY! I took one bite and was dying but my normal spice tolerance is like a medium spicy. I ended performing microsurgery on the chicken and took off all the skin and then it was a tolerable sandwich. There was no stars or peppers on the menu to indicate that it was spicy. All that being said, I would come back again because a lot of people like this place and the menu changes very often. I'd come back for a dinner just cause I like being able to make choices.

Such a great time at the Four Horsemen. Great spot in Williamsburg. We had no reservations but the hostess was so attentive, cool and helpful. She's a gem! The food was delicious, no problem drinking and dining at the bar as the bartender was awesome. Try the skate with beurr blanc sauce and maitaki mushrooms. So so good!

Sometimes it is the most simply articulated menus that impress me and leave me with a most memorable experience. A set lunch menu at The Four Horsemen was so delicious and for a special occasion, very reasonably priced at $32 for the amount and quality of food that you are served. The place is intimately small, but with an expansive and comfortable feeling. Make reservations ahead of time, choose your drink and leave the rest up to them.
No comment

It was ok. Nothing special. Overpriced. Charcuterie was really salty. Ribs were dry and lacking flavor. Amberjack was the only good dish we had, very fresh. I don't understand why the broccolini dish is served cold and the acidity overpowers the other flavors. Food was slow to come out. Although our server was very attentive. You'll spend at least $100 and still feel hungry. After all of the hype, I was really disappointed.
No comment
No comment
Such cool decor, amazing unique wine selection and you feel healthy from eating the food. On the more expensive side but you get what you pay for.

Best new restaurant in awhile. But you should only come with a reservation. The first time we stopped by at 9:45 p.m. on a weekend night, we were told we wouldn't be seated for over an hour. When we finally ate there the food was amazing. The natural wine was amazing. Everything was amazing. We had oysters, one of the cheeses, endives, spicy sausage, tartare, and the best scallops I think I have ever eaten in my life. We finished the night off with sorbet and the first natural vermut I've ever tasted. Perfect casual dinner date.
I didn't get to enjoy anything because this place as Was crammed shoulder to Shoulder, it must be popular or a desperation of the lack of venues in the area.
Overpriced and service was slow when I went for brunch on a Saturday. Decor was nice and bartender was friendly. Their hot sauce is good but portions are too small for the price.

The food is fantastic, as was the wine.  They made things I wouldn't normally go for delicious, such as beets and cabbage.  The desert was pear crumble with sweet potato ice cream, again it was delicious.  I went for the lunch which is a set menu. I'm giving this place 3 stars because I left hungry!  There were 7 people at the table, and it seemed like they gave us enough food for 6.  I think if I'm spending $80/per person on lunch I shouldn't leave hungry.  But yeah the food was fantastic.

Probably the best restaurant I have been to in Brooklyn (besides Five Leaves). Great vibe and knowledgable, friendly staff :) Ordered all cheeses, speck, almost everything on the raw/cured section.The yellowfin tuna and beef tartare were out of this world. The citrus salad was refreshing and delicious. Of course the wagyu steak melted in your mouth... The deserts were just as good! We had some sort of butterscotch hazelnut pudding that was one of the best things I've ever tasted. Would go back 100%
No comment
No comment
Amazing food, great service, warm atmosphere and the music was on point! Will come again forsure!
No comment
Excellent food. Such a knowledgeable staff when it comes to the food and wine. Wonderful ambiance. highly recommend!
No comment

Williamsburg's most overrated restaurant. The best thing about this place was the $7 bread, and it was only worth $5. I've never seen yuzu tuna be so butchered to the point that it tastes like tea leaves rather than yuzu, or tuna. My date just turned 25 and it triggered a quarter life crisis. And I paid for the privilege with the standard 50% Williamsburg markup, followed by an additional 'this place is owned by a famous person' 50% markup. The only redeeming part of this was the waiter, who had a penchant for calling us "gang" and "friend" (which was at least mildly entertaining)
No comment

One of My Favorite Wine Bars in Williamsburg. It is a great home in the wall wine bar (my favorite) with a atmosphere you would not find in any other place! The bartenders are very attentive and everyone is very friendly, a very down to earth place.
No comment
If you start tearing up while wining and dining, you know you're having a good night. Our waiter was also the nicest guy in the world. The ambiance is very relaxed. This place is a must try!

Went on a Sat around 9pm. Not worth the hype or prices. Difficult if you have any food intolerances. Service was not bad but all the staff looked so sweaty (lol, no but seriously ...so sweaty) and rushed and overwhelmed. I felt vicariously stressed from the staff seeming so stressed out. The layout makes the place feel crowded. Did have one glass of wine that was memorable though. Wouldn't return.
No comment

I really wanted to love this place! I went by myself when I made a day trip to NYC, and sat at the bar for dinner and a glass of wine. It's a trendy, somewhat intimate environment but definitely on the louder side. I ended up ordering the sea bass and the potatoes per the recs from the waitress. Both were pretty tasty but neither were mind blowing which is what I would have expected from the reviews and the price. Sea bass was well cooked but the flavor was ordinary; herbs on the side a bit overpowering. Potatoes were essentially crispy versions of patatas bravas; yummy but nothing super special. Worth going back and trying it again though.. next time I'll be sure to get the bread which is supposedly really good.

Absolutely perfect place for a date night! Huzzy and I went for an early weekend dinner and really enjoyed it. The atmosphere is relaxed and intimate, and the decor is interesting and cool without being pretentious. Rachel was our server and super wonderful and knowledgeable. The food is complex and delicious without being overwhelming, and it's obvious that the ingredients are chosen and treated with care. The wine list goes on for a mile and is really thoughtful. We had charcuterie to start and then each had a main, which was the perfect amount. Bonus--there's a focus on natural wines without sulfites, so no swollen feet the day after! Highly recommended.

legitimately my favorite place right now. I go here pretty frequently and it always delivers. service is unpretentious, wine selection is super thoughtful & the food is reminiscent of nouveau scandi -- I'm into it. Draws a relaxed but smart crowd and is a good place to catch up & have a convo

So glad we came here. We didn't have a reservation and showed up around 8pm. We were seated in the bar within 10-15 minutes. The staff were very nice and gave us menus and water while we waited to be seated. We had the split pea salad , beef Tatare and clams. All delicious and rich flavours was so delicious and paired with white wine (which I do not know the name of) but the our server was very knowledgable with what to give us.

The atmosphere is wonderful and the staff is very attentive. Food is pricy, and I've had much better beef tar tar. The have excellent cheese selections and an extensive drink menu. Nice for special occasions but not an everyday place.
No comment
No comment
This place is always PERFECT. Great service and foods are amazing!!! Can't believe this kind of restaurant is happening here in Brooklyn.

Favorite Wine bar in NYC. James Murphy gets NYC dining. All of the food is great. They really do expand your wine horizons. The sickest part about this place is that I've been here 4 times, and still my favorite thing is the bread and butter. All the vegetable dishes are great, but nothing beats that bread with butter.
Amazing food. Good ambiance. Nice servers. Just make sure to reserve ahead of time since they get booked quickly.

Found this place while watching Master of None (thanks Aziz!) and please just come here for the french whipped goat cheese - just do yourself a favor and get the cheese! Too bad it's sourced from a cheese specialist or I would have bought this in bulk and brought it here!

This place is so great. Been here twice. A few days ago we had what is possibly the best prosciutto in New York, and the gnocchi is also top notch. The gnocchi was creamy but not heavy and the portion, although not particularly large, leaves you satisfied. Desserts are excellent too. There's an incredibly extensive wine selection, and the staff's knowledge of it is impressive. The service is great; the atmosphere, lovely. I really can't say enough good things about this place.
No comment

The staff is awesome! Really attentive and on their game. The food was delicious. Large enough to share options from each part of the menu between 2 people. There is a LOT of wine to choose from. We mostly drink California wines but our waitress was super helpful in bringing out a few different bottles and giving a great description of each within our price point. We ended up with a great Tempranillo that was below budget and paired nicely with every course. The yellowfin tuna was our favorite but every plate was good!
No comment

My favorite wine bar in NYC. Completely unpretentious, fun, great music, great lighting. The food is off the charts. Had a steak bavette with anchovy sauce and fermented peppers and I swear it was the best meal I've had this year. Combined with excellently curated wines (I had a Croatian Orange one). Am going back this weekend to get that steak again.

Our meal started well with a good wine rec but went downhill quickly. Course came out terribly spaced - 3 small plates all at once and then nearly an hour until our next dish, gnocchi That was poorly cooked and had unidentifiable burnt onions(?) topping it. Our final course was a toast that was mushy and soggy. Overrated food and poor service. Wine list great.
No comment

The Four Horsemen is very, very good. The wines are good, and the bartenders are friendly and knowledgeable, but the real surprise star is the food. The food is SO good. The beef tartare, in particular, is one of the best things I have ever eaten - as someone who orders beef tartare basically whenever it's offered, I can safely say this is the best beef tartar I've ever had. Everything else we ate (salad, cheese, gnocchi, dessert) was also excellent. Eat here - I can't imagine you would be disappointed.
No comment

horrible service thursday night. told my mom "she definitely wouldnt like" the wine she wanted to try. everything was abrupt and just made us feel like idiots and not welcome. sea bass was good but bad taste in my mouth w service
Worth the ride from Manhattan to Brooklyn.  Amazing food with a great wine list to top it all off.

I had their weekend lunch set + one of their cheese today with friends. The cheese was amazing and inspiring. The lunch set is a great deal. All the three dishes were amazing. I wish the dessert weren't so sweet but still the whole thing was wonderful! I would love to go back at night time.
I got brunch here this weekend. I ordered the kimchi fried rice. The food was delicious, but the portions were small considering the price. The service was excellent. I would come back.

This new place looks great. The design is perfect, clean and simple. The small plates taste great and the attention to ingredients is great. I love their eclectic wine list, it is expensive but it is great. A cool new addition to the hood.
No comment

Wonderful find. Actually a wine bar with a huge wine list and a small food menu of delicious, expertly prepared dishes. Best to have a range of starters to share and then one of their larger single plates like the gnocchi or tilefish. Food is absolutely delicious, service is excellent and best of all, they have paid careful attention to acoustics so that you can hold a decent conversation at your table without having to shout at the top of your voice. We will definitely go back.
No comment

Great atmosphere, great service, great food, great wine selection, reasonable prices, super friendly waitstaff and hostess.  They had an open table and got us right in when we were going to be happy to sit at the bar. 10/10 will be back soon.
Nice atmosphere. Very limited choice on the menu but food is great. All natural wine offered. Enjoyed everything I ordered.

The sugar snap peas nearly made me have an out of body experience. Everything else we ate was excellent as well. The well-curated wine list offers interesting discoveries, the staff is gracious and knowledgeable, and a great selection of music plays at conversation-friendly levels. What's not to love?

Love this little gem in the BK. My girlfriend and I have made this our new date spot. Great juice and even better eats! Staff is awesome. Never heard better acoustics in a restaurant in my life. Makes sense as James Murphy is behind this concerto of dining and ambiance.
No comment
The food was terrific, great atmosphere, they were also very accommodating for our reservation changes. Our server was knowledgeable about both the food and wine, made great recommendations.
Amazing wine bar and food!!!  Met some cool peeps from Copenhagen. Thank you Will for taking care of my friend and I. I'll be back very soon!!
The wine! It's so fabulous. The vibe is perfect, the wine list is incredible, the staff is incredibly welcoming and helpful. This place is one of my favorites.

I was lucky to celebrate my birthday with dinner at The Four Horsemen. What a great meal and experience! The dining room and bar have an intimate feeling with dim lighting and upscale decor but still relaxed. Our server was really kind and accessible but really let us enjoy a long meal by bringing out our dishes with nice timing. I particularly love wine bars and small plates to share, so the menu was up my alley. We opted for the bread which was so delicious with homemade butter. We shared the yellow fin tuna, beef ribs, and rigatoni bolognese. Every dish had great attention to detail and were "melt in your mouth" good. We opted on a bottle of white wine from their short menu, but they have an extensive menu if you are well versed in wines. We even saved the bottle as a momento because it was such a memorable meal. I've read the menu is ever changing and seasonal, so it will be exciting to return for the next meal.

Don't believe the hype, not on the food at least. The wine was nice but I was led to believe - by all the gushing reviews - that the small plates of food would be worth their high price. They're not. By all means go for a glass of wine but if you want an actual dinner and not just hideously overpriced, oversized canapés, don't go here for food. For those with money to burn, this isn't a bad place, it's nicely done out, but the atmosphere is just average.
No comment
No comment

I really enjoyed our dinner at the Four Horsemen. The staff couldn't have been nicer and the wine and food was stellar. We tried the potatoes, which were amazing, and the tilefish was knockout, too. I look forward to returning there again!

Great atmosphere with friendly, fun, and knowledgable service. Excellent quality food - great for sharing and perfectly compliments the whole wine tasting/exploring experience. Share stuff, try new wines, hang out with the staff, learn about some fun wines, listen to great music... You won't want to leave. I've been 4 times. The prices are surprisingly reasonable, too. Bravo!
That schnitzel was super; the trout and pear was a surprise; but wish the homemade beef jerky came by the pound. Wonderful. The service done with ease.
No comment

Everything is delicious and on point. The staff is fantastic and knowledgeable about the wines. Great for a group of friends, dates, and dining solo at the bar. Wish this was my neighborhood restaurant.

One of the best natural wine bars in the city. Not pretentious for those who are curious about wine and want to try new things. The service is impeccable in its warmth and attentiveness. Food is lovely, though not huge portions. Would be great for a group if you want to order a few bottles and have an amazing time.
Incredible service. Very knowledgeable staff on (vast) wine list. Order the bread, charcuterie/cheese boards, carrots, cabbage and crispy potatoes. Vibe is on point. Avoid the tuna though.
No comment
No comment
Absolutely love this place - everything is just on point, really. Great wine selection, atmosphere, interior, light. Can't say anything but only good things about staff - very helpful and nice.

Fantastic wine list for a wine geek but it does not exclude casual drinkers, there's enough for both. The service is knowledgeable and attentive and not rushed at all, even though this is a small place. The food is adequate but a bit hit and miss, so go here for the wine primarily. If you want a seat at the bar I recommend getting there when they open. There's only a few stools and people understandably park there for hours.

We were a party of 7 and all left happy, well fed, and appropriately buzzed. Very accessible natural wine list with many excellent bottles under $60. Service hit the mark at all points and the shared plates were all winners.

Wine prices were very reasonable, food was tasty, service was on point. Can't wait to go back and try more wine. Everything I had last night was super delicious, especially the white field blend from provence, oh and the orange wine (forget the name). Making a reservation was smart, probably would of been a long wait if not.

So, I heard a lot of good things about this place so I decided to check it out with a friend. Saw the menu on Yelp and got excited. So we get there, the place is very nice and cozy. The staff there was on point, our server was great, friendly and offered us a few suggestions. When I saw the menu I was disappointed to see only 2 main entrees which were a pork chop and I think some fish dish that started with a t. So much for that steak I saw in the Yelp pics and wanted to try. We ordered a few starters, the beef tartare, clams, and the yellow fish crudo, and we decided to share the pork chop dish for our entree. I gotta say I eat out a lot and love places like the Spotted Pig, Lartusi, and the Breslin in the city. This unfortunately was not the same experience as my faves. The tartare was on the dry side, and only came with minimal sesame crackers to scoop it up, halfway through we just scooped it up with a fork. The yellowfin crudo was tasty but nothing really special to make it terrific. The clams had some type of sausage in it, but I really didn't care for the smokiness flavor of the whole dish. The biggest disappointment was the main pork chop dish. You figure for $36 the portion would be pretty significant for a pork dish. It wasn't at all! We had about 5 slices of pork garnished with a very tasty kale (best part). We came in not that hungry, but we didn't leave this place satisfied. For $180 and 4 beverages between the 2 of us this was very pricey and unfilling. I never mind spending good money on food but when you leave a place disappointed with taste and not even close to full it's just not worth it. Again the service was terrific, everything else though was just mediocre. Oh well.

First let me say that I really liked this restaurant the first couple of months it was open. The wine and the portion size was perfect. Everything was good. The last couple of times I went hasn't been so good. We waited about 15 min for a waitress to come to our table and almost an hour and a half food to come out. I honestly felt bad for the staff (I've been in their shoes) they were very understaffed which was probably the reason the wait was so long. Only two cooks and what seemed like one waitress (possibly two) for a full restaurant. There are some great dishes that are worth the money and some that aren't. For example the tuna tartar and the cheeses are some of my favorite things and the price is right. Having said that its kind of ridiculous  the amount of money they charge for a side dish portion of the pasta entree. 20 dollars is a little too much for such a small portion. The only other entree option is $35. Second avoid the $6 bread and butter. Just because the butter is "cultured" doesn't take away from the fact that it's literally bread and butter which you usually get for free. Other then that this is a nice restaurant to take a nice date and to sip on some nice wine while you talk about how much you hate republicans and tell your friend that you've decided become "gluten free".
Beautiful food. Amazing service. I would go here everyday if I could. Wine list on point. Delicious.
Everything is so ridiculously good. The staff is amazing. The food is amazing. The wine is amazing. New fave!
No comment

A friend and I tried to dine here during July 4th weekend. This place had really good reviews so I was really excited. We got there around 9pm and it was the only place in the neighborhood that had people in it (everyone else was probably away for the holiday). My friend had arrived earlier to check to see how long the wait was and they just told her that it would be about 30 minutes. We went to check about 20 minutes later and they said it would probably be about another 30 minutes! We went back to check about 25 minutes after that and another hostess had said that they had given our table away and that they wanted to call us but couldn't.. You know why? BECAUSE THEY NEVER ASKED US FOR A CONTACT NUMBER TO CALL US. The second hostess was definitely worse than the first one. Her attitude was horrible. I will never go back to this place. Williamsburg has plenty to offer. Good luck staying in business with those two stank hostesses on board.

This place was incredible. Each plate was an amazing full flavor profile,  but each was different. The wait staff was phenomenal, especially Billy, who moved reservations around to seat us and gave excellent recommendations. Follow his recommendation and get the gnocchi. My wife is Italian and the chef came out to discuss how he makes them with her. They are fluffy pillows of delicate pasta and the frizzled shallots add an interesting textural element to the plate. Although we would highly recommend every plate on the menu I would suggest ordering the potatoes. They are reminiscent of patatas bravas and honestly better than the ones that we had at the El Nacìonal in Spain. Definitely one you should visit. We sampled every part of the menu and were never disappointed. Wish we had pictures to show the vibrant colors matching the tastes.

My wife and I are still talking about the meal and the fantastic evening we had at Four Horsemen last weekend. We walked in on Friday evening without reservations and were warmly welcomed by the hostess. We ordered some wine and were seated at the bar within 20 mins. William (our bartender) was amazing! He took us on a journey through France and helped us discover some great wine regions of France. One of highlights was a Gamay from Loire Valley (Vin Rouge) which blew us away. The meal was just as good. We shared some cheese (robiola bosina with a great tomato jam and bianco sardo) both different and tasty. You have to get the bread! It might have been the highlight of the meal, and not because everything else was not great but because the bread was that amazing! We also shared the snap pea salad and beef tartare. Matthew recommended we try a very unique plum brandy to go with our dessert, which was so complex and flavorful - I am not on a mission to find a bottle for home. This was an unforgettable evening and I highly recommend it for anyone looking for a romantic, chill evening in Williamsburg. Pro tip - sit at the bar and chat with Matthew.
Nice atmosphere with manageable noise level for conversation. Great spot to take a date. Food is good without being over the top. I definitely recommend this spot.

I had dinner here last night with friends and was enjoying a bottle of sancerre and small plates we ordered. When I took a bite of sugar snap pea salad, there was a piece of foreign object found in my mouth and quickly spit out. When I looked down and picked up to see what it was my worst nightmare as a restaurant goer came true that night! It was a piece of broken glass. I quickly removed my plate and told the server and had them take back the salad to the kitchen. I waited expecting a manager and or the chef to quickly rectify the situation but instead was ignored. 5 mins later they asked us would you like to order anything else assuming they would offer something on the house - with that assumption I didn't want to take a chance on ordering another meal, instead ordered another bottle of Sancerre. I didn't want to dampen my experience so I carried on with dinner hoping to enjoy the rest. When we got the bill - they only took out the salad and the cake cutting fee from the check! (cake was for friends birthday). My friends and I were shocked! We assumed something would have been on the house and a apology should have been warranted. I complained to the manager and she wasn't being understanding and sympathetic to the situation. She said - it looks like you were enjoying yourselves. I told her that I didn't want to ruin my friends birthday with my near choking/ getting cut from a glass experience. The establishment was extremely rude and handle the situation very poorly! This was one of my worst experience ever at a restaurant. DO NOT EAT here! Worst service!

I love this place! I left off one star only because I think it's a bit pricey for what you get, and they brought all the food out at once. I went for their prix fixe, weekend lunch. Actually, it's just a set menu for one price - $28. I got 3 courses and a tiny piece of bread. It was just enough food for me! If you have a bigger appetite, and most ppl do, compared to me, it might not be enough. But it was perfect for me and every dish was delicious! The little roll was rock hard, though...but the butter was great and it was only the bread! I honestly can't recall everything about each course (a few days ago), but there was a lovely polenta, a super fresh tomato salad and the main dish was fish (I can't recall anything about the fish, but I know it was delicious!). The wines - all natural - are why I came. It's hard to fine natural wines outside of Williamsburg. They had a small, but impressive selection. I couldn't decide between 2 of their sparklings, so my server kindly let me order 2, half glasses of each. She was knowledgeable of the wines and helped me choose a glass with my lunch. I don't mind paying a little more for nice wine, but I felt that for the pours I received, the prices were just too steep. They have a selection of prices, from $13-$18 (probably higher, but that was as high as I would consider), but I wish they had a few that were more affordable, as most are going to want to dry more than one! And while the lunch was a good price, there were no other happy hour specials or anything. And, again, they brought all the food out at once, so it got cold and wasn't as tasty. There are at least 2 other, natural wine bars in the area that I will try & compare. I know at least one has a happy hour that we will try. Still, try the set lunch & bring your wallet!

These horsemen brought no apocalypse - only a fleet of little plates and charcuterie.  Expectation met surprise, as dish after dish arrived from the kitchen, to flash, find favor, and disappear in a flurry of forks.

Intimate Asian influenced wine bar.  We started with skate wing jerky which was surprisingly good and I followed with the Korean Army Stew which had just the right amount of kick.  However, the wine steals the show at The Four Horsemen.  Large selection of predominantly French wines but let the bartender guide you and you are in good hands.  We had a bottle of Cinsault from an Australian producer that was a very tasty light red that went great with our meals.

It's amazing how easy it is for the new breed of "Williamsburgers" to accept this sort of restaurant. Our party of five had quite a few items from the menu and the consensus was that for the prices and portions, this is a rip-off. The bread that every review is raving about is $6 to start with (aka two loaves of amazing seeded rye bread at the Polish bakery on N 8th). We got two (yes, two) end pieces. Yes, it was warm and pretty good, but two crusty pieces for $6? We bought it up with the waitress a couple of times, and she kept saying she'll check with the kitchen, or go "smile" at the chef to get more, but we never received another proper slice. How easy would it have been for the restaurant to satisfy their "difficult" customers who are asking for another slice of bread to go with two small, crusty pieces for $6?!!! The rock shrimp pasta was overcooked and watery; the sunchokes were rubbery; the $10 patatas bravas were bland; the overpriced tuna dish tasted like day-old goulash--sush an unfair treatment for a delicate fish. On the bright side, the bacalao toast was yummy and the beet salad was fresh and well-seasoned. The wine selection is impressive and not as ridiculously priced as the food. My advice: if you want to check this place out, go to the bar, enjoy a glass or a bottle of delicious natural wine and maybe have one snack before heading somewhere nearby (St. Mazie, Bozu, Dokebi, Caracas, etc etc) for dinner that won't leave a bad taste in your mouth.

Cosy & elegant, friendly and knowledgeable staff, top notch food and ... amazing natural wine selection.  I would go here for the wine alone; unequalled in Williamsburg. One of the best dining experiences I've had in a while. Recommend going when it's not too busy to get a more intimate experience.
Wine list is great. Food is quite good but be aware portions are tiny. Service is excellent - very knowledgeable about wine and very attentive.

Very delicious but be careful if you have food allergies. Not all ingredients in a dish are listed. For example, I ordered a toast with hake (fish) and corn. It made me feel sick immediately and I couldn't figure out why. I later found out the fish and corn were cooked in milk, which I am allergic to. I would have never guessed fish would be cooked in milk.
i had a great experience here. the space is very tight but great food, drinks and service. a good place to take your time and catch up with a friend.

We had such a great Saturday night here.  Rachel took excellent care of us. Thank you for the perfect wine and food pairings.  We went for all the bready/ potato type foods and didn't regret it.  Gnocci, Warm bread with butter, fried potatoes with aioli, tomato chipotle.  Will be back again soon.
Food was excellent.  Staff is friendly.  Best natural wines in the city.  How it is supposed to be.  Worth driving from Manhattan.

Skip it! Not a lovely place or vibe at all. Came for a glass of wine with a girlfriend, around 10 pm week night. The bar was not crowded, nor was the restaurant, rest of space. The woman behind the bar was not at all gracious, no hello, greeting, smile, or a nod of acknowledgement, just a stink face. The decor and vibe of the place immediately strikes one as cold and minimal, and foreshadowed our experience- slick and icy. First thing that happens is that the bartender is half-yelling at the one waitress, and is clearly annoyed about a bottle of wine that was mistakenly opened. Uncomfortable to be privy to this, and you would think she would be embarrassed or apologize for her vibe kill to customers, but no. She says out loud to no one in particular, "does anyone want to order this wine now that was just opened?!" My friend offers sheepishly, "Well, maybe I'll taste it?", as she starts to pour, my friend offers, "Just a taste please", The bartender snaps back, "I think I know what I'm doing." Well then. The wine was not to her taste, and she asks then if they serve coffee or tea. First the bartender, jaw dropped, rudely exclaims "you're not drinking!?" I add quickly that I'd be having wine but my friend wants to switch to something non-alcoholic if possible. Bartender is clearly annoyed, and then says, "we could do a tea", "great", my friend says, "do you have mint?" The bartender then says she can't find mint but she has another tea. OK, my friend says, as long as it's herbal. I order a white wine. My wine was quite nice, but for $15 I should hope it would be, however her grumpy, verging on nasty demeanor were so off putting, it was frankly hard to enjoy. We tried to shrug it off, and chalk it to a tired, slightly unkempt bartender lady who was having a bad night. Of note, the place had plenty of empty seats, so it's not like we were coming at dinner time or into a packed bar and taking up two bar seats, as one (shocker!) non alcohol consuming customer. We did not feel welcome or enchanted by the place, and especially not by the frazzled bartender woman, so we soon asked for our check. My wine, though lovely tasting, I left unfinished. Got the check, and we thought there was a mistake- one item for 15, the other for 11. I said, "Pardon me, I'm not sure if this is our bill, she just had a tea." "That's your bill! With the tea!", snappy said. We paid up, tipped. End of story. Eleven dollars for tea folks! This is not the Waldorf Astoria! It's grubby yuppie Williamsburg. And the bartender woman has clearly been in the bar business too long and resents what she does. Hospitality , nope. Also of note, though the place has a long by the bottle wine list, they offer very few wines by the glass, and the prices are high end by the glass prices. I find so few wines offered by the glass hardly make it a wine bar (which they advertise themselves to be). Takeaway- Did we take this personally? No. She wasn't nice to anyone really.  If you go- Don't order tea or sit at the bar ;)
Great wine but mediocre service - we waited over 50 minutes for main courses. The waitresses seemed more interested in talking to their hipster friends. A shame. Date of visit was April 29.

Very interesting wine list, even by the glass, and an appetizing food menu (small dishes). Decor is cosy with all these beige shades (think Denmark meets Japan), service is courteous and knowledgeable. The only reason why I don't put a 5th star is because it's not really my type of crowd, a little bit too hipster for me (no offense meant).

Fantastic natural wine selection.  We tried many different wines by the glass.  The best wine we had was the Nero d'avola which is only available by the bottle.  Great place to try several Orange wines to see what the craze is about.  Food is very good, with many fresh ingredients.  Favorite dishes were the lardo charcuterie, roasted sunchokes, and the homemade bread.  Flank steak entree was very good.  Snapper entree was good but the porcini sauce could have been better integrated with the fish.  Nice clean, Danish modern interior.  Very good service who was knowledgeable about the wines.  A very nice "foody" library above the kitchen where that Danish influence is evident.  Excellent sound system, as one would expect from James Murphy.
Great food, really thorough and impressive wine choices on offer. Fab tunes and attnetive service. Winner!
a great way to spend our wedding day! delicious small plates and knowledgeable staff to guide us through the wine list.

Top notch - service to food to ambiance, dawling! Give me everything with a dash of extra and that's Zaytinya. The flavors are booming, the space is slaying, and the servers are serving! Jose Andres does it again! You will fall in love with the space as soon as you take your first step. Then your taste buds will say thank you after each dish hits your mouth. No dish should be left behind as you really in a seasoning wonderland where each dish gets its own moment to shine. This is a must visit! Snag a reservation NOW!

Great place to stop by for some mediterranean food. I came by during restaurant week and had the hummus, chicken youvetsi, and salmon. The hummus was creamy and topped with fresh chick peas, and went well with their fresh made pita. The chicken youvetsi, was a nicely seasoned tomato pasta with pieces of chicken, very filling! The salmon was perfectly pan fried with a nice crisp, and paired well with the chopped roasted pepper. Overall, a great experience, can't wait to return.

This place has been on my list for so long! The interior design is stunning, I mean, look at their bar! The waitress was extremely sweet and patiently explained the menu to my friend and I. The pita bread was delicious with the olive oil they provide. The bread tasted so fresh and soft that I couldn't help but ask for more. The food was great I just wish more was provided for the price. I left a bit hungry still and so did my friend and we even had appetizers and tons of bread haha. For the first time  in my life, I tried grape leaves. It was pretty sour lol but I heard that is how it is supposed to be. Grateful to have tried something new! Loved the experience
I would 100% come back here, I wanted to try everything on the menu! The halloumi flatbread was really good. The French toast was thick and sweet - beware it's a little squishy / soggy.

We have been to the DC restaurant and loved it! We had really high expectations but the food and service was OK at the the NYC location. The ambiance in NYC is nice but service was slow. We waited 15 mins before getting offered water. The food wasn't as flavorful as the DC location. I did send an email to the restaurant group manager with my feedback.
No comment
No comment

Wow! Just wow. Jose Andres is so talented that even simple egg meals were a hit. We had shakshuka (oohhemmgee) and greek omelette (also yum). Lets talk about shakshuka. I have tried so many shakshukas all over the city, possibly in every middle eastern restaurant but this one was another level. First of all it had chicken in it. Double protein hell yeah. And the sauce. Very hard to describe in words. It was just incredible. And green omelette. You'd think it's just herbs and egg but somehow it tasted too flavorful for such simple combo. But the best part was the service. The staff was incredibly polite, accommodating, friendly and so nice. A rarity these days in NYC. We felt very heavy after these light dishes for some reason but overall great experience.

The restaurant itself is stunning (as is the bar) - and we ended up here after walking past it and being intrigued. The menu consists mainly of small plates and we split the Bantijian Bil Laban - crispy eggplant with garlic yogurt and Tumeric apricots, and sea scallops with dill yogurt, apple, radish, and sesame rose spice. Both dishes were delicious, however a bit smaller than we anticipated. If I return, I would be sure to try more of the dishes. We finished with dessert, which was also impressive in its refined, but sweet flavors. Perfect for sharing plates and trying a variety of elevated food.

One of my most absolute favorites - ambiance, service, and experience always delivers here! The food is amazing and fresh. Love the dips and seafood selection. Bar is beyond -- staff is above and beyond, a must go to!!!
No comment

Zaytinya is such a nice vibe - the waiters were so attentive, the hostesses were friendly and the food was delicious! When we were seated, they served us pita and olive oil to start for the table. We ordered the beet salad, hummus and labneh for appetizers which was so good. My friends got the octopus which they also enjoyed. We also shared a bottle of wine and the waiter was really good at tapping us off when we needed it. Overall would love to come back and try more!

This is THE SPOT!! Found something to me added to my favorites. Everything from the ambience to the service to the food! Our server Gustavo was super friendly and suggested us some delicious options. MUST TRY the HTIPITI dip and Brussels sprouts. We were a group of 6, and we shared the spreads, flatbreads ( halloumi and charred rggas appetizers and for entrees we got the kebab platter, butter and garlic shrimp and the Brussels sprouts. Everything was just spotless. Special mention for the bread that is served on the table and rotated every time the fresh and hot batch comes out. Simply outstanding

Delicious Mediterranean food, everything was spectacular! Interior is beautiful as well

Amazing Mediterranean Mezze selections.  Fantastic ambiance and service.  Only criticism is just one bathroom inside the restaurant  which is unisex.  Had to go upstairs with a group of people to find another restroom in the hotel.

First time visited tonight since friends recommended and claimed "decent food with reasonable price". We initially planned to order the dishes lamb leg ( $16) and Branzino fish ($22) on their menu. The waitress came over and told us there were two special dishes tonight, one is lamb shoulder, the other one is whole Branzino fish. Sounds great. So we took the advice and ordered both (we have 3 ladies in total) without asking the price. We also ordered a mushroom dish which tasted fantastic. Both special dishes tasted great with special sauces. We could not finish at all. Probably finished half. The service was also good. Interior of the restaurant is also great. The bill came, the lamb shoulder $160, the whole Branzino fish $75.

My friend and I came here for lunch a few weekends ago and we were seated right away. The space itself is quite lovely with a large bar and lots of tables in the main dining space. We split the brussel sprouts and the hummus, which were both very good. I ordered the salmon durum my friend ordered the chicken soup avgolemono and both were good. I'm deducting a few stars because the service was severely lacking. My friend had ordered a coffee and it came at the end of our meal after asking about it several times. It also took us forever to order and get our check.

Definitely a beautiful spot to dine in for Mediterranean food. They have unique Mediterranean style cocktails. I got the margarita which was pretty good and different. The food is good and fresh. The only thing I don't recommend is the kunefe for dessert. It was missing cheese which is the main ingredient! They have a fancy tea pot for tea. Great aesthetics and presentation and great service.

The decor of this restaurant is truly astounding! I expect nothing less of the restaurant attached to the ritz nomad location. Food was delicious and our server was very knowledgeable giving wine and cocktail recommendations. Had a wonderful experience.

Another winner from Jose Andres! From the food to the cocktails to the decor to the service to the atmosphere, you leave the streets of Manhattan and are on the Mediterranean coast. Chef Andres has created a menu that relies primarily on Greek and Lebanese flavors, but is quintessentially Mediterranean. The Santorini Octopus might be the best octopus dish in New York (sorry Milos). On the ground floor of the new Ritz Carlton Nomad, Zaytinya is already a huge success. The dishes are all mezze-style and good to share so you can taste a lot. The wine list is primarily Greek and Lebanese as well, but I suspect that we will see more Italian, Spanish and French wines as customers assert their preferences. A wonderful addition to the local dining scene.
No comment

Brand new locations in Flatiron. Greeted and welcomed upon opening door. Restaurant is beautiful with high ceilings and nice decor. Very comfortable bench seating avaible.  Servers very friendly. All food was good and presented well.

Went here for a bday dinner tonight. Service was incredibly slow. Food was ok. But nothing to write home about. The kicker was that we intended on splitting the bill, presented our cards to the waiter and EVERYONE at the table was charged the entirety of the bill ($521) dollars. The waiter was not apologetic AT ALL and just said "Oh shit, it happened again." Pretty wild that this is happening at a restaurant by Jose Andres.
Amazing decor and design. The dim lighting and sleek look of the bar makes this place an absolute must for date night. Food was sensational and packed with flavor. 10/10.

What a wonderful Mediterranean tapas place. We ordered almost the entire menu and everything was delicious. Zatar margarita was very tasty. My fav was brussel sprouts, eggplant dish, Kebabs, and hommus. The staff was very attentive with 5 star service. It was packed on a Monday night so I recommend getting reservations.
Shout out to Joey! Excellent service. Quality food and fresh ingredients. Food was so good I forgot to take photos.
No comment
Excellent food and beautiful ambiance. The zatar margarita was delightful! Portions are not big but filling.

For Greek food that'll leave you coming back for more.. go to Zaytinya. And make sure you get the hummus & omg the brussel sprouts. Possibly the best we have ever had. The interior of the restaurant is also wonderful.

Lively scene. Good bar. But minuscule portions. Salad dressing was very acidic and over powered the greens. The octopus was fine, tiny plate, nothing extraordinary. Adana was one small skewer worth of meat. I think its more like tapas than entree sized, be warned, in case you're hungry or with a guy that wants a meal. However loved the fact they had gluten free bread.

I am convinced they have high ratings bc if anyone spent money here, they want to feel good about it... The restaurant is gorgeous. It's dim lit and beautiful. The bar and walls are stunning. Their seating arrangement is packed tho. It's not fat people friendly. The seating is so tight that when we were served flatbread, a lady taking her seat at the table next to me accidentally brushed her purse over it. Service people didn't come by frequently enough to replace it. As for the food food... I don't know. I have paid way less for a fuller meal made from fresh ingredients at other Turkish places. The portions are tiny here and not even executed great. Everything tasted over cooked. The Adana kebab, what ever rice dish I got, and eggplant appetizer was just eh. If you want to feel special about going to an upscale looking place, this might be worth checking out? Cocktails were expensive (about $20) and my date was muslim so we did not drink. I've paid a lot for fancy cocktails so I wonder if the experience would have been worth it if I had a bit of alcohol in my system. I really really wanted to like this place but I paid for food and was not happy. Oh. Our food was served with the waiter removing a metal gold lid and though we appreciate that it kept the food warm, it just felt corny. Last thought. With that many people in a space for dinner and music blasting, don't expect to hear who ever you're there with
Beautiful restaurant, great staff, flavor combination are interesting and delicious while and the classics are top notch!

Jose Andres Mediterranean restaurant in Nomad, NYC.  I was so excited to try it.  We got hummus with ground lamb, roasted Brussels sprouts, fried eggplant and kofte kebabs.  The pita bread was so airy and light.  Everything was delicious.  The staff were very friendly and helpful,

Came here for lunch with a friend and it was incredible. 3 plates was the perfect amount for sharing. Highly recommend the brussels as a side to whatever you get. Only thing I regret is not asking for more pita.

Zaytinya is gorgeous and the food was incredible! The GM, Jaime, is fantastic - she will make sure you have a great time while enjoying great food and bev.

Location is inside the Ritz- Carlton. The vibe is pretty cool and chill. Absolulely craving again for ther hummus and pita bread. Servers are very well knowledgable of the menu. Bar

The food, the service and the atmosphere was amazing. They had the best hummus I have ever had! Also the Turkish chocolate cake ... if you have unique taste buds like me, you will taste tart, sweet, and just delicious flavors. Flew from Vegas, 2 train rides and walking to get to this area and I will do it all over again.
Loud, generic, exaggerated small portions.

I'm a savory brunch person who never orders the sweet dish but decided to get the Lebanese style French toast. Holy you know what it was one of the best French toasts I've ever tasted. So fluffy and soft! My friend wondered why it didn't have whip cream and it turned out the the cream is inside. Try this dish with the Pomona cocktail, which was also very well made and not super sweet - a balanced match to the French toast.
No comment

Happened to walk by this place on our way to the new Swingers mini golf and it looked so inviting through the window, we had to come back for dinner. When we found out it was mezzo/tapas - we were sold. When I say everything -  EVERYTHING - was delicious, i'm not exaggerating. Even the fluffy pita bread with dipping oil they serve before you even order! The flavors were on point and each bite was the perfect combination. The ambiance was beautiful and service was great - our server Joey was charming and brought us champagne on the house for our anniversary. This place served us a dream dinner - do yourself a favor and make a reservation! You'll be SO glad you did!

We had been to the DC location of this restaurant and were thrilled to know that this opened in NYC. Absolutely spectacular and one of the best meals we have ever had in the city. We had the lamb hummus (our favorite and to die for!!), hpititi dip, octopus, lamb kebab, grape leaves, cauliflower and mushroom (our other favorite!). Everything was beautifully plated and truly cooked to perfection of exactly how food is supposed to taste. The service was attentive, professional, and efficient. We already can't wait to go back and this is a restaurant not to be missed!!

We went to this upscale restaurant Middle Eastern restaurant by Jose Andre credited for bringing the small plates dining concept to America. This was a recommendation from a friend who will travel for food. The restaurant did not disappoint. Everything on the table was cooked to perfection. We ordered salmon, shrimp, brusel sprouts, falafel and chicken durum, kabab platter, cauliflower tiganites and all the desserts except greek yogurt with apricots. When we all get together, it is typically a feast!! I would highly recommend seared salmon, brussel sprouts, warm pitas, hummus and kunefe id you have a small appetite. I will go back for sure. I would say that restaurant is very busy specially during weekends. Do not forget to make a reservation.
Great food, great ambiance, Mo was great at service. Great place. Will go back. Everyone was so friendly and professional

We celebrated 2 family birthdays here on a recent Saturday night, and overall we had a very positive experience.  The venue is visually very pleasing (beautiful bar).  Also, all the food we ordered was delicious, from appetizers to entrees.  We had a variety of kabobs and spreads, and their taramosalata was phenomenal with their unique pita.  There was also a rice dish that I can't recall but it was super good, had some ground lamb mixed in.  The service we received was very friendly and efficient, and not as pricey as you would imagine it to be.  All told,really glad the fam chose this place and secured reservations.

This restaurant is housed in the beautiful Ritz and it's Bar is beautiful as well! Small tapas, full of flavor! Some a little overpowering but really enjoyed t

Stopped in on a whim on a rainy Monday night around 8pm.  Place was packed but the friendly hostess was able to squeeze us in.  So glad too as the food was outstanding.  Small tapas style dishes, so if you are a volume eater you might leave hungry or need to spend some $$.  But quality of the food makes it worth a try.   I am a big fan of brussels and the brussels  were absolutely amazing.  Crispy with great flavors and the yogurt compliments by toning down the bitterness.  Highly recommend them.   I'm not a fan of lamb so I was really surprised by how much I enjoyed the Sultan's Delight.  I think all the flavors mixed so well it eliminated the typical lamb taste that I don't care for.   The restaurant is off the lobby of the new Ritz-Carlton Nomad but also has an entrance from Broadway.  I just found out there's a location in DC from another Yelp reviewer, so looking forward to trying that location out.  I suggest giving this place a try and recommend reservations.

Excellent- from food, service, ambiance.. not a thing to complain about. I will definitely come back!

Awesome dining experience! Walked in on a Saturday noon and was lucky to get a table by the window. The inside was beautiful, ambiance was great, and the food was very delicious and authentic. We loved every dish (especially the falafel and hummus and meat) and the portions are just right for us.
Exceptional dinner--highly recommend.  If your physician tells you to start the "Mediterranean Diet" for health reasons--you can't do better than to start here!

Absolutely loved Zaytinya! Everything was perfect from the incredible host who gave us amazing recommendation, to the lovely corner tabel for my friend and I. The waiter gave us great recommendations from delicious Brussel sprouts, lebneh, eggplant, and hummus! The warm pita bread kept coming and was Devine! I can't wait to come back for brunch and dinner. The ambiance is lovely, the music takes you back to the Mediterranean. LOVE everything! Highly recommmed this venue.
Great food, service and ambiance! Awesome addition to the neighborhood. The halloumi is a must try as well as all the dips!
The service is top notch here but the food is good not that bad but nothing all that amazing to rave about. I did enjoy myself here overall.

The food is excellent, and the service is just as good. I highly suggest getting the mixed meat platter and the dips (the tzatziki is excellent). It's great for a date night and also for groups.

Omg! It is a fantastic place to dine! I loved the ambiance and food as well! I would love to come back and have dinner again! Great food, fast service, friendly waiters! Would recommend to anybody! Thank you

Simply AMAZING!!! I can't wait to go back! The ambience was great and the food was even better! Friendly staff. Great prices and portions. Everything was delicious!!! I recommend the xtipiti, the brussels sprouts (the best I've ever had), the smoked beet salad, the octopus, soutzoukakia and chicken youvetsi -- basically everything we ordered. Perfect amount of food for two (very hungry) people. The Greek/Turkish coffee was brought out on a traditional serving tray -- beautiful! I seriously cannot say enough good things. So happy to have found this restaurant.
Too good Mediterranean food; especially falafel, Brussels sprouts were top notched. Excellent food, outstanding service, amazing vibe. Highly recommend this place!
No comment

I went there with very high expectations based on my friends experiences in Jose Andrés's other restaurants in DC. But it was disappointing. We ordered Adana, it was cold and dry. Appetizers were also didn't taste good and portions were really small. Only good thing with this place is their cocktails. Also they charged my friends credit card extra and she had to call the place 10 times to get it reversed.

Beautiful fresh and airy dining room. The bar is beautiful and the dining room transports you to the Mediterranean. I can't wait to come back for all the yummy drinks. The food was tasty too but I thought the desert and drinks were better than my chicken sandwich. I wish my sandwich could be a little bit more interesting or sophisticated for the price. I can see our server was probably new in the industry but she made us feel comfortable and right at home. Overall we had a great time.
What a great experience at Zaytinya. The food was beyond great, the service was impeccable and the vibes were on point. Returning back any day again!
No comment

Food is unremarkable. Service was poor on a Wednesday night. Nothing terrible, but not sure why you'd come back. Two desserts were just bad. Best thing is the prices are actually quite reasonable given that it's in the Ritz hotel.  Skip it.
IMAM BAYILDI. Eggplant, onions and tomato slowly cooked in olive oil with aromatic spices and garnished with pine nuts. This was really great!

Fabulous small plates .  The Metaxa sidecar is the most delicious cocktail. (We hope to copy it at home ... would love to know what is in the "spice blend") We will order the  Htipiti, smoked beet salad, little fried eggplants, and the octopus Santorini every time we go. Amazing. The bottomless basket of warm ultra thin pita beats any other standard restaurant bread. This is our third time at Zaytinia. Once in DC. Twice in NYC.  Already looking forward to our next visit. Service is attentive. Food comes out quickly. No problem . Just make sure to tell your server if you want to slow it down a bit. The lighting is quite dark away from the bar, however the overall ambiance  is big, bold, and a bit boisterous. Perfect for us. Not the spot for cozy and romantic.

Zaytinya was a totally magical experience. From the impeccable decor to the delightful service, we were utterly blown away. The food was off the charts delicious. We know these dishes well, it's the food of our homeland, and the interpretation of these middle eastern staples was wondrously surprising and scrumptious. And don't skip dessert, those were so special too. Our server, Gustavo, and the manager, Jaime, were so professional and warm at the same time. We loved everything and we will be back!
I'm a big fan of Chef Jose Andres- and he be has done it again. Amazing Mediterranean food in a pretty upscale environment. It's tapas-style, so be prepared to share.

I love Zaytinya in DC so was very excited to try the NY one out. The ambience was nice but the food and service were really not up to the mark. Service was extremely bad and all our food arrived cold. There was no sequencing to the food - they just brought stuff as in when it was ready and a few apps came after the entree. The dessert (some cake) was pretty bad in taste. Would probably not go back
No comment

I'm so excited about this place and returning to try everything on the menu. Had a leisurely afternoon meal here. We ordered everything to share. In the spreads we got the red pepper cheese, labneh and the hummus with beef which were all excellent. The beet salad was lovely. And the kababs were great too. Cocktails were innovative and just perfectS I got the twist on a side car with orange. Service was top notch with friendly servers and the ambience is gorgeous. It was a meal to remember and I will be back!
No comment
Everything is incredible. The ambiance, service, and delicious food. I got the shrimp salad! 10/10

I really, truly enjoyed this restaurant! We were given great service and recommendations throughoutthe experience. I started with a za'atar margarita which had complex and unique flavors, would definitely recommend giving that a try as it was like nothing I've ever had before. We had a variety of dishes - humus with lamb, charred eggplant pide, fattoush halloumi, shrimp and the lamb kebab. Shrimp, halloumi and lamb are all MUST HAVES. The fattoush salad and pide were okay - we enjoyed it but they were more standard when compared to the excellence of the hummus with lamb, shrimp, halloumi and lamb kebab. Great food in a beautiful atmosphere and the service was top notch.
Sooo good!! Love their dips and salty air margaritas. So yummy and beautifully decorated

Many years ago we dined at Zaytinia in Washington DC and were excited that a New York branch would be opening.  We love Little Spain and Mercado at Hudson Yards. The room at the new Ritz-Carlton is beautiful, elegant & comfortable at the same time. The service is excellent from top to bottom and the food is delicious.  The warm, thin pita is addictive. The Greek 56 Isles beer is better than Allagash White or Blue Moon. The red pepper feta dish refreshing and flavorful. The fried eggplant with apricots and yogurt perfect. The rice with fried shallots hearty & tasty. The meatballs tomato sauce is herb infused and cut with feta. The lamb shank was filling, but the portion was the right size. I recommend the restaurant whole heartedly. Next time dessert as we were too full. The only dish we would skip next time is the Halumi cheese, good, but not as great as the others. The only negative for the 200 seats restaurant is there is only One bathroom? How this will be solved is a question and a mystery on how it was designed.

Loved the ambiance and of course the food was innovative. Enjoyed the whole Branzino grilled to perfection, the lamb shank, cauliflower and the Htipiti dip which our waiter recommended. Great service from our waiter all evening. So attentive. I would go again in a heartbeat.

We had a fabulous family dinner, elegant but not stuffy...colorful, delicious bites and cocktails that deserve a special shoutout too. And excellent service! I particularly loved the cauliflower and the CHICKEN YOUVETSI - YUM.
No comment
Great service. , great food and very friendly staff . Recommend shrimp (karides ) and Hunkar Begendi

Great atmosphere, but noisy. Sat at the bar, was busy and a tad overwhelmed with only 1 bartender for the bar guests and 1 for tables. Food was good, albeit a little toned down in terms of spices/flavor, typically associated w/Middle Eastern fare, assuming in order to cater to a broader (read: tourist) palette. Food tasted good nonetheless. Portions varied greatly for tapas. The shish (skewered meats) were appropriately sized. More eclectic dishes (e.g., octopus or Laban/eggplant) were less generous.
No comment

Went for brunch and was very mediocre. The free unlimited pita was pretty bland and sometimes seemed undercooked. Ordered the Cilbir and it was frankly insulting when they put it in front of me: 2 fried eggs over the thinnest smear of yogurt and some za'-atar on top with nothing else on the plate. I had to stop myself from laughing because I paid $15 for it. The other people I was dinning with were fine with their shakshouka but weren't blown away. The best thing we had was the baba ghannouge
Wonderful service, great ambiance, superb food- all served by a great efficient and attentive professional friendly staff!

Everything about it from the time we walked in for our work holiday lunch, to the time we left was a really good experience. Friendly staff, knowledgeable waiter, excellent food. Prices what you'd expect but nothing crazy. The decor is pretty cool. The light fixtures unique. Must have the dessert with lemon sorbet, pistachios, olives, lemon curd, etc. Well worth the calories.

Not as good as the DC zaytinya- which was surprising because it was in the Ritz- the Turkish coffee was very poorly made and the service was a bit slow. However, the food at zaytinya is ALWAYS unreal fresh and their bread is always fresh. Staff always kind.
No comment

It took the hummus 30 minutes to arrive and it arrived with the entree. The manager did nothing to make it right. I was told by a waiter that if you order everything at once, they bring out everything at once. In what world does someone want their hummus appetizer to arrive at the same time as their main course? It took ten minutes to get water. The timing of everything is completely off at the restaurant. The food is delicious whenever it does actually arrive. The waiter was a little discombobulated but the restaurant was understaffed and she was working her ass off in an impossible situation with a disjointed and disorganized kitchen that can make the food great but can't time anything to save their life.

Charming and cozy, a lovely spot for dinner. The plates are small and you will likely need to order around 2 per person for a filling meal. The dishes are flavorful and delicious. Our group especially loved the brussels sprouts.

Dunno what to say.  I was super excited about this place.  It's beautiful and has a great vibe.  Let me preface this by saying that I lived in Greece (constantly also visiting Turkey and other places in the Levant) so I know a little bit about mezze style eating. Anyway, let's begin.  We ordered a soujouk pide and the soujouk was nonexistent; okay maybe a couple paper thin truffle like slices of sausage.  Our artisanal cheese pikilia/assortment was basically 3 or four bite sized pieces of cheese. The cauliflower was bland and uncooked.  Everything else we had: falafel, octopus, lamb baharat, shrimp and soutzoukakia were generally pretty good but tiny.  Look, I'm basically listing off the entire menu and my party of two relatively thin people left this place hungry. Lastly, I totally understand that they want to elevate the galaktobouriko but it should still have some semblance of a galaktobouriko; and btw mastiha should be served freezing cold ideally in a frozen glass.  It is not raki to be diluted/cooled with ice (no need for three glasses).  To end on a high note, the Mediterranean G&Ts were definitely on point.  I really very much wanna like this place, and I may be back for a G&T, but it could be so much better.

Great dining experience.  Must get spreads because the airy bread is wonderful.  Service was excellent without being hovering. Everything was delicious. We liked the kofte, chicken orzo, and Brussels sprouts the most. Sat in a cozy booth.  Had a delicious cocktail made with Ouzo, which I doubt you could find elsewhere.
The food here is the worst I have ever had the beef tasted dry and over cooked and the hummus had a very strange taste. I stay at the Ritz all the time but will not be back.

I don't enjoy doing this but, we had a HORRENDOUS experience. HORRENDOUS. I wasn't expecting perfection but I left feeling highly disrespected. The food and ambience were great but no one came tom our table for over fifteen minutes. We might have waited longer if we didn't flad a cook/ chef down to tell him. Why didn't we tell a server? Because none of them would even make eye contact with us. We were sat at 3:25 and told (impolitely) that we needed to be done by 5:00. We saw a busser before a server, who took our water order. When the server finally came, he attempted to take our water order. I guess they don't talk? When we ordered, the server forgot my soup. When I got it, it was cold and I had to wait for a spoon. Our server was nice enough but completely tone deaf to what transpired prior to his arrival. I was there to catch up with my dining companions and wasn't expecting perfection but we were forgiving the staff for blunders they didn't have the wherewithal to apologize for. When we left at 5:20, the restaurant was about two thirds empty. I guess they didn't need our table that bad? We had an awful experience.
Amazing food, beautiful space and friendly, helpful staff. Really excited that Zaytinya has finally arrived in NYC!

We truly loved dining at Zaytinya! The total experience was absolutely outstanding - decor, food and service were wonderful!! You won't be disappointed- highly recommend!  Jose Andres and his team have a winner in NYC!

My expectations were fully met and beyond. The service that all of you offered us from the moment of our arrival until we left was incredible. My husband was delighted to have enjoyed his birthday with you and I am very happy to have selected you. For us, excellent attention is always paramount, as well as tasty food, and you fulfilled all of that, especially with the service. Thanks for everything. See you soon.
No comment
Great food and service! Such a beautiful space as well. Looking forward to going back many times!!

Very good, but shy of excellence. Space is beautiful. Service was attentive at times, spotty at others. Labneh was over-salted (and I am a salt fiend). Brussels were a little over-cooked. Pide, halloumi, and apricot dessert were superb. Lovely meal, and would recommend....but for perfection every time try Shuka or Shukette.
Food was very good.  Ambiance is very much a hotel restaurant.  Service was mediocre at best.

After much fanfare, I decided to take my girlfriend here for her birthday. The hostess was gracious and accommodating, as we showed up a few minutes late. Once we were seated, it took a very long time for anyone to come for water or drink orders. This theme permeated throughout the rest of the night, even though the restaurant wasn't busy at all. The food was slow and uninspiring. At the end of the meal, the waiter did not ask if we wanted another drink or dessert. I had indicated when I made the reservation through their portal that we were celebrating a birthday, and nothing was done to acknowledge that. No one refilled our water the entire meal. No one checked to see how the food was. No one said thanks when we paid or left. Price aside, I would not recommend this restaurant at all. Very disappointed and will never return. I expect a lot more from a Jose Andres establishment and hope they fix these issues.

Very beautiful ambiance when walking in. Loved that we stayed at the ritz and they had this option however we quickly learned this is just highly unfortunate to be a ritz restaurant. Food was ok/decent. But definitely not what expected for this restaurant. Waitress was gone over 15-20 minutes before we even made a drink order. Our party of four was ready to order at least 2-4 bottles of wine and she couldn't make any recommendations and said she would "go ask the bartender for recommendations" then was gone another 15 minutes. She proceed to come back with options for us to try but were not available for bottle purchase- therefore why are we trying them? It ended up being such an awkward experience. She also could not give food recommendations. While this place has good potential it was terrible for our anniversary and one time we had in NYC and chose to spend it here. Go else where. I am generous with this rating as food was simply ok. Would be better and better off spending money elsewhere.

fresh delicious abundant food. the flavors are delicate and exquisite. the meats tender. the service impeccable (joey was our outstanding waiter.) the ambiance is sexy but comfortable. bring your first date, your best friends, business associates. they will all thank you.

I liked everything I had besides the fish but truly can't say that there were dishes I hadn't had at other Mediterranean restaurants.

Came here for dinner on a Monday night. Was able to get a 5 PM reservation last minute which was nice. Ordered a bunch of things and loved most of them. Got the smoked arctic char dip which was a ground fish dish that was really flavorful. Loved the lafa, which was a grilled flatbread that was also quite flavorful with a touch of lemon. The labneh was too cheesy for us. The fish in a cage was too salty, but made for good leftovers with rice. Lastly, the service was so wonderful. It's a small somewhat cramped space but they made it work with a stroller and made us feel really welcomed.
