I'm not a long haul reservation person.  How do I know I'll want to eat there in 2 or 3 weeks!  The middle eastern menu with Delish twists + turns is SO worth it.  The stand outs for me were Artic Char meatballs - one of their amazing breads their fairytale eggplant like a sweet + sour style all great.  I have still not made a reservation. And while they've suspended take out. Except one night I so wanted it I shamelessly begged the kids working the door for some food - they said they'd check with the chef yes the stars aligned.  I went back in half an hour took my food home for another half hour of food bliss!  Thank you to the Chef!

The food here was amazing! I came here as a party of 4 and we made a reservation a couple of weeks in advanced for a Thursday evening. We started our meal with the frena and labneh. The frena was amazing - bursting with garlicky flavor and the labneh was bright and complex. We also shared the roasted cauliflower. I really liked the dates and how it brought sweetness to the savory dish. I ordered the mushroom arayes, which were really goood, and even better when I dipped it into the toum that came with my boyfriend's chicken plate. For dessert, we ordered two mic drops, but they accidentally served as four, with the two extra's being on the house. I would definitley come back to try other things on the menu!
No comment
No comment

I am absolutely enamored with Shukette. We loved sitting at the bustling counter and watching the expeditor in all his glory. This man is a super star. He makes sure every dish is perfection, yells fire the cauliflower, and calls out the table number all effortlessly. We decided to focus on the "Shuk and shared the heavenly frena Moroccan fry bread with the creamy, delectable hummus. One of my fav things was the roasted cauliflower that had perfect char and sweetness from the medjool dates. The broccolini had a spicy kick from the Fresno pepper sauce underneath. We were also sent a pita served so hot and fresh that when opened steam escapes with accessories of tahini, zhoung, & toum. The toum garlic whip was fluffy and had the best flavor of the 3. We finished with the shrimp skewer which was seasoned very well and an epic finish to the meal. Our server also took the time to explain the sections of the menu and how all items are meant to be shared.  This joint is an absolute must when you visit NYC!
No comment
No comment
No comment

You had me at smoked arctic char. We luckily got seated at the of the counter where the phenomenal chef was working her magic. When she was not expediting the food she briefly chatted with us. You can't go wrong with a a chef from Brooklyn wearing door knockers! She's my kinda gal. The food was just so tasty. Smoked arctic char was creamy and loved the red onions on top. The Frena bread came our nice and hot. Mushroom Arayes reminded me of an empanada filled with yummy mushroom. The dipping sauce was a delicious tahini. Loved the pickled beets that came with it. The Adana came in three patties which were also tasty. Last dish was the beef kebab. Cooked perfectly in a skewer. Overall just a great meal. The entire staff were all friendly, knowledgeable about the food and the atmosphere was fun, warm and welcoming. Would back for sure! Sitting by the counter was so much fun.

No comment

Shukette is a really trendy spot lately so I had to try it! It's a shared plates experience which was fun because my cousins and I got to try lots of different dishes. The dips were fantastic and the bread was even better! The presentation was also beautiful. Definitely get the Broccolini, it was one of the best Broccolini preparations I've ever had. The service was for the most part good, they moved some tables around to seat us. However, our waiter was a little bit of a know it all; when I asked a question about one of the cocktail spritzers he kind of had an attitude like "duh it's..." when he responded. Other than that it was amazing and the food came out really fast which was nice too.

After trying to get a reservation at Shukette for months, my sister and I finally managed to snag a reservation for 4. We ordered Frena, Labneh, and Roasted Cauliflower to start, and the Steak Shish Kebab and Fish in a Cage as entrees. The Frena was amazing - I highly recommend this dish. It was soaked in olive oil and a little crispy on the bottom. There were also roasted garlic cloves on top that were great. The Frena was very small for $8, so we decided to order a Lafa as well which was also very good. The Lafa is more of a flatbread type of bread. The Labneh was good as well, but a little cream cheese-like. The Roasted Cauliflower dish was also very good, but overpriced at $16 for around 6-7 pieces of cauliflower. For the entrees, the Steak Shish Kebab was really juicy and tender, but there were only 5 pieces of steak on it. For $26, I didn't think that was worth it. The Fish in a Cage ($36) was very good. It was a whole crispy fish with two delicious sauces. The fish was probably the most worth it. To end the meal, we shared the Tahini Soft Serve. It was great with the halva floss and hazelnut, but I didn't like the tart syrup they used on top - I believe it was pomegranate. Overall, Shukette has some amazing dishes, but the portions are way too small for the price.

This is my GO TO spot in Chelsea. The menu is incredible and everything I have tried here is excellent. Every time I'm in NYC I snag a reservation here - at this point I think I have tried each seasonal menu!
No comment

Shukette! Amazing middle eastern food. My only complaint is that we did sit outside and these black bugs were crawling everywhere- on the table, near the side wood paneling - we did our best to ignore them. I love the light drinks - I ordered a citrus spritz and we shared hummus, frena, broccolini, cauliflower, and shrimp- the best things were the frena and the cauliflower. I really wanted to try the soft serve but I'll have to come again to get it.

What an absolute gem! We loved everything about our experience. From our helpful and charming waiter, from our seats right on the counter next to the head chef, and everything we ate- Everything was perfect! We ordered everything our waiter suggested and, from the appetizer (labneh & frena), the fish in the cage and tahini soft serve, we loved it all. Asked to sit on the counter, the experience was fun and exciting to see the cooks in action. Recommending this place to everyone I know and I Can't wait to come back!

I want to start out by saying the food that we did receive was very tasty as many reviewers have said, and that is why I am even giving a second star. However, our experience at Shukette was clouded by the slow, inconsistent and unprofessional service. We were a group of four, we had a reservation for 9:45. The restaurant had other customers but did not seem to be overly busy. Once placing our order we didn't receive 3 of the dishes that we ordered. For the dips that we received, the breads that we ordered with them did not come out at the same time, making it hard to eat. When we mentioned to our waitress that we hadn't received many of our dishes still, she seemed surprised and sent a man over ( can only assume was a manager) who just said " I hear we didn't get our lentils here, I will send over an extra pita bread." After all this, we still did not end up receiving 3 dishes that we ordered. At the end of the night when we were ready for our check, we told the waitress that we never received these dishes despite a manager already trying to reconcile this. She told us " I'm going to go crush some skulls " and made her way to the kitchen. A lady who we assume was another manager came over and profusely apologized, offered her business card and ended up comping less than a quarter of our bill of the items we did receive. Overall really poor service and unprofessional. We will probably not be returning with all the wonderful other options in nyc.

Wow I just had the most phenomenal meal!!! I popped in to Shukette for a solo dinner, and I was initially concerned about the family style plates. However, it was definitely the right call!!! Everything was fresh, super flavorful, and so unique. I will absolutely eat there again... maybe even during this trip to NYC!

Love their inventive dishes and the sharing concept. Drinks were also great. Favored dish was the sweet potatoes- the goat cheese butter on top was gas.

Overall I had a good experience here. Hard to find good Israeli inspired food in the city but this lives up to its predecessor, Shuka from west village. As something of a sister restaurant I liked it a lot and ordered a bunch of things to try. The garlic frena bread and cauliflower were great as well as the dips selection. The fish in a cage was also a great share very while the Kebab was ok. Would def come back again as they change menu a lot.

Been wanting come here for so long. Finally, made it. So we ordered fish in a cage, smoked mackerel dip, their insane frena bread! So good! And of course the real reason I went was for my tahini soft serve. It didn't matter whether weather was cold or not, that I had to had and I don't regret it. Although fish in a cage dish was a bit too fishy for our taste. Service was so good. They were very knowledgeable and tentative with details on everyone's allergy. Ambience of this place is great. Although recommend to come with bunch of formes to order bunch of dishes to share. Have to come back here again!

Definitely on the smaller side for portions, but gives you an excuse to eat more! The grilled fish, shrimp skewers, dips with pita, and ice cream were all amazing. I sat outdoors, but the inside definitely looked a lot nicer (although it was packed!)

So glad I finally made it here. Having very much enjoyed the experience at Shuka a long time ago, I was looking forward to dinner at Shukette and it did not disappoint. We managed to get a last min reservation for outdoor seating. I'd say it was a pretty lively atmosphere. Service was friendly and attentive. My friend and I shared a bunch of dishes and pretty much devoured everything because it was so good. I particularly loved the Frena bread dipped with hummus and labneh and the Crispy Fairytale Eggplant. I'm already planning on coming back with a bigger group so that we can try more dishes this time around!
Delicious food. Their frena bread and labneh is amazing. Their grilled chicken melts in your mouth. Place is amazing

This was a good experience but felt like a bit of a step down from Shuka.  The service was off, and the dishes didn't come out in an intuitive sequence (eg our bread came first, and the hummus at the end, so we had to order more bread to dip into the hummus).  The crispy fairytale eggplant was excellent as was the heirloom tomato salad.  But the hummus was not that great (a bit chunky and despite it sounding extraordinary on the menu, It didn't quite deliver on the promise).  I'd still go back here, but not 5 stars in my opinion, especially compared to its sister restaurant Shuka.

As a diehard Shuka fan, I was so excited to try Shukette (Shuka's sister restaurant in Chelsea). Dishes were very flavorful and yummy but tiny! Our dinner together (4 dishes below) cost us $80. Similar to Tapas sizing. Service was relatively quick but the waiter was a little too pushy for my liking. Overall, I would pick Shuka all day everyday!

Food is great, but for sure bring your Pepto Bismal because you will be rushed to race through your meal in no time flat. Our apps were in front of us before we finished ordering, and we were halfway through our second course before our wine showed up (we'd been sitting maybe 11 minutes at this point).  Rush rush rush... gotta turn the tables but this is ridiculous. Place is a factory churning out cauliflower piled high, various breads on a treadmill and zero chitchat with the staff bc they gotta move move move!  Food is really good, just wear your track shoes bc they are going to race you out!!

Super trendy middle eastern spot in Chelsea. Some dishes were more memorable than others. All the dips and breads were noteworthy and full of flavor but the meat entrees were a bit underwhelming. The shish kabobs were undercooked, and the fish in cage was good but not the best roasted fish I ever had. The tahini icecream and frena bread are a must.

Wow - What a great spot for dinner !  Best to plan ahead with reservations through the RESY website as you will receive a pre-recorded message if you call. There is also the option of texting the host if you have other questions. They were booked the night we went but we were able to grab an outside table. The service was excellent and our server we ordered every recommendation that was suggested - Frena bread, Castelfranco Salad, Blue Fish and Fish In A Cage. Everything and I mean EVERYTHING was delicious!!!!

We didn't have a reservation and lucked out with a seat at the bar. Everything was absolutely delicious and the staff were amazing. Diego was especially helpful and made our experience extra special. I will definitely return the next time.

You have to eat here. You can't really go wrong with whatever you order here and I'd recommend that you make a reservation beforehand as the booths seem to be prime seating areas. We ordered the hummus and labneh, the Frena (must order, it's beyond this world delicious), the lamb and beef meatballs (Adana), the sweet potato, the charred broccoli, and for dessert, the Tahini soft serve. All the food is well prepared, seasoned perfectly, and bursting with flavor to the brim. It'll blow your mind. Also shoutout to the amazing staff that work here, who are very attentive to their customers and know the menu.

Spectacular meal ...more of a 4.5 star if not for a bit of service chaos.  Server did everything in his power to be excellent but the place is a pinch too chaotic on a Wednesday for truly exceptional service.  Garlic bread was silly good ...order 5! Fish in cage ...shrimp kabobs ....doner...all magically delicious! Can't wait to go back !

Very lovely place. You can order Korean and Japanese foods. My boyfriend and I spend two hours there after we decided to be together that afternoon. It definitely would be a memorable place for us. Everyone is so nice and patient. Highly recommend.

They don't really need me to add more raves to their already glowing list but I can't help it. We snagged a bar seating last minute and it was really fun food-watching. There was NOTHING we ordered which could have been improved upon-- the spices, salt level etc were perfect (well, ok I could have used a larger portion of the breads). Great energy in the place.  Server gave great recommendations ranging from choices to how much to get.

Came here twice already and loved my experience both times! We had a table the first time and sat at the counter the second time. I would say try to get a table because it is more comfortable but the counter you can see them preparing food which is fun. I've tried a bunch of things and unfortunately I can't remember all the names but what stood out to me were the cauliflower, frena, roasted beets, and the tahini soft serve. I love how vegetarian friendly this place is plus you can get a bunch of small plates and share with the table.

Definitely worth the hype!! Our server, Angel, was the nicest server ever -- provided great recommendations and helped us plan out our dinner. He suggested the breads and dips and we were not dissappointed -- they were by far the best items on the menu and if I went back, I would legitimately only get breads and dips.

AMAZING, AMAZING. A group of 5 of us came in for a weekday dinner and we were all so impressed!!! Had a delicious dinner with friends yesterday evening. We ordered a few dips, some bread, a lot of mezze, a couple of kebabs and chicken Joojeh. This may have been in my top 5 restaurant I visited, in the US, all year. We ordered so much food that I can't even recall the specifics to share here but trust, you will enjoy what's on the menu. Menu does change so that may be why there's varying review ratings. I'm wishing I could go back right now and eat more. Also the service was very strong. Ask to try wines from the Middle East.
Every single dish was out of this world, service was attentive and playlist was *chef's kiss*

What an amazing spot! Came here for a late dinner and had a great time! The vibe was so fun, our server was so nice and gave so many recs (sorry I can't remember her name but she was great!!) and everyone was perfect! We truly loved every bite.

Shukette most definitely lives up to the hype! Got a late night reservation and took the opportunity to order and taste as much of the menu as possible. First of all, loved the fun ambiance & creative menu... very cool diner-like vibe! Secondly, food was really really good!! Fun, creative twist on middle eastern cuisine. Some standouts include all the dips / mezzes with their bread, grilled calamari,  shawarma spiced fries, joojeh chicken, steak shish, as well as all the tasty "accessories." And make sure to save some room for the tahini soft serve... it was like nothing I've ever tried before and truly a "mic drop," as described!! My only wish is to be able to land another reservation to Shukette to experience it all over again!

OMG. Amazing. Delicious. Amazing service. Great ambiance and the vibe was perfect on a Friday night after visiting an exhibit. Looking forward to returning many. 'Any times.

Food so authentic and delicious, I didn't know where to start so I kept ordering. Plates are meant to be shared, so bring an appetite. It is worth the price trust me. The lamb is cooked to perfection. The bread is fresh and garlicky. The steak kabob is smoky and the radishes and pickles that come with it are fresh and satisfying.

Love Shuka so had high hopes, but was totally disappointed. Meh flavor in food and nothing was exceptional that we had at all. Wine list overpriced and not very good. Need at least a couple great wines by the glass on a dinner menu.  We had a specialty bread that was doughy and only a little flavor, labneh ok, nothing special, carrots ok, butter beans totally bland, shrimp fine, again boring, Iranian rice tasty but not interesting enough to go back for. We stopped ordering as didn't really like any of it. Malbec was best red on the menu by the glass and really just drinkable.

Amazing food! Everything is very tasty. The Frena bread is outstanding. The fish in the cage is a really special sharing dish. The staff Hayden our server was perfectly attentive and interesting to talk to. The atmosphere is vibrant, fun and low key hip. Eating at the bar is also a special treat as the food open fired cooked in front of you. James the host is awesome. All in all, a true gem.

Hosts were unusually rude and honestly ruined the vibe. I wish I could say the food was better but it was either to sour or too spicy. We ordered the wagyu beef which was no better than supermarket ground beef. The potatoes and broccolini were over charred. There are about a million better middle eastern restaurants in NYC and you should take your business elsewhere.

I can not provide words to describe what is now my new, overall, fave restaurant in NYC.   If you are a party of 2-3, eat at the counter. Energy.  Flavors.  Service. Love.  Quality.  They've got it all. I will rebook before getting back in the cab.  Congrats, Shukette - you are rock stars!  And a shout out to Joe - he provided exceptional, genuine service/care - as if I was a guest in his home.

From the ambiance to the food to the drinks, I can't say enough great things about Shukette. We were a little nervous since we heard such good things about the summer menu and they recently changed to their fall menu but everything was incredible. Absolute musts to try are the frena, labneh, fish in a cage, and tahini soft serve but also really enjoyed the delicata squash and the crispy skate. I recommend also trying some of the accessory sauces cause they wen't really well with the bread and hummus. Everything was perfectly seasoned and every dish was well thought out and crafted with care. I can't wait to go back and try more. Run don't walk to this incredible restaurant before it's impossible to get a reservation!
No comment

One of the best Mediterranean restaurants I have ever been to. Everything they had was so full of flavor it made you stop talking momentarily to savor it.  From amazingly tasty dips like Labneh and hummus to several different kinds of fresh breads to an assortment of small plate meat and vegetable dishes there was nothing that we tried that I would even qualify as "ordinary".  Of the larger plates we tried the grass fed beef and lamb was exquisite.  So was the joojeh chicken.  Both were so so tender and practically dissolved on your mouth.  The cage fish may have been even better.  The fish came right off the bone easily easily and was by itself incredibly spicy and tasty but they gave multiple sauces to dip it on that were each delicious on their own right.   Finally their Tahini soft serve desert was a unique and delightful desert.  Great atmosphere and fast service also.

As a big fan of Shuka and having read all the reviews about how Shukette was even better, I must say that I was disappointed by the miscues. In an attempt to be overly creative, the food at Shukette is overly spiced with sometimes conflicting and competing tastes. At the moment Shukette is packed, but I doubt that it has the staying power of Shuka. The Tahini soft serve is very nice.

Absolutely delicious. Top to bottom. Frena is the world's greatest garlic bread, tastes almost like a roasted garlic focaccia. Hummus is better than my moms, topped with chickpeas, tahini and spices. Extremely delicious. Pickles a necessary complement to this richness. On top of that, Waiter suggested sweet potatoes, which blew my mind. Zesty, creamy, meaty. What a meal. Service was spotty but everyone was nice. Hostesse was a gem. High recommend.

I've been wanting to try this place for so long and it surely does not disappoint - so good that I secured my next reservation right after. First of all, the bread, oh the famous Frena bread, it tastes like a buttery fluffy cloud. Words can't describe how good it is. The hummus, as the name goes, is surely "not your average", and it compliments the bread so well.  Next we got the grilled shrimp because the lady sitting next to us had it and it smelled way too tempting. Obviously no regrets, it was a little spicy, which was unexpected but wasn't overpowering. The portion was a little small though but it was shrimp so understandable. I think next time I'll try the fish in a cage. We also got a citrus salad, was pretty good but personally it felt more like a dessert rather than a salad. Overall the portions were not big, kind of like tapas, which is great since you can try a variety although it may end up a little expensive. The bread was definitely fairly priced though and I would come back a hundred times just for that. The ambience was pretty cool, open kitchen concept and you can see the magic happening right in front of you, but it did get a little smoky, which I personally didn't mind. Overall, this place was worth the hype and I can't wait to go back.
Soooo good!!! Love their dips and breads. Rlly hard to get a reservation but their food and drinks make up for it

We had a fantastic dinner here! We were able to luckily get a last minute reservation at the bar overlooking the kitchen. We loved watching them make all the delicious foods while enjoying our courses. The Frena bread is a must!! We will be back on our next trip to NYC!

Omg. Everything here was amazing. The Fava bean dip, the bread, the fish in a cage. The cauliflower and the artichoke were good but might skip those next time. Wish I tried the tahini ice cream. Will be back, I love you Shukette!
No comment

Some of the best Israeli food in the city. First visit, we came with a group of three and got the labneh, hummus, zaalouk (eggplant), jobneh (essentially string cheese), frena, lafa, gozleme, kibbeh, feta-toush, jeweled rice, fish in a cage, and the tahini soft serve for dessert. We loved just about everything. The labneh came with amazingly crispy fried squash blossoms, and I couldn't come and not get that. I loved all of the other mezzes and breads as well (the zaalouk and frena were probably my other favorites from those groups), although my wife didn't love the herbiness in the gozleme. The fish in a cage was also incredible, and is the rare whole fish dish that would get me really excited. We could probably skip the feta-toush, jeweled rice, and soft serve next time around.

This is the best Mediterranean food in the city, hands down. The Tuna meatballs were so good, and the most unique dessert-- definitely try the Tahini soft serve! The service was thoughtful and attentive, the music was trendy but not over the top loud, and the vibes were perfect. Every dish was rich with flavor, and the small plate dishes were a good portion without being massive. I can't wait to try their menu for the next seasonal rotation.

Amazing food. We visited from Miami and were recommended this restaurant by our son to no disappointment. It was busy and got a table at the bar where you see them cooking in front of you! Food was delicious... can't wait to go back !
Food was amazing and so was the service! Been raving about this place for weeks! Will definitely be back!

I was very interested in Mediterranean cuisine This restaurant satisfied my desire very good service wonderful entrées and appetizers I recommend the fish in the cage perfectly grilled whole fish with vegetables also Great cocktails and roasted vegetables

I was so happy to get a reservation to this restaurant. I had the Not Your Average hummus. It was delicious. The Zaalok was great. The eggplant was great. We also ordered the Spicy fries. I could not get enough. The steak kebab was delicious. The food was great and the price was not bad either.
