I got to enjoy the NYT / Resy event last night which was a pre fixe meal, and it couldn't have been more delicious. The service was flawless and warm, matched with one of the best meals of my life. It's hard to get a reservation here but I've already locked in one for next month!
Make reservation first! But it won't wait so long to be seated. I came there with my friend at my Bday. The server is very nice! The food and drink are great! It's always packed.

Outstanding meal pre-show Roxy Music at MSG. We weren't sure where to go and luckily our search led us here. Food was heavenly and team members Nikki and Haden went above & beyond to take care of us. Heirloom tomato salad was a delicious final taste of summer, with corn and other tasty bits. Labneh one of the best ever. The bread was perfect, so crispy on the edges, yum. The fish/roe salad (forgot exact name) was also a treat. Steak kebabs were perfectly cooked and the peach and tomato and zucchini were also very summery. The shrimp were also perfect, nice & spicy, and to finish, that soft serve was delicious...so glad they were able to get the machine running! We are fans of this team's other restaurants and would come back here in a second. Highly recommended.
Got off then plane from San Francisco, and got a late dinner here. It was an incredible surprise! We loved everything, especially the broccolini. Great atmosphere and service.

I ate here a month ago and am still thinking about the meal. We were lucky enough to get a seat at the bar and ate like kings.. Each dish is on point and bursting with flavors. The frena was a real winner; fish in a cage delightful. And the ambiance was energetic and warm. I can't wait to return!
No comment
No comment
No comment

It is absolutely insane and gross to me that they charge extra for bread for their dips. How could you feel it's appropriate to charge someone for a separate order to even be able to eat their original order? It's just a big turnoff.
No comment
Wowww amazing service and very unique and creative dishes. The scallops were perfection.
No comment

Get a reservation here as soon as you possibly can, you must try this place. The food is incredible. If you like Mediterranean flavors then this is your new favorite restaurant. My wife was able to book a last-minute reservation here for our wedding anniversary. The menu is intense, so don't fret - just ask the waitstaff and they will guide you through with their recommendations. Our waitress recommended Labneh from the dip section and the Frena from the bread section. They paired brilliantly well together and we will make an effort to try the rest of their dips and breads during subsequent visits. The Labneh was a beautifully put together yogurt based dip, and we learned that Chef Ayesha Nurdjaja prepares the yogurt fresh in-house from scratch. The Frena was similar to the Focaccia from Ci Siamo, wonderfully rich with a great depth of flavor. The Roasted Delicata Squash was a great appetizer and went beautifully with the tahini. Unfortunately, after this point in the meal I was regrettably full from overdoing it with the Frena and Labneh and was reaching the end of my capacity. The Tuna Meatballs was delicious; however, the Jeweled Rice was the star of the show and will stun your senses, the aroma is incredible. The Kebab plates are filling, but definitely a must-get item. Fish In A Cage was delectable. I wish I had spared more room since I was full after the appetizers, but I will be making another visit soon!

Shukkette is well known and held in a high regard in NYC, as they should. It's delicious food and very unique! However, for the price you pay it does not totally equate to what you get. I think it is slightly overpriced, even though the food is good. The best things to get are Labneh dip with Frena bread is amazing, but I do not recommend the cauliflower- not cooked well and not as flavorful as other options. Great mocktail and cocktail options as well! Also, might not be preferred with anyone who prefers a quieter environment- very loud pop music and very busy!
Absolutely delicious, full flavor, perfectly cooked food. Our server Joe gave us great recommendations and was delightful. Can't wait to come back

Absolutely incredible! Scored a counter seat reservation here during my stay in NYC with my mom. The food was out of this world. We enjoyed the butter beans, frena, cauliflower, and jeweled rice. Everything came out piping hot and fresh as we watched it being made right before our eyes! We dipped everything in the toum, which i have not stopped thinking about since. To drink we both had a citrus gazoz which was delightful and refreshing. Our server tanya was wonderful and truly made the experience one to remember. If we are ever in the city again, we will be back!!!

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: You will have an absolutely lovely experience at Shukette -- because of both the delicious food and ambience. When they say they welcome walk-ins, they are being honest. I walked in on a Sunday night around 8:30pm, and it was bustling. We happily waited at an outside table and had the wonderful Chateau Musar, a white from Lebanon. Waiting for our table was fun and made our time even better! What a rarity. My favorite dishes from the summer menu: the Frena bread with its fully interior, crisped outside, and melt-in-your-mouth garlic; the Labneh is amazing and one of the best in NY; the steak shish kabab has delicious and perfect medium rare steak; joojeh chicken. GET THE TOUM. The eggplant is all over their instagram, but I didn't like it -- too sugary. I look forward to trying the fall menu.

Loved this place and its vibe. Menu offers many choices for both vegetarian and meat eaters. Had the labneh, Moroccan bread and delicata squash. Get the dessert! Sat outside and service was lightening fast.

My boyfriend and I had an amazing dinner at Shukette tonight. The food was superb, I especially loved all the dips and the couscous. The tahini ice cream was also such a treat. Would definitely come back!

The place is a bit loud (like a bazaar) and a little crowded since they pack people in, but we'll worth it so that more people can eat there.  Sat at the counter and watched the cooks work hard. The hummus and the tahini dessert were amazing.  Wish I was in town longer so that I can go try more food.  Sadly, it looks like eggplant dishes are out of season in December.  Highly recommend eating here.
No comment

In a city bursting with incredible Israeli and Middle-Eastern restaurants, Shukette just might be the most fun. And that's not even mentioning the outstanding food. We visited with reservations on a recent Saturday night, and the buzzy atmosphere, beautiful interior, and kitschy, playful decor were immediately infectious. After being seated at perfect, romantically-lit sidewalk table, we dug into their equally as playful and diverse menu, featuring far beyond the usual hummus and pita (although they do that exquisitely, too). After starting with wine, we made some painstaking decisions given the many, tempting options. We started fresh with the hummus, pickles, and fattoush, and followed that up with the crispy fried squash blossoms and shawarma fries. However, the standout at Shukette is the bread. While the khachapuri is delicious, the puffy and garlicky frena is outstanding and the best thing on the menu (or any menu). We ended with their eccentric but absolutely tasty tehina ice cream sundae, a subtle and nutty end to our meal. The service was equally as wonderful and we felt very well-cared for as we enjoyed our meal, watching the evening Chelsea foot traffic go by. Put simply, Shukette is an NYC must.

It was great that we were able to book reservations.  They were nice enough to accommodate on the same day for an earlier reservation.  The service was wonderful.  We sat at the bar (which could get a little hot because they are grilling the food right in front of you).  The bread and dips were wonderful.  The Joojeh Chicken was great.  The fish meatballs were good but a bit to salty.  The Fattoush was great but drenched in dressing.  (less is more).  The Frena and Lafa bread was amazing.
Entitled attitude for subpar service with no delivery option. Basic hummus. That is all.

Most definitely one of the best dining experiences I had so far in New York City!!! Everything from the decor to the vibe on the bar to the service was simply perfect. The food was delicious and the soft serve in the end was to die for. Felt like I was back in TLV. Would definitely return!

Came here for dinner tonight and the place was pretty packed! The staff was really friendly and ambiance was nice. Although the bar had different music than the restaurant and it sort of mixed into each other(totally different genres) which was a bit weird. The food was pretty good. We got the crispy artichokes, hummus, frena (which was really good), joojeh chicken, and spring rice. We also got charmoula on the side, which was delicious. The portions are quiet small though. Overall, food was good.

Shukette serves some of the best Middle Eastern food in NY and perhaps the  Middle East where we have travelled extensively.  The dips, (eggplant, zucchini blossoms), breads (Frena, Leba),lamb kabab, fish balls are all excellent.  Even the soft serve dessert is refreshing and good.  Service is very attentive, including the brewage manager/sommelier and waiter.  The inside of the restaurant is packed, but they do check vaccinations.  If you are Covid fearful, outside might be a better option.
No comment

It's so hard to get a reservation here so we decided to check it out as soon as it opened at 5PM hoping to get a walk in table for early dinner.  We did and was luckily sat on the bar seats right in front of chef Ayesha. We were able to see how much attention she and her team paid to all the dishes. Everything we ordered was delicious and we can't wait to visit again to try the rest of the menu.

Incredible food and service! The Frena was to die for and I would go back just for that bread alone. The rest of the food and drinks were all great as well and our server was very friendly! We will without a doubt be returning and we are so happy that they finally opened!

I am a regular at Shuka so I was really excited to finally check this place out. It is such a cool spin off with a totally different vibe similarly inspired menus but definitely new fun and different things. I sat at the bar and was able to see all of the delicious dishes being brought out and that help me decide what to get. Some of my favorites were the tuna meatballs. I don't even love tuna and I really didn't think they could be good in this form but they were so tasty and delicious with some cilantro type of flavor going on very small and really satisfying. I also liked the lamb kibbeh which I don't usually like but it wasn't greasy at all.  The heirloom salad had a slightly different spin from the one I have had before and had such an amazing light dressing on it that matched perfectly with the sesame seeds. Overall I really liked the use of sesame seeds in a lot of these dishes. I also tried the cheese that was like mozzarella and it was amazing and I learned that it was made in house. Not surprisingly everything was super fresh and service was right on point. I really enjoyed my cucumber spritz and they had some delicious cava on the menu as well. I had to end my meal with the tahini soft serve and it was totally worth it. I can't believe how delicious something could taste that doesn't even have dairy. I will definitely be back!

Terrible food.. of course another Israeli place calling themselves middle eastern food. This is not authentic in any way and I'm convinced that the people that like it are people that have not tried Palestinian and middle eastern food so they settle for terrible service and flavors like this

Can there be a better restaurant?! The only issue with this place is that you can't eat the whole menu in one sitting. If you're into a great experience, grab a seat at the chef's counter and watch as they prepare it all. The dips are to die for (suggest the hummus or roast carrot) and the pita is likely the best you'll ever have. After a few of the "shuk" small plates, we split the lamb tagine, which was perfectly seasoned and prepared. If there's a better middle eastern spot in town, I'd be shocked.

I went here with a group of friends. The staff is nice and the decor is cute, but I would say that this place is very overpriced for what you get. For example, none of the dips come with bread (you have to order that separately) and the portion sizes are really small (you're supposed to order family style). My Syrian friend said that the Food wasn't very authentic (the feta-toush was basically a block of cheese with a very small salad). We felt that only the caged fish had a justifiable price (it was very good). Overall, if you care more about ambiance and presentation than getting your moneys worth of food I would say go here, but otherwise don't.
No comment

Solid! Knockout, eclectic menu; stellar, authentic service; relaxed, cool vibe; inventive, delicious cocktails; and...reasonable prices. What a find! Special shoutouts to manager Corwin who steered our birthday celebration in the right direction, and server Jennifer who nailed it with her astute recommendations and attentive service. Thanks, guys, can't wait to return!!

After wanting to try Shukette for a while, I finally got the opportunity to last week for some apps and drinks.  Service was amazing - the host was able to change our reservation time to earlier even though they were incredibly busy and our table service was always on point.  We ordered the labneh, fried artichokes, frena (bread with roasted garlic), shawarma fries and a couple gazoz. The frena and shawarma fries are going to be part of my standard order for sure. Can't wait to go back!
No comment

This was my second visit - I love Shukette! Taking a star away because we had to wait for 40 minutes for our reservation. They did provide a round of drinks while we waited which was much appreciated. The food is delicious. The dips and appetizers stand out more than the main courses. I do wish they had a full bar. The cocktails are sake cocktails. The tomato salad from their summer menu was the best thing I ate all summer.
No comment
Fun vibe, really good food, friendly service. I'm Iranian, and there are some familiar-ish dishes that really warm my heart at this spot.

Worst experience ever at middle eastern restaurants! I usually don't write reviews, but I had to for this one. The food was so so and cold, and everything was overpriced. They charged for everything separately, even bread and sauces. Definitely not going back.

Shukette was one of the best dining experiences I've had in a while. The staff was amazing and had lots of recommendations. I can't say enough good things about the food. Everything we got was delicious. We started with the hummus and frena which was the perfect combination of light and savory. We then ordered the heirloom tomato salad, jeweled rice and joojeh chicken. The heirloom tomato salad was light and fresh, highly recommend. The jeweled rice is super unique and has lots of different flavors and textures. It pairs really well with the chicken! We finished the evening with the Turkish coffee. It was not on the menu, but I recommend asking your server if it's available when you go. It came with cute little candied almonds as well. 10/10
No comment

Shukette was surprisingly a really disappointing experience. Although the staff attempted to help ease our long wait time with a glass of wine, the only thing worth trying on the menu ended up being the frena

It wasn't terrible but...when the best part of the meal is the bread that says something. I think the service played a part in that the server was more interested having us order a lot of items vs. really explaining what would pair well on the a la carte menu i.e. which breads should go with which dips, which courses, etc. The skate fish was bland as could be, the carrot dip was lovely but went terrible with the garlic bread. The NY steak was also bland and had to rely on the garlic dip for flavor which was also ordered separately. Also the steak was fatty and served with flavorless onion rings on top which cheapened it and undercooked sprouts. Add to all this that you're sitting on plywood benches and the whole thing comes off as roadside cafeteria meets food truck. There's hope but it needs a lot of work.

This is by far the best restaurant in Chelsea (sorry Worthwild you got dethroned by a new comer). If you can snag a resy TAKE IT!!! This place is so good it's worth traveling to even if you live in another neighborhoods. I would travel 30+ mins to eat here. Fortunately living in Chelsea, it's a short walk. Thanks for elevating our food game and bringing some food pride to Chelsea. Congrats on NYTimes top 10 new restaurants to open in 2021, couldn't agree more!
Truly of the best meals I've ever had. Every dish was a 10/10 and the service and vibe were excellent! Can't wait to come back!

This was my second time at Shukette and I brought some new friends. I still think this is a top 5 restaurant in the city. We started off with the labneh and the mummarah ( red pepper dip) both of which were delicious. We got the signature garlic bread and the mozzarella pita. Mozzarella pita was amazing. From the shuk we got the tomato salad and the crispy eggplant with labneh. The tomato salad was actually my favorite dish, which was surprising, I didn't expect this dish to have so many different layers of flavor. The eggplant too was marvelous, sweet yet spicy and crispy so so good. For a main we got the fish in the cage which is always good and great to share. For the dessert they had the seasonal cantelope sorbet which we LOVED. Also got the garlic addition as a dip and we couldn't get enough. All and all, I was even more impressed than the first time and I am so excited to come back and try more new dishes. 9.8/10

I loved it here! The experience was excellent. From our sweet attentive kind server-Ashley  to the amazing Chefs-Eloid, Luis and the rest of their team. Sitting at the bar was the best view as we watched the Chefs working the magic in the kitchen. It was truly enjoyable. Highly highly recommend this place. Honestly, the food was Delicioso!! I will return for sure. Guys, check this place out. No joke. This is a real review. Thank you all for making our time here a very memorable one. You rock Shukette!

Such a fun place for casual dinner. Great atmosphere, fun music and attentive service. Lamb skewer labneh and lafa bread were phenomenal and authentic IMO. Sit at the bar with another person or at the booths for a bigger party. Skip the floral cocktail
Fabulous different food-fun to sit at the chefs counter and watch the action. Lots of dippy things to share and the Lafa is worth eating carbs! The bigger dishes can be shared -I liked the chicken.

Amazing server and food was delivered promptly, but unfortunately the food and the wine disappointed everyone in our party. We all agreed Shuka is far superior to Shukette. The best dish we had of 8 was the lamb, but only those of us who had the lamb all had stomach aches hours later.
No comment
No comment

Restaurant gets packed at peak hours so it can be a bit crowded, but the vibe is really lively and nice nonetheless. The labneh with apricots paired with the frena is a really delicious, different spin on mezze classics, and the toum is great to pair with entrees if you love garlic. The fattoush and the tuna crudo were both excellent and fresh, and the lamb sausage and fish in a cage were both delicious - the sausages had a touch of sumac which I loved. Cocktails are meh but service is great.

What an incredible meal!  I wish I was a professional food critic so I could do this place justice.  We got three dips (eggplant, salted cod, and hummus) and two breads, the tomato salad, the fried squid and the Adan Kebab.  We got way too much food, but it was all outstanding.  The salted cod was the best of the dips and the tomato salad was our favorite dish.  The food was just exceptional.  I am not really an ambiance/service reviewer, but they were both excellent as well.

Went there on 3/3/22 for a 7:30 2-person "chef's table" reservation that was made *months* in advance. Walked in on time to have one host exclaim to the other "oh THAT'S not available, just sit them there".  Right in front of us. Instead of doing their job and managing reservations which are for 90 minutes, they blew us off and sat us at the bar instead, no explanation/apology. We didn't say anything, but the bridge too far was when the lamb tagine we ordered - the ONE thing we wanted - was forgotten by our nice but harried waitress, who was offering us dessert when we pointed out we didn't get half of our food. Which she should have known, had she bothered to check. she then tried to gaslight us -  by saying "we like to time things this way." we were nice enough to the manager, who asked us if we wanted to wait 45 minutes, but he need not worry, as as we will never come back. What we did get to eat we liked, but the staff needs to be retrained. starting with the hosts. Given that every square inch of that place is designed to jam in as many people as possible, the service is taking a big hit as a result. Disappointing birthday.

Really unfortunate experience tonight. As someone who lives nearby, I really hope it gets better. They forgot about our order and totally forgot about us in the corner. The only food we got was a SMALL piece of bread that wasn't enough for the Labne after ordering 45min earlier. So instead we went to the  yummy Chinese restaurant across the street.

One of the best meals I have had in a long time and we eat out and travel a lot. Everything we tried was like a flavor explosion. The breads, the hummus, the labneh, the squash - all insane. I cannot say enough good things about Shukette and will be making a reservation for the next time I'm in NYC.

We got a bunch of appetizers and salads--the portion sizes are insanely small for the price. My $15 fattoush salad had about 3 grape tomatoes and a quarter cucumber sliced. The labneh was a thin layer on a teacup saucer. I have never seen a laffah so small in my life (my family is from the Middle East). The fried squash blossoms on the labneh and the flavors of the fattoush were great, the flavor profiles of the rest was just okay. The garden gazoz was refreshing but unmemorable. However--the tahini ice cream w the floss and syrup wowed. The taste was an amazing explosion of contrasts. It's the only thing from there I would get again.

Definitely eat here. I wish I could order everything on the menu. Everything I had was absolutely to die for, especially the tahini ice cream! And if they have octopus on the menu, we'll order it! This place is fabulous. Everything from the ambiance, to the staff, down to the food is absolutely spot on. Ace of a spot!

This restarting is what you look forward to when you come to New York City. The food, ambiance and service was great. All the hummus options were amazing as well as the tuna. The tuna was perfectly cooked with the  Couscous around it. I personally liked the Tuna more than the Chicken but non the less all the food was perfect.
delicious. best restaurant ever. so flavorful and wonderful. you should come here; you will not regret it
My fat ass was excited to try this spot and it was...bland. Our waiter was nice as hell, though. Overall, a hard pass for me.

Ate here with my beloved wife and son. Service was accommodating and prompt. Food was awesome with a wonderful array of flavors and textures. Really enjoyed the breads and the fish dish was amazing for the price. Would highly recommend!
No comment

Incredibly yummy. Be hungry if you go, and also be prepared to be a bit indulgent. The food is very good but also very rich and often fried. Not a problem if you know to expect (and enjoy) that kind of fare. Cocktails were decent, wine selection is good.

Wow! The vibe, the food, the drinks , all 5 stars! Make sure you get the dips, especially the hummus and the beet one. The cauliflower is also amazing and the whole fish. The tahini soft serve is unlike anything I've ever tasted, it's a must! The ambiance is also very cute and the service was amazing. We sat at the bar and our waiter was awesome and had great recommendations and then the manager stopped by to chat and gave us a little cardamom shot to go with dessert, it was all around a great experience. Make sure to get a reservation ahead of time, they book up fast!

Wow , how to start, just wow?  I'm amazed by food by every touch in preparation this yummy dishes. In open kitchen, you can see all magic-works which make this tasty food creations. Everything works as one tuned orchestra. 5  to kitchen, servic, ambiance. I can't give enough compliments to Chef Ayesha for her hard work in Shukette and this brand she is building. Do not miss this place you'll be thankful once when you go there.

Great new Chelsea restaurant. A melange of dishes, flavors and dinnerware. The best Middle Eastern food I've ever had in New York! One drawback for some people- not a full bar. They offer artful delicious drinks made with wine, garnished with exotic herbs. Our party of four ordered a lot. One dish surpassed the previous in terms of taste and creativity. We'll return!
Some of the best middle eastern food I've ever had - theres this one bread that was simply amazing. My only qualm was I wish there were more drink options
No comment
No comment

Wow!  If I could only use one word to describe the experience at Shukette it would be - WOW!  As soon as you walk the fun begins. You see the team in action creating your meal that look like works of art right in front of you. It is impressive and a pleasure to watch. The decor and vibe are upbeat and fun.  The staff is welcoming and warm. The service is friendly, prompt and efficient without being overwhelming.  The food is so colorful and flavorful and keeps you wanting more.  The dishes are unique and each dish is its own masterpiece.   I love a good cocktail and Gazoz are fun wine spritzers with fresh fruits and herbs. It's like getting a bouquet of flowers!  Everything is fresh!  All the dips are delicious, the hummus is as smooth as silk, the play on baba ghanoush using zucchini is brilliant. The labneh is my favorite served with squash blossoms.  The saltcod is something I wouldn't normally order but everything was so delicious I had to try it and it is probably one of my favorite things on the menu. The squid kebab is amazing.  The lamb gyro is authentic and the fries are cooked to perfection. The fish in a cage is last meal level, perfectly cooked and boneless served with fresh grilled veggies.  You could make a meal alone of the different kinds of house made breads.  The frena is absolute perfection!  And last but certainly not least, as named on the menu as the mic drop and it really is, is the tahini soft serve with halva floss. Absolute genius. You could go just for that and be absolutely satisfied.  It's all in the details at Shukette and Chef Ayesha has seen to that making this dining experience a complete WOW!
No comment
The food was unique and pleasant but not memorable. The service was amazing! I found the drinks on the sweeter side . The fena, Apple fennel salad, and squash were the best from what we ordered.

Seems like we waited forever for Shukette to open...we did! Finally, we were treated to a delicious, delectable meal. Each bite filled our senses. I won't tell you what we ate, you only need to know that it was all delicious. Our plan is to try something new every time we go; it's an adventure in taste. And believe me...Shukette knows the meaning of service! Go but don't take my time slot!

We love Shuka, and were so excited when the chef opened this spinoff restaurant. We had high expectations, and the experience exceeded them. The food was fabulous - it's hard to make a recommendation since everything was so delicious. I would definitely recommend Shukette!

A tremendous new addition to the NYC restaurant scene. The hype is real. My sister and I had a gorgeous dinner, the food was ten stars!!!! Get the bread with garlic, the fish in a cage, the hummus, you can't go wrong with anything. Long live Shukette!

It's new and already on our favorites list. We enjoyed everything on the menu and a couple recommendations include the labneh, sea scallops, lamb gyro and any of the freshly baked bread. Also get a seat at the bar to watch the chefs work their magic.

I only gave 5 star's because they don't have the choice of giving 10 stars!  The food was spectacular and the service couldn't have been more attentive and friendly!  I can't wait to go back!  FYI, Resy didn't give many choices for reservations but we got in as a "walk-in" at 5:00 when they opened.

Phenomenal middle eastern.  Open kitchen concept makes for a different / date night vibe.  Service was great and friendly (surprisingly so for our 5pm res).   Flavors were incredible in bread appetizers along with spreads and mains.  Can't wait to go back until I've tried everything they have to offer.
sooooo yum!!!! the appetizers were especially amazing and our waiter was so nice (: great middle eastern spot

the rating is low not because of the quality of the food but the quantity.  everything is ala carte.  look- the NY Times ad other places gave this place great reviews and thats fine but my chicken had no sides at all- just garnish-  it looked pretty empty- sure they want you to buy the appetizers- they are known for that- we did share some sort of bread with green herbs and yes it was absolutely delicious and we sharewd that tahini ice cream- oh my oh my was that delicious too-  my chicken was good but a little salty for me and my friend's porion of the calamari an entree was so small it looked like an appetizer-  I live a few blocks away and couldnt wait to try this restaurant- my neighbors like it a lot but some sort of side with the chicken= anything but just garnish= broccoli, potato- not asking for much= just the dip was on the plate with the garnish=
Great Mediterranean inspired food. We ordered plenty of small plates, they were all awesome, especially the tuna meatballs. Will be back !

This place is delicious. Lots of great mezze. For New York, it is pretty good Israeli food. Nothing as good as in Tel Aviv or Ottolenghi but yummy.  The portions of the mezze are ridiculously small: I ordered the Lebne and it was just a table spoon of lebne with 3 squash blossoms, the hummus was also tiny as were the salads. But New York lacks good Israeli food and this is one of the better ones I have had. The prices are high: one piece of pita is $5 but it is good pita.

the best food I've had in a long time the staff goes above and beyond they make you feel like you own the the place the food is so good I had crispy artichokes  frena withe labneh and joojeh chicken and I'll tell you this food so good they'll beat  bobby flay thank you to James  Cassandra and Raquel for give me there is one more I can't remember her name however she know who I'm talking about thank you again see you soon
Crazy good. The Moroccan bread and the fish in a cage were both incredible. Even the hummus was the best I'd ever had. Will definitely be coming back

Outstanding in everyway. Have been waiting for Shukette to opening for over a year and it was worth the wait. The best middle eastern food in NYC along with the sister restaurant Shuka in Soho. The food was excellent, service warm, attentive and knowledgeable and the decor beautiful.  Excited to go back!
After anticipating the opening I must say it was One of the best meals I have ever had! The staff and music was just as great!!!!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

A great ambiance in this spot! The menu is full of awesome choices and I really enjoyed my French onion soup. This was a great place for a new years day lunch or would be perfect for date night. Service was quick and friendly. Planning to come here again!

Love this place. I stopped bc I was early for  event near by. Luckily it was shoot hour n I gad the old fashioned for $12. Superb. Jeff and Rice ( bartender in training) were amazing! If I  lived near, I would  come everyday! It got busy after. Best fries I  ever had so crispy n hot. The car has beautiful bottles and aromatics is display. As Jeff said " aesthetics is everything "! J'adore! C'est Magnifique !
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Recette came highly recommended on Yelp and I expected better. This is a French cafe with very basic fare. What really threw me off was their "brunch menu" which essentially picked up items from their regular lunch menu and added $3-$5 per item. So strange and so quintessentially Williamsburg. Fundamentally they are marking up a regular menu for a weekend. I wouldn't spend money here when there are several much more impressive dine-in options around.
No comment

Amazing food, drinks and service! Cannot recommend this place enough; we got the mussels, escargot, ribeye, and burger and all were great. The staff also made the experience wonderful, specific shoutout to Ricardo and Ivan for making it a place we'll definitely dine at again!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I came here with my gfs we wanted to try the restaurant week however the regular menu was more enticing. The table shared french onion soup, grilled octopus, escargot. The main entrees we're the beef bourguignon, steak frites and mixed mushroom truffle gnocchi and for dessert we had the pancotta.  Everything was delicious.  They did not miss a beat on the flavors on the food. The dessert was perfect for a lightness and the cappuccinos we're perfect for a quick me up to keep the night going. I will definitely returning here.  Thank you Costa and the beautiful blonde waitress.  Both amazing and delightful.  Highly recommend this place
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Great food and a cozy atmosphere. Staff were friendly and attentive. Brunch is a busy time, but food was great and fresh.
Great French spot with nice cocktails! The steak frites are my favorite to get here. Friendly owners as well, love this neighborhood spot.

First of all, this place was completely packed, thats how we knew it was going to be really good.  We made reservations and got seated almost immediately in the back by the kitchen.  Our waiter was extremely friendly and attentive.  We  started off with the octopus, French onion soup, and the escargot and of course our drinks, I had the Brooklyn desire which was delicious, sweet, but not too much. My gfs had shared a wine bottle.  The octopus was great, however, I didn't like how they cut up the tentacles in small pieces, making it a little chewy, flavor was there, but they should keep that octopus whole, keeping it tender.  The escargot was good, not chewy at all, buttery.  I didn't try the French onion soup but my friend really liked it. For our entrees we had the wild mushroom truffle, that was absolutely divine! Creamy, truffle, goodness.  My favorite thing on the menu.  Beef bourginon was tender, and oh so flavorful, that meat was so super soft.  The mashed potatoes it came with, was extra creamy and absolutely delicious, I liked that they had the mashed on the side so you can be in control of how much sauce was going in there.  Steak frites was good, not the best, but nonetheless yummy. The French fries were super crispy and we loved it so much.  For dessert, we received panacotta on the house.  I've never had panacotta, but this was pretty damn good. The berries were fresh, and the panacotta so jiggly. *chefs kiss* Would definitely be back to try more on the menu.

Excellent food, drinks and service!  We had octopus carpaccio. Grilled Broccolini, crispy maitaki mushrooms. Husband had branzino and i had a burrata tomato salad with a lovely touch of strawberries . Everything was absolutely delicious. For dessert we shared a poached pear w vanilla cream sauce. All the food was great. Highly recommend.
the food was delicious everything was amazing I really enjoyed eating at recette the escargot  was one of the best I ever had in my life

Came here during Restaurant week to try out their food and overall, it was pretty good! The steak tartare and escargot were both pretty classic but tasty, and the soup was heartier than I thought. It is too bad they didn't have the stew option available from their prix fixe menu when we went there, was really looking forward to that. The salmon was alright overall and the steak was fine. The crème brulee was a little off because mine didn't have the best brulee and didn't have that resounding cracking sound but the crème was good. My mothers crème kind of had the opposite problem whereas her brûlée was better done but her creme was really rough, probably cause the eggs started cooking too much. Overall, still pretty good, and would probably choose to get a bunch of appetizers to split.

this place is so cute and i always walk past so decided to make a last minute res and its 10/10. first of all the staff is so nice and friendly. they explain everything to you and generally just make you want to be there. the food was amazing. short rib cavatelli stole the show- really a must try. great flavors and textures. the branzino was also really good we finished it all! we finished w panacotta which had a great creamy texture and wasnt too sweet. also will say for the quality and experience, pretty affordable.
had a great experience with my mom and fiancé. super cozy space. the gnocchi was bomb and so was the escargot
No comment

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Recette, and it was an amazing experience. The food was delicious, with a wide variety of dishes to choose from. The service was top notch, with the staff being attentive and friendly. The atmosphere was cozy and inviting, and the decor was beautiful. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a great dining experience.
Awful food. Horrible energy. The staff were arguing with each other the whole time. Also dirty!!

Our airbnb was in the building right above Recette and we ended up going there 3 times during our trip. The french onion soup is something I'll be thinking about for a long time and the steak frites was phenomenal. We also enjoyed the lava cake for dessert. The staff was really nice, the ambiance is cute with all their plants, and the food felt high quality. It's not cheap, but it's worth the splurge every once in a while.

I had lunch at Recette today and it was divine! The heirloom tomato and burrata salad was delicious, best strawberries ever! And it paired perfectly with a Lagunitas IPA. I chose frites for my side and they were perfectly crisp. The service was excellent as well. Can't wait to go back to try the food week pris fixe menu!
Above average food. Great service. Excellent ambiance. Great drinks. Bit expensive but not outlandishly.
I've been here twice and every time I wonder why I don't come here more often! Food is delicious, service is great, and the cocktails are the best.
No comment

Such a wonderful restaurant-- will definitely be coming back! Everything on the menu sounded amazing, we went with the kale & fennel salad, mussels, Bronzino, chicken, and chocolate lava cake between 2 people. The food was all so delicious and not overly complex-- just really tasty, satisfying, and well executed food that you want to eat. We can't wait to come back to try the rest of the menu!

Came here with friends in our last night in NYC yesterday. Really loved the atmosphere. I believe the gentleman who helped serve us was the owner. Him and the other waiter were really wonderful. The cocktails were top notch. The linguini was really light and perfectly portioned. Panna cotta desert was SO good. Would definitely recommend this restaurant.

Had the best time at Recette! The food was great and the service was amazing as well! We had the French onion soup (amazing), the broccolini (amazing), the mushroom flatbread, the potatoes, and the heirloom burata. Great atmosphere and service!

I hate leaving bad reviews, but this was the worst meal I had since bad mussels that gave me food poisoning in Holbox. The octopus was chewy & tasteless, the potatoes over cooked and without salt, the tomatoes sour and the sauces had a strange funky taste that didn't go with the dish at all and had such a bad after taste, I needed to order a mocktail that I didn't even want to mask the taste. I love food and I never not finish the plate if it's remotely good, but this I couldn't finish :(
No comment

Hard to ask for a restaurant nowadays thats not just Williamsburg trendy but also has a chill, and mature vibe. Music is eclectic and fun, not mainstream and sets a friendly vibe. just enough on the menu to give you options but not enough to overwhelm. It also gives me the impression that the menu choices they do have, they're impeccable at..It seems like it's a male dominated stuff, and they're all very friendly and good looking ;)  The food is fresh, I didn't have any residual icky feelings/lethargy even after eating the non-veggie options. Theyre not super gluten friendly, but most things can be modified to any gluten sensitivities. The vegetarian options look simple and satisfying. The burrata salad is addicting and even the omelette was great considering it was just a regular omelette, French styled of course. The DRINKS though, cocktails are simply perfect. I like to stick to neat drinks at this point but with their signature cocktail menu I just had to try. Also tried the branzino (on a dif occasion, no pics) and it was well worth it. Haven't gotten around to trying the dessert yet. Perfect for a solo time or group gathering for an upscale casual time. Its a newer restaurant in the area so less packed than I'd  expect (my introverted self appreciates this hehe) though i can see this spot being a local gem as soon as the hipsters and gentrifiers discover it lol
No comment
Don't pass this place up. Local place with adorable decor, amazing food and drinks. The owner is amazingly hospitable and the atmosphere is comfortable and classy.
No comment
No comment
Very tasty avocado toast and kale salad. Great drinks. A very cute outdoor area and nice wait staff. They gave us individual plates so that we could share which was nice and convenient.

We honestly had the best night here last night.... Tu meke!!!  The food was wonderful (gnocchi and deserts, omg), drinks nice, setting lovely - on a busy Saturday night they let us sit for over 4 hours!!!  The service was outstanding, simply made the night perfect.  It was our last evening in NYC, spent in Brooklyn here and would come back in a instant!  We thank you all for just making a special evening possible before we went our seperate ways... arohanui!!!
No comment
No comment
great service! They are sooo nice. Pannacotta and all their cheese stuff slaps. Outside but covered eating area was perfect on a rainy day
Had a fantastic dinner here. Awesome food, nice ambiance, and great service too. Especially recommend the steak tartare.
Amazing food, ambiance, service, and drinks! Great spot for date night or drinks with friends! 11/10 recommend the cavatelli.
No comment

From the moment I walked in I felt so welcomed. The atmosphere is warm and comfortable- the service amazing. My meal was delicious (mussels!) and went perfect with the wine. I plan to bring my friends back. LOVED!!!
No comment
It feels like you're dining in Paris. Food is flavorful, service is friendly and cocktails are on point. All in all a great spot!
No comment

Came here for brunch on a whim and literally had the best time and maybe the best brunch ever. The owner, Miljan, is so cool I would invite him to my wedding, maybe even marry him. He was the greatest host, he made the atmosphere so fun with good music and some deserts on the house! 10/10 experience I'll be back this weekend.

Finally went here this past Saturday and it did not disappoint. The food was absolutely delicious and the bartenders are top notch! Really great vibe here. We were in the mood for French bistro and the steak frites, onion soup and steak tartare were excellent and totally hit the spot!

This place is a gem in Brooklyn. You have to come by for food and drinks! You will not be disappointed. The staff was amazing and so attentive, and the ambiance was so cozy and inviting. I'm glad I found this restaurant and will be back for more of their delicious dishes. Do yourself a favor and come try it out.

Had an excellent meal for restaurant week. Steak tartare and escargots were perfect. My steak frites were some of the best I've had. And the cocktails were delicious. Worth going even just for cocktails.
Frozen burger for 20+ bucks. Croque Madam and was ok. The eggs Benedict was vinegary. You'd expect more for the number of positive reviews this place has.

The food here was so good! Came here with a group of folks and we had a selection of different food they have, and I'm still thinking about it... it's been a week! I will definitely come back here for sure, vibes were great and drinks were delicious. Also a cute date spot if you're looking for somewhere to take someone!

Recette is my new go to spot in williamsburg. The steak tartare is amazing along with everything else on the menu - brunch & dinner. The owners and everyone there are  extremely hospitable and caring. Love it here!!
Solid food.  Linguine vignole was flavorful.  The clams were tiny. Nice wine selection.  Friendly and efficient service.

the staff was attentive and friendly! bartender was able to accommodate for tasty non-alcoholic requests, I'd order the cucumber based mocktail. so refreshing with your dinner! the crab cake was as tasty as it was aesthetically pleasing, highly recommend the roasted chicken it was the perfect portion for a classic chicken dinner. The French fries were incredibly crispy and delicious, a must get with any entree you order. I'm usually picky about beef tartare for obvious reasons, this beef tartare was not only safe and clean but so flavorful! can't go wrong with finishing it off with the creme brulee!! 10/10, the perfect date night spot

Just enjoyed a wonderful date night here. Lots of options for cocktails, I got The miss O'Hara cocktail and it was very good. Food was absolutely delicious. The service was wonderful and very attentive. We had an early reservation and the were packed by the time we left. Definitely recommend!
Great cocktails and food. The cardamom panna cota is amazing! Very nice ambiance and service.

Attentive service. Romantic atmosphere. Delicious food. Came for the French onion soup and short rib cavatelli, but was blown away by the truffle gnocchi too! Lava cake was a perfect end to the meal. Enjoyed their organic wine selection. Nice addition to Havenmeyer restaurant row.

Perfect date night spot! Dimly lit but not too dim and an intimate feel without feeling claustrophobic. The staff was attentive and sweet. They didn't hover and somehow timed the attention they gave us perfectly. Food was great, wine recommendation was on point and the manager was adorable! I had a lovely birthday dinner here!
Great place, beautiful decor and relaxing vibe. We had mushroom flatbread, ceviche, short rib cavatelli and linguini with clams. Everything was great. Highly reccomend.

Truly delicious food! I live nearby and came the week they opened. All 3 in our party loved each of our meals and drinks. I'm so glad to have this place to show off when friends and family come visit. Friendly, helpful, and endearing staff as well! Would eat the short rib cavatelli here 1000 times over.
Great cocktails and great food. The service was also amazing. Delicious spot in Williamsburg

Just had a really amazing meal at this restaurant tonight. Everything was excellent and the staff was so helpful and attentive. It was our first time here and definitely not our last -we will be coming back a great night out!
Delicious food and drinks! Fun and intimate setting. My gf and I sat at the bar for our dinner and drinks and the bartender was pretty awesome. Definitely would recommend for a date night.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: I wanted fish and chips after work so got a takeout order that I enjoyed ten minutes later. The batter on the fish was still crispy but the food were a little bland without the accompanying sauces. The portion is a little small for the price. Overall, a place to try out but I don't think I will be coming back.

I love Gordon Ramsay, was so happy to try this place! Got the combo with fish, shrimp and chicken -  perfectly fried and still juicy inside.  It went so well with the tarter sauce!  Also got the biscoff shake which was good but a bit sweet for me, this will definitely get you on a sugar high!

The biscoff shake is everything!!! While yes, the menu is overpriced but you are in NYC and it's next to Times Square plus the fact it's branded Gordon Ramsay, I wasn't surprised. We tried a mixed combo of fish and shrimp, both were great, fish was definitely on the smaller side though. The milkshake is where it's at though, its creamy, addicting, and just perfect. Whip cream was not your typical aerosol whipped cream, it seemed home made to me. The staff was friendly but seemed like they needed more training. There were like 4 people trying to clean and figure out a machine. The staff over in the deep fryer side also dropped the food like 2x while we were there.  Overall great place, highly recommend it!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

What a cute addition to Times Square! I found the location to be extremely clean and right off the busiest part of the square. The decor is very UK flag decked out and the staff was super friendly. Food was fresh - you can even watch them make it in the open kitchen area. The sauces were all so delicious. Highly recommend trying some of their Parmesan or dirty fries! Their shakes are actually so amazing too - especially the Biscoff. They also have fresh lemonade and peach tea. If you love fish and chips or fish sandwiches (chicken available too) or you're missing your British roots - come here!

We stopped here for a quick bite before a show. We knew we wouldn't have a lot of time to sit for dinner so this was a great option right by the theater. My partner and I shared the fish combo and upgraded our chips to the Dirty Chips #1. The fish was solid fish and chips. Nothing to rave about, but very tasty. The fries were a bit of a let down. They were a bit soggy and there wasn't much chorizo which was disappointing, but the flavor was still pretty good. The service was very quick and everyone was so kind so it was a pleasant experience on that front. Biggest turn off was that the place was packed and there wasn't enough seating. Most people were eating but there were people just hanging out probably waiting for a show which was annoying. We didn't have to wait too long for a table. A good, quick bite right in Times Square where you don't need to break the bank.

It's Gordon Ramsay, so I had to try it.  It's essentially a high end fast food place for fried items. Ordered the fish combo with dirty fries #2 and mixed combo. Fish was flakey, abundant, and fried perfectly without being too greasy. If you like the batter where it's really thick, this is the place for you.  The shrimp and chicken was tender and not overcooked.  They make the items right in front of you, so they probably don't around sit around too long to get chewy. The dirty fries #2 had good flavor but was a bit too salty. The regular fries were seasoned perfectly.  If you're looking for a value meal, this isn't it, I spent around $48 for these 2 combos. Dining area is tiny and cramped when it's at capacity. I might return one in awhile..maybe.

I LOVE Gordon Ramsey so I had to try this place. I ordered the Fish and Shrimp Combo which came with fries (aka chips). My husband ordered the Shrimp which came with fries (aka chips). We also shared the Sticky Toffee Shake and the Dirty Chips #1 which were the fries topped with Jalapeño, Chorizo, Cotija Cheese, Red Onion, Chives, Parsley. Between both of us for dips we tried the Gordon's Tartar, Curry & Mango, Southwest Ranch and Dijon Mayonnaise. We loved the food, the drink was super rich and thick. I loved all the decor in the place, and it was also super clean which is always good. It is a bit pricy but it's Times Square and Gordon Ramsey. All meals are made to order and are served super hot! The service was quick, efficient and friendly. I would definitely recommend and will be back soon!

This place lives up to to all the hype!!  The 3 piece fish combo with fries was quite filling. The shrimp combo has 5 large shrimps and fries. The dishes were deep fried and not very flavorful but they offer a good half dozens dipping sauces. Trying the dips were an adventure on its own. Aiello, tartar, Dijon, mango, to name a few.  The shop makes all the items when you order them. There is a wait for your food if the place is crowded.  My favorite thing was the shake!  Biscotti shake?   It was flavorful and hit the spot while waiting for your order. They is ample seating. Turnover is relatively fast. The price was appropriate for the area. Entree $16- $25+. Depends on you add ons and sides.  I will try this place again  in the near future. Let's hope it remains the same or better!

I really like the decor of the restaurant.The service was very delightful and helpful with food menu .The fish & chips dish was very delicious the fish was nice and fresh both tarter sauces was very tasteful, fries as well was great , only thing my jalapeño was not hot but besides that everything else was perfect
No comment
No comment
No comment

Stopped here for a meal before a Broadway show. Not a large restaurant but there was enough seating. Surprised to see it wasn't at full capacity. Ordered the fish and chips. The fish was perfectly crunchy and the chips were fine. I had the tartar sauce and curry mango sauce which I loved. The restaurant was clean and the service was friendly. The prices are a bit high but it is Manhattan. A good place to go if you want to grab something to eat before a show.
No comment
No comment

Holy shit this place is good. It's located in the heart of Times Square so if you are planning a visit to Time Square and are looking for some places to eat, add this to your list. It's not overly greasy and the sauce is subtle and the fries are solid. I mainly came because I wanted to try a gordon ramsey resturant without it being super pricey so I think this fit the bill.

Pretty average fish and chips overall. The chicken sandwich that comes in naan bread wasn't great either. Strangely, I felt really full after eating a little bit of the fish. I wonder what they add to it that made it so heavy. I would not come back here given the quality of fish n chips for the not-so-cheap price.
No comment

This was our Good Friday dinner and it did not disappoint! I was a little worried the lobster & shrimp combo would not be worth the price but it was definitely worth it! The combo came with 2 good size pieces of lobster & 2 pieces of shrimp. The fries were approved by my youngest who ate all of them. The fishwich was so tasty & fresh. Everything is made fresh to order.

Good yummy Fish & Chips. Lobster as a Hook It Up protein add is totally worth it. It's hard to give Fish & Chips 5 STARS. Hells Kitchen's risotto with Gordon Ramsay screaming in the background deserves 5 stars. The sauces were good not great. The BATTER on the fish was the STAR. 7yr old actually eating FOOD was the biggest winner. Service was about as good as it can get for a self serve setup.
No comment

Came here twice in two weeks - first  time was for their fish and chips and the second time was for their Biscoff milkshake. While the name of the restaurant says Fish and Chips, they offer other non-seafood items like chicken sandwiches, which I have yet to try. Their fried fish was freshly fried, the better was very crunchy and the fish was delicious. The pricing is about $19 and it comes with 3 pieces and a generous portion of chips. I've had a fair share of fish and chips in my life in New York, UK, Ireland, Australia, and I think this is likely ranked top 3 on my list. The restaurant itself is fast casual with no table service.

I wanted to love this place! I love Gordon and I do very much enjoy good fish and chips but it didn't wow me. I got the fish and shrimp combo to be able to try both and it wasn't bad by any means, just nothing outstanding. The shrimp was better than the fish in my opinion. Based on reviews I got the tartar and cocktail sauce and both needed a little something to make them pop, they just seemed muted. Overall for a place that touts an affordable version of the dish it fell short, the one combo was just about $20. I would say try the place to be able to say you tried it but I don't plan on going back
No comment

I've been watching a lot of Hell's Kitchen so I knew I had to come try this place out as soon as I saw it was opening. I stopped by with 2 friends to try it and had the fish and shrimp combo with dirty fries #2, tartar sauce, and cocktail sauce. The fish and shrimp were crispy and light and definitely the stars of the meal. The fries were nicely flavored and the sauces really complimented it all. I finished with a biscoff shake- which was so thick and creamy!

Took my wife to Gordon Ramsay's Fish and Chips.    The Fish was absolutely perfect.  Moist and tend fish coated in a light crunchy batter.   The tartar sauce was good but the curry mango sauce just shines, an amazing sweet smoky flavor.   The wife got Lobster and Shrimp, was a bit surprised when she found a shell, I don't think the batter is really needed on lobster.   We enjoyed the fries, but they were not much different than other fries.   $18 for Fish and Chips may seem high, but I have spent more for worse!   These are made how Fish and Chips should be made.   Kayla was an absolute joy, especially when we asked to see Gordon and she pretended like he was in the back.
No comment

My friend mentioned that Gordon Ramsey has opened a restaurant in Times Square called Gordon Ramsey Fish and Chips. She said that her and her son enjoyed their meals, so before going to the movies, we decided to go. Apple Maps has the wrong address so I had to call--an employee told me the correct address but said that they were having technical issues and wouldn't be open for another 10 minutes (we were going to get there for 5pm). This worked out for us because there was no line and we were able to pick our seats. You just grab a table that's available. When you walk in, you place your order with the cashier and you are given your receipt with order number. Once the order is ready, they announce the order number. Since my friend ordered the fish and chips when she dined here before, she tried the shrimp and chips with sriracha aioli and tartar sauce. I got the fish and chips with the same dipping sauces. We definitely enjoyed our meals and we washed it down with lemonade. The meals are made to order and you can see they preparing the meals (flouring and everything). No heat lamps over here! You can get the fries loaded but I thought regular fries or should I say, chips, were good. We both could taste peach in the lemonade--it was really tasty. I think I want to try their milkshakes next time. Gordon Ramsey has a penchant for using colorful language but the customer service was excellent. This is a nice addition to crazy Times Square as it can accommodate adults and kids. I recommend!

Couldn't wait to try this place and left so disappointed . The fish sandwich was tasteless and the French fries overly salted . The gentlemen taking my order was nice and helpful but I wouldn't recommend this place for fish and chips .

Very good food hot out the light grease and the batter around the fish or chicken is light and crispy I love the staff very helpful and informative and the place is stable and easy to walk through. They have to update the address because there is no suite# and it's tucked away into 44 street not on Broadway so the address could be a little confusing. It's worth the wait and the lemonade drink is delicious without being to tart....I would go again for a snack after a show.

Came back for our second visit. I asked if they could cook the fish and shrimp just a  few seconds longer than normal, they were more than happy to accommodate and this time the fish and shrimp were perfection! I also had one of there milkshakes and I can honestly say it was the best I've ever had. The food is second only to the friendly staff they have there. We will definitely be back!!
Clean and food was great. Fish and chips. Also have shrimp and chicken. We had fish and chips combo and the fish was fresh and prepared just right. It is an upscale fast food place. Well done.
I'm a fan of the food but not the price. $17.99 for the fish and chips combo. Add $3.99 for a fountain soda.
No comment

Has the British flag on the packaging but there is nothing British about these fish and chips. French fries and fish basically. No mushy peas, gravy or curry sauce on the menu. And milkshakes? Lol. So American. Offer a can of lilt  instead.
The chips were very over done almost burnt.  I didn't eat them all. The fish was good and curry and mango sauce was lovely.

As an expat it's not as easy to get "proper" Fish & Chips in the US as it is back home so when I heard of this venture opening I was super excited to get my fix. However I cannot give more then 3 stars. I visited just after 2pm on a Weekday. Location was not busy, maybe 6 people dining. Place was clean and organized but lacking atmosphere - no music that I can remember?  I was able to order straight away upon entering and I ordered classic Fish & Chips (coming with 2 sauces) and a soda. With taxes that was close to $24.Blimey! Anyway the price could not dampen my enthusiasm and service was also polite if not great. Upon receiving my food after waiting for approximately 7-10min I was however dismayed to see that the "Chips" were not classic fish shop chips like back home. More like American fries. How can this be Gordon???? And vinegar in packets??? The fish while plenty of it was not great either - whatever batter is used (I overheard a team member tell another guest it wasn't beer battered?) was not crisp and it relentlessly stuck to the roof of my mouth every time I tried to eat it. I'm sad to report this was truly an underwhelming experience and one I would not repeat especially if you really want that Fish & Chip shop food and experience you know from back home.

Normally. My advice for grabbing a bite in Times Square would be leave. But I actually quite enjoyed the food here. The staff was on point. That's usually something you can never say about places in this area. Surprisingly calm environment and not a hot mess like all the other quick bite places in the area.
The fish and chips were delicious! Exceeded expectations. Service was quick and the food was amazing. Would highly recommend if you're looking for a quick and easy bite to eat!
Excellent fish shrimp and chips.  A bit pricey for takeout but it's Times Square.  Location is a little hard to find on side street 44th st. But worth it

I was honestly expecting this place to be better. They're only serving one thing basically on the menu it should be perfect. The fish was pretty good but the chips were not great. I hope Gordon Ramsay likes it when he comes by.  I probably won't come back but if I do it would only be for the Biscoff shake. Additionally, all of the staff were lovely, very helpful and friendly.

While I was super excited to try British style fish and chips following a long day in the City, I have to say that I was not super impressed. The fish was good - not terribly flavorful, but hot and fresh. The fish was also pretty greasy. However, if you are a fish and chips eatery, your chips should be amazing. The chips I was served on Saturday January 28, 2023 did not impress. They were not super hot and there was nothing to rave about. While I am glad that I tried this restaurant, I will not be back.

We tried the fishwich combo, it really needs to be eaten immediately because the batter was all soggy when I got home. The fries and sauces were decent, I'd be willing to give it another shot in-person and maybe with a shake.
Great ambience, quick service, delicious fish and chips! Thought the portions and the flavor were outstanding. Was a great solid choice when we were tired and needed a recharge in Times Square.

just visited the new nyc location. my mouth had a party, i will definitely be going back. I tried a few combos so i got a little of everything and loved the sauce choices. fast, friendly and fresh just the way i like it.

This place is so close to me, we had to try it. They basically have fish and chips, nothing else. For $19 you get 3 pieces of bartered fish and some underwhelming fries. The fish was fine, the chips? Not much flavor, zero crispness. The sauces sound good but out of the six we tried, the only one any of us liked was tartar. Nothing else on the plate but a tiny bit of lemon. It wasn't bad, but for that price? Won't go back even though I love the fish when done right.
Good hot fresh fish and chips reasonably priced.. Friendly service. My fish and chips place in times Square..

Gordon Ramsay Fish & Chips is the perfect  NYC  representation of London , England's famous known delicacy!  The staff provided exceptional customer service and the restaurant is kept in pristine condition!  A special shout out to Jason, who makes sure the restaurant runs like a well oiled machine. Gordon, you should be extremely proud of your NYC Team and how well they represent your mission!  Thanks for a great experience
Delicious fish and chips. Quick and efficient service! I would definitely go again. It is very clean and a relaxed environment.

A bit disappointing but I suppose it is what it is - a fast food restaurant with a celebrity chef.   Fish and chips was a staple throughout my early life.  First in Ohio and later in England.  And, we are talking real fish and chips down to the real newspaper wrapping.  So, imagine my delight when I discovered a Gordon Ramsey fish and chips restaurant.  Who better than Gordon Ramsey could make authentic fish and chips?   Well, the search goes on.  Nothing to see here.  Restaurant was clean and well run.  Service was quick and staff was polite.  And, fish and chicken were both good.  Not great but good.  But, I have to say what is going on with the lobster?   Just like the chicken and fish, the lobster was battered and deep fried.  But at least the chicken was de-feathered and fish de-scaled.   Not so much with the lobster that still had much of its shell on.   I honestly did not know if this was purposeful or negligent.  The restaurant is so well managed it must have been on purpose, right?   Some delicacy I am not privy to?   In any case, not a fan of battered, deep fried lobster shell.
Great tasting food and a lasting experience; listening to Adele's music was a nice treat.

Fish and Chips was a childhood favorite of mine--mainly Arthur Treacher's , so when Ramsay's shop opened I knew we had to try.  One night on the way to Town Hall we stepped in for a quick pre-show meal.  A small-ish fast casual restaurant space was very crowded with multiple people standing to wait for their orders.  Counter staff and fry staff were very efficient and quick and friendly.  Our meal took about 10 minutes during which time we finally found a seat.  The fish was very very hot and extremely crisply fried.  In other words a 9 out of 10.  It was a little greasy but that's somewhat to be expected. Chips were more American style fries rather than thicker Brit cuts.   2 sauces came with your order--I opted for standard tartar and a smoky ranch that was tasty.   Portions were generous. A small beverage selection and 2 shakes options (not sure they go with Fish and Chips but looked very tasty so I'll be back for one as dessert one day).  One slight negative--the garbage area kept getting filled up with the cardboard boxes the meals are served in and made for a sloppy view.  Staff was quick to clear that area but maybe a redesign is in order to not show so much trash toppling over.

It's...okay. A bit surprising that it wasn't better given Ramsay's penchant for tearing apart restaurant operators. Fish and shrimp (we tried both) were crisp and well-battered on the outside in the classic English style, but the inside was a bit mushy (and who ever heard of mushy shrimp? -- I suspect a frozen product was used). The "chips" were basic American-style fries, more or less, and nothing special. Dipping sauces were excellent, however. The biggest issue? We had to wait more than 20 minutes for our order -- not exactly what you expect in a "fast" casual restaurant. And the place was a bit messy, though we arrived at a busy time and perhaps staff couldn't keep up with cleaning (still, it's the kind of detail that would drive Ramsay mad). It's a nice pre-theater option to have in Times Square, but I wouldn't rush back. Especially since seating is limited and you won't be guaranteed a table (we had to grab ours quickly!).

Excellent but limited menu. Quality dimsum but not the most authentic but worked well for work lunch. I'd go again.

Stylish modern interior spot near grand central! The portions are large so don't think you're getting the small plates that you would normally receive on a weekends dim sum place somewhere else. The bamboo trays are way bigger so the photos can be deceiving! Quality of the food was excellent and they have an easy menu with Chinese, English, and pictures of each dish. They have a checklist system after you order as well to make sure you have everything you've ordered. I saw someone next to me order a dim sum sampler box of 9 different dumplings which I'd never seen before, but cool to make dim sum super accessible! I ordered my usual favorites and was pleased with my solo dining experience.

column3: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column6: Really great new place! Super tasty dim sum, the truffle mushroom dumpling and the lava custard one especially! But everything was good!

Not far from Grand Central but off the beaten, tourist path--service was lovely, attentive.  Food was good--came out fast and hot--would definitely try again--fried pork dumplings were great!

I took a quick trip to New York for a Broadway show.  Before I went I looked up dim sum close to my hotel and was so impressed by Dimsum Garden. I was alone and the staff made me so comfortable and welcomed. Service was excellent. I ordered the soup dumplings which were delicious. And the sampler of dim sum. Not only was the platter a piece of art but tasty. The custard bun was amazing. I will return next time I'm in the city

Avoid the crab meat spinach shrimp dumpling. It tastes almost like nothing even with the soy sauce/chili sauce. The hargow & siu mai were pretty good and I would get those as my staples. The menu is limited so I couldn't get any rice rolls. The black buns with salted egg custard was pretty good. Would come back for a quick bite, services was attentive and fast

Went bc we were craving dim sum and this was close by. Highly disappointing. Shrimp and pork shumai was extremely gross. Pork fried dumpling and chicken fried rice were mids asf. Beef short ribs w black pepper sauce either had no meat, were severely undercooked, or just tasted bad. We had stomach aches after. 1/10. Absolutely would not recommend.

So glad this just opened up in the neighborhood. We ordered pick up for some steam roasted pork buns and soup dumplings. The buns are super fresh, super soft and very flavorful. Had a good amount of filling in them also.  The soup dumplings were dense and had a great flavor soup filling.  Cant wait to try more and sit inside when we go out one night as it was beautiful inside

Good spot on a evening walk to get fresh dim sum. Very good service and good food. Good atmosphere
I used to go here a lot until one afternoon the chef who was smoking outside went in ahead of me and slammed the door in my face. I will not support this establishment again.
Great service, and the dimsum is super! Very nice presentation, this is the greatest dimsum place I've been so far in NYC. Must try.

We were planning a long walk to Chinatown for dim sum when we found this gem on Yelp. It's a small dim sum house on Lex and 40th. It was packed at lunchtime with what looked like local office workers. Our biggest challenge was limiting our order. We ended up with shrimp shumai, scallop shrimp w pea sprout dumpling, black truffle mushroom dumpling and roast duck dumpling. Everything was so delicious we decided to add Shanghai soup dumplings to the order. Amazing. In fact I prefer them to Shanghai Joe's. Say no more.

Outstanding food and friendly service. It was recommended by friend and I was pleasantly surprised.

Good portion sizes for a reasonable price. Everything looked good so definitely ordered too much. The dumpling platter is so cute and it lets you try different things without ordering a full order of them. Great soup dumplings and shrimp dumplings. The fried tofu skin rolls are a must.
Best shrimp siu mai I've had. Pan fried noodles were excellent. Service was top notch. Would come back here again to try more dishes!
Omg so good. We got the dumpling set, each item is delicious and very different from the next.
So yummy! We have steamed roasted pork buns, crispy shrimp ball, shrimp friend rice, and a bunch of other thing. Each was so good!
Yup I can get a great dimsum without going to Chinatown now! Nice ambiance and clean too.
Awesome soups dumplings! Large dim sum so not as expensive as it seems from looking at the prices on the menu. Really top quality and freshly made to order. Very yummy.
Great choice.  Quick service.  Nice interior. Portions were large.  We ordered far too much and still under $60 for two.

Came in yesterday afternoon with my friend, the place just opened.  We each ordered a signature DimSum Platter. It consists of 9 different kind of dimsum. All of those are great. My favorites are crabmeat and shrimp dumpling, black truffle with mushroom dumpling and steam egg custard bun. I never had those three kinds of dimsum. Especially the steam egg custard bun is so sweet and creamy. The environment are great, overall a great place. I will definitely tell my friends about this place.
Stumbled upon this place and what a gem! Clean nice atmosphere, excellent service. We both got the dim sum platter and were wildly impressed. Terrific flavors and execution and presentation A+!!

The ceiling of Canton dim sum, can't wait to taste their new Manhattan location, highly recommended, and if you have trouble choosing, then I recommend you to taste the nine-court set. Well worth it.！！！
No comment
We ordered their dim sum platter and lo mein. We enjoyed both. The platter is a must try. The dim sums are very exquisite and large. There were also 2 sweet ones in the platter.
Dim sum was excellent. Service was quick, and food was reasonably priced for New York. Very close to Grand Central so very accessible to the Upper East Side desert of good Chinese food.

Very friendly staff. Food is very good and served promptly. I was a party of one and all the tables were full but they never rushed me. I had shrimp rolls, steamed pork buns and house lo mein. Also very reasonably priced....
Cute on the inside! Clean and bright, nice furniture. Food came out fast and was very excellent. We had only dim sum and all the dishes we picked were really good.
Great place with good food and excellent service. We're visiting from out of state and stopped by for some dim sum. This place did not disappoint, food came out fast and priced very reasonably.

The order was wrong. Our order was supposed to contain duck dumplings, and the restaurant sent chicken feet instead. It was very late and we didn't want to send the order back or wait for a replacement, so we just ate it. Not very good. We will not order from them again.

Visited Dimsum Garden, which only opened in the past week. Dropped by and had a sit down dinner. We were the only people at a table in there (although people stopped by for takeout), but it was only 5:30, and after all, they just opened. We ordered fried pork dumplings and steamed shrimp dumplings, and the signature Dim Sum sampler platter.  Disclaimer: we are not expert Dim Sum eaters. Just beginners. However we know what we like and we like what we were served. The sampler is huge, with every type of beef, duck, shrimp, pork and more, and the crab dumpling was delicious. The two dumpling plates had 3 dumplings each, but they were also massive. Everything was delicious and washed down nicely with pots of herbal rose and jasmine tea.  All in all a welcome addition to the neighborhood and we will be returning.
Authentic Dim Sum in midtown. No need to go to China town anymore. Great food and service

The service was good and food was presented nicely.  We were seated right away and the staff was attentive.  They even brought another table over for us when they saw that we needed more room for the food.  We ordered a wide variety of dim sum (shrimp dumplings, shrimp and crabmeat spinach dumplings, sticky rice, soup dumplings, beef short ribs) and the panned fried noodle with beef.    The dumplings were a good size and we realized we ordered too much food.  The staff graciously helped us pack the leftovers to go.  The shrimp dumplings were tasty - steamed well and had a good taste.  The custard buns were interesting.  It was a dark black color on the outside with a sweet yellow custard inside.  This was different and something I've never tried before at other restaurants.  The custard was a bit on the sweet side so one was all I could have.  The rest of the food was standard fare.  The sauce on the pan fried noodles was too thick that it did not mix in well with the fried noodles.  We wanted to order the fried rice but all the choices were crossed out on the sheet.  We assumed this met they were not available.  Then halfway through our meal, we heard a woman at the next table ask if the fried rice dishes were not available because they were crossed out.  The server said that was for a different day and they did indeed have the fried rice available.  It was too late for us but if we would've known, we would not have ordered the noodles.  If I had a craving for dim sum and just happened to be in the area, I may stop by here again but would not make a special trip.
