I ordered today from door dash expecting it to be really juicy and tender and the portion I got was mostly the fatty pieces. I asked for medium rare and I got it more on the medium well side. I could've definitely gotten a better steak somewhere else for $38 and the wait to receive the food took a really long time too. Waste of my money.

Me and my friends were really hungry and we found this place on Maps so we tried and it was great! It's open until late, food has a lot flavor and the sizes are pretty big. Service was amazing! Tomo and Meho I don't know if I'm writing your names correctly but we appreciated your service! I was full and I took the rest to home! Also prices are reasonable. Definitely I would come back.
This place is awesome, fast service, the food was amazing, mijo and tomo take care in my table and they were really kind and patience with us, definitely I will back here

If you're in the mood for some delicious Japanese cuisine, I highly recommend trying Ichibantei. Although I've never actually dined in at the restaurant, their takeout is consistently good, and their dishes never disappoint. From my frequent orders, I can say that their Karaage, Agedashi, and Ichibantei steak are must-tries. The steak, in particular, is always cooked well and pairs well with a dry sake. Despite the occasional mishap in delivery, the food is always of high quality and is reasonably priced. I appreciate their consistent food quality, making it my go-to spot for a late-night Uber Eats order. If you're looking for comfort food that hits the spot, give Ichibantei a try.

Great food, good service and a cozy little outdoor cabin to enjoy our meal. If your looking for a meal under $20 this is your place ! We ordered the Chicken Nanban, and the Garlic Chicken which came with rice , salad and a side of miso soup. Each entree was $15.99 and it was plenty of food ! The chicken was flavorful, moist and well prepared. Our server was attentive and made sure we had everything we needed. Only downside is the have limited seating outdoor only but are opening up indoor dining in the next 2 weeks. If your in the area this is a great spot to grab food with friends, family or even a date night.

I eat at Ichibantei so much, the least I can do is leave them with a 5-star review. I've tried a couple things on the menu such as the Katsu and Okayo Don, the Kaarage, and tuna steak (all super delicious!!!) but nothing compares to their niku udon bowl. The broth is perfect, they don't shy away from piling up the beef and everything meshes together so well. I've had the niku udon more times than I can count and I will continue to do so because Ichibantei is consistent with their delivery of home cooked goodness.

Super cute authentic Japanese restaurant that cooks Japanese comfort food. They have outdoor seatings, but in the warmer weather if you are magnet for bugs maybe avoid. Love the decor inside with the vinyl disc and the music and vibe of the place. The staff are friendly and great with recommendations. They have draft Sapporo beer!!! Enjoy the meals and app and felt like I went to a Japanese household and had a home cooked meal.

Went here to eat with a couple of friends and after we were seated, the same waiter who seated us was nowhere to be found. After 20mins of waiting, we just decided to go somewhere else to eat and that's when the waiter decided to show up to ask us "oh you're leaving?" with a slight smirk on his face. It was obvious that they just didn't want to serve us, which was a shame because we were excited to try this place. Don't give them business.

We also ordered gyoza, which were standard--hard to mess up. The pork tonkotsu was also delicious, although portion was smaller than some other places I've ordered from.

The portions were generous, and overall prices were fair. It wasn't the best Japanese food I've had, but for location and all things considered--I'd go again.

The katusdon, similarly, was not as tender as I've had, but it also wasn't greasy, so I'm happy with this. Thumbs up

Came here for some late night food around 2AM. Love that it's open late. It's small and dark. There's a TV (playing sports), and reggae albums on the walls. The tables and chairs are high and hard - fine for drinks but slightly uncomfortable for eating. The food is great though. I highly recommend the Cold Ramen Noodles + Chicken Nanban. Just could not get enough. Some places have cold ramen but the noodles are way too chewy. This place has got it down just right. Chicken is super flavorful and tasty. Add a beer to top it off.

We ordered a bunch of appetizers including the karaage and the octopus (which was interesting to say the least- don't order it without asking what it is haha). For my entree I had the garlic chicken. All in all it was a delicious but really filling meal.

This place is outrageously good for takeout. Currently sipping the Niku Udon Noodle and it is just... chef's kiss. Haven't been here IRL so can't vouch for that. They are open late during the pandemic, which is most appreciated.

This is one of my favorite places to eat. When I can't choose a place to eat in the area, I just head here. They open in the evening but they close really late which works better for me. It's a pretty small place but I never had to wait for a seat. Seriously though, everything on their menu that I have tried were great. I usually get their chicken nanban, ramen, or the cold noodles they offer in the summer but their other chicken dishes, hamburger steak, and the takowasabi appetizer were also amazing.
Don't order from here - you pay restaurant prices but chicken isn't crispy at all, all soggy
No comment
Too good. This place happened to be the only thing opened in the area we were and I would normally not spend this much money on individual meals but the Wagyu was to DIE for.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I REALLY wanted to love this place but there were a few glaring issues. First of all I ordered pickup and requested 5:30; they called to confirm and while I asked for a little earlier they said they could only do 5:30 so I agreed. Basically I didnt walk out of there until about 5:50 which was really annoying. They were somewhat apologetic but they weren't really rushing at all. In addition they could have thrown something in to show that they were apologetic but alas nothing. I also asked them to make sure the order was right and of course when I got home and opened it up they got an order wrong which should have been porkbelly but was another chicken. Regarding the food I don't know if the chicken wouldve been crispy if you order at the restaurant but when I got home the chickens was marginally crispy and the flavor wasn't anything special. I love their menu choices but none of it was really awesome. I doubt I would come back but hope they can fix up their dishes and service. Try out their online ordering for 20% off.
No comment

Great ambiance. Love the reggae music in the background. Food was excellent. Wife had the ramen noodle soup and I had the seared tuna. Both were delicious. Owner is very friendly and provided excellent service.
No comment
No comment

I had food delivered.  While tasted great, it wasnt too memorable. Everything was kinda on the hard side. While I know food delivered wont be fresh, the rice was kinda hard and so was the chicken.  I also felt the portions were kinda small for the price.
No comment

We had their fried chicken, wagyu hamburger, katsu don, and soy garlic chicken. Everything was a bit too sweet for me but everything tasted good. Their portions are small but their food isn't expensive so I guess that is okay. It came with white rice and a plate of salad. The salad dressing was great!
Delicious katsu don! Fun Reggae themed atmosphere. A tad on the pricey side but not to bad.
Staff was super friendly and kept checking to see if we were doing okay! Food was delicious and drinks were great! Love the small environment of this place

This place is incredible! It's usually not too crowded and the garlic chicken is amazing. The teriyaki chicken is also amazing! The entrees come with chicken and salad and rice and soup and it's a really good deal. Also, $5 Sapporo! Highly recommend.
No comment
Excellent quality delivery. Packaging was tight, clean, and of sturdy quality. The food was delicious. Probably the best delivery tonkatsu I've ever had.

Friends brought me to this cool little spot and I really loved the vibe. Once you go in, there are a good amount of seats, and what's pretty cool is that they play reggae music. There was only one man serving us, so it wasn't the fastest service. I tried the Chicken Nanban which is chicken with sweet & sour sauce and their homemade tartar sauce. The entree also comes with a bowl of miso soup (really good but was a bit too salty) and a salad (very fresh and the dressing was pretty good). The nanban itself was not bad, but for me it lacked a bit flavor and the chicken was a bit soggy. I think this place definitely has potential though. Maybe their ramen is better? I actually came here wanting to try their ramen, but they said they sold out the ramen and I came here at 8:15 PM?..so I will be back again to give it one more try!

Cash only place! But so worth it! I support fully. They work very hard to keep the food and services consistent. I respect that! The foods are very delicious and pls look at the photos for references!
I love this spot. The karaage is excellent and they have a good selection of sake in cans. Super friendly staff too!
No comment
Pretty solid. Homestyle cooking which can really fill a niche in the area. Get the chicken and the egg, nom

It has been awhile since I've had a bad experience at a restaurant. First I ask for the wifi and the guy working here gives me a spotty response saying it's only for employees. Cool I get it. My friend orders something and then changes her mind shortly after to downsize it from large to medium. The guy comes out with the large AND a medium and then tells us then that it's too late. My friend tries to clarify that she said she downsized it. How you about to scam us by giving us TWO orders of a large AND medium when she clearly said she just wanted one order for herself?! The worker continues to give some attitude with a b***h face saying too bad it's too late it came out. We're like ok we get it. Then 5 minutes later he comes and taps my friend on the shoulder and says we're gonna have to charge you for that you know just to rub it in. Serious? Just my two cents for future visitors. Gave 2 stars instead of 1 cuz the food wasn't too bad.
Love this restaurant! The burger and Nanban are awesome, and the delivery is always on time from my experiences

Awesome place for late night dining and very cool atmosphere. Got off the plane, unloaded our gear in the apartment and went off to find a cool spot with good food. Yelp is great! That's why we're here! I had the chicken nanbann along with a seaweed soup that filled me up and the flavors were amazing!
Cash only and overpriced. Food is okay but not beyond the average level of Japanese restaurants. They close very late and it's a good place for late night snacks.
No comment
This place primarily sells donburis and meat with rice dishes. Very good, casual restaurant with a cool reggae theme.

I ordered katsu don takeout from this place as I was craving Japanese comfort food, but the other place I wanted food from does not do takeout, so I decided to try this place because it was close by. The restaurant has this cool hip hop vibe to it. They own the wall space next to the restaurant, and there's a huge mural with their name on it, so it's not that hard to spot the place. The restaurant has a couple of large wooden tables with stools that would be good for large groups or otherwise communal seating. The place struck me as authentically Japanese, and the employees were really nice, but the katsu don was just meh. I saw that the other fried chicken dishes were more popular, but I'd had enough fried chicken for one week, so I went with pork. Hopefully, the chicken is much better than the pork. I definitely want to come back to try the chicken when I have a craving for it.
No comment
I live around the block. Been here plenty of times. Only takes cash, be mind. Very nice Japanese comfort food at a nice price
Incredible food and always consistent.  Friendly staff in a very easy going atmosphere
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
I love this spot. It has a chill Japanese hipster vibe reminiscent of one of the random spots you could find in Tokyo. The chicken nanban is phenomenal and the beers are served very cold and cheap.
Relatively inexpensive dinner. I liked the presentation and food. I ordered the garlic chicken but I'm looking forward to trying the fried chicken next time.
No comment

I LOVE Japanese food, and frequently cook it at home so I was excited to try this place since it's so close. Usually when my boyfriend and I go to an expensive NY restaurant for the first time we share a plate since they range from $15-$25 per plate and the check can go up to the $60s for a lunch. When we stopped in here we were going to try the wagyu, and when were about to be seated in the empty booth section, the waiter told us we had to order an entree for each of us if we wanted to eat there. I understand covid precautions, but I have never been to a restaurant that forces you to individually buy plates unless it was a buffet (understandably). I'm disappointed that during a pandemic when everyone is low on cash, and restaurants are already struggling, this restaurant forces you to have your own $15-$25 plate of food just to eat there. I won't be going there anytime soon, but may one day I'll check back to see if they changed their policy.

The food here is good for sure! I would be hesitant to say that it was one of the best Japanese places in the city. I ordered their signature dish, and I found it to be a bit too fatty for my liking. However, they keep their prices low and are definitely good at capturing that signature Japanese izakaya vibe.
No comment

Decent but a bit overpriced. Also, this store has an exorbitant amount of delivery fee (don't get tricked by the "1.49" they add a % if your food cost). If you want a good Japanese restaurant you can get better food for same price all around NY.
No comment
No comment

Hands down my favorite place in New York City. It's a teeny tiny place that always has reggae music and Japanese decor. The food is always great but not what you would typically get from a traditional Japanese place hence the self proclaimed "Japanese soul food". The service has always been super accommodating since they're cash only as well as friendly. They also are opened super late and always have $5 GIANT mugs of Japanese beer. To say this place is a hidden gem would be an understatement.

I used to like this place a lot, but after recently dining here last night, I noticed a decline in food quality. The fried calamari was so salty, as well as the pork katsu don I had. And the rice was not soft and fluffy at all. It seemed like it was sitting out and was hard and chewy. Sad to say, I won't be coming back here anytime soon.

Divey and cash-only. The karaage is huge pieces of chicken. The ramen is ok, nothing special. It comes with pork, half an egg, seaweed, and bamboo shoots. It's a huge portion though. A good backup plan, but I probably wouldn't return.

Lousy. The food is mediocre at best on a good day. The staff has really gone downhill since the guy with the hat left. I will never return. Used to get delivery a lot and once upon a time it was decent. The past few times I've tried it the food arrived cold and was bordering on inedible. If you like wasting money and being treated like garbage this is the place for you. If you want good food and to be treated with a little respect I suggest you try anywhere else.

We are here very often! CASH ONLY! Authentic Japanese Soul foods with reggae music playing in the background. You can't beat that!!! The entire staff is super friendly and attentive to your every need. Must get their Garlic Chicken, ChickenChup chicken, Ramen, Tuna Steak, Potato Salad, Agedashi Tofu. Portions are big so make sure you come with an empty stomach!!
No comment
It's open late, friendly staff, small and cozy restaurant, interesting menu, big portions, fresh food.

Awesome Japanese comfort food and Karage style chicken. The tacowasu (Raw Octopus with wasabi) was a generous portion. The Nanban chicken was fantastic and the $5 ice cold Sapporo was a crowd favorite. Affordable late night food with Reggae spinning. It is like if you were in a Japanese surfer izakaya. Staff are cool and the food is great.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
I like this place!  Super chill spot tucked away with reasonable prices and qhat seems to be basic but good food. I only had a drink here but i will be back.  Cash only though!

We had the ramen and tako-wasa. The broth of ramen is spot on. It has pork flavor in it and taste awesome. We also had the mini sausage appertizer and tako-wasa. Tako-wasa is a wasabi flavor raw octopus appertizer. It is very fresh and chewy. A lot of people may not like this type of flavor, but I found it very authentic. The decor of Ichibantei is like all the other restaurants in East Village, and it is more like a bar. Overall great experience! :)
No comment
No comment
Good food but cash only which quickly becomes a minus when you are not always carrying cash around.
No comment
The delivery service is extremely slow. I live only a couple blocks away and both times I have ordered from them it took well over an hour.
They always serve beer in the frozen cold mug, just like a cozy Izakaya in Japan.
No comment

Not happy at all with Food. The Karage and teriyaki chicken looks the same, greasy fat deep fried with a lil sauce. The mixed vegetables that come with is a cup of lettuce with soy sauce. Don't waste your money on this place.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place is simply a gem. I have been here dozens of time and food is always good, you can probably order closed eyes and you won't be disappointed. The place has charm and staff always nice. I definitely recommend if you are looking for a place to chill.

Solid food but the interior is a little low scale -- a pretty tight fit with large shared tables.  Not a place where you might bring a first or second date to, basically, but eat with friends or just hang.  The wait staff was really helpful and knowledgeable.
Chicken Nanban is my jam here. Just enough flavor not to over power the chicken! Eat some sausages as a good compliment and down that with a beer! Perfecto!!!
Everything was fresh and delightfully tasty. I've eaten  plenty of katsu. This is probably the best I've had. It's not too heavy and simply tasty.  Worth the look.
No comment
No comment
They forced us to pay 20% gratuity and on top of that harassed us for one person out of 12 not ordering something. Completely rude and disrespectful
Stoner owner bad attitude. Food Ma Ma. Waitress asked 5 times for something. Not stoned just bad. Stay away.

I went with a few friends on a Friday night, and to our surprise, the restaurant was completely empty. We followed the reviews and ordered tonkatsu, chicken nanban, and karaage. They were all juicy with the perfect amount of crispiness. My favorite was the chicken nanban. It is true that the service is a bit slow, but the staff is extremely friendly and attentive.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Have been here a few times and have always had a great experience.  Food is very good and beer is cheap.   Sake selection is good too.  Note that it is cash only, though.

Fantastic food and atmosphere. Took my girlfriend here for our first anniversary dinner and we agreed it was the best non-home cooked meal of our lives. Got the teriyaki ramen with ichibantei steak and the gf got the fried pork. Comes with a bunch of rice and miso soup. Get the sapporo beer!
No comment

So I was super pumped to try this place since it was sold to me as Japanese Soul Food. But I'm guessing it wasn't the traditional soul food I was thinking of (i.e. fried chicken, ribs, mac n' cheese, etc.) and more so along the lines of Japanese comfort food. It's a small place and definitely reminded me of Japan but when I tasted the Kara-age...I just wasn't impressed. It was just OK. I was over at Jin Ramen earlier that day and tried the boneless fried chicken, which was super delicious. My other friends really liked their food so maybe I just didn't order the right thing. If there's a next time, I'll try the Chicken Nanban.

I have to downgrade the rating. I previously complained that the food was on the pricey side, and they've recently increased their prices again.  Although I like their food and the staff is so polite and friendly, I would love to support them but it's no longer an every day option for me.
No comment
No comment

There is a ridiculous rule about people not being able to share meals. We were harassed and guilted by one of the employees because a couple we were with decided to share a plate. Worst service I have received in a long time.
No comment

No credit cards. No alcohol served (though they did let us bring wine in). The menu is extremely limited. I was there with a group of about 10 people, and several had a lot of trouble finding something they wanted. I wanted a chicken dish or a vegetable dish: the latter was nonexistent, and the former only came deep-fried. If deep-fried chicken is your thing, then maybe you'd like this place. But even so: the deep-fried chicken teriyaki I got was full of gristle and tasted terrible. My boyfriend loves meat and tried to finish my dish (I just ate rice)...and even he admitted it was bad.

Small portion for the price. Mediocre food. If you are hungry and want some good food or drinks, go to Taisho, Rai Rai Kan, or any place in east village that opens late. Don't come here or you will be disappointed.

They have really great Japanese fried chicken and fantastic beer and sake prices! Sometimes the TVs can be a bit overwhelming and it's hit or miss with who else is eating here. The most fun I've had was when it was a sleepy rainy night and we were the only ones there. They played great reggae tunes. The staff is super sweet as well.
The nicest delivery man I have ever met, and the food is amazing as well. I cannot be more impressed!
No comment
No comment

Everyone says to get it, so honestly just follow the crowd. The chicken nanban is so tender and juicy. It strips away easily. The tartar sauce gives it a really great flavor, and it comes with salad, rice, and soup. The portions are generous so I'm always busting by the seams when I'm done eating, or I'll have a few pieces to take home as leftovers. Also, the service is good, and the waiters are friendly, smiley, and attentive. I've also gotten the katsu don before and it's also very tasty.
No comment

Yummm!  I had the japanese-style barbecued steak (don't remember the name) at the recommendation of the staff, and it was delish.  Will definitely be coming back for more. The place is also meticulously clean.  Good job.

Based purely on the delivery experience, the menu is pretty limited, but everything we ordered was good.  We ordered the katsu don, chicken nanban, and the kurobua tonkatsu.  All were good and roughly 12-14 dollar each.  All I would recommend to anyone.  They also offer sushi rolls.  But I would stay with the savory entrees.  Delivery was quick, food wasnt cold, everything turned out well.  Will definitely be on the list to try again.

Best chicken karaage ever. Juicy, flavorful, and tender. The rice is good too. I've never been to the place but I order the garlic chicken, teriyaki chicken, and chicken karaage pretty much every week. The delivery guy is really nice and polite. They are sometimes late but then they compensate by giving free drinks.

So I spoke to one of the workers there and they told me that they are waiting for their liquor license before they open for lunch... not sure what they two have to do with each other, but the food is still great.

We came here before a show. The theater was just 2 blocks away and we had about 50 mins, so we thought why not! The food was great with reasonable price. But it took too long for them to prepare. We ended up 15 mins late for the performance, and couldn't finish our meal. People said it wasn't usually like that, but if I am in a hurry and in the neighborhood again, I probably won't walk in there. Otherwise, they are pretty decent

Ichibantei is my favorite place to eat whenever I am in the city. The place has a unique atmosphere that really enhances your dining experience. The staff are very attentive and friendly. The food is amazing. The Kaarage chicken is to die for as is the Garlic chicken. Portion sizes are perfect. Most entrees come with a side of rice, miso soup, and a salad but they don't skimp on the main dish. You get a healthy serving of meat that makes the meal feel like a great value. I don't know of many places in the city where you can get a great meal for two for under $40. You can't go wrong with Ichibantei!
No comment
The only Japanese restaurant I know of in NYC, that serve real Chicken Nanban ($10 and comes with rice & shredded cabbage).  The staff is very friendly and even hooked me up with a free Taiyaki!!
No comment

This place has great food at good prices. For $8-12 you can walk out  full and the food is extremely interesting. The nanban and black pork are great and I can't way to try mire. The cute japanese girl who usually works at the counter is very nice and always willing to suggest her favorites. You gotta try this place they really deserve your business.
Food is amazing and delivery guy is super nice. Order fast though cuz it can take a while to arrive.
Nice frosted mug of beer, the cold and hot ramen are the best as well as the Karaage chicken and salad!

Rather decent tonkatsu here! Crispylicious and went well with a reasonable serving of rice. The menu isn't the cheapest you can find in the East Village, but still rather comparable for the food. Definitely worth checking out and comparing with the other places around here, although I don't know if I would come here consistently.

Stopped by here pretty soon after it opened and was met by a very welcoming staff. One of the owners and I explained the various dishes to my friends who aren't too familiar with Japanese food. Everything we ordered was delicious and my tonkatsu was the best I have had in a long time. Super nice inside and clean.

Usually pretty busy and this place is quite tiny. The atmosphere makes you feel like you're in an underground japanese bar. Food is flavorful but can be on the greasy/yummy side - especially any pork belly. Amazing food to pair with a frosted cold beer.
Great food, great attitude and definitely delivered within a reasonable amount of time. I ordered the recommended chicken nanban... Bomb!

My girlfriend and I go here at least 2 to 3 times per month. The simple recipe for a great restaurant is good food and friendly staff and Ichibantei has just that. My go-to dishes are the Chicken Nanban and Katsu Don.
No comment
The only place I know of that serves Japanese food with reggae music. It's more like a bar than a restaurant. Cool place to chill with buddies.

This place looks like a cheap chinese takeout from the outside, but don't be fooled - authentic japanese waiting to be served!  Food was quite delicious - well we only got the karaage but they were so nicely fried and juicy!

excellent low key spot. focus here is katsu, fried goods, sake and reggae. yup, the japanese are the biggest reggae heads on this planet outside jamaica. and whoever commented about "japanese soul food" sounding funny.. what's there not to understand? order something here and there's your answer.

No credit card, no alcohol served, no water (isn't there laws against this), ok food, saw many people walk in and walk right back out.  Prices changes depending on what they feel like charging you.  Compare the board vs. the menu.

Tizzzzyizzzzzyiiiiight. Loved it. A true muddafooking gem. Japones soul food with carribean decor and reggae music...am i pulling your chain? nah, mon, i no pull your chain. There's flag on the ceiling that says smthg about japanese soul food. I was delighted by this place well before dipping into the food. That being said, the food is quite satisfying. I had the tonkatsu (fried pork) and a fried chicken appetizer. It was taaasty, as was the sauce. Sizeable mugs of Sapporo for $5, glass for $3 and another, i believe japanese, beer on offer. They also have Japanese wines (say wha??)--red and white--and a good-sized sake list. This is definitely an eatery i wish to introduce many a friend to, but only those friends on the A list. Do yoself a service and get acquainted with the Ichibantei. You've earned it.

No comment

This place doesn't need any further advertising as it is packed nearly all he time -- but deservedly. Really charming tiny spot underneath a rather loud (hilariously so if you are sitting in one of the outdoor cabins) elevated train station with quirky pan-cultural elevated diner food. The Burger I had was absolutely perfect: the platonic ideal of a cheeseburger. I went with a friend, and we split this and the vegan cobb salad and gobbled both right up, though the novelty of vegan bleu cheese sort of wore of after a while. But the burger is one of the best in the city--perfectly cooked, juicy, great bun, and perfect proportions of meat to bread to sauces (they use a korean mayo laced with I believe gochugang that was brilliant) -- over all I am a big fan.
No comment
No comment

Came here on a Sunday and had to wait 30 mins for a table. We ordered the egg and cheese sando and the omelet. Both were very good, but the egg n cheese sando was the highlight imo. Will be going back to have it again
No comment
No comment

This is a quaint, cute hole in the wall diner. The servers are extremely friendly and the golden pancakes melt in your mouth. It is worth the longer trek to the edge of Manhattan to eat at Golden Diner!
No comment
No comment

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment

I got here around 9:50 am when they open at 10 and there was already a line forming so I knew I made the right decision coming here during my trip to New York. It's a cute little place, only a few tables and a few barstool seats. The Chinatown egg sando with bacon added was probably the best breakfast sandwich I've had. The hash brown patty was perfect for the sandwich, but the bun..... was amazing. I was so satisfied after the sandwich but the green tea coffee cake was just calling my name. It was the perfect amount of sweetness, a bit dry but went so well with my iced coffee in the freezing weather if I'm ever in the area again I know I'm getting that sandwich again.

Good brunch food. But was a little disappointed by lack of asian flavors. Had the avocado toast, chicken katsu and Chinatown egg and cheese sando. Was expecting something a little more fusion/unique. Food was yum but it was hard to tell just from the taste of the food that this was supposed to be asian diner food.

Walked in to @goldendinerny and finally got to try one of the most famous burgers in NYC! It looks so simple but was really yummy and not greasy. I could taste the Korean gochujang from my first bite, and who knew it would fit so well! I loved that the cake was not too sweet at all, but has a distinct tea flavor. This place is definitely a successful example of Asian American fusion food, and I will for sure visit again!

The last time I came to Golden Diner was before the pandemic. I remember the Katsu sandwiches being tasty and service was good. So when I was in the neighborhood with a few hungry friends, I was more than thrilled to share this spot with them. I must say, it was little underwhelming. The sandwich was only 'OK' this time, but the service was pretty bad. We were left unattended to, making it difficult to even get out waters refilled, let alone our check. Hoping this was a one off, but I'm less thrilled about bringing friends here and bragging about this place like I once did...

Returned for Saturday brunch; Golden Diner remains winning. I put my name in for 2 at 1:04 PM, and we were seated 20 mins later inside at the bar (heated outdoor was available sooner). Obviously got the chicken katsu club, as well as the pancakes with berry compote and Thai Cobb Salad. 5 stars forever.

Awesome pancakes, also got the burger and the omelette. Burger was solid, nothing crazy, good diner burger and omelette was eh. Pancakes were soooo good though with the maple butter and great hashbrowns
No comment
No comment
Long wait.  Worth it!  Get all the things you see pictures of and skip your next meal. You'll be glad you did!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I was expecting to like this place a lot more! Dont get me wrong it is not bad necessarily just overhyped imho. The chinatown egg and cheese sando however is worth a trip - bread is so fluffy and the hash brown is lovely and crisp. The rest of the stuff we ordered we werent into. The vegetalian hero isnt bad, just OK - its a refreshing crunch but i wouldnt go back to it, mostly feels like cut up veggies w a lot of not particularly compelling vinegarette type sauce. Unfortunately really was not a fan of the thai tea tres leches -- for some reason all the components felt like they meshed tg weirdly esp the cream on top and the lime. It got kind of greasy for my taste after a few bites and didnt have a super strong tea flavor. Rum punch was also fine but nothing special. Wish i cld give 3.5 cuz i did not dislike that much but just wasnt that into it
Legendary already. Great meals and fair prices. Pancakes are not to be missed. Had the Katsu Club, Breakfast Burrito, Burger, etc. simply exemplary food and service.

Surprisingly really good! I was worried because usually fusion means that one is good at nothing. Golden Diner was very strong with the Chinese influence yet also balances American diner food fare really well. The Golden Cheeseburger ($22.50) was fresh and the Mushroom Rueben Quesadilla ($16) was innovative yet familiar in a comforting away. Would definitely come back to try other dishes.

I love Golden Diner! I've been here quite a few times since they opened, both for brunch and dinner, and always have a fantastic meal. But brunch would be my preferred time to visit. My favorite dishes are the Chicken Katsu Club, Honey Butter Pancakes, Lemongrass Avocado Toast, and Green Tea Coffee Cake. Portions are pretty generous. Service is always friendly and attentive. I recommend booking a reservation or arriving before they open so that you can make it to the first round. You should definitely give this place a try!

Absolutely amazing breakfast spot! The food was delicious and fresh, the portions were generous and the service was top-notch. Highly recommend the pancake stack and the breakfast burrito. The ambiance was cozy and inviting. A must-visit for anyone in the area looking for a fantastic breakfast experience
No comment
Bussin tuna melt and pancakes and Caesar salad. Idk why the katsu club is so popular but it was still solid. The tuna melt has salt & vinegar chips in it which is awesome and adds a nice crunch

Is this my favorite pancake in all of NYC? Is this pancake cloud fluffy and hot and does it melt in my mouth? Is the butter here pictured, a honey and maple butter? Is the berry compote fresh and sweet, but not-too-sweet? Did we eat a full dinner meal (on point always / delicious) but ALSO get honey butter pancakes and coffee for dessert? I hope you know my answers to my questions and if you don't know enjoy some emojis I took the time to find and tap:

I really wanted to like this place but the food was just okay :( I would say the best dish was the chicken Katsu but I thought there was too much cabbage! I would skip the mushroom Reuben. The fried chicken had good flavor and the extra large salt flakes that was added at the end made the wings very salty

It was the place to go for a St Pats day brunch or any day but on St Pats you might have a brew, among those on tap that day, a milk stout! The breakfast menu offered eggs in many ways including in a breakfast burrito, wrapped just like a burrito at your fave Mex place. A robust slice of multigrain bread came with my classic breakfast special and the potatoes it came with/ they serve are bite size hashbrowns. A couple of unique side items: the matcha coffee cake is a must try, it was warm, rich green, just the right amount of sweet. The pickled cabbage is also available on the side and came on a nicely stacked chicken sandwich the Birthday girl enjoyed; notably that bread fit for the club sandwich, thin layers. Credit to the service; this place is busy and they work it assuring any allergy accommodations as well. It is a cozy place maybe 10 tables inside in a row. Make reservations! The outside, seating looked nice as the sun was shining on them, and also steadily full, albeit you might need ear plugs as this part of New York carries the sound burden from the transit bridges overhead. Since it is Chinatown, on nearby, Broadway, directly under the bridges, the local street, vendors, were selling a host of interesting items but I couldn't tell you what they were & could not hear the vendor's explanation. The Golden Diner is a beacon for eaters; I think it's trendy because I noticed one gent come in & snap some photos before he sat down & another couple buying T-shirts! Make a reservation!
No comment

I've only been here once for dinner with friends, and I will say I'm not sure what all the hype is about.  Yes it's cool that it is a diner based on Asian food - very hip - but I thought the food was just okay.  I ordered the Thai Cobb Salad ($17), my friend ordered the same with Chicken (an extra $10 ... thats a $27 salad!) and I forgot what my other two friends ordered...but we shared the Honey Butter Pancakes at the end ($14 + $4.5 for the berry compote = $18.50).  Pancakes were good, but I'm not much of a sweets person to begin with, so I'm glad we split it four ways.  Overall, not very impressed with this spot and wouldn't be my first pick for a restaurant when we live in NYC!
No comment
No comment
No comment

I visited shortly after they opened, friendly staff, not tok crowded, delish katzu chicken sandwich. Place is small, under the Manhattan Bridge in the LES, walking distance from my home which is great. I love the fusion of the dishes. Food is fresh, I ate in.

Went to the dinner on suggestion from a friend and it was average. The dinner doesn't have too much infusion from different cuisines. I would also say it was relatively expensive for a dinner. I had a large party so we sat outside - the sun was in our eyes and the train went by frequently. Service was attentive, but overall the experience was nothing special.
No comment

I have to come back to enjoy more of this great food. This is comfort food in the best way. Everything was appealing on the menu . I was so thirsty for the pancakes and goodness they are just as good as they look. The honey butter is so good. They add a fresh lemon zest to the top. I had my berries on the side. The wings are fire too , everything was just good. Service was great too. Appreciated every moment of this experience. Be back soon!
No comment
No comment

I was initial attracted to Golden Diner because of the pictures of the egg sando and the chicken katsu sandwich. And yes, I ended up trekking over and visited just for those two dishes. And yes, they were as good as I had pictured.
No comment
No comment

Soooo yummy! The yuzu Palmer is so refreshing, I could guzzle down a whole pitcher easily.  The Chinatown Egg & Cheese Sando w bacon is delightful- creamy and cheesy eggs, crunch hash brown, smoky bacon, special squishy scallion bun- perfection! Also indulged in the Thai tea tres leches cake, which was a decadent treat.  All in all solid, and Chef Yoo is very active in the restaurant, not only in the kitchen, but making the rounds w guests etc
No comment
Golden diner's thai tea tres leches cake was tres tasty, their katsu club sandwich was so unique and yummy!!

Checked my vaccination card. All the staff was energetic and attentive. French toast and lemonade seem basic but Golden Diner has a different take on it that I haven't had before. They serve a savory cheese French toast oposite of the syrup and fruit. The first piece I cut off was moist. Looking at it I wondered if it was undercook. Tasting it tis was perfectly cooked but was getting soggy quick from the cheese. New flavor combinations for me but I liked it.

The fact that the chef worked at Momofuku definitely  enticed us to make our way here during a very rainy NYC day. It was well worth it. Our server was very pleasant and the food was great. I'm a big fan of breakfast sandwiches but often times I'm not totally enthused by them. But this one was amazing. From the softly folded eggs with a sprinkle of cheese incorporated, to the milk bun, to the savory goodness of the sausage. The pancakes were incredibly rich and fluffy. I'm glad I shared both dishes with my sister because there's no way I could handle an entire plate of pancakes. Would definitely come back!

Great brunch spot! Came here with a few friends on a Friday right at open, by the time we left the place was pretty packed. We shared the Green Tea Coffee Cake, which was really unique and yummy! The Thai Tea Tres Leches Cake sounded really good too, but I had to stop myself from ordering too much lol. For myself, I got the Chicken Katsu Club which was a nice little twist on the classic club sandwich. Glad I got to try this place!
I basically live here, and everything is delicious. Faves are the Chicken Katsu Club, the Egg and Cheese Sando (with bacon), and the mushroom Reuben Quesadilla.

The reviews made it seem pretty good so I went with my family to try this place out. Since we were hungry and wanted breakfast, but now I feel like I've been robbed. The pancakes were soggy and drenched in honey , so I thought it was terrible since it was overwhelmingly sweet but the eggs and the hash browns were pretty decent but I won't go here ever again.
No comment

I ordered to go. I got the chicken katsu with fries and korean chicken wings. The chicken katsu with purple cabbage and the sauce in one bite was very delicious. The fries tasted original and shouldn't cost 9$. The skin on the Korean wings were very hard, but the meat was cooked well. Overall would give it another try but with different items on the menu. The chicken katsu is a must try if you get food from here.
Food was good. Recommend the honey butter pancakes and chicken katsu sandwich. Staff was attentive and nice too.
No comment
No comment

Everything we had from the menu was super delicious! Sad the vegetalian sandwich was out really wanted to try that item too. It was hard to pick a favourite. From a uniqueness perspective, savour options wise the chicken Katsu club sandwich and the mushroom quesadilla were great. The former had a nice mix of crunch and flavors. The latter was mixed with sauerkraut so not too heavy. The green tea cake was not too sweet which I'm a fan of. The pancakes I thought would taste like Sunday in Brooklyn given the shape except it's much lighter, fluffier and really unique! Feels like it's made from cream cheese so the texture and taste were a bit like Japanese fluffy cheesecake. Service was excellent, fast and friendly. Definitely long wait but well worth it.
Worst breakfast experience poor customer service. If you live in the area do yourself a favor and NEVER go here.
No comment

Incredible brunch spot, we went on a rainy day and didn't have to wait !! The food was so incredible and this place lives up to the hype. I would highly recommend this spot!! We got the the Thai tea tres leches, the milk bun egg sando and the bfast burrito. Everything was good and their hash browns r so crispy!!!

I thought I knew what was possible with pancakes. I really did. It's my favorite breakfast item and I'd have them in countless different styles, at countless different restaurants, and at countless different price points. That is until I sat down at Golden Diner and was treated to what has best been described as death bed material. They were not only different from any pancakes I've had before, they were better. Be it in taste, texture, temperature, or even appearance. In fact, they were so good that by the time I had finished my meal I was already planning my next visit. A visit that would occur less than a week later and would include not one, but two orders! Needless to say, consistency is not an issue at Golden Diner. Long story short, these are the best pancakes I've ever had and I can not recommend them highly enough.

Delicious food, great vibes, and amazing service! I got the chicken katsu club and it was delicious! My friend and I sat outside in the sweltering heat but it was still a great experience. We both really enjoyed the food and restaurant overall, and I also thought the service here was so good. Would definitely come back for brunch again
No comment
No comment
No comment

Golden Diner in Chinatown is a cozy diner serving up inventive Asian-influenced diner fare. We started off with a refreshing glass of yuzuade with iced tea added to make it Arnold-Palmer-esque, but so much better. For mains we ordered an amazing bacon, egg, hash brown, and avocado breakfast sandwich served on top of a pillowy sesame scallion milk bun. Golden diner is a perfect place to get a really amazing hangover breakfast. Be sure to get there early as it's walk in only and the line gets long post 12pm
No comment

Had the most unbelievable meal at Golden Diner! Everything we ordered was flavorful, yummy and the atmosphere is cozy. Honestly one of the best burgers I've had and the pancake dessert went fast! Tuna melt was also so soo good. We had the best time and Chef Sam Yoo took the time to come out and chat. Love it! Must go!

This is one of the best findings in NYC for breakfast and beyond. I'm so glad to have come and experienced the evolution of diner breakfast, which seems to be disappearing trend. If you haven't had their food yet, get here!
No comment

We reserved outside for a Friday night, and they were obviously super busy. However, the service was slow and they served our starters at the same time as our entrees. I was disappointed to see that the inside of my Katsu club was raw, and while they replaced it and gave us a coffee cake to apologize, I felt put off that a marquee dish slipped through the cracks like that. The inside is very cool and stylish, and I appreciate that the outside seating is heated. All told, the food was good with one aberration, the service just felt a little haphazard.

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: I live nearby and have been meaning to try Golden Diner for a while now because every time I walk by I see people eating delicious looking food!! Finally made my way there with my mom for lunch and YUM. We ordered the honey butter pancakes (with fruit on top for a few extra bucks). Omgggg if you love butter you will love these. They are so fluffy and airy and soft. Definitely recommend. The monte cristo french toast was also very good - I thought it would be sweet but it's actually salty with cheese and prosciutto meat on top. As for cakes , we tried both the thai tea tres leches and the green tea coffee cake. Both were good but the tres leches is the clear winner if I had to choose just one. It's so moist from being soaked in delicious thai tea yummm. The portions were very big so we had some stuff packed up to bring home afterwards.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
I did a drive-by at Golden Diner, picked up a chicken sandwich and was impressed by the freshness and how the flavors melded into one delicious sammy.  This spot is a definite go to!
No comment
No comment
No comment

The egg sando is a brunch much have at golden diner. It is just perfect. Had that with the pancakes and tater tots and a drink. The syrup is a bit much for the pancakes so I asked for maple syrup instead but otherwise it was all amazing. Also had a drink that's named after the place. That was also really good. I'll definitely be back to golden diner to try out the rest of the menu.
No comment

Not a diner even better. I started with Korean fried chicken wings, and vegan nachos.  They were delicious. Next I ordered the golden cheeseburger. It was delicious. For dessert I had the tres leche cake. It was moist and delicious. The food was cooked so well and great.

The Chinese Egg & Cheese Sando is to die for. It had a hashbrown layer that was at perfect level or crispiness and the buns were so fresh and delicious! The berries compote for the fluffy pancakes was out of this world too. We sat outside in a super cold morning because there was a considerable wait for a table inside, but the heated outdoor area felt nice and toasty.
No comment
Must go! The katsu chicken club is divine (although definitely come hungry since the portion sizes are MASSIVE). A little difficult to get to and may require a short wait, but it is well worth it.
No comment
The katsu sandwich was good. The fried wings were very subpar with a thick sauce. Not sure why this place is popular!
No comment
No comment

got the breakfast sando and it was quite good. the home fries were a bit salty and the bread was a lot, but was overall delicious. also tried the green tea coffee cake and that was a big thumbs up! cozy place, would come back and try the rest of the menu.
No comment

I paid $44 for an egg sandwich, a breakfast burrito, and a cup of coffee.  Look, I get it, we want something "different" but there was nothing "special" about the items I got yet paid 3x what I would pay at a deli down the block.  Just not for me, hope they do well but I'm not their target audience.

I really loved the chicken katsu sandwich! The katsu was crispy and tender and the sandwich had so much flavor aside from the katsu. The portion sizes were huge too! I also had the wings and tried my friend's pancakes which were amazing. The wings can be skipped on to be honest but this was overall super worth it! Would def come back again :)
No comment

This restaurant is a hidden gem! It's a nice warm environment with friendly staff! The burger is DELICIOUS!!! the sauce is so flavorful, fries are hot and fresh! Order this burger and you won't regret it!
No comment
No comment
great food, nicely sized plates. the place is cute and plays "cool" music on top of everything else. i like it a lots
Great pancakes. Nice staff. Affordable prices.
green tea coffee cake all day everyday -- the best coffee cake i've had in new york city

I Love the atmosphere of the place, the waitresses are extremely nice, and the food came very fast and food was amazing! I had the Chinatown Egg-Sando with a side of sunny-side-up eggs and the sandwich was delicious but the eggs were extremely oily and not the best they were ok. The food here is also not pricey at all.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant.
No comment

This was one of the best meals I had in NYC. The katsu club was phenomenal, the chicken wings were so crispy and flavorful and the reuben quesadilla was killer. This will be on my regular rotation when I visit.

Came for Sunday brunch, place is always packed for good reason. Great unique twists on classic diner food and portions are generous. Came with a big group and tried the thai cobb salad, monte cristo french toast (which is out for months apparently), lemongrass avo toast, chicken katsu sando, green tea coffee cake - great across the board. Would also recommend the makgeolli horchata.
No comment
Green tea cake was dry according to my sister but I thought it was delicious. Overall food was delicious and would go back.
No comment
No comment

It was very yummy! Lots of good options. Had the Chinatown Egg & Cheese Sando with bacon. The hashbrown was so crispy and perfect, the eggs were very creamy. There wasn't much of a line at ten am on a Saturday so we were sat right away. Great brunch spot!

I'm not a big diner food gal-- but a friend of mine lives in the area and is a FIEND for this place. I gotta say, I see why he loves it so much. It's an Asian fusion diner with massive portions, but the best part is, all the food is delicious! The fried chicken sauce has the perfect balance of heat and sweet, the burger is juicy beyond belief, and the katsu sando was a complete textural journey. Would recommend to anyone looking for a diner fix!

Cute little spot under the bridge! Can get a little noisy especially if doing outdoor dining due to the trains passing by. We got korean fried chicken, and I got the chicken katsu club while my bf got the burger. The Korean fried chicken was just okay- not as crispy as some you would get from a Korean fried chicken place but the flavor was good! Burger was very flavorful and cooked well. I loved the katsu club- the pickled cabbage in the sandwich really balanced out the oily fried chicken and the chicken was marinated and fried really well. Also came with a generous helping of fries. One small thing that threw me off was that the pickle that came on the side was soft when I bit into it, instead of crunchy like I expected. Overall, good service and good food- would come back if I'm in the area!

Stopped by Golden Diner after reading the great reviews. The food was a more for someone with a liking for vegan or more natural foods. I didn't end up staying to eat but the staff was kind, the atmosphere was great and chill. Maybe one day I will broaden my horizons and eat here.

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: Had breakfast this morning at Golden Diner - I will be dreaming about the Honey Butter pancakes with berry compote for years to come! The lightness of the pancakes, the subtle sweetness of the honey butter, the touch of lemon zest - even the iced coffee was amazing! If you are on the Lower East Side, it's a must that you eat at the Golden Diner!

The food here is amazing. They do breakfast right. I love all their eggy breakfast items - breakfast wrap, breakfast sandwich. Plus their hash brown is bomb! The green tea crumb cake is too dry for me, must be eaten with a drink.  Chicken katsu sandwich is very crispy. I only wish their service was more on point and that they had a bigger menu for dinner service. I see too much of the same selections between breakfast/lunch and dinner.
No comment
No comment

Food is OK. This vegan grilled cheese was OK, just the bread was SUPER greasy & the fries weren't hot. My sister got the "Egg Sando" and her sandwich looked really good but again the fries were cold & old. Hopefully I'll have a better experience next time I eat at this business.
No comment
No comment
No comment

The golden diner is situated directly under the Manhattan bridge which is such an authentic spot. The interior reminds me of a retro diner, and the passing of the trains above takes me back to the 1900s. Now, let's get to the food. First off, this is the best egg sandwich I've ever eaten... I have no clue what they did to that bun and that egg but it was insanely good. Second, I had the honey butter pancakes... one of the best pancakes I've ever had. Fluffy, crispy, hint of lemon and super sweet. Burger was perfectly cooked, and chicken katsu was also a delicious. Both indoor and outdoor options for seating, packed on weekends now. I would 10/10 highly recommend this restaurant.

One of the best breakfast sandwiches in lower Manhattan. Always friendly staff in a cozy restaurant, you can never go wrong with the Sando

One of my fave spots for comfort food! Love all the flavors with Asian influences. Chicken Katsu Club is so good. Ordered takeout twice in one week :-)

The place feels like a classic diner with a twist. Have been eyeing their chicken katsu club for a while and it did not disappoint. The sandwich was absolutely loaded, mainly due to the katsu and the abundance of slaw. It was for sure a messy sandwich to eat but beyond delicious. Definitely order it deluxe (with fries) if you are hungry. Almost all tables, including us, ordered the Korean fried chicken wings. The sauce was very good - gingery, spicy, but I find the outer shell of the chicken too hard and a little difficult to chew.

We were drawn to the heated outdoor dining and the food did not disappoint. The attentive staff started us off with some warm water which was a nice touch. The avocado toast was unlike anything I've had before (in the best way) and you could tell all the food was super fresh. The bright yellow tables were a nice touch on a winter day.

Love this take on a traditional New York diner down in the LES. You can find something close to all the staples here. They're extremely accommodating for allergens and have delicious food. Had the Chinatown egg sando on gluten free bread. The eggs were perfect, and they also have fries that are addictively good. Fun time, nice outdoor seating, good service.
No comment
Everything we got here was delicious. The breakfast food was packed with flavor and the menu is really inventive without being gimmicky.

Everything was delicious and the service is outstanding.  We had the tuna melt, Korean wings, and a salad.  All were tasty with unusual flavors.  We sat outside and it was a nice atmosphere.  I'll definitely be back and I want to try the pancakes. Someone next to us had them and they looked incredible.

No comment

Long ass line everytime but the foods great. Probably too overpriced but hey it's nyc hipster joint I get it. Also damn if I wasn't Korean I'd be tempted to get their drinks but like $12 for makkeolli? Anyways I like this place a lot, make sure to book a reservation u less ur cool with waiting 1.5 hr

As a lover of pancakes, I've been looking at Yelp pics of the honey butter pancakes for years. It took a while, but the stars finally aligned and we finally made it to over to try Golden Diner. Let me just say that the honey butter pancakes with fruit compote are amazing and rank up there among my favorite pancakes of all time (along with Clinton St.; the crispy edge pancakes at Over Easy in Kailua, HI; and Norm's in Los Angeles... ). Golden Diner's honey butter pancakes are incredibly fluffy and tender. The honey butter was absolutely delicious and the fruit compote was wonderful--neither the honey butter nor the fruit compote were too sweet and the flavors of both worked really well together. Husband and I split the pancakes and a Chinatown egg sando with sausage. The eggs in the sandwich were cooked perfectly--light and tender. The sausage, hash browns, the scallion bun were all delicious. Husband even gave the standard drip coffee high marks. Struck up a conversation with the couple next to us who raved about their house made granola and were throughly enjoying some gorgeous avocado toast. The place is tiny and the tables are "New York close," but they also had heated outdoor tables available for those who might feel more comfortable with a little more elbow room. As we were leaving we had a chance to meet the owner, Sam. Though he was busy during the morning rush, he took the time to say good morning and thank us for stopping in. Loved everything about this place!  It'll be on our list of regular breakfast/brunch places when we're in NYC going forward for sure!!!
Super busy and limited seating. Get there early or prepare to wait. Worth it. Best egg sandwich we have ever had. Amazing simple food. Good coffee. Definitely going back.
No comment
No comment

Alright alright. This is now one of my top pancakes I've ever had in NYC. This is tied for first place for me. I mean honey butter pancakes? How can those not be divine? I got here at 9:55am on Sunday morning. They open at 10am and there were already 4 other parties waiting for it to open! By the time I left, there was about a 30 minute wait. They have both indoor and outdoor seating. I sat outside because it was a beautiful day. My waitress came over super quickly. I started with a black coffee. They are really good about coming over to pour you more as well throughout the meal, so I always had a full, hot cup! I obviously ordered the honey butter pancakes and a side of bacon. Oh ma goodness. My mouth is still watering from the deliciousness that was this meal. The pancakes were SO fluffy and so tasty. They were drenched in the perfect about of syrup and topped with berries compote (optional but highly suggest) and the most amazing honey butter. I want some of that honey butter just to bring home on it's own. The bacon was also so good. Not sure what they do to it but it just hit different. There were so many other things I wanted to try (the breakfast sandwich, the breakfast burrito)... but guess I'll just HAVE to come back! The wait staff was so kind and attentive. For sure could not have asked for a better experience. Overall a 10/10 meal. Get there early! It's worth it!

We came here a few days ago. We all ordered a typical diner breakfast. Food was good. The service was great! Very friendly!

Sam Yoo is a veteran of Momofuku, Torisi and Noma, but his Golden Diner has more to do with the 24/7 spots his Dad owned in Queens and Manhattan than any of the places Sam has worked over the years. Golden Diner, in the grittier Two Bridges edge of Chinatown, is a cross-cultural tribute to the classic NYC diner. The basics are all here, but upgraded with Asian, Latin, Italian and other ethnic ingredients. Definitely worth the trip!

What an amazing concept, classic diner with Japanese, Korean and Southeast Asian flavors! The only diner in all of nyc that I'll be dining again gladly. Everything in their menu is bomb. My party of two ordered the katsu club sandwich and matcha & hojicha coffeecake to share. I ordered egg&cheese sando (butter is used to make the eggs, you can ask for no butter) and my friend ordered four eggs (only whites) comes with a side of toast and home fries. Their home fries is basically extra crispy hashbrown. The kind only I had access to growing up in Southeast Asia. I will be back to try the rest of the menu including matzo-ball soup, tuna melt and vege sub. They recently opened for dinner as well. Can't wait to be back!
No comment
Chicken wings are so good that I accidentally ate half of the bone. Would recommend just be careful.

I ate there yesterday evening with a friend. We both got food poisoning. The chicken in friend's club sandwich seemed funky. My food tasted mediocre. We both had toilet explosions later that night. We paid over $70 for 2 sandwiches, a coffee, a Coke and got sick.

A usually busy spot on the weekends, the Golden Diner is  mixed in the streets of Manhattan's chinatown. I would recommend this place for a casual lunch or brunch, their most unique dishes include the vegetarian Reuben quesadilla which uses the mushroom texture to replace the corn beef texture, and the chicken Katsu club sandwich. For just a tea break the matcha coffee cake and the tea pair well together. Currently they offer outdoor dining under heated lamps. Since the restaurant is close to the train station it can be hard to hear conversations, but overall the service is excellent and the food is decent .

Another great takeout spot during these times... thoroughly enjoyed the chicken katsu club, the burger (with special delicious sauce) and the green tea coffee cake to end on a sweet note. Our friend also ordered the vegetalian hero and really liked that. It's definitely quite busy on the weekends so it takes some time to get your order/get a table but well worth the wait.

I am sorry, but  I happen to be a salad connoisseur. I ordered the vegan Caesar salad; with tax  over $14 (plus I then added a tip on top of the $14) all for a  bowl of romaine , a few (but good) croutons and dressing. Sub-par for the price. Either lower the price by a dollar or two; or add more substance to the salad? Maybe management can let me know where the great expense is in this salad please ? I realize NYC rents are very high.

Sooooooo good!  Went here with a friend for her birthday brunch! Yummy food,  DELICIOUS COCKTAILS (we will come back to try them). I will say the wait for tables yook a while,  I called in advance to be on the wait list,  I called around noon for 2pm.  I got there around 2pm,  buy still had to waiy about 20min to be seated.  Apart from the wait it was perfect!!

I'm so glad that they reopened! This has always been my favourite neighbourhood place, great food and friendly service, especially the very best Smashed Avo (aka Avocado Toast) in NYC

I stopped by here during lunch time and it was still packed! The server recommended the burger which was very very flavorful and cooked medium rare! Based on the other Yelp reviews, I skipped the fries. I'd like to go back and try some other dishes like the breakfast sandwich and chicken club. The golden burger is probably one of my favorite burgers in the city!

Great service, the green tea coffee cake is amazing. They have plenty of outdoor dining with heating too

Friendly service and delicious food. Egg sandwich and Cobb salad were to die for!! Definitely coming back

Literally my favorite restaurant in the neighborhood and my favorite place to get brunch in the entire city. Golden Diner has curated its menu so well that if its menu was a newly released album, there would be no skips :' ) Vegan options are satisfying, the egg sando is the best egg sandwich I've ever had, and Golden Diner does a beautiful job of delivering us our all-time favorite meals with a unique Chinatown/LES spin.

I can solemnly swear the Chinatown egg sando kept me happy during quarantine. I ordered it an embarrassing number of times. I'm not a cheese person, so sorry if my cheeseless BEC is offensive, but holy moly it's so good. The crispy potato, the perfect eggs, delicious crispy bacon AND THE SCALLION BUN my goodness it is the perfect breakfast sandwich. I'll have to try something other than the sando, soon!
Absolutely delicious and well worth the wait if there is one. A tuna melt from heaven.

Where do I start?! This is hands down the best BEC in the city. The only one on our crawl that included some form of a hash brown on the sandwich, and at that it was a scallion flavored hash brown to boot. This thing weighed a solid pound and was so good it's hard to put into words. Make your  way to Chinatown for this morsel!

Love this spot! After a cold walk to get here, we were immediately served hot water to warm us up. The menu is inventive and absolutely delicious. The chicken katsu club is a must! And if you choose to indulge in dessert, which I always do, don't miss out on the Thai tres leches! Already excited for my next visit to the Golden Diner.

Came to Golden Diner. It was perfect. Truly enjoy the atmosphere and pleasant service. Golden Diner is one of these spots where all the menu items look magnificent, I had Lemongrass Avocado Toast and it was very good. Workers are extremely welcoming. They're accommodating, polite and always on their game. Golden Diner is great.
I'm going to start by saying get the chicken wings it is amazing staff was very friendly place is very clean. I recommend this place 100%

Licked our plates clean. That's all you really need to know. Great fusion flavor and fresh ingredients. The backdrop of the sound of the subway going by and night lights make this a true hidden gem of Two Bridges.
LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! Get the chicken katsu club sandwich and the calamari for sure. Absolute winners. The pasta special was great too. Highly recommend!

YES, this place is as good as they're saying!!!  I stopped by on a late afternoon as I was in the neighborhood and was VERY happy that I did.  I ordered the egg &  hashbrown sammy that everyone is raving about and it is that good!  DELICIOUS!!!  I added avo & sausage to mine.  So big I needed a knife & fork to eat it.  The diner is super cute & cozy, very retro chic.  The waitress was lovely & friendly.  I would definitely go back to  try more of their dishes.  I HIGHLY recommend it!!!!!

Note food is good people are great but it is expensive. Breakfast burrito is great, home fries are tooooo die for.  Burger is good but messy. Almost everything u order will be good to exceptional.  But you will pay for it as their prices are high.
Not coming here. As a longtime LES resident these prices are outrageous, not to mention under a noisy dirty bridge. Gtfoh
