Great Breakfast... first the coffee tastes a little like chai tea. So good. We had the Lemongrass avocado  Toast with poached eggs and the  biscuits and gravy with poached eggs as well. Both A plus.Staff was super courteous . The diner is super clean and welcoming. Good energy all around

Every single thing I've had on this menu has tickled my tastebuds in the best way. It's somehow familiar and provides comfort while it also pleasantly surprises! The fusion of flavors will be some of the most unique and inspired combinations you've ever had. The green tea coffee cake and makgeolli horchata are just two examples. You can also get the standard diner style cheeseburger and fries, which are completely on-point-- the burger is cooked to perfection and the fries are sooo delightfully crispy. You can also go more to the Korean end of the spectrum and get the current seasonal special bibimguksu, which is actually spicy on the Korean scale. And don't forget the ALL-DAY Asian inspired breakfast items. Outdoor seating is available pretty much just under the Manhattan Bridge. I personally found the trains passing by sort of NYC-charming. The restaurant opened not long before Covid hit and the fact that it's going strong is a testament to its amazing quality!

We came here based on a best breakfast review. No disappointments. The food was great. Very fresh and vibrant flavors. They do not recognize military service however, when asked, our server took care of us I. Other ways.

Omg I'm not sure why I waited so long to order from this place and it's like a 10 min walk from my job. I had the vegan breakfast burrito and those potatoes inside I loved them so much. It's not your standard bodega home fries or diner. This right here was crispy and savory and I can't stop thinking about it that I might be going soon.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Ordered breakfast in this morning and saw they had good reviews. The food arrived hot. Wife had the breakfast burrito with home fries, while I had the omelet with home fries. Everything tasted great. The only knock I had was it didn't come with any silverware.
No comment
No comment

Very popular place. Location is not too convenient; far from subways and there are no good places nearby for shopping or get coffee while waiting for table. We waited 90 minutes for the table and not sure it was worth the wait.
No comment
Went here for outdoor dining. Best honey butter pancakes I've ever had. Will definitely be coming back.

Golden Diner truly is a unique dining experience.  Wait is expected, but if you come with small group shouldn't be more than an hour to snag a bar seat.  Menu highlights are many, so really gotta come with a group and try a bit of everything.  I had the club sandwich and really well made and filled me up.  Loved the sauce and the slaw.  Ordered side of pickled radish and it was pretty bad and small considering the $4 price tag.  Maybe 7 piece of cubed radish that had zero flavor.  Food great, but avoid the sides.  Drinks lean wine and cocktail but my punch was solid choice.   Tight spot, so wouldn't recommend bringing kids/strollers/large shopping bags.  Come here alone and enjoy.  But find a bar nearby to wait it out if you don't make reservations.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Love this joint. Love the food. Cool people, staff is friendly. I highly recommend this place. Keep up the good work.
No comment

Love this place! Super cute old school vibes inside, but very clean and new. The menu is very reasonably priced and the food is great! They have some unique things like machta coffee cake that looks amazing, but also have all the classics you go to a diner for. Staff was very warm and friendly. Im so glad to have a place like this in our neighborhood!

I'm so glad I've encountered this new diner in the lower east side. The place is very clean, staff is extremely welcoming and friendly. The food..is just absolutely amazing. I've probably had the chicken Katsu sandwich five times since they've opened. I've also brought a couple friends to try and they've fallen in love with the sandwich. Besides the katsu sandwich, the burger (special) was very yummy. Definitely one of the most unique diner spots in the lower east side.
Came across this gem while looking for a place to eat. Delicious chicken katsu, amazing staff, cozy environment. Definitely coming back

Went there yesterday spontaneously with friends. I haven't eaten out at all in 10 weeks! We walked in to look at the menu, and the staff was very efficient. I ordered the eggplant parm sand, great price, got it quickly....it was the BEST eggplant parm I've ever had! I hope they have the special again. Chinatown is part of my weekend route, I'll definitely be going back!

I got the chicken Katsu club and sat at the bar. The service was great- everyone was super nice and friendly, including the chefs working behind the bar. As for the club, this might damn well be the best sandwich in New York. The mix of the cabbage, bacon, chicken, and (i think) two diff sauces really knock it out of the park. Also it's a huge sandwich. I came in HUNGRY and could only eat 3/4 slices. So good. Already plotting my next visit.

Golden Diner is delicious and has everything you want to eat. Two of the best sandwiches in the city have to be Golden Diner's Chicken Katsu Club and Sam's Tuna Melt. The Honey Butter Pancakes are fluffy clouds of deliciousness. The Thai Cobb Salad is bright, refreshing, and addictive. I'm not vegetarian, but the Mushroom Reuben Quesadilla and Vegan Nachos are must-trys. I have no idea how Sam infuses mushrooms with such smoky, deep flavor, nor how the nachos can be that satisfying. I work nearby and find Golden Diner to be the perfect place to meet friends, or have meetings. If you're looking for dessert, the Green Tea Coffee Cake and Thai Tea Tres Leches Cake again exhibit Golden Diner's ability to reinvent classic soul-satisfying food. The coffee is strong, the beer is refreshing, and the cocktails are inventive. Golden Diner is a must-try in the neighborhood for breakfast, brunch, lunch, or dinner.
No comment
Was just mediocre. It's understandable that covid hit many restaurants hard but them cutting down on quality isn't going to help. Just makes you consider cooking at home.

Simple menu, executed flawlessly. This is not your average diner food. It's a small place with great vibes - good music and cool art - where you can watch them cook your food behind the bar. I got the breakfast sandwich special which had an incredible scallion milk bun, creamy eggs, and extra crispy hash browns. Also got the matcha coffee cake to-go, which I could not stop picking at all day because it was so good. Already ready to go back and try more!
No comment
So yummy!! Not your typical 'diner', but the Asian infused menu is awesome. The maple butter pancakes are by far the best I've ever had. Also great for dessert!

My father and I came here for brunch and both had the honey butter pancakes with berries with a side of bacon. I also ordered for myself the makgeolli horchata. Everything we had was delicious and excellent! The pancakes were so soft and the horchata cocktail so smooth, and the bacon was certainly organic, maybe even freshly sliced. If this restaurant was in my neighbourhood I would gain so much weight.
An incredible and thoughtful take on a traditional diner.  Eclectic menu and passionate staff.  Could rave about this place all day long.  You will not be disappointed here.

Check out the yuba hero, it's fantastic! Grilled tofu skins with fresh veggies, perfectly seasoned. The open, cheery ambience of the diner was both inviting and comfortable, perfect for a get together with old friends!

Came here today and ordered pancakes with mixed berries didn't expect how bad it tasted with the mixed berries and the butter I was really disappointed of the taste and how the mixed berries looked nasty and soggy strawberries looked purple instead of red. Only thing good here that I have had was the breakfast sandwich and 2 eggs how you want em platter.

This is a very special restaurant and not to be missed.  It is Asian-European with flavors that are primarily asian but with riffs of sophisticated European dishes.   I went  after having drinks at Mr Fong's bar next door.  We ordered the Sunchoke salad special, the Korean "fritto misto" and the fermented black beak "spaghetti Vongole" with clams. Each dish was different and better than the last.  All were incredible.  We also ordered one of the better sojus Ive had and several dark beers.  You must order BOTH Soju and beer at this restaurant-called "somac" its double the alcohol and double the cost, but worth it.   All of the dishes were very extraordinary and will no doubt earn michelin stars if the chefs can keep up the consistency.  DO NOT miss this place if you are a foodie and like Asian cuisine.

Don't let long wait times deter you, the food here is incredible and unique! I've never had better pancakes or hash browns. The Vegitalian with charred Yuba was both original and delicious. We got a chance to meet the owner Sam who was extremely kind to us and his employees. If you haven't been, make sure to go!

This place is GOLD. The service is wonderful, it's very clean, and the breakfast is fantastic. It's also very reasonably priced (you'd think you weren't in Manhattan). I highly recommend this place. Very friendly and welcoming.

Everything was so delicious! My friend and I shared the chicken wings, the chicken katsu club sandwich and the pancakes with berries. Definitely too much food - we ended up leaving half the pancakes - but glad we got to sample a few things. The wings were our favorite but would order everything we ate again. Also had their Palmer cocktail which was delightful. Service was great - friendly and swift. Will definitely be back.
This place excites me. Classic modern and just plain yum. Will be back to try everything.

Great food / great service. We had the katsu sandwich and the avocado sandwich - both were unique and great. The interior has a diner charm to it and we loved the fusion aspect in the food! Will be back again!

Chef Sam is amazing! The food here was delicious and great price. They source fresh ingredients. You must get the special egg sandwich that is not on the menu. Make sure to have their homemade hash brown within that sandwich! The bread is customized for them and anything with Asian bread is the best since it's never dry. Katsu sandwich is phenomenal as well. Coming here every week!

This was the best calamari and cobb salad (thai style) I have had.  I wish they would open a Golden Diner on the West Coast.  The chef is young and very creative.  He takes a lot of pride in his creations.
No comment
Food and service was good but not the best value for the area.  The Chef is always there and seems hands-on with everything.

Golden Diner is a phenomenal take on elevated diner food. I had the breakfast burrito with avocado and it was truly delicious. The potatoes were so crunchy, the black beans had a perfect flavor, and the eggs were light and fluffy. I need to go back and try the chicken katsu club (half the restaurant ordered it) which I will be doing ASAP. The service is super friendly and the chef makes sure each dish going out is absolutely perfect. It may be off-the-beaten path but I highly recommend making it there. It is small so you may have to wait but it's worth it and sitting at the counter is a great experience.

New restaurant. Quite friendly. Ordered omelette which had quite fresh ingredients. Coffee was ok. My one  complaint was that I think the hash browns are basically not something I would eat.  I think they were deep fried and I had difficulty locating a piece of potato. This is not like the hash brown potatoes you get at typical diners.

Excellent, delicious reasonably priced breakfast with great service. I had the breakfast burrito with a side of avocado.  The crispy potato was an unexpected and delightful addition. Highly recommended!

Really cool new diner spot under the bridge, with solid food! I love sitting at the bar and watching the cooks do their thing. I've tried much of their menu and everything so far has been delicious! Two of their daily specials (egg and cheese sandwich, and lunch bibimbap) are now my favorites. They take your typical diner food and give it a fresh twist. My only gripe is that the menu is pretty small and doesnt seem to have changed at all since the time they opened....please add more things to try!
Great place! Food is worth the price and staff is extremely friendly. I will DEFINITELY come here again.

The chicken katsu club is truly amazing (the shredded cabbage is secret MVP) but we really need to be talking more about the wontonini! The broth is spectacular and the wonton skin is thin with perfect chewy texture at the closure of the dumpling. I will be thinking of it a lot. The fries were also great (I know that feels like a throwaway but a really crisp fry just shows you how many mediocre fries you have in this life) and the tuna melt was bright, crunchy, and buttery. Can't wait to go back!

Went there to see why there is a line every weekend. For my experience one of the worst breakfast ever in the city. The pancakes ( 2 for 12 $) were totally raw and tasted just like butter...in a bad way. My wife ordered the chicken katsu club sandwich (12 $ without fries) which was good but nothing more. They were so kind that when i showed them my raw pancakes, they sent me a piece of matcha cake for apologize...even the gifted cake was bad, simply didn't taste like nothing, just sugar. I live just across the street and i personally won't go back or suggest the place to anyone. Even the location was nothing special, full of young brooklyn kids that think its cool to wait an hour to sit at a fake diner counter
Delicious breakfast, especially the egg sandwich special. Very friendly staff. A great addition to the neighborhood!
Amazing!!! Best avocado toast! Eggs are so soft and flavorful. Chicken is delicious .Service is awesome since they remember who we were! Love this place!!

I visited this restaurant for Sunday brunch and came away surprised at the quality of the food. Every single bite of the meal was delicious, and I look forward to visiting Golden Diner in the future. We had avocado toast, a sandwich, and the burrito. Can't beat fresh ingredients, a sizable selection of items on the menu, attentive staff, and attention to detail on the meal. Definitely check this place out -- you can't go wrong!

Friendly staff. Good solid breakfast, cute little place. Prices were pretty good to me, other places that are new you get breakfast and it goes up to $13 sometimes. They were also trying some new stuff while I was sitting at the bar, seems they're gonna do some creative stuff with specials and the menu. Base menu is short, sweet to the point, as I believe breakfast diner menus should be.
This is such a great spot - the chicken katsu club is so good and the avocado toast is a must order.

Stopped in today for a late breakfast. The counter area is open and you can see what is being cooked. The main cook was standing behind the counter eating food, then wiping his fingers in a bowl. He then followed up by wiping the bowl with a dish towel. He kept eating food and cooking. I saw this after I ordered and was disgusted. Another worker guy came up from downstairs. We ordered cheese on our eggs. He picked up some cheese and started eating it. There is nothing good about this. The main cook took some burnt, old "homemade hash browns" that look as if they have been sitting for days and put it on our plate. This is the worst I have ever seen a restaurant. I don't know where the great reviews are from. It was so gross. I paid the check and left.

Wow. The breakfast sandwich a was delicious, moist and amazing. Love the tuna melt as well, they place chips on it! Cool vibe, nice ambiance. If you do not try the pancakes you really have a problem. Order pancakes for the table, for yourself or for everyone, they are amazing!

Not your average diner. Fun vibe, good music.  Chicken Katsu club was very good, but not as amazing as others claim.  Loved the sauce and cole slaw, but I'm more a fan of white meat chicken. Pasta Vongole was excellent, noodles were interesting and had a nice kick.  Chinatown breakfast sandwich excellent ( bread was the hilight). Fries good too. We had a shaved ice dessert which was a little disappointing.
No comment

We waited for 2 hours. 1 hour waiting outside. 1 hour for our food to be served on the table. They apologized twice saying that they only have electric stove top now since the installation was not complete yet. Menu was super limited. Breakfast costs $60 with tax and tip. If I knew better, I would've went to Clinton Bakery and waited there to get some quality breakfast.

The food is incredible! I especially loved the burger (woah!), chicken katsu club, Korean chicken wings and noodle "special" (creative Asian take on vongole). The "diner" portion of the name is a bit of a misnomer because the food quality is on par with the latest and great new American restaurant. However, you wouldn't expect that from the reasonable prices. I tried dinner but can't wait to come back for breakfast options.

Came for lunch on a Tuesday and was surprised by how busy and strong the bacon smell was in there. Was still able to snag a table for two, and we both ordered the chicken katsu club. Sandwich was delicious, though definitely on the rich side.

This place is a hidden gem in two bridges. Clean, super cute inside, great vibe, the staff is so friendly but the food is the shinning star - unbelievably good. We're from LA and In-N-Out burgers are a staple of any So-Cal diet. The burger they serve here is... OMG. It's like someone put a tux on an In-N-Out burger & invited it to the Oscars. Easily one of the best tasting burgers I have ever had.

Literally ate here for breakfast yesterday, ordered for dinner last night & came here again just for brunch!! tried something new everytime and let me just say !! THIS GOLDEN PUNCH  sooooooo goooooddd !!
They are now open for dinner and it's even better. Always imaginative and delicious. Soup with mini dumplings was a real treat. Try the shaved ice dessert.
Highly recommend! We were walking by and stopped on a whim. Owner is behind the bar cooking - waiter is really pleasant!
Great breakfast sandwich on an amazing bun.  Clean, bright, new.  Friendly staff. Lots of vegan options in the menu, but meat too.
I want to go back and try everything on the menu! Super friendly staff and an extremely well-run kitchen.
A great spot to escape the hustle of the city under the noise of the trains and cars on the Manhattan Bridge.  The atmosphere, service and food were exceptional.
Would definitely come back here. The breakfast burrito and coffee cake were amazing. Everyone is nice. Loved it!

hidden under the manhattan bridge, this place is an absolute gem. walk into a little, but most definitely quaint diner with a vintage, boho feel. unfortunately, due to the state of our country, we were unable to eat-in but I highly recommend getting take-out. the cold brew was the perfect saturday morning pick me up while we waited for our meals. The breakfast burrito and golden omelette were delicious and cannot wait to try the rest of the menu.

Out here visiting from Los Angeles, California... And I am totally in love with this place!! Got to meet the chef as he was preparing my food, and he is such a great guy! He has amazing energy!! He made my avocado toast fresh, and it is so good!! I highly recommend this place!
This place was freakin delicious. Get the avocado toast and the katsu sandwich and you will be so happy. The staff is nice and attentive. I will definitely be back to try more of the menu.

Golden Diner was such a lovely surprise on a quiet street. Sun-filled and welcoming, we had a delicious lunch on a Wednesday afternoon: vegan Caesar salad, Galangal avocado toast, and a special, the spring bibimbap. I usually roll my eyes at the mention of avocado toast. You're charging me how much to slice open a fruit and squash it on a piece of bread? But this was a thing of beauty, as well as super flavorful, with lots of layers bursting in your mouth: kaffir lime, galangal, fried onion, pickled radish, scallion. The Caesar was refreshing and I had to fight my dining partner over the decadent croutons. One of the standouts to me was the matcha green tea coffee cake: so subtle yet so complex. I can't wait to return and try the chicken katsu club.
No comment

We were looking for a place to get fresh poke bowls and came here due to such great reviews. It did not disappoint. We got one spicy tuna bowl and one miso salmon bowl. Both were great. Next time I'm interested to try the ahi tuna bowl. Be aware there is very limited seating inside.

Good poke in nyc is hard to find, but this place is one to check out. We got two different poke bowls from here to go during a weeknight. One miso tofu and one ahi tuna with added spicy tuna. I was pleasantly surprised at the size of each bowl. The protein is generous and so is the rice which was super fresh. All the other toppings were delicious too and mixed well together. It was awesome to see two pre-set vegan options. The fish was very good, fresh, and marinated well. We loved both our bowls and would recommend as one of the best poke places in the area.

Love this place but only getting 4 stars because I wish they included more of the toppings. I had literally 4 tiny pieces of mango and 5 edamame pods. I kept digging around looking for it. But super tasty and large portions.
OMG ! Amazing Poké bowls better than California's, everything is super fresh And it's very reasonable price!!!
No comment
No comment

I got the salmon bento box and it was incredible. Everything was cooked and seasoned to perfection and there was such a wonderful diversity in flavors. The staff was very kind and got me my order very quickly! 5/5 I will definitely be returning
No comment

All their food is irresistible! Ingredients are so fresh and cooked and prepared to perfection! I usually call to order ahead because everything was made to order. Otherwise it still does worth the time to wait for such quality food.

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: This place's quality has gone way south compared to before pandemic. Used to order here very often but recently ordered twice and both times white rice is too mushy/ cooked with too much water so you get few chunks of rice here. Last skip the cornflake because they are not crispy and has a moldy smell.

We need more businesses like this in the neighborhood. Healthy and fresh. Ever since working from home I miss having salads for lunch or even dinner. This is even better than those salad chains. Thoughtful and good portion sizes!
No comment

I'm kind of shocked at how much care they put into their poke bowls. I've had every poke imaginable in the city. Usually the rice is like a rock and a little bit tough at other establishments. Here, they were even thoughtful enough to make sure there is seasoning at the bottom of the bowl so the rice is extra delicious. There is such a quality and variety to the additions: avocado, masago, everything is so good. Even the lettuce is crunchy and fresh. They were so so nice during the pick up too. Great place.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Got the tofu poke bowl and truly one of the best poke bowls I've had in NYC. So fresh and really packed in the rice and other add-ons. Sauce was so good as well. Will definitely be ordering from here again!!
I been going for the past nine months and the food is amazing!!! Very friendly staff and they remember my order each time. I wish I lived by a spot this cool in Brooklyn! Yay!!!
There's not one bad meal to have from here. Everything is always on point! Definitely my favorite poke spot in NYC. They're great with customizing toppings for the poke bowls. I appreciate them!
No comment
the best poke in the city!! we got the spicy salmon and miso tuna both were amazing will order again soon
No comment
No comment

The bowls are big because the protein to rice ratio is way off, LOTS of rice not enough fish. They were pretty cheap with the add-ons but at least the fish way fresh. Would've been better if there was less rice and more fish. Maybe ordering in person would work better here.
No comment

Simple NYC is a small mom-and-pop type of restaurant. There are two tables and a small counter to eat on. It is quite cozy with adorable decorations. The service is friendly and they offer Poké bowls, bento boxes, and bubble tea. The poké isn't the best but it is still quite tasty. They have a larger rice to toppings ratio than other places. The portion is large and the rice comes out hot. You may have to wait for it to cool down before digging in.

Spicy salmon poke always hits the spot. Would recommend. Also the steak bento box is worth it! Always great customer service!
No comment

No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Ordered the spicy tuna poke... didn't know what to expect since the pokebowl is not entirely customize-able but it came with avocado so I already knew it was going to be good. And guess what? The pokebowl was super delicious! High quality, fairly priced and filling, I recommend this place to everybody especially since it's conveniently located in Chinatown. Wait time isn't long either. Only downside is the limited seating but if you manage to get a seat like I did, you will enjoy the setting especially the cute decor. Definitely my new go-to poke spot!
No comment

I'm on a mission to find the best poke in the city and Simple is a strong contender. Very reasonable prices ($9.50 for a huge salmon bowl) and $3 for bubble tea. The thing I love about this place is that you get a huge variety of toppings included with your bowl, and there's a nice balance of creamy (avocado) and crunchy. They event let me substitute some of the toppings for ones I preferred. I'm looking forward to returning and bringing friends.
No comment
No comment
No comment

I've ordered poké bowls to go from this place. Decent but certainly have had others that are much better. I wouldn't mind coming back again for lunch if I'm truly craving poké though since it is in my work neighborhood.

One of those restaurants that you can go to and know you'll like every time, no matter what you order. Had the short rib bento and it was perfection. Would definitely recommend getting an extra order of egg salad, which was a steal at under $3. The people working there were friendly and great with explaining what the dishes were like.
No comment
Really nice poke. Good fish, tasty toppings, nice amount of flavor. It made me happy today!
No comment

Simple thank you for opening up! Poke bowls galore! Poke bowl you are dear to my heart.... Salmon, tuna, crab, octopus, tofu. All so yum. Salmon is my favorite. The Tonkatsu curry dish is humongous! Lunch for days, literally. All dishes around $10. Also they have siphon drip coffee, and teas with bubbles. The lemon mint kumquat is my favorite. Ambiance is cute and cozy. Not much seating available, enough for about 15 people or so. Definitely not good for groups. Owners and staff and super nice!

Came here for lunch today and got the king crab poke bowl. The portion size of the food is big however it's mostly rice ( your choice of white or brown or quinoa) The toppings are yummy and of good quality however mixed in felt like it was too much flavors going on. Had hard time differentiating what I was eating. Also the amount of King crab seem real little. The decor of the place is super cute though.
No comment

This is by far, and no offense to PokeBowl on 840 W 50/51st Street, the best Poke Bowl I have ever had. I have been here I believe twice or at least three times, and I have not been disappointed. My first visit was suggested by fellow gym-goers​ at Willyb Crossfit down on Grand Street. When I walked in, a young woman greeted​ me warmly and answered all of my annoying questions. The staff was even generous and allowed me to try one of the ingredients​ I was not familiar with. I got the Spicy​ Tuna Bowl with brown rice, seaweed salad, edamame, sesame seeds, dried seaweed, shredded carrots and mangos without the pickled radish (although since I've been there, they still put it in my bowl, but no biggie). Everything tastes fresh and is truly made with love, this is a tight space so if you're just strolling around the LES and are in the mood for a poke bowl; this is definitely the place you want to go to. They offer free tap water and their service is excellent, I've never seen the place messy nor have I seen anyone experience ​bad service. They also offer bento boxes and even offer octopus as the​ main protein, which is not something I have seen from a poke bowl​ restaurant. Definitely give this place a try, you will not be disappointed.

Another amazing poke spot to add to the list! It took a little while to get our food when dining in here, but the poke is delicious so it made up for it in the end. I had the Ahi bowl with brown rice. So good!
No comment

I would give negative stars if I could. Ordered a salmon bowl and it was a disaster. Rice was cooked like glue paste and it's entirely inedible. Used to be overpriced but okay. Worse and worse every time I order. DO NOT ORDER.

I don't understand the latest poke bowl craze (in NYC, Shanghai or CA), but I sure appreciate it since I'm from Hawaii and often get homesick for local island flavors. Served atop rice, quinoa or lettuce with all kinds of other stuff like carrots, cucumbers, wonton chips, avocado, etc is NOT the way I grew up eating poke, but that's almost similar to the new way me and my family have been eating poke for a fast, healthy lunch or dinner for the last few years (minus the wonton chips). Leave it to the mainlanders to innovate it! I love the vegan tofu bowl at SIMPLE. They are so generous with the seaweed salad, avocado, pickled daikon and tofu on mixed greens. SIMPLE is going to be one of my regular stops for fresh and healthy (and reasonably priced) bowls in NYC!

Such a cool small, hidden spot for food. Great tofu bowl as their vegetarian option. The staff was friendly and the food was great. I personally am not the biggest fan of asian foods doused in soy sauce and that was not the case at this place. The meal with light but filling, and felt pretty healthy overall. Not sure how long it's been open. But really would suggest this place to others.
Ppl who work there were nice and poke bowl was so good! Definitely come back next time.
I had the cooked tofu poke. This is an excellent option for those who would like a vegan option. The two women working there were very nice also .

Got the spicy tuna poke which was a simple delight! For its price, you get a decent amount of ingredients in your poke bowl. Fresh, filling and flavorful. It's a small, fast and casual dining place with a few tables if you choose to sit in, or you can order to go. Super friendly service. Worth coming back to try out the other items on the menu!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Simple is a small and friendly mom and pop poke spot in the Lower East Side but they are also going to open one in Brooklyn. (I passed by it when I was driving) The price point is reasonable and service is very good. I had the salmon poke and the king crab poke. It's good but not the best I had. The fish is fresh and they give a descent amount of fish and rice. They give a very small amount of avocado and you do not  pick out everything in your bowl. The poke is tasty though and they are not always busy. It's small inside but there are several seats but no bathrooms.

While I was looking for something light and easy digest, I came across this place through Yelp. The reviews seem pretty nice and the photos looked amazing so I decided to give this place a try. I got spicy tuna poke bowl ($10) and while it is definitely a lot pricier than most dishes in Chinatown, the portion was huge and healthier (less oily). I wouldn't say the fish was super fresh but it was definitely decent with other vegetables. I would come back if I'm craving poke bowl again!

i ordered take out, and my food was on time. i was greeted with excellent customer service! as for the poke bowls, they were amazing! i loved the organic tofu poke bowl, and i am definitely coming back. :)

This cute little place is an excellent addition to the neighborhood. Their poke bowls are absolutely delish! I opted for the spicy salmon poke bowl with quinoa this time around and it definitely did not disappoint. The fish was fresh and the bowl had a nice kick to it. The portion size was pretty sizable. I also had the ice matcha latte which was decent and not too sweet. Overall, this is a great place to grab a quick lunch or dinner.  I love the fact I can switch out the rice for healthier options! Not feeling raw fish? They have great bento box options as well.

Stopped in with my boyfriend for a Poke Bowl and a Bento Box. He had the chicken poke bowl and I had the short ribs bento box. Both were amazing and left us feeling satisfied. Will definitely be coming back!
No comment
:( ordered the poke bowl and it was probably one of the worst I've ever had. It was incredibly bland with stale toppings.
I'd say this has to be my favorite poke spot in NYC because there are a lot of different flavors in one bowl. The workers are very energic and friendly.

Up there for the best poke in the city! I've been a few times and am a big fan of everything I've had. Really reasonably priced, for poke. The service is fantastically warm and helpful, even when I'm pestering them about which bowls to get. My favorite is the spicy tuna with white rice base and wonton strips and sesame seeds for crunch. So good! This time I had the crab, which was delicious, though I'd still go for the spicy tuna if I had to choose. Great bubble tea as well. Love this place!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
NOT HAWAIIAN! Hawaiian food consists of lau lau, pipikaula, lomi lomi salmon, limu, kālua cabbage, huli huli chicken, musubi, pipipi, opihi, haupia, malasadas... and well its not on your menu!

My go to for poke bowls. The family that runs this place is literally the best ppl in the world. I don't come by often but when I do they always greet me with a smile and remember my order!! They are really sweet and kind. Once I was waiting outside with my daughter in a stroller cus the restaurant was busy during lunch rush hour, the owner came out with a cup of water for me to cool down with. Like seriously ....where else would you get that type of treatment??? ANYWAYS, back to their food. Their combos are amazing. I always get their salmon over half white rice half salad with wonton strips as my "crunch" whatever they put in it is CRACK. Love love love this place ! Wish I could give them more than 5 stars

This isn't my first time having poké, I have a good idea how "good" poké should be like. I can say this place lives up to my expectations. From nice employees to great food. Everything here deserves a 5 star review. You wouldn't know until you try it :) so go try it!
No comment

I found this new little gem while in the neighborhood, and it didn't disappoint! I was so excited to see a poke place in the area. I stopped in on a Friday around 8pm to find the little cozy spot filled with customers. I ordered the salmon poke bowl ($9.50), which was a great deal and the cheapest considering all the poke places I've tried out in the city. The people running the place are super friendly, and brought out my food and even asked for feedback. The salmon tasted fresh and all the toppings worked well with the bowl! Although you don't have a choice of toppings, the pre-set toppings are perfect accompaniments. They also sell bento boxes. When I'm in the area, I will definitely be back!
No comment

Clean, delicious, light, and refreshing... But don't misenterpret light for small portions. Perfect portions! I had enough to take some for a snack later! So so so so so good. If you are seeing this, look no further. You must stop here.
No comment

Simple has amazing jasmine milk tea, super creamy and light (not too sweet). I had the Ahi tuna poke bowl and it's pretty good, huge portion. Simple is a good place for milk tea and poke bowl!!! I will definitely come back for more.

Freshest crab meat quinoa avocado salad I had, home made salad dressing limey sour with spice - definitely original and refreshing.  To die for egg salad : simply good organic eggs with truffle salt.  As for the pan seared cooked salmon - value for monies - tasty x9 top ingredients fusion with lotus root, citrus miso, edamame and more.  Will visit again for sure!

Shit maybe $13 can buy you happiness. I love the food, good portion competitive price, and they have water available in the fridge. Pretty quiet and cozy too. Good vibes. They have vegan options. I just moved nextdoor and can see this becoming a go to
No comment

This place is AMAZING!!! The spot is cute and cozy, the food is delicious, the portions are large and the service is very nice and friendly. I really love it! The teas se also all delicious and addictive! I highly recommend This place. I've gone out of my way to go pick or eat there more than once. The spicy tuna is  awesome!
No comment

Great poke bowls I got the salmon bowl. Gave me a choice of rice, brown rice, quinoa, and salad. The bowl was packed with fish, avocado, and seaweed. They also have a great variety of Japanese dishes which I want to try next time. The lady in front was so pleasant and really made you feel welcomed. They also served bubble tea for $3, which was refreshing. I definitely recommend this place.

Come here every now and then. Great customer service and are always so kind and polite. I order the Salmon poke bowl and their poached shrimp poke bowl. All of their ingredients are very fresh.they also have Yuzu or plum soda which are very refreshing and goes well with the bowls. Their space for dining are limited but there are parks near by.
No comment

Small little shop. Food is delicious! Had the spicy salmon and ahi tuna poke bowl. Everything was full of flavor. We ordered taro bubble tea too which was good! One of the chef's came out to ask us what we thought about them. She was SO nice and informative. Definitely coming back next time we are in the area.
Omg!! I'm so lucky to find this place. Got a salmon bowl today. Fresh, yummy, juicy and colorful! Love the brown rice option. Will definitely come back!!
Poke... that unique mix of sushi and salads.  Has never disappointed.  Never packed, yet turn over is consistent.  Happy customers is all I see.  Staff is amazing.  The dishes are healthy!
No comment

Not the best poke bowl place I've been to but it's cheaper compared to the others. They already have a set of what should go in the bowl, all you have to do is choose what meat and topping you want. I got the salmon bowl. Does get me full but I wish they put more meat or avocado in mine.
No comment

What an amazing little gem in Chinatown. We had an exceptional experience. The quality of food is top notch. A little small inside but well worth it and not to mention a wonderful family ran business. I highly recommend the spicy salmon dish along with the tofu.

Simple uses amazingly fresh and unique ingredients in their poke bowls. I get it almost weekly for lunch and never had bad fish once (rare in the city) ... The ailoi dressing is so good and they allow for substitutions if you ask nicely!

The poke here taste very fresh. It's not an assembly line like most places. You order at the counter and wait about ten minutes and you get a fresh bowl of poke. I tried the octopus and the ahi tuna. Both are good and well seasoned. Prices are also reasonable. The ahi tuna does appear to be seared tho. And the bowl is filling. I also like how the fish is not drench with sauce.
No comment
No comment
The woman at the counter is so kind! And of course the bowl was amazing but I wish there were more salmon chunks.
No comment
No comment

Tried Simple for lunch. We had the Spicy Tuna Pokebowl and the Octupus Poke. Fresh and delicious. Will definitely come here again. $10 a bowl seems pretty reasonable. It also looks like they have good coffee options.
No comment
No comment
Love chicken Katsu, poke spicy tuna, poke salmon, and special poke shrimp cocktail;) yum yum!!! This place is MUST try!!!

This restaurant did not disappoint all the rave about their pokebowls! Have been here a few times in the past when they served katsu and was great back then as well. The spicy salmon pokebowl was filling and has a lot of complimenting flavors when mixed. Finished the entire bowl with no leftovers because it was soooo good. Cannot wait to return for another meal!
Nomnomnom delicious poke! Staff are so nice and genuinely friendly. I love that they have cold tap water in bottles available.... What a great idea. Kid-o loved the bubble tea.

The price for the actual pokebowl was comparable to other poke places but the serving size was more generous than pokeworks. I prefer how at pokeworks you're allowed to choose what you want to add and can have more proteins but the preset menu here was pretty good too. The food was very good quality and the price of the bubble tea was also cheap compared to places like kung fu tea. I'd come back again!
Live in the neighborhood and the is probably my favorite spot to eat alone. Love their spicy salmon so much.
No comment
I would come here for lunch everyday if i could! Love the food, drinks and the owners are so nice!!!

New fave place in the neighborhood. Quick, healthy, and delicious. I especially love how you get to choose your base. Most poke bowls come with the standard white rice option, but here you get to choose! Either salad greens, quinoa, brown rice, or white. Tried the ahi tuna and spicy tuna poke with salad base and both were incredible ^.^
Best poke I have had in NYC. Extremely fresh and the owners are super kind! Would definitely recommend.

The best poke bowl in NYC!!! Their spicy tuna and jumbo shrimp with red quinoa is amazing. Everything is super fresh and tastefull. Space is small but cozy. Staff/owners are very friendly. Will definitley come back many times.
No comment
No comment

When Yelp points you some where, I have found that their recommendations are often times full-proof. Case in point, Simple NYC was on a list of "The Best 10 Poke near East Village" and it just so happened that it was right near the many errands I ran with my parents today. We walked in around 2:15, and were treated to delectable Poke that makes my mouth water just thinking about it.  We tried both the ahi tuna and spicy tuna, one with fried wonton wrappers and the other with sesame seeds over a bed of warm brown rice. Texture is the name of the game in Poke, and Simple NYC certainly brought some serious flavor as well with this humble dish. I would suggest trying Simple if you are on the Lower East Side and craving something healthy, but also indulgent.

Friendly service, generous portions, clean, delicious food! I got the organic tofu bowl with half rice, half greens for my base. I stay in New York often for work and found this place because of the positive reviews on Yelp and proximity to my hotel. Will absolutely recommend and return.
No comment
Very good! Great addition to the hood. Fresh, well prepared, delicious and all the 5 star yelp reviews reflect this.

The place is pretty small, which means you might not be able to find a seat, but don't let that deter you. The food here is delicious, fresh tasting, and probably my favorite poké place in the city. The staff are very friendly, and the place has a warm mom & pop feel to it. I've only had the raw fish poké bowls, but next time I might try something a little different... maybe a hamburger bento box?

This was delicious and deceptively filling. They have not just white rice, they have brown rice and qinuoa! Fancy :3 lots of different kinds of bowls. Recommend the salmon bowl. Definitely coming again!
Highly recommend! Foods are so fresh and delicious! Great service! Really like the decoration and hand drawing chairs!!!
My new favorite place in Chinatown! Super friendly and welcoming staff, soothing atmosphere, and FANTASTIC food!

Went down in quality. Extra greens still the same amount of sauce. That is a very dishonest way of doing business. I am a long time customer since 2016. Find another place for poke bowl, you might pay a few extra dollars but it's worth it.
No comment

The portion of my chicken katsu is huge!! and everything is fresh and yummy. I can tell the food is cook with care. The price is just right! I absolutely have no complaint except that they should have the royalty stamp since I will come back often!

Compared to several places in NYC and especially LA, Simple NYC is overrated. Smaller portions of fish, and few toppings in comparison to vast arrays of interesting and refreshing poke places in NYC and LA, and heavy reliance on rice and dressing (spicy salmon bowl) to make it fill you up. We didnt enjoy nor find the reasons for high reviews. Friendly service for the stars.

Got the Salmon Poke with a base of brown rice and sesame seeds on top--the perfect meal! Great blend of flavors, really fresh, and the small indoor space of the restaurant is relaxing. Best poké I've had so far!
Very good spot I got ahi tuna bowl which was  very reasonably priced for what you get, the seaweed salad was epic in the bowl, and it only cost me 12 dolla holla!
Well priced, great portion and really delicious. The staff were also very nice. This is currently my favorite poke restaurant in NYC.

Had the salmon poke bowl with fried noodles and the steak of the day. I would normally not go to chinatown for sushi but I was surprised at the quality of the food. I was surprised how much better the poke bowl tasted with warm rice, but there were generous pieces of raw salmon and garnishes like guac, seaweed and masago. The steak of the day was well cooked medium, tender, marinated in soy with rice and other sides. Overall a solid place for lunch and pre party meal as it's open until 10pm. At 8pm on a Wednesday there were still people coming in for a bite. Its a small place, but the service was friendly and the place was clean.

There was a man on the stoop of Simply NYC and said, if you're hungry, this place is the best. Just as this friendly prophet foretold, I was hungry, and it was the truly the best. The crab and salmon bowls were both delicious (no I didn't eat both by myself, thank you very much), the service was fantastic (shoutout to Betty) and the vibes were all good. All of the flavors and veggies were incredibly fresh and delightful. Best of all, it fills you up but not in a "Now I hate myself for the rest of the night" sort of way. Will definitely be back.
No comment

I discovered Simple NYC after my favorite poke spot (Great Wall) stopped serving poke bowls and boy am I glad I did! From the moment I walked in (after being hit by the door which is a little jenky), I was showered with positive vibes. The staff took their time and explained what each foreign ingredient was, customizing my very own poke bowl. The food was then brought right to our tables and proved fresh and delicious. I ordered a salmon bowl and my friend ordered a spicy salmon bowl. We were provided with complimentary water in a gorgeous pink bottle!! I will also note that I observed 5+ single men during my 30 minute stay. Can't wait to return to this charming and welcoming and delicious establishment!
Came here for first time before 12noon and 6 of us got the only large table there and placed our order and rest was history! Awesome menu and delish, colorful, healthy poke serving in Chinatown, LES.

The butter poached shrimp in the poke were perfectly cooked, and the flavor combinations of the different sauces and toppings were great. Staff were very friendly. This is a great spot to grab a quick bite to eat!

Favorite poke place! Always leave satisfied and full! Octopus is my favorite. The bad thing about this place is that you might have to wait a while for seats because the stores small with only one long and one small table. Theres also a little area with stools that can fit 2 customers next to the counter. But besides that, the workers are friendly and attentive. Food comes fast too. Give this place a try!

Awesome spot!!!!! Such great healthy food and fast and affordable. It's perfect!! I always get the vegan tofu bowl. It's a small cozy place but I  get take out so NBD. So glad it opened up right by my house!
No comment
Great poke ! Very flavorful . I'll be coming here a lot . They have healthy options ! Fish is very fresh !

With all the poke spots that have been popping up in NYC, I'm really glad one made it to the Lower East Side. Their bowls are very reasonably priced, around $10-14 for a filling meal. Service was quick and staff was friendly too. My boyfriend got the salmon bowl and I had the ahi tuna. We both enjoyed our bowls, but I do wish there were more than 3 slices of tuna in my bowl, especially compared to the mound of salmon cubes in his bowl. The tuna itself was seared well, but it was drowning in the aioli and I had to scrape it off in order to taste the fish. In addition, their bowls are preset and not customizable, so it was kind of frustrating because it came with ingredients I don't really like, such as beets, oshinko, and ginger. I think I would've liked my bowl a lot better if I could've customized it, like at other poke spots. Overall, you get value for your money here, but I probably wouldn't go out of my way to come back.
Absolutely love this place. So far have tried spicy tuna and the salmon poke and it's a great serving and very fresh. Also can't beat the price. Staff is also delightful!
I visited here last Monday on my lunch break. The food was delicious. We tried the salmon bowl and some fried wonton dumpling. It was perfect and the price was reasonable. I will be returning soon.

Wow, the Poke bowls are amazing, also tried the Salmon Bento Box, it's all ready getting busy here, soon the line will be out the door, I hope they can find a larger space because they will need one.  Food, service, price, innovation, 5 Stars all the way. NYC needs more places like Simple

Awesome bento boxes, really healthy and homey feeling. A bit on the pricier side considering the cheaper (and less healthy) food options nearby, but would definitely come again when I'm in the mood for some wholesome food.
Really good food.  Fast service.  Nice people.  Super casual.  I highly recommend this place for a quick dinner.

I'm a fan. The atmosphere was quirky even though the space was on the smaller side. I am in love with the poke bowls. All the flavors and toppings complemented each other. I like how that you can pick rice or salad. I got the salmon poke over a bed of greens and it was very good.

I have just eaten their ahi spicy tuna poke bowl with salad leaves. It was tasty and the veggies and fish were clearly v fresh but I thought it was way too salty and the sauce quite over powering so felt a little ill after. If they went more easy on the salt and sauce it would be perfect for me.
Clean and delicious. Makes healthy eating donnish more tolerable. The people are always friendly and nice. A gem in Chinatown! Love the cooked salmon bowl and bento!

Came here with my parents and we all enjoyed this quick, affordable, and filling meal! We ordered the fried salmon bento box, octopus on white rice poke bowl, and king crab on white rice poke bowl. High quality food, decent price, friendly service, and cute interior design will def bring me back again and again!
Best poké I've ever had. Fresh and healthy ingredients for a good price. Friendly service and homey environment with eye catching decor. I highly recommend this spot
Amazing poke place with the freshest poke ingredients and the kindest owners. Try their siphon coffee and desserts too!

I've been a little obsessed with poke lately, and having exhausted DC's poke places, I was excited to see what NYC had to offer. The shop is small, but bright and clean. When I arrived the place was packed and there was hardly any room to move. But by the time my order was ready, it had cleared out a little and I was able to sit. I ordered the standard ahi poke on quinoa, because I liked that they had more than just your standard rice offering. Unfortunately I wasn't really a fan of the dish overall. The ahi tuna wasn't raw, it looked like it had maybe been seared first, and it was cut into big slices instead of the little chunks I typically prefer. But what killed it for me was the sauce. It was mayo-based and way too heavy/oily for what should be a light dish. I just wasn't really a fan. For what it's worth, the presentation was really nice though.
No comment
So many delicious toppings and fresh tasty fish. Shop even has a little ukulele you can play in the shop. Try the entrees too. The seared tuna comes out nice and cool for a hot day.

The best poke I've had in a long time. Really fast and friendly service too! I got The raw salmon poke bowl, and it was really delicious and fresh, also the quinoa was super legit, and the lotus root was crunchy and well seasoned. I will definitely be going back to this place.

Delicious food, friendly and charming owners, cheery ambiance, and decadent surprises.  This is an incredible neighborhood joint that goes above and beyond.  I've been there way too many times and I can't find a single fault.
Their food is real good and not expensive! Ive tried their tofu bowl and hamburger bento and both were yummy.

I had a great dinner here last night. I got the salmon poke salad without edamame, and the fish tasted fresh. The salad was harmonious, and it was just a delicious, healthy meal. They also paid close attention to my shellfish allergy, which lots of restaurants don't, and they were very considerate of my needs in that regard.

Love this new place by my home. It's cute, homey and have delicious food. I ordered the Ahi Tuna Poke bowl with salad green and Jasmine bubble milk tea. So good. The Poke bowl have so many different toppings it makes it fun to eat. The bubble tea here is amazing. Everyone must try it. The staff here is super friendly. You can sit down and the staff will bring the drink and food to you. They started taking credit card which is a plus. Before it was paid only with cash. I love the cute stools and art on the wall. Everyone like the fat lazy cat stool lol. The cat pillows and ukulele near the window is so cute. Love this mini and cozy environment. Feels like home. I highly recommend this place for Poke bowls, bento boxes and bubble teas. Plus you get a free raindrop cake with your order. I came with sister and friend so we got two raindrop cake. The pear and Yuzu flavor raindrop cake. This place is always packed so try to get there early for a seat and enjoy your time there. Great experience when you in Chinatown.
No comment

I'm a huge poke fan, and this is my new spot!  Quick, fresh, healthy, and aesthetically pleasing to boot.  Plus at about $10 a bowl, it's very reasonably priced.  The spicy tuna is my favorite, but everything is great here, even the bubble tea.
Great food,service, price, good size bowls (probably a bit bigger than most places I've been to) would definitely go back!
Cheap and fast, and not too expensive!! So glad I found this little place. Ahi tuna bowl was fantastic!
No comment

My daughter and I saw many places for Pokebowls all over NYC and had to try one. The boys wanted Katz but we were craving something fresh. This place is close to Katz so while the men got a mile high pile of meat we got giant bowls of deliciousness. You get to pick a base of rice, quinoa, or greens then they add the protein (raw or cooked options) and then pick a crunchy topping like wonton or sesame seeds. You can eat in (it's very small, maybe 10 seats) or take it to go (there are parks nearby). We brought ours all the way back to Brooklyn and they were still fresh and great tasting. The owner packed our meals up with some packs of soy and spicy sauces. She was so nice!! She asked us where we were visiting from and when we told her Ga she said she wanted to expand to the south. I hope she does!! I will miss these awesome bowls. So glad we made the detour to get one.

This place is amazing!!! The food is superb and they make sure that you are happy with the food. I tried a new flavor of bubble tea for me and didn't like it but they were so nice and made me another that is to die for!!! Thank you so much!!
So delicious and refreshing! I had their king crab poke bowl and loved all the different ingredients they have going in there - will definitely be back!

Great poke for the price, easily beats all the other poke around that's a few dollars more and not as filling. Definitely get all of the crunchies. My favorite is the ahi tuna, I like that it's seared slices rather than cubes. The salmon is also tasty. I wish they had more places to sit, but I often go for pick-up on my way home from work, they're quick and friendly. The bubble tea is also tasty.
No comment
Great presentation,  fresh fish and a variety of toppings for a very reasonable price.  Wish they were open on Sundays as well!

Decided to finally try Poke (po-kay) and Simple was on my mind. The place is tiny, apparently family run, and a bit slow in the service department. That said, I found the Crab poke to be pretty good, basically a salad over quinoa (my choice of foundation) with crabmeat on top. Reasonably satisfying, but not overly exciting. The slow drip coffee was pretty good, but also seemed to take an overly long time to make. If you've got the time, and manage to score one of the few seats available, Simple is a pleasant enough lunch spot. You might actually do better with takeout, however, since those meals seemed to take priority over those being eaten on the premises.
I could eat here every day. The Poke Bowls are delicious, and the bento boxes are enough for 2 meals. Everything tastes fresh and the prices cannot be beat.

I love coming here. Food is delicious and staff members here are so friendly. I've been coming here almost every week because I work nearby. I can't get tired the food here at all. There's a lot of variety and different combinations of poke bowl but I always get the same one.

Executive chef and wife opened this neighborhood gem. Super tasty and healthy food. I had the butter poached shrimp poke bowl on quinoa. Can't wait to go back. The place is tiny and super cute. I also had the passion fruit green tea. Yum! Went there with my baby and they were so welcoming!

I love the service here. They have the 'mom and pop store' vibe! They're all so super friendly and can tell they cater to their customers every needs and only wants to make their experience better. The food is really delicious without the wait of hours like other spots! The decor inside is the cutest as well!! I hope they soon get more exposed to have more customers and hopefully open more shops!! good luck!
No comment
No comment

The best poke bowl I have had until now. Super fresh fish, crunchy veggies and quinoa. Sauce on the spicy tuna was delicious.  Staff was really kind and helpful. Will recommend this to everyone going to NYC.
The Pokebowl was amazingly good. I tried the spicy tuna and ahi tuna pokebowl and was given a good amount of portion each time.
No comment

stopped in this new spot today! the bento box was really good, the pickled veggies were perfect and the pork was light and crispy. jasmine bubble tea was yummy and the bubbles were a good amount of chew. and they have this cool coffee sitch where you choose your beans and then they use a method straight out of the lab serving up straight organic chemistry realness. also decor is on point with benches inspired by neko atsume and pokemon. will definitely be back to try the poke bowls!!

Their poke bowls are amazing and a whopper of a deal! The miso glaze that comes with all the bowls are just simply superb, with the perfect hints of miso, orange, and I think some teriyaki. I always get it with brown rice base and roasted sesame seeds. The salmon bowl is my favorite - it comes with a super generous portion of salmon, and all of the side ingredients play together playfully. I keep the ingredients separated, without mixing, and it feels like I get a whopping 2 meals out of 1 bowl. I also sometimes get the tofu too, and $9 may seem a lot but the bowl is just so much food. Definitely check this place out for the fish though. For the price, it's seriously a steal!

Stopped by here on a hot summer day after yelping what was good to eat in the area.  Ordered the salmon poke bowl and it was AMAZING.  Seriously, probably the best poke bowl I've had!  Service was a bit slow, but only because they didn't have much staff at the time I went.  The older asian lady at the counter (the owner?) was super sweet when I was ordering.  I am sad I don't live in New York or I would eat here all the time!
No comment

I've tried Organic Tofu Bowl and Loving it! All ingredients are so fresh. And the size of the bowl is huge. You also have choice on rice or quinoa. I cannot finish the whole bowl myself. It is a small place, better for to-go. Great option in Chinatown/ Lower East Side!

Really delicious poke bowls!! I had the salmon with quinoa (but there are a few different grain options), and it was extremely flavorful. Coming from the Bay Area I was seriously impressed. My family had an assortment of other dishes: tofu curry bento box, spicy tuna poke, and salmon bento box, and everyone was very satisfied with their meal!! The only downside is that it's a small place, but people are constantly coming and going so by the time our food was ready, we were able to get seats!!

Very solid meal! I mean you can kind of tell it's not "real authentic" Japanese i.e. the curry sauce was a bit off like mild or watery. I got the cutlet and that itself and the whole bento was good, fresh, and filling. Plus the lady was so nice and friendly!

Usually only leave reviews when encouraged by staff, but for simple, I'm doing it purely because I love this place! Been visiting this place for over a year now, and the food is consistently delicious - fresh and absolutely comforting. Am a huge fan of the cooked bento boxes (salmon and slow cooked ribs!) since I don't take raw fish. The place is cozy and the service superb - Betty, Roswell and the rest of the team are always warm and friendly. Already on my way to my 4th reward bowl; and I'm gonna keep coming!
The poke bowls are great and the prices feel fair. Decor is cute and service is friendly. Sometimes takes a bit to get your food but no worries!
Clean and bright space with fantastic poke bowls and bento boxes. Fresh and healthy combos. I tried the salmon poke bowl, which at $9.50 is one of the best deals in the area.
Just like their name Simple, but effective. The salad poke bowl is awesome especially with extra base. I'd say the only downfall is some stuff on the menu is not all year round.
This is one of my favorite places to get a pokebowl. It's tasty, fresh, and satisfying, for a great price. The bento boxes are good too--very large portions. Service is very pleasant. Can't beat it!
No comment

Wonderful atmosphere, friendly staff, and deliciously fresh ingredients. Best poke I have ever had. Spicy salmon is a delicious combination of fresh greens, beautiful fish, and perfectly cooked rice. Highly recommend.

A pop of color and a burst of flavor at Simple NYC. My boyfriend and I ate here as per the yelp reviews and were not disappointed. It's super close to the Bowery Ballroom so if you want to grab a bite before the show I would totally recommend Simple NYC. The restaurant is very quaint and small. Don't go there expecting to fit 50 of your closets friends. But a really sweet date idea for two or three. The staff was lovely and kept the restaurant pristine. The decorations on the walls were cute and colorful and added a happy, quirky aesthetic-for all the IG freaks it's very Instagrammable. Now, we both got bubble tea and pokébowls which were super tasty. The bubble tea is fairly inexpensive (about $3) and the taro bubble tea was definitely superior to the others. My Pokébowl was the lump crab meat ringing in at a solid $13.50. The price was appropriate for the quality food and the amount you received. The wanton "cruncies" were lovely as well all the fun veggies. The only downside to my experience there was that there are not a lot of veggie options. Maybe one or two if you don't want to order a bunch of sides as your meal. My boyfriend got the only vegan bowl they offered with quinoa, which was super tasty, but a bit disappointing that it was the singular option. So, to all my veggie friends out there maybe not the place for you (if you want variety) but if you're in the area I'd give it a try!
Need to try their taro bubble tea. The best in NYC in my opinion since the boss makes her own jasmine tea base. :)

I would highly recommend this place! I was craving for some Poke around Chinatown and found this place on Yelp. Food was simple yet delicious. The place felt homey and relaxed. Service was quick and excellent. We really enjoyed our dinner here. Will definitely come back again for more!!
Very fresh and delicious poke bowl. Ordered Ahui Tuna Bowl with quinoa and wonton strips.

Went here with my friends, food was AMAZING!! Forgot to give a review immediately but the person working there was very nice and helpful and truly outdid herself. I ordered a bubble tea and a bowl and the total was about $20, so not bad at all. Initially I thought my bowl was a little empty but it was actually a LOT of filling food, I had leftovers to take home. The place itself is very small but it's clean, cute, and there is a seating area. Overall, I really liked it and I will be visiting again. Would recommend it to a friend.
There were three of us at Simply, each ordered different items from the menu. We were very pleased. It was healthy and seasoned well.
No comment
Fantastic poké spot! Their spicy ahi tuna poké bowl was delicious and surprisingly affordable. The waitress is always pleasant and helpful. Will be coming back!
Amazing food every time, excellent service, and such nice staff. The poke is very fresh and the flavor pairings work perfectly. Love them!

My go to place when I want something quick and clean to eat especially in Chinatown. This "poke" bowl is a bit cheaper than the other places in NYC. They also give you a buttload of rice which I can't complain about. Only thing that bugs me about this place is the ordering process, they kept messing up my order and I placed it ten minutes before the people behind me. They apologized but come on, it happened on two occasions. :|

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: This place is consistently good. The staff are super friendly, the wait time is not that long, and they have a rewards program - claim 10 stars, receive half off a poke bowl. It's one of my go-to's for lunch.
Love this place! Come here all the time, just wish they were open on Sundays too.

Really great little poke spot. The staff is super nice and the decor is cute and fun-  perfect for a casual date or quick bite. The menu has different poke combos and is less a build your own spot, but the combos have everything you need and are a good size, high quality and really tasty!

Love this place! My husband has a been a huge fan since we moved to the neighborhood and today was my first time trying it. It's a warm cheery spot with a few seats and the woman behind the register was very kind and attentive. My husband had his go to spicy salmon bowl which was delicious and I went for the steak of the day which turned out to be a massive NY strip over rice and salad in a bento box. Perfectly cooked and very reasonably priced. One thing to note is that they sometimes run out of certain items by evening since it's clearly a popular spot. We'll be back for sure, wish they delivered!
my favorite poke spot. wish prices were cheaper because there are many other cheap eats around. will be back when i crave again.
One of the best place for a quick bite and delicious poke bowl. Everything on their menus are fresh and yummy. Also, they make really good home made iced tea I must order every time I go there.

I got the ahi tuna bowl with white rice and sesame seed toppings. Definitely a lot of rice. I found it odd that the rice was hot. I thought that would spoil the raw tuna. The flavors combined were nice. I also found the toppings a bit weird, especially corn flakes? Overall it was a nice flavor combo and big portion. Small complaint was the avocado was more like guacamole mashed up and sort of browning.

My favorite poke spot so far, good portion, fresh ingredients, tasty, reasonable prices, avocado included!! And super friendly stuff! I usually get the spicy tuna, the sauce is amazing; I've tried salmon and ahi tuna too, but spicy tuna is my favorite. My boyfriend loves the curry hamburger. Their bubble teas are pretty good too. Highly recommended!

I was looking for some poke restaurants around my job and I'm so glad I found this place.  I usually order their spicy salmon poke and their raw salmon is always fresh with no fish-y taste.  Compared to other poke places, their bowls are inexpensive and portion size is pretty big.
great tasting Poke, I loved that it's in Ctown. we had the Salmon and white rice bowl with Octopus, Ahi Tuna with quinoa, and Curry hamburg... everything was jsut on point! definitely coming back.

Great and friendly service.  Small but cute place.  Had the spicy tuna poke bowl.  Pretty good.  Lots of textures, flavors and a treat for the eyes to see all those colors.  Eat the rainbow.  Also had the Tonkatsu Curry bento.  Came with a potato croquette that was really good.  A small salad, steamed broccoli and cauliflower, and rice. The pork was really good the sauce may need a little something.
Happened to walk by when I was in the area for work and decided try it. The staff is so great and the poke style bowls were excellent.

I had Poke 3 nights in a row from Simple! It's simply delicious!!! Spicy Tuna (with white rice or with Greens) was my favorite but I tried Ahi Tuna last night and that was so YUMMY too!! I plan to try the Octopus tonight. What a wonderful and quaint little place just a block away from my home!

I tried this place for the first time today and I really liked it! It's the perfect place to hang and grab some food with friends. Plus they've got delicious pokebowls ready to go and the staff are very nice and friendly. Definite must try!

Have been looking for a Poke place that has reasonable prices with great food.  I have finally found one at Simple.  They use fresh and healthy ingredients in all the Poke bowls.  My first time there I went with the Salmon Poke with white rice, fantastic.  It isn't authentic Poke that you get in Hawaii but it works beautifully.  It has a combination of Asian cuisines/favors all rolled up into one bowl.My second time around I went with their special Miso Shrimp with quinoa and my wife got the Salmon Bento Box, both were great.  Each dish is definitely enough to satisfy your hunger. You can expect a little wait since each item is made to order, but it is well worth it.  Staff is friendly and willing to explain and/or provide recommendations depending on your diet. They are also looking to change some of the menu depending on the season and the best available ingredients they can find.  I'm looking forward to coming back again to try their other bowls and bento boxes.

I mostly only order the salmon bowl with wonton strips but I've ordered like 20 of them, I recommend you try it. The slow cooked short ribs look good but I haven't tried them. The tonkatsu curry portions are very large, but I recommend the salmon. There's not much seating though so its not good for large groups.

delicious, fresh, fair priced-- neighborhood gem! Have gotten the Salmon and the Tuna, both really really good-- The bubble tea is also delicious,  the lychee one in particular. Torn between wanting everyone to know about it so it never closes, and wanting no one to know about it doesn't get packed !!

Our table was "taken from outside from a garbage. It was felt like that. was not help to relax. Not all food was testy.  salad and seafood salad was from yesterday's party, I think. They r adding 10% service charge and also asking for tips explaining that the 10% is not a part of tips. Do I care of that?... I will not use this place any more.

Wow. Overall, really awesome food. We ordered the salmon and tuna poke bowls. Was surprised at how well the tastes and textures worked in the bowls. Just excellent. Siphon-for-one coffee and milk tea were also excellent.
Cute little place to take your lunch break. Had many food choices and also amazing drinks. The gentleman in the front was really nice, and overall customer service was one of the best!

Having not tried Poke before, I ordered the King Crab Poke Bowl with crisp wonton strips and I enjoyed it very much. The service was so friendly and accommodating that I was appreciative as I tried this new cuisine. The space is somewhat small so trying to find a seat can be a challenge. So why does this review only have four stars? I blame myself for that. I don't have anything to compare this Poke experience with. Was there too little King Crab? Was there too many vegetables? I don't know since this was my first Poke experience but it was a great gateway into this cuisine!

Pork katsu was pretty fresh as was their vegtables. The dishes overall were well made and tasty. The drinks were also pretty good. The only downside was the lack of seating and the cramped space. Other than that definitely coming back.
So delicious! Quick, friendly service, affordable, adorable space, fresh ingredients, not a single complaint. We got the spicy tuna poke bowl and it is really unique and tasty. Portions are good too!
great services, nice food, cozy environment

Place is alright. I think I've set the bar pretty high for myself by trying out Poke for the first time in Spinfish Poke House in Pasadena, CA, which is supposedly the original poke place that started the trend there... regardless, point is- I've only had poke one other time and that's the only comparison I have. I got the jumbo lump crab meat tuna bowl without aoli and it was nothing to write home about - the crab meat was good but the other additions like the masago, seaweed and pickled ginger were sparse and did not give the rice enough flavor to complement the crab meat resulting in a fairly bland dish to our taste. My friend got the spicy tuna and it was also just okay with similar reasoning, nothing outstanding. The servers/cashiers are super nice and friendly and bubbly and even though it's a tiny place inside, it's a very nice atmosphere to sit and enjoy your bowl. Try it out for yourself, maybe you'll like it :)
No comment

Loved Oiji in east village, so we were happy to celebrate our two year anniversary at their new joint. My husband messed up our reservations, but they kindly accommodated us and sat us at the bar. We also found out we were expecting around this time, so while I would house down all the raw items - I was a bit more careful. I will be making my way back here when we have our little one! Lovely dinner spot!
No comment

Korean food has come a long way very quickly in New York, from a niche cuisine to a mainstay alongside Italian, Thai and Japanese. For many years Jung Sik was only truly upscale Korean restaurant in NY, but now there is a lot of competition. Michelin-starred Oiji Mi is one of the newest with excellent service in a beautiful space. An cocktail menu centered on Korean ingredients are all very unique and wonderful. The food is excellent.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Excellent meal! We loved Oiji and went regularly so we're so happy Oiji Mi lives up to it. We did the tasting menu in the dining room and were not disappointed. Cocktails were great and stunning. The food was great. I love that you can choose from three options for every course which allowed us all to try multiple dishes. The oysters and Oiji bowl as well as the wagyu special were all stand outs. The service was friendly and put up with our questions and general nonsense. Lol. Loved the ambiance it is a beautiful build out. We will be back.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Came here on a Tuesday night with a 5pm reservation. The staff were very kind and attentive. There's complementary coat checks. The ambiance is suitable for date night or a small party. The food was great. It's a 5 course prefix menu. Just be mindful with picking out some menu items, there are extra charges with certain items. I highly recommend getting their ssam bo; the pork belly practically melts in your mouth. They also had a Wagyu dish that was their specialty so it was not on the menu but if you want it, it will be additional $66 (worth it in my opinion). For third course, the uni bowl and abalone jook had amazing flavors. I was surprised with how delicious the jook tasted. For fourth course, the Wagyu steak and duck tasted great.

There are much better Korean prix-fixes out there (Jua, Kochi, etc.) and Oiji Mi just disappointed. The only good dish was the one with shrimp + uni because uni can make any dish delicious (as long as it's not spoiled or gone bad!) but the credit is more on the ingredients than the dishes themselves. Oysters were a good pick too and servers were nice and informative, but none of the dishes really stood out.
No comment

delicious!!! I was so happy with my visit to Oiji Mi. We got the five course menu for $145pp. The wagyu dish was an additional $15 and the oiji bowl was an additional $25, so it adds up. Regardless, all of the food was delicious, service was great, and the interior was beautiful. It's a modern and unique take on Korean food. My favorite was the oiji bowl and bo ssam --definitely get these!! And if you're looking for a drink, the Coniferous flip cocktail was amazing :) Will be back!
No comment
No comment
