No comment
No comment

The famous oiji bowl with uni & sweet shrimp was def a highlight! the savory + sweet combo with seaweed rice was so flavorful and warm. And the oysters were the FRESHEST i've had in years! The wagyu reminded me of galbi-jjim and felt like home. The chilled lobster ramen was such a creative take on ramen and had the most delish egg volk sauce. And the honey persimmon yogurt milk bingsoo was a refreshing way to end the meal!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

came here w couple of friends on a weeknight and sat on the bar, we ordered couple of rounds of cocktails w raw bar and bossam, the oysters were fresh and delicious, bossam's great, the flavor and the presentation!  the cocktails are creative but lacks the kick and whiskey based drinks. the service is wonderful, even at the bar! I'll probaby return for full dining experience at the main dining hall.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Oiji Mi is the sister high-end restaurant of Oiji.  Do be prepared to divert from the price set on the prix fixe menu as there's several supplement fees and great drinks here.  However, this is not a casual restaurant in my eyes so the price "at the end" is justified.  I went as a party of five so we all ended up trying the other one's dishes.  With this being said, I can honestly say that you can't go wrong with any of the options that Oiji Mi gives.  However, my personal favorites would include the wagyu and gruyere donuts.  All in all, Oiji Mi deserves all the accolade it receives and I would definitely return for a special occasion.
The food is solid but you definitely come for the atmosphere. Super cute design, clean bathrooms, and all the staff members I interacted with were very friendly and accommodating.
No comment
No comment

Absolutely incredible from start to finish. I was visiting the city for the weekend, and out of all our meals, this was by far the best! The service was outstanding. The perfect combination of professionalism, not hovering but always available. Now to the food...everything was amazing. I think my favorites were the bo ssam, lobster ramyun and black bass but I would eat every dish again. The decor was also fun and modern yet elevated. By far one of my new favorite restaurants.
No comment

Please ignore the names I put down for the dishes because I can't remember any of them. But the food was amazing! Michelin star well deserved! The cuisine was elevated korean food and to didn't disappoint!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Our experience at Oiji Mi was our favorite dining experience in NYC! We opted to book a reservation in the lounge area as we weren't up for the full tasting menu and I'm honestly very glad we did. The ambiance in the lounge/bar area was much more laid back and relaxed than in the main dining area which was a bit noisy. We also received fantastic service throughout the meal. We started with the Oiji Mi version of an Old Fashioned, the name escapes me at the moment. But it was beautiful with an ice cube that had the restaurant logo on it. We also shared the Oysters and Pork Belly for 2 plate which was absolutely amazing. It was such an interesting combo but it worked SO well. Scrumptious. For dessert, I asked if they had an espresso martini on the menu and the waiter recommended the secret menu Exospresso Martini which was the best espresso martini I've ever had in the most beautiful hand blown glass coupes from Japan. Everyone around us commented on how beautiful the glasses were. They will set you back $45 each martini but well worth it in our opinion. A lavish experience that we thoroughly enjoyed on our first date night of 2023 and our last dinner in NYC.
No comment
No comment
Outstanding food and service. The staff are so attentive and the entire experience feels seamless.
No comment
No comment
Outstanding service and food. The prix fixe menu was incredible and the cocktails were great too. Highly recommend.

It was OK. Nothing to be raved about.. ok food but nothing really stands out.  Flavors ate forgetful. They're not bad. But no Michellin star quality nor the service. Friendly servers but not superb. Host dud not pull out the table while guests are trying to walk by the narrow space between the tables when we were shown to our table.

Made a last minute reservation and we were just wowed with the service and especially the creative Korean cuisine. Our server was wonderful. The tasting menu was truly delicious. Loved it so much we made another reservation for our upcoming anniversary! A Korean culinary delight. Bravo

Drinks, first course, and second course was good. Then everything went downhill. The waiter gave a stank face when I said I did not want another bottle of sparkling water. I get that their main goal is to up sale but I was genuinely debating if I wanted another bottle of sparkling water or a bottle still water. The soup tasted stale and sour. My partner took a couple spoonfuls of the soup and stopped eating. The waiter never bothered to ask if something was wrong. Instead he said " you guys must be too full" and took away the dish. I was beyond speechless to evens say anything. My wagyu kalbi came very thin and the outside layering tasted burnt. While all the photos on yelp depicted a thick cut of meat cooked medium/ medium rare. The waiter never bothered to ask how I liked my meat cooked to start. We spent about $550 with tip and that is not a cheap price. That night, my partner and I took turns using the bathroom. Will not be returning.
No comment

Was able to make a same day reservation for this place on a Friday night, first time trying a Michelin starred Korean restaurant. We ordered the 5 course tasting menu, the bosamm platter was amazing, never had oysters along with pork belly before but it was a great combination for the bossam! The first course with the scallops, beef tartare, and pumpkin soup were also very delicious as well! Was really happy to have tried this place, would definitely come back here again!
No comment
No comment
No comment
Amazing experience from start to finish! Everything we ate was perfect. Definitely get the Oiji Bowl.

Gorgeous room, beautiful food, wonderful service. Extremely enjoyable experience. My only very small grumble is that I wish they exchanged or replaced silverware between courses; these are beautiful shiny utensils, and show their usage from first course to second course to third course. And then for the fourth course they brought out additional utensils for the land animal protein, and there were utensils everywhere on the table.
Pretty good but underwhelming. If you're looking for Jungsik experience I would say this is like a lower end version of that. I enjoyed my meal overall. If I could do 4.5 stars here I would.

Best Michelin experience I have had yet. When selecting my entree each course, I asked our server what he recommended and my entire table was jealous of my meals the entire dinner! Everything was absolutely delicious and unique. The cocktails were tasty and the restaurant was such a nice atmosphere. I would 100% go again.

Came here for a birthday dinner and it did not disappoint! I would say the only thing that wasn't up to par was the atmosphere, it's very loud and tables are packed quite close. We also had a kid at the table next to us who was watching videos out loud on an iPad and banging glasses together which was not a great experience... However, to the most important part - the food was great. I thought the appetizer was interesting with 3 different things to try vs. a pick one even though the portions were small. We wanted to try no additions on this menu to see if we were full and I would say about 80% or so if you have a good appetite so don't come starving! Some favorites were the pan fried fish in a delicious broth, the jook and the lobster ramen.
No comment

You know this is popular not only when you see posts on social media influencers you follow but when you actually see your friends posting this place on social media. The price recently went up from $125 to $135 for a 5 course meal. The reservations were pretty easy to book on RESY but the place actually looked full. The interior looked very modern and the food was all beautifully presented. Service here was exceptional from beginning to end. For the first course, you get all three options: oyster, beef tartare and fois gras which they suggest you eat in that order starting with the oyster. For the second course, we picked bossam for 2. Very filling and the combination of all the ingredients oyster, sides and pork belly wrapped in the cabbage was delicious. For the third choice, we picked the Oiji bowl ($20 supplement)which was raw shrimp, sous vide egg yolk, uni over seasoned rice. Mix it together. This was very fresh and tasted like the sea. For the fourth course we picked the sea bass which was served with fried calamari, semi cooked squid and scallop, clams with a truffle seafood broth. The broth was delicious-everything was delicious but we found the squid a little off and not too fresh. We also picked the wagyu galbi served with carrots, cauliflower over a mash potato purée. This was very well prepared. For the final course we picked the bingsu, so refreshing. As suggested we had the ice part drenched in condensed milk first and added the strawberries to it afterward. So yummy. We also ordered the chocolate mousse with passion fruit ice cream.
No comment
Great food, great vibes. All the food was great, but imo the oiji bowl was better than the lobster ramyun. Note: the lobster ramyun is not a hot dish!

Nice experience overall. The service is amazing and our server was very eloquent and set the tone of our experience. The food and drinks were good but only the sea bass really stood out for me. I could tell each dish the chef put a lot of thought into it but its hit or miss.  Overall a really nice restaurant.
No comment
No comment

column3: Downtown Jersey City, Jersey City, NJ
column6: My girlfriend and I came here last night and it was amazing. The portions were small but delicious. This was the first time she's been at a fine dining establishment that also had a sommelier. It was great learning the history of some of the wines and why there were to be paired with whatever we got on the menu. If we had more time, we would have loved to stay to order more off the menu.

One of the most memorable dining experiences ever.  Creatively prepared, wonderfully executed and delicious without being ponderous.  On top of the food, the service was stellar. I was amazed by their interior as well. I already made a reservation for next week and look forward to trying their other dishes
No comment

5 courses fixed price dinner, with very extensive drink menu. The owner/chef Brian Kim greeted us at the table and made recommendations on foods and drinks and answered any questions that we might have. Very beautiful restaurant, with gender neutral bathroom. Love their Jo Malone diffuser in each individual toilet stall. The environmental, friendly, reusable cotton napkin to dry your hands after washing is another plus. Very hard to make reservations, especially for parties more than 2.
No comment
No comment

I cannot say enough how amazing the entire experience was.  From start to finish, the ambiance, food, drinks, and service far exceeded my expectations. Our server, Daniel, was hands down one of the best servers I have ever had. He was extremely knowledgeable of every item on the menu, extremely attentive, and went above and beyond to make our visit absolute perfection.  Each dish was carefully curated, and it's obvious that kitchen takes the utmost pride in every plate that comes out of the kitchen.  Each cocktails was creative, well balanced, and extremely aesthetically pleasing.  Oiji Mi is definitely a MUST if you are in the city!

The interior and the presentation of food + drinks are all really pretty! We came here to celebrate my girlfriend's birthday and both of us throughly enjoyed every single dish. Great price point for such a high-quality dining experience. Highly recommend!!

A perfect dining experience. Owner/Chef Brian Kim is a wizard. The exciting menu includes many wonderfully thought out and excellently executed dishes with exciting ideas about how we eat now, while embracing a love for tradition. In a word, delicious. The service and hospitality are impeccable including a warm greeting when we entered, a creative and well informed sommelier and staff that made sure our meal was memorable.
No comment

phenomenal. gorgeous. scintillating. one of the my favorite places in 2022! the ambiance is beautiful, the food is top tier, the service is amazing. if you're my Yelp friend reading this review, just come -- you will not be disappointed.
Definitely one of the best dinners I had in NYC. Great vibe, food and service. Will be back shortly.
Went there for our anniversary. Enjoyed the food and drinks. The cocktails were really good and the service was prompt. Would come again.
Was excited to try the place food looked really good. But $500 dollars later I had horrific food poisoning afterwards.... Think it was the oysters. I guess with raw food you always run your own risk.

Had dinner in 9-2022 at lounge.  Fantastic foods with great service! Our server Chris was very knowledgeable and friendly.  At lounge, we were able to order a La carte.  There are about 5 lounge seats only. (At the main dining room, a course meal is offered.  But give many choices, I think it is fine) 3 of us ordered about 10 dishes and 4 deserts.  Our favorites are scallop, grain salad, sea urchin rice, bass, and lobster noodles.  The favorite is the bass. Their dishes are relatively small(except bass this) but very high quality.  All 4 deserts we tried were fantastic!  This is probably the best Korean fusion around flatiron area.  Hope to go back soon!

gave this place a try and was one of the few restos that was doing an xmas eve tasting.... (not gonna lie, it was one of few places still available) -- so I kinda had no choice but being a michelin star, i stuck with it... very chill spot, and the ambiance was nice... kinda felt segregated though as I was seated at the bar , which was ok cus I was a solo diner but the dining table was behind the bar so it felt as if it was just me and whoever was at the bar - were the only people at resto.... tho when u go restroom, its when u see a big dining area with lots of guests.... anyways, at 195$ ... for a 5 course tasting menu - Ima say it was borderline worth it... would I reco it? Probably not , considering there are other places that might be more "worth it" in my opinion... However, dont make me stop u from trying it. I did enjoy the food, I just maybe felt - it wasnt up to par from other places I been to.... id definitely be back but for other stuff on menu, rather than the tasting menu - staff was great too... blonde asian lookin bartender was cool as well... check em out.
No comment
No comment

Beautiful restaurant! The design and ambience were probably my favorite part of the experience. Ordered a la carte so can't speak to the tasting menu. The Oiji bowl was good but nothing spectacular. The black bass was OK and I wouldn't necessarily order again. The lobster ramen was fantastic. The duck is a must and was my favorite dish.
Best new restaurant this year. Creative food, attentive service, fantastic drinks and wine list.

I had COVID and was unable to cancel the reservation within 24 hours- the restaurant charged $150 fees. We called back and asked to reschedule or a restaurant credit so we can come back, but the lady was so rude, condescending and started lecturing us. I have been to OIJI so many times, but I guess kindness is out of service here!
Amazing cocktails. I especially liked hot girl summer which came with an ice pop. The food was great as well.
No comment

Unreal experience. Worth the hype... cold lobster pasta was amazing. Also the galbi was delicious. We tried all desserts and they were good as well. Cocktails are delicious. The spicy mezcal one was the table favorite

Its unfortunate when a new front of house staff forgets their purpose is customer service and not policing their guests. My absolutely negative review has nothing to do with the food but everything to do with the terrible, rude, inflexible and condescending front of house staff at Oiji Mi. I arrived early for my reservation because my guest had to catch an earlier flight. That change was admittedly on us!  We were told they could accommodate the change only to be told 15 minutes later that we had to wait for our allotted time, which we could not do. We asked to sit in the front or bar but no can do. No big deal. We get it. Things changed. We will just go elsewhere!!  We were then asked to "sit down and wait for our time" at which time our table would be ready!  it was as if they were not hearing us. Fast forward this was all chalked up by them to a "miscommunication" but it was nothing of the sort. We left only to be charged $100 for a "no show!"   I returned to clear up what I thought was a mistake only to discover it was very much their intent to charge me for what they interpreted as a "no show and cancel". It was sad to me to realize that this new restaurant in my neighborhood would not be another friendly place for me to visit frequently as the front of house had no interest in trying to be flexible and accommodate its customers (or just say "sorry we can't tonight" and move on) but instead are inflexible clock watchers standing ready to press the "charge" button on Resy (first time ever for me!) rather than create a welcoming NY dining experience. They Completely Missed the point, created a stressful experience that I will never risk repeating. Book it but don't dare be late! They will make you feel bad and will absolutely not be kind or accommodating. All if this was avoidable. They could have let us walk out and be done but their decision to charge us Ed's purposeful and pathetically punitive. Yawn.
No comment

Everything is amazing at good thanks from the food to drinks to there customer service and staff amazing def will recommend.. 10 out of 10 !!!laura is the best bartender beautiful soul wonderful drinks and so friendly she's amazing come see her for the best expresso's you ever had .....
Came for date night dinner and loved the food & drinks. Really, really excellent. One of the waitresses was super on top of it, the other one was kinda lost - but hey, new york service, amiright?

Maybe my review is a bit slanted because their curry chickpea scramble is my favorite breakfast in NYC so hopes were high. The lamb ragu was unfortunately really bland, but the Caesar salad was great. I'm willing to give it another shot as I'm such a fan of the breakfast, hopefully it was an off night.
No comment
Just opened in the neighborhood. The b-fast sando is god tier. Will be back for more!
No comment
Why have you cancelled my order??? My disappointment is immeasurable, and my day is ruined.
AMAZING!!! Dinner, drinks, service - all around great experience. Our favs were the lamb ragu, the steak frites AND the celery martini - so we good wanted a pitcher. See ya soon, Good Thanks!
No comment
No comment

The two friends that took me here at one point were eating here every weekend. And I can see why! The veggie benedict was one of the best I've had - the egg ran perfectly and the hollandaise sauce wasn't too pungent which I often see at brunch spots. The goat cheese fig crepe was also very tasty. We all wiped our plates clean!
Place at slightly above capacity, kitchen is extremely slow. Sunday bartender treats people like she's doing them a huge favor --just overall unpleasant. Canceled and never going back.

Tried out this new spot in Wburg last night. The atmosphere was really elegant and cozy, the servers were all very friendly, but unfortunately the dish that I ordered (hanger steak) was not great. Ordered the steak cooked medium and it came probably medium rare and extremely chewy. Fries were very good.
No comment

Tonight I stopped to meet the owner to set up a future brunch event. The owner is pleasant and accommodating. I truly enjoyed our chat. The French onion soup had great cheese pull and was so darn tasty. I ordered a salmon burger before I had the soup and really shouldn't have because the soup was so filling. I decided to taste the burger and fries even though I knew most of it would be dinner for the next day. Well my belly was so happy I did. I ended up finish off the fries. That salmon burger was seasoned to perfection. My compliments to the chef. The vibe was just right. They played great music you can chair dance to or get up and dance. I'll definitely be back. Oh the waiter was super cool and made me honey mustard and gave me creme brûlée to try. I gave him a great tip to show my appreciation.
No comment
No comment
No comment

We had such high hopes for this well decorated new spot. Typical drink menu. $10 happy hour beers. The food was just disappointing. The burger was just too small of a patty on an oversized bun. The creamy chicken pasta was more like something we could have cooked at home. And the steak tartare was great. It feels unfortunate that otw home everyone was saying how great the fries were. Not the entrees. Not the drinks. Sad but true. Hope to come back maybe next summer and give it another try.
Best meal I've had in a while! I had the mussels, crab cakes, camembert coulant, and two of their specials tuna tartare and steak. Every single thing was delicious!
No comment
No comment

I was very excited to try Bistro So as I loved their previous restaurant, unfortunately it did not live up to my expectations. Overall it was just ok for me, some items we ordered were better than others. The mezcal cocktail, Scallop Risotto special were both good but the French fries i have to say were incredible, salty but perfectly cooked and actually were the best part of the meal. But what was really disappointing and left me feeling super bummed was my highly anticipated order of the Beef Bourguignon, classic French dish that any French restaurant should nail. The beef was astonishingly dry and the opposite of tender, the accompanying mushrooms and carrots were obviously cooked separately (sad face), the lardon was non existent and I now wonder if the Beef was even cooked in the deep and rich stew that is supposed to Beef Bourguignon. Will I try Bistro So again? Maybe for brunch, but if they serve Beef Bourguignon like that I don't know if I can trust them to prepare a delicious classic French meal...(sigh)

The staff is really friendly. But the food is terrible. I ordered the steak tartare but it was simply inedible. They probably forget to add Dijon mustard? Anyways, go here for a soccer game but don't bother trying their food. It's "bistro so so"
No comment
No comment
One of my favorite restaurants in Brooklyn. Great service and owner. Enjoyed the pasta dish and salad last time I was there. We sat in the outdoor area which was lovely. Would recommend.

Charming atmosphere, delicious food! The music was perfect. Can't wait to go there for brunch. We had the mushroom risotto, mesclun salad with shrimp and tried to get the truffle fries, but that was forgotten, no big deal. Everything else was spot on.
No comment
No comment

Always perfect. Great place to walk in at the spur of the moment for cocktails and a great meal. The love the owner has put into this place is palpable, the staff is great, and the space is gorgeous. Food is exactly what you want it to be. Great steak, great, happy hour, too!

I was recommended by a friend to try this place. I had been looking at the menu and planning when to go. I sat outside in the back and enjoyed the foi gra, escargot, steak tartare , burrata and more . The ambiance was beautiful and made me feel like I flew to france . Every dish was tasty and just right. I ended with the creme brulee which was perfection.  And the bartender made me an espresso martini for national coffee day. The service was friendly and made me feel at home from the hostess to the busboy food runner waiter all attentive and helpful.  I can't wait to return with friends and share this amazing experience.  Best of luck

This place is everything! The food is divine, the drinks are divine, and the staff is divine. Also, it's female owned and that's a big deal for me. We adore a female owned local business. Watch me become a regular at this lovely place! :)
i lovvve this place! great staff. menu and vibe! stellar wine list and authentic french food.
The food is amazing and the service was perfect. Everyone there is so sweet and all of the food we had was incredible. I highly recommend trying out Bistro So
We are sooo happy to have this new restaurant on our block! Amazing customer service and food. Excited to come back with more friends

My wife and I ate at Bistro So last night around 7pm. I will start this review with the positives. The ambience was wonderful, the service was great and the fries were delicious. We shared the beef tartare topped with a raw quail egg, and she had the oysters by herself. Unfortunately, around 10pm she started feeling sick and we rushed home. We couldn't get home fast enough and she became violently ill from food poisoning in the car on the drive home. Once home, she spent several hours sick in the bathroom and even chose to sleep in the kitchen to be close by. We've both had food poisoning before and it was the worst I have ever seen. I called the restaurant this evening to inform the manager of what happened so they could look into their food safety, and was clear we weren't trying to gain anything from this situation, we just didn't want anyone else getting sick. The manager (a woman whose name I didn't get) was not at all concerned and was adamant that my wife did not get food poisoning from their restaurant, claiming that you don't see symptoms until a day after exposure, which is untrue (you can become ill after as little as 30 minutes of exposure) and assured me that their food is incredibly fresh and wouldn't even consider the possibility that she got sick from one of the three raw dishes she consumed. We weren't going to leave a negative review as long as the restaurant agreed to simply look into the situation but their lack of concern and accountability deemed it necessary.

Highly recommend this french spot for breakfast or brunch if youre in Brooklyn. Very cozy place with friendly and accommodating waitstaff! The shakshuka was the best Ive had in a while and Ill definitely be coming again for breakfast
Great place, friendly staff, and the food was awesome. I would definitely recommend coming for dinner. Great date nice

This place is such a comfort! I fully agree with all the other reviews- amazing food, amazing drinks and delightful staff. We had the cod, the escargot and the steak frites and everything was perfect. So glad to have this place in the neighborhood!
Amazing food, ambiance, and most importantly, amazing people. On Thursdays they also have live music that is a completely different experience and super inviting and intimate
Wonderful spot with great vibes, food and drinks. A little taste of Europe in NY. Everything is great here!!

As someone who grew up in Belgium and frequents France often, I have to say this place nails true authentic French cuisine in terms of taste and atmosphere.  The ownership is hands on, service super friendly and makes you feel welcome in a way that is just perfect.  When you want that nostalgic feeling of travel or another world, they really set the stage and deliver. Thank you for such a nice pleasant evening.  We used to frequent Pates et Traditions and happy you have this new space for your new adventures in Williamsburg...see you soon!

Everything you could want in a local bistro; great appetizers and entrees, a variety of great cocktails and wine, and most of all, the ambience. Not only is the location itself gorgeous, but the staff and patrons are a great mix of interesting friendly people. But if you want to keep to yourself and just enjoy the food that works too. Especially love the mezcal cocktails, the burger and steak frites. 10/10 will be back again.

This place is sooOo good. Honestly unreal. My favorite French place in Williamsburg closed down last month and have been dying to find a new place. Bistro So exceeds my hopes and expectations. Wine is so fresh, mustard chicken penne was fire as well as burrata and cod fish. I will try to come here every week but I'm afraid once more people know about it I won't get in. Anyway.. amazing place, great ambiance. Have nothing but positive things to say.
No comment

Got the strawberry tart to go and it tasted extremely fresh even after a subway ride home! Beautifully made and the sweetness of the custard was balanced out by the buttery cookie crust and tart strawberries  will definitely come back to try the other fruit tarts
Great dessert ,nice service (Wi-Fi provided!!!), beautiful environment. Highly recommended, great choice for taking a rest and take pictures! Listed as my new favorite weekly place for dessert!!!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

I've never actually visited Roam, but someone brought pastries from there to a party I was at, and now I think I'm going to have to go. The Lemon Shaped Dessert was divine, as was the gorgeous St. Honore Pistachio, but the Banana Paradice was my favorite because banana desserts get a bad rap and are rarely creative, and this ticked off both.
No comment
No comment
I decided to try this new place in the neighborhood. The decor inside is relaxing and cozy. The dessert was very pleasing aesthetically and not overly sweet. Definitely worth a visit.
No comment
No comment

So excited for a new dessert spot in LIC!! They're currently in their soft opening. My friend and I got the tiramisu Mille crepe cake and the gala apple shaped dessert, and they generously gave us samples of the ube chiffon cake. I thought everything was pretty good, but our favorite was actually the ube chiffon cake! It wasn't too sweet and was really well balanced. They had an event earlier in the day, so we didn't get their full selection, so I'll definitely be back to try the other desserts & drinks!
No comment

Fancy new dessert place in LIC! It's a nice place if you want to sit down for a chat too. I opted to go and I have tried tarts and Mont Blanc. It's around ~$10 per piece. The tart is fresh and light. Will plan to try everything
This is a very cute dessert spot located in a gallery! I picked up two fruit tarts and they were both very yummy -- not very sweet! Will definitely come back to try their other desserts.
Lots of delicious sweets and I love how they have artworks displayed! Saw one of my favorite prints by Murakami Takashi as well! Will definitely come back again soon to try the rest of their menu!
Very good dessert and nice service. Cool place for sit down and chill the arts  are amazing

The aesthetics of this cafe is clean and chic. Everything from the layout of the cutlery seems carefully thought out. We really enjoyed the fresh fruit pudding. We got the dragon fruit one, and we enjoyed how silky the pudding tasted. It was a refreshing treat!
No comment

Such a nice addition to the area. I really like the desserts and their deco. I visited this place with my wife and we had mont blanc and lemon shaped dessert. Both are fantastic and we can't wait to come back soon.
No comment

Not a bad place for a cute date , a bit on the pricy side as 3 desert and 2 drinks came out to around 50ish dollars ? But it was an absolute amazing take on the reconstruction of a fruit in desert form with actual fruit on the inside , service was great with the server personally placing each desert and drink in front of you , tho I do wish the place was a little bigger as it is kinda small  but anyway it's 10/10 would recommend , come try this new place !
The apple and lemon had something sour and icy in tbe middle that was a nice surprise. Both of the desserts were so cute and pretty.
Shitty quality and terrible customer service. I would avoid this place.
Great dessert spot with authentic flavors! Tried their Matcha Raspberry jar cake and loved it  100% would recommend for not overly creamy, overly sweet desserts!

Came across this cafe on the way to get bagels and had to go in to check it out. The walls are covered with artwork by Takashi Murakami. I got a hazelnut hot chocolate which was very flavorful. They have a selection of pastries, fruit tarts, coconut jelly and mousse cakes. There is plentiful seating by the front and on the side against the wall. I will definitely be back to try their desserts and coffee.
Really cute interiors, the desserts are so pretty. We had the coconut jelly, highly recommend!
Everything looks so pretty. The flavors are very innovative, I'm excited for this hidden gem to arrive in LIC!
The desserts are so good and packaging is pretty. I also like their coffee here! Great new spot

Went here on Saturday and got their Coconut Mousse cake and their Coconut Ube Jelly. The staff was super sweet, and the desserts were great. The coconut ube jelly was my favorite, but both were super good. The chunks of ube mixed with the coconut jelly was the best I've had in a long time

A cute & modern bakery cafe with exquisite desserts.  We wanted to try everything in the display case!  Cozy seating & Japanese Pop Art Decor. Service was friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend the Chicken Floss Beckham Bombs!  We'll definitely be back soon!

Nice chic cafe tucked away in LIC, they offer a nice selection of pastries and coffee&tea. The art on the walls are a nice touch to enhance the space and will soon have the option to be purchased. Roam will also be opening a backyard space coming in the spring/summer, so I'm looking forward to coming back then.
The dessert here especially the Mont Blanc - homemade chestnut cream, cheese, and almond meringue is an absolute hit. Highly recommend

column3: Upper East Side, New York, NY
column6: Really cozy little space with a clean modern vibe. Walked by it everyday on my home so wanted drop by and try a dessert. I had the lemon dessert and it was not too sweet and the perfect amount of lemon balanced with chocolate. Excited to try more of their desserts and check out their gallery soon!
Drinks are awesome! I ordered the white peach oolong with milk foam. The dessert on display looks like art! Will definitely come back for the dessert next time.
Super cute cafe/bakery that just opened in LIC! These pastries look so cute and seems like it's going to be a really chill working area. I got the grape tart which looks really good ^^
Great small desserts. I got the matcha cheesecake. So light and tasty! Wanted to try the coconut desserts next, can't wait to go back. Also the shop is so cute. Great addition to the area!
So glad to have this as an addition to LIC! Really unique desserts. Loved the mont blanc!

very delicious desserts that are unique and *not too sweet*. i'm excited that we have a new dessert spot around here- there is a coffee bar as well and a cute seating area. the mont blanc (chestnut dessert) was delicious, but very rich. we also the dessert of the day, which was amazing. I would highly recommend stopping by if you are in the area!
Amazing selection of desserts and ambiance with the art displays. The dessert itself was the perfect size and richness.
Really good, nice and friendly servers and delicious desserts, definitely coming again

If you looking for hidden gem across the street from Madison Square Garden Bourbon and Branch is a place to be . Craft cocktails are amazing and food is delicious. Even a picky eater like me can find ton of stuff on menu that I would love too . We came heir last Friday had amazing meals and great cocktails. Service was on point and really friendly. And place itself are beautiful
No comment
No comment
No comment

I ordered the greens and the pizza with mussels. Definitely would recommend the greens pizza. It's so delicious and refreshing the muscles. Pizza was OK but not amazing. I had a glass of riesling which was great, unfortunately we don't have too many dessert options. I went on a Saturday evening at around 7:45 PM and it was super easy to get a table for three, which ended up being a table for five and was large enough to accommodate that so that was good. They graciously were able to split the bill. I am multiple cards. The space is spacious. It doesn't have a bar area but the tables are large and you're not rushed to leave.

Selfishly want to keep this place a secret so it doesn't get too hard to get a table .. this has to be the best new pizza spot I've eaten at of late. Pies were unreal- get the mushroom and a red pie. We loved the mussels fra diavlo pie. Like Neapolitan style but with a crispier middle, Oma Grassa completely blows Leo out of the water on execution and on service. The menu is small - they are pizza experts, and I appreciate that they don't try to overextend themselves on the appetizer section. My biggest gripe is when pizza is not served hot - OG luckily serves it PIPING!!! Thank you!!!!

Glad to see more artisanal pizza in the BK. Tried the cherry tomato pizza and the antipasti plate. Both were fabulous five out of five stars. I'm not crazy about the decor in this place, it's a mishmash of austere and clunky mismatched items. The way the tables are spaced or something makes the place feel kind of empty and not warm. Also the lack of a bar is a miss for me. Bars where solo and coupled diners can congregate make a place so cozy and convivial. In sum great food but I wish the decor was less cold feeling.

There's never a short supply of pizza in the city. There aren't a vast amount of choices on Oma Grassa's pizza menu, allowing it to focus and perfect the handful that they do have. Service is spotty, but the mushroom pizza is delicious.
No comment

As someone has already written, Oma Grassa is a restaurant serving simple (but simply delicious) fare. We checked out the brunch menu this weekend and were able to try a good chunk of the menu. All of the egg dishes were saucy, tasty and loaded with fresh herbs. The sweet strata will satisfy anyone's sweet tooth and the pork sandwich.... wow. Massive but delicious. Definitely looking forward to coming back for some pizzas and wine in the evening!

Yummy yummy! Salad  called lettuces which are great. Many types of pizza made to order like the cheese-aka margarita but with some Pecorino on it. A zucchini pizza was spicy and delicious too. Great crust and great flavour. And then there is antipasto and eggplant Parmesan which was also great!
Amazing food, a little gem in the neighborhood with great service and very friendly and clean!

I hesitate to write this for fear of never getting a table there again, but the food here is exceptional. Simple fare: antipasto, salad, and pizza. But all made with seasonal ingredients and truly fine cuisine. I have nothing to do with this restaurant. I just tried it for the first time tonight, 2 weeks after they opened, and felt compelled to write this--in party selfishly so a new local favorite does well.

Had the anchovy, the mussel, and plain cheese, as well as the "lettuces" salad - salad was big enough to split three ways. Everything was great! Our favorite pizza was the mussel. Revelatory crust! Nice waitstaff, spacious, no wait, but we went at 5:30 on Saturday. We ate about 3/4 of a pizza per person.
OMFG! Had brunch here today. Ordered several items off brunch menu. Honestly, each dish was amazing! Love this place! If I could give 10 stars I would

$86, but no dinner. miserable experience. theatre tickets in hand. early arrival. heads up to server. ordered 2 pizzas. 70 minutes in after several reminders we had to leave to make curtain. coats back on standing up to go. one pizza arrives. wolfed down a few slices each. a gourmet experience. server pissed we didn't want the second pizza. $86 check arrived. wouldn't talk to us as we left. certainly won't return.
No comment
No comment
No comment

This menu, hailing from Trentino, was unusual and delicious. The food was really like no Italian food I'd had before, but each dish was delicious. I recommend the zucchini Parmagiana appetizer, the fig Negroni (one of many on the list) and the bread gnocchi.

I came here because I heard good things about the carbonara, but was honestly not super impressed. It was just okay - had maybe a total of 10 noodles and the flavor felt like a very typical carbonara (nothing special). The restaurant interior is cute and service was good, but probably not somewhere I would return to.
We saw several huge cockroaches in the outside sitting area...The waiter said it's the norms for street seats but still I would expect more from a highly-rated restaurant like Misirizzi.
No comment

Stellar dinner here! It's a small and cozy atmosphere. We were seated in the back room - only 6-7 tables there. The lighting was dim, but not too dim. Colors were soft. The menu offered many options for meat eaters and vegetarians alike. The pasta was delicious. Portions were controlled. Service was swift and friendly. Highly recommend!
No comment

Really have no complaints. Misirizzi is tasty, unpretentious, and reasonably priced! It was very easy to get a reservation the day of. There are loads of Italian restaurants in NYC that are overpriced and almost impossible to get a reservation unless you jump at them the first chance they open. I'm happy to say Misirizzi is not this type of restaurant. My partner and I very much enjoyed the burrata and prosciutto (but to be honest how could you go wrong with that?). We shared the carbonara mafaldine and the squid ink tomato sauce seafood pasta. Both hit the spot! It was hard to pick a favorite, honestly I couldn't. I would say the portions are not huge, but with an appetizer and some wine it was definitely enough to satisfy. I would happily return!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This restaurant was a breath of fresh air. The ambiance was really warm and romantic and I'm so glad my boyfriend and I stumbled across this restaurant on our walk in the city. The food was so delicious, both dishes we had and wine we tasted were recommended by the server. I highly recommend.

We were a bit disappointed when we came here because we heard such great things. The appetizers and drinks were some of the best I've had, so I would definitely come back for those but the pasta was nothing to write home about. They did have gluten free pasta which was a major plus but it wasn't anything special. This would be a great date night spot if you want to share an app before going out. Highly recommend the artichoke!
No comment
Pretty decent Italian spot, the mafaldine and the bruschetta were definitely my favorite, nice staff too

I spent hours researching which Italian restaurant to go to in Manhattan. I am surprised that Misirizzi wasn't mentioned. I thought the vibes of the restaurant and the food itself was fabulous. The restaurant was small, so it was giving an intimate/cozy ambiance. Now for food, you HAVE to get the artichokes. The pasta was all so fresh! I would 10/10 recommend!!! Also, it was easy to get a reservation.
Got the pesto, carbonara, artichoke and aperol spritz. All so delicious! Was able to walk in on a Friday around 6:30 which was especially nice

So Good and a delightful quaint restaurant that serves mainly Italian. The branzino dish was fabulous and all the pasta dishes were superb! Great wine selection and the service was above par! Will make this a must stop restaurant every time we come to NYC!

This was a great dining experience. Came here for a birthday and our waitress was so friendly, as was the owner (Alessandro maybe?). They even gave us free tiramisu. Very small and intimate on the inside. Will definitely be coming back.

Misirizzi has excellent quality Italian food in New York! I ordered the Black Linguine made using squid ink which I've always wanted to try. The dish itself was seafood based, so the squid ink noodles complimented the flavor of the dish. The sauce was a garlic-lemon lobster broth worked so well with the seafood & noodles. The seafood tasted fresh not fishy! I wish the noodles and seafood were cooked in the sauce longer so that the flavors got to know each other better, but over all the dish was delightful!

this place had one big win dish while everything else was mediocre. the star of the show was the lasagna - literally the best i've ever had. knew we had to get it when i saw "grandma's recipe" on the menu. the meatballs were okay; they were cooked medium rare/rare which I'm not used to with meatballs, but really good if you like meat cooked that way. branzino was recommended to us but was nothing special - it wasn't bad, just really oily and not the best choice here. want to go back & try other dishes + dessert, but would also go back just for that lasagna!

The pastas were great, especially the malfadine (which is essentially a carbonara). However, the appetizers were just okay. I don't recommend burrata plate, it didn't have much flavor. The fried artichokes were also just okay. Good vibes though.
No comment
Good Italian fare. Goat cheese salad and seafood pasta were yummy. Outdoor seating is nice and spacious. Good service too.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Sirie from Italy opened Misirizzi in a cozy space with working fireplace.. She has a big smile & warm personality! Antipasto Of Italian meats, cheeses, artichokes; followed by pastas & Bronzino ala interesting veggies; tiramisu & coffee gelato-Italian wines! Lots of local smiling guests. Sirie: YOU are The Hostess with the Mostest!! We will return soon & invite our friends!! Xoxoxo Bonnie Manter

I threw my birthday party here and it was such a seamless, easy, wonderful experience. We were in the Farmhouse wine cellar which I would describe as intimate gothic chic sexy. Siria who helped me with all the planning was fab. Rachel, our server, was amazing - so attentive, kind, chill. The rest of the staff was great too. Food was delish. Cocktails & wine kept coming. Would highly recommend.

Somehow I had never noticed this restaurant before but now I can't stop thinking about the meal I had last night. The restaurant is so pretty and charming. Even though it was packed, the acoustics were great and we could have a conversation. The food was absolutely delicious. The fried artichoke appetizer (carciofi fritti) with lemon cream dipping sauce which they aptly named "magic sauce" was the most delicious I have ever had. All three of us agreed we had never had better fried artichokes. The pasta was also scrumptious. I had the Radiatori with Arugula Pesto, Candied Tomatoes, Pine Nuts, Mozzarella Cream. The pasta was perfectly al dente and the combination of flavors was exquisite. I also had a spicy mezcal paloma served in a beautiful cocktail glass which makes such a difference. For dessert we had the bread pudding and the ricotta mousse. Highly recommend and can't wait to go back. Only downside is that it's pricey, but I think they earned it.

We decided to treat ourselves to some fancy pasta and drinks after a long day of walking 30K steps in Manhattan. Everything hit the spot here: the drinks were delicious and the food was flavorful. We shared an artichoke appetizer and I had the squid ink seafood pasta, everything was 10/10! Also everyone was so friendly and I really enjoyed the smaller cozy atmosphere, as well as the stylish decor of the restaurant!
Cozy, good service, good food (fresh and pure)! No loud music, perfect temperature, not too many people but not empty either.
The crispy artichoke dish was the star of the show. Hands down. The burrata with prosciutto was an amazing pair. And grandmas lasagna may have been the best I've ever had.

This is a nice little Italian spot in NoHo and we decided to check it out for drinks and appetizers. They did have a pretty vast selection of wines and some Italian beers. We ordered some beers but were pretty disappointed with the lack of options on the menu. There were not too many vegetarian options, not a single item on the menu with mushrooms and no risotto items either. We decided to start with the bruschetta of the day - it was two pieces of bread (which was served almost cold) topped with tomatoes and some arugula. It lacked flavor, was pretty unappetizing and turned out to be a disappointment. We decided to call the check and leave. Maybe they have other items on the menu which are good, but the first impression was unsatisfactory and that's what I'm basing my review on.

This was a perfect place for a birthday party for my wife ,for 16 people, in a lovely private room wine cellar. Soria ,one of the owners made it easy to arrange everything in a professional, charming ,and stress free manner! The food, wine, ambiance, and caring service made every detail of the party perfect !Every guest raved about the setting and the food! The price was very reasonable for a delicious four course meal!

100 stars! Intimate, charming atmosphere. Carefully prepared and beautifully presented dishes. Attentive, charming service. A bolognese prepared and flavored a completely unique way (to me). Can't recommend highly enough.

Lovely restaurant with delicious food at very reasonable prices. I wanted to comment on their exceptional service...I made a reservation on resy at 6:15pm and made a note that we are rushing to a 7pm show, and wrote down what we intended to order. When we arrived, they had already put in all the orders for us, and had appetizers on the table within 10 minutes of us arriving, and our mains within 20 minutes. We got to the show with time to spare, all thanks to the attentiveness of the Misirizzi team. Really, really appreciate their thoughtfulness.
Good food, excellent service, nice indoor/outdoor venue, decent size portions for the prices (we only tried the pastas). Enjoy a drink here and save room for dessert - piadina Nutella is delicious!

intimate little italian restaurant. service was good and the food was absolutely delicious. i went as part of a large party with a pre set menu. they brought out many appetizers for the table to share, and each and every one was better than the last. for dinner, i got the pesto pasta, which was also outstanding. definitely recommend
Wow wow wow.  I wish I could give more than 5 stars.  The service the food the staff is incredible.  Save room for dessert.  Thank you Misirizzi staff for a great evening.
No comment
No comment

This spot is a true hidden gem. Great food and drinks paired with an excellent staff makes this restaurant a must.  We ordered the Buffalo caprese salad with prosciutto, a daily special, the bread pudding, and a few signature cocktails. Give it a shot!

Randomly stumbled upon this Italian restaurant and I'm so glad I decided to go inside. My server ended up being one of the owners, Alessandro, and he was so attentive and conversational. I ordered the gnocchi which was the special of the day. It was a pesto gnocchi with shrimp - the pesto was creamy and the shrimp was cooked perfectly. I got a spritzer cocktail that I didn't love but I know how hard it is to make a mezcal cocktail. I would definitely recommend Misirizzi to anybody who love authentic Italian.
Great service, great food, not too crowded. All and all just a cute little spot with great Italian food! Will b going again
Super cute aesthetic and Nico is the best! Happy hour is a steal $7 spritz! Such a good spot
Very low key but such a good vibe with a small group. Feels intimate and like I'm in Italy!
No comment

The food here was good and service was ehhh. My boyfriend and I came here to get the lunch special. We got a salad and a pasta dish for less than $19.00 which was a pretty good deal. We got the pear and blue cheese salad. It was a tad bitter, but tasted good with the creamy blue cheese and sweet pears. We didn't eat all of it because it wasn't the greatest salad. We also got the pasta. The pasta was really tasty, but way too salty. As we got to the bottom of the dish, the more salty the pasta became. Although, the pasta was cooked perfectly and seasoned really well. The decor of the place is nice and they have a nice bar to enjoy drinks at. However, the service is just okay. Not the most friendly vibe. All in all, I'm glad I tried it but would not go back again.

We arranged with the great team at Misirizzi to have a private graduation  party for 17 on their outdoor sidewalk covered space. The planning was easy, the folks were flexible when our numbers changed a bit.  Day of the party the service was attentive, the food was great across the board and all our guests were impressed and had a great time.

One of my favorite cozy Italian restaurants tucked away in the EV. The food is delicious, we were stuffed, definitely recommend the chicken cutlet dish, it's my go to! Augustine our waiter was amazing and very helpful in recommendations. The vibe here is great with quality tunes.
No comment

The staff was very friendly and accommodating. However, the food, while not bad, was surprisingly mediocre...the meat/cheese plate included something that looked/tasted eerily like lunchmeat ham? And the pasta--while it tasted good--wasn't anything to write home about, and the visual presentation of it was pretty lacking. Overall, maybe worth going to once, but there are other options available. But again, the service was great!
Extremely meh all around... especially for the price tag! The "special" pasta was the worst of everything we ordered. We work so hard to go out occasionally -- really wanted this to be good. Sigh.

super cute & cozy italian spot downtown. staff was attentive and knowledgeable about their menu. very fresh pasta, the zucchini parm was amaaaazing. great aperol spritz bar as well. highly recommend you give this place a little love!!
No comment
No comment

Cozy spot for good Italian food, quiet/intimate and friendly service. I came in on a weekday night for a date, and we enjoyed our time. She had the squid ink pasta, I had the arugula pesto pasta. Swordfish tasted a little funny, but otherwise the food was great. We'd be happy to come back!
No comment
Cozy and delicious with great staff. Very nice prices my favorite place! I love patrol Aperol spritz! Love it

I chose this restaurant from the positive reviews and cute looking space and was not disappointed. We were able to make a reservation for 8 people on a Friday evening. When we were running late they were very accommodating and did not give us problems. The waiter was very friendly and they also kindly stored our ice cream cake for us. They have a good variety of wine and cocktails to choose from. The cheese and meat platter was also appetizing. The black linguine was filled with fresh squid and shrimp, although I feel like it could have used a bit of a kick, perhaps some garlic? It was a great evening with no stress.

Went here the other night. Food was okay. Got the spinach tagliatelle Bolognese which I would recommend if you do go there. The zucchini parm was good but not as good as the yelp photo. Overall would recommend for a date or a small group outing. Not too expensive and good atmosphere.
No comment
No comment

This is one of those hidden gems that we are lucky enough to find in New York. The staff was friendly and welcoming and the decor is exactly what you want to see in the Village. The food is the real star here. It is authentic, high end Italian and it is delicious. I highly recommend finding your way to Misirizzi for any occasion (we celebrated my wife's birthday) or just a great mid-week meal.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Wow this place was amazing! I went here for a company dinner and was pleasantly surprised at the dining experience and the classy attitude of the workers.  The risotto was amazing and I really enjoyed the cocktails.  The only thing I'd like to see would be if they offered you olive oil and balsamic with the bread.  I didn't ask for it specifically but the bread wasn't very good in my opinion.  The entrees were phenomenal and were all served to our table of 7 at the same time by the wait staff.  Excellent service!
No comment

No comment
Went here pre-theater for a drink, cheese, and olives. Excellent small bar, cozy, and good cocktails. Would absolutely recommend.
Amazing seafood pasta and nice cheese plate. The waiter was really friendly and the environment feels like you're somewhere far more charming than east village.

Sadly the food here was just OK. We got the calamari, zucchini, strascinati, and the black linguine. The linguine was probably the best of the bunch. Adding another star because the restaurant itself is very intimate and cute. And the rose was solid.

My partner and I came to Misirizzi for a date night and we were very happy with our experience. I love the cozy atmosphere and minimalist decor. The service was excellent and the staff was knowledgeable. We ordered meatballs, duck risotto, and bronzino, and paired it with a Montepulciano. Everything was delicious and cooked perfectly. We will definitely be back and recommend Misirizzi to our friends.

Cute little spot that is easy to get into. It's nice to sit by or around the bar for their unique spritz drinks. They do not have a full bar, which is worth note. The food is solid, and there is a more diverse menu than many Italian spots. The shrimp and white bean dish is really cozy and nice. The best feature may be the downstairs which you can basically take over with a full family style party. (As per below looks like the great dish is no longer on the menu but yay for a full bar!)

So...this place is super confusing. It has the atmosphere of a cool hole-in-the-wall italian family restaurant, and we loved the drinks and bread that we ordered. That being said, I ordered the pasta with tomato sauce and...i was shocked. I have never seen such a small portion of pasta that was an entree for $19. It was delicious, but not worth $19. Also, one of the other tables "shushed" our table for laughing and having a lively conversation. Mind you, this was around 10:30 at night. I know that having rude customers is out of the restaurant's control, but it completely dampened the night. Don't know if I would go again ‍
No comment
Food was amazing! Service was great! I'll be back for sure! Everything was so divine!!!
No comment
Simply wonderful truly attempted small charming Italian spot. We'll go every time I'm back in the neighborhood. Lobster risotto and Endive salad with standouts.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

This place is such a gem. We went on New Years Eve and they fit us in by sitting us at the bar with Ale. The owners, who are young entrepreneurs from Italy originally, were so friendly and the food was fantastic. This place made our night!
No comment

I dined at Misirizzi tonight and I was slightly disappointed because the reviews were so good but I didn't feel like this place was 5 star. The drinks are phenomenal and the desserts are really good (especially the nutella piadina). We got the scallops and kale salad for antipasti - the scallops were slightly undercooked and mushy and the kale salad was nothing to rave about. We got the black linguine with seafood (calamari, shrimp) and the strascinati with lamb sausage for mains - the calamari was undercooked and mushy, as well, but the strascinati wasn't bad at all. Overall, the place itself is very cute and welcoming, the service is phenomenal, and the drinks are super great, but the food is whatever.
No comment
No comment

Here in NYC touring hotels and restaurants for an event later this year and of all the places we visited, we decided to eat at Misirizzi because of the intriguing weathered ambiance. We met Siria and checked out the private dining room downstairs and sat at the front table by the door. We started with the meats and cheeses and I had the black linguini with shrimp and seafood - which was fabulous. The pasta is made onsite and was the best I have had in a couple years. After dinner, we spoke with Siria and the staff, and she told us how she became a restaurant partner and more. Everyone was so gracious and friendly. We all loved the experience.

Cinque Stelle! Sooo good. My first time here and plan to become a regular as this gem of a restaurant is right around the corner from my office! The ambiance is great, service amazing and the food delicious. I hope to convince the owner to put the Osso Buco on the menu as it is THE BEST that I have ever had! That is a high compliment indeed as most of my family were/are from the Liguria region in Italy and were/are in the food service business in some capacity or another that many great chefs! Buon appetito!
No comment

Sweetest little place in the neighborhood.  Delicious pasta,  crisp salad with a well-balanced dressing that enhanced rather than covering the arugula.  Nice little wine list and a feeling of welcome.  Right around the corner from the Public Theater.
Very nice place, so cozy restaurant and delicious food. The staff was very friendly and gifted for me and my wife a bottle of olive oil because we just moved to New York) It was great and pleasantly

I had a birthday dinner here last Friday with a group of 14 friends in the private dining room and I couldn't have asked for a better experience! The private room is in a wine cellar which made for a beautiful setting. The food was absolutely amazing - cheese and cured meat platter, the grilled zucchini parmigiana, gnocchi, lamp chop, and branzino were some of our favorites. What made the experience so memorable though was the service! Our waiter was very busy with 2 large groups but made us feel like we had his whole attention and was so friendly and funny! He recommended delicious wines for us and even let our group of 14(!) do a mini wine tasting between 2 bottles that we selected. It was definitely a night to remember and I would highly recommend it!

Absolutely outstanding food and service. We split the artisanal cheese plate and endives salad. They were excellent. I had the cavatelli with the pistachio/almond/orange pesto. It was like nothing I've ever eaten before. The orange was subtle. Perfect, really. The chocolate molten cake was A-plus, as were the cocktails, wine and friendly service. I would highly, highly recommend this spot.
The cutest little Italian restaurant! We had three different pastas, all of them were amazing, great vibe. Truly recommended!
Service was great, loved everything we ordered. I like the small atmosphere. Hope to be back.

Such a cozy, great place! Came here on a Wednesday night with a friend and had no issue getting a table but it got more filled up throughout the evening. The food was very good! The zucchini with cheese was very delicious and not too heavy. The pasta with pomodoro sauce was very flavorful and cooked perfectly. I asked them to add spicy lamb sausage to it and they had no problem altering dishes. My friend loved her mushroom gnocchi special. Finally, the molten chocolate cake was really tasty and the perfect ending. Great place for a casual weeknight meal.

This is a very cute chic place. They have a nice wine collection however food was ok. I ordered all the vegetarian options on the menu so cannot comment about the rest. Also, try to get a spot closer to the window as their air conditioning does reach the other tables

Looks like the same Italian restaurant as Aroma. Just with a different name. Service is good. But food is nothing special. I want to give it 3.5 stars but don't think it's worth 4. The seafood pasta was a bit salty and salad was average. Dessert way too sweet for my taste. Don't get why the yelp reviews are so good here
Great lunch 2 courses menu! I had wonderful carbonara pasta and an amazing lava cake. Great recommendation

Solid Italian restaurant in the east village. Service was impeccable and they had a great selection of less commonly found central/southern italian wines. My boyfriend and I ordered the meat/cheese board, the steak, and the gnocchi of the day. Everything was delicious at a great price point. Other than the annoying couple who were arguing with each other next to us, the ambiance was great as well - lovely mood lighting and music. Will definitely have to come back soon!

Just had a lovely dinner here and not only did I love the food but they had excellent service. Our waiter was very nice and also really funny. The food was all very fresh and had a nice spin on usual Italian. I also love how my cheese board had a lot of cheese on it as opposed to those other places when they only give you a tiny slice of each cheese- lots of cheese!
What a warm and inviting restaurant! Food was fresh and delicious!! Staff is incredible! Will definitely recommend and return!!!

Omg, this place is so good. Ordered the pork chop and arugula salad and each dish was probably one of the best versions I've had ever. Service was top notch. Professional, attentive, and very friendly. Not sceney, a good NYC gem, classy. I can't wait to come back again. We were too full to try dessert but the peach tiramisu, molten chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream, and bread pudding sounded incredible.
No comment
Nice place, beautiful space and great service. Food, just ok. Certainly not 4.5 stars we were led to believe.... many better choices in the area.

Great spot dinner. The food, wine, service, and décor is all on point. We came as a group of 8 and everyone walked away very happy with our time there. The food from the meats & cheese plate to the pastas were incredible. My favorite was the strascinati with lamb sausage. We also had a couple of good bottles of wine which were very well priced. Will have to come back and try some of the mains. This restaurant is worth a visit.

In a neighborhood with a number of excellent Italian restaurants, Misirizzi stands out: The food is marvelous, with dishes just original enough to be interesting, prices are entirely reasonable, and service is warm and friendly. Very much hoping to keep going there for years to come!

Went to this place on a cold and snowy Friday night with a party of five. Didn't have a reservation but the host was very nice and was able to accommodate us. We got lucky. Place is small with a more modern decor. Restaurant is an odd shoe and we sat in the back. Food was good. Had a. Side of carrots which were nice and crunchy with food butter flavors. Began with zucchini Parmesan which was an unusual yet tasty dish. Got a pasta dish to follow which I also enjoyed. Wines by the glass included Barolo. Service nice and attentive and friendly. We'd come back.
No comment
No comment

My boyfriend and I were looking for a cozy dinner spot on a cold Saturday night. We snagged a last minute reservation via Opentable, and 2 hours later found ourselves at Misirizzi. The entire experience was lovely. The food was delicious and the service was so fantastic! We knew we were in for a treat when the complimentary olive oil and olives for the table blew us away. When we asked where they got the olive oil (because it was that good!), our waitress brought us a bottle to take home! Such a sweet gesture. We shared two starters - the meatballs & the tris de mini - which were both excellent, and for our main we had the cavatelli. I've had a lot of Italian food in NYC, and this was the closest to rivaling the food I had in Italy last year. Everything tasted fresh and authentic. Looking forward to a return soon!

Tonight I was walking on 4th street and I saw this nice gem. I went in for a glass of wine and I stayed for dinner. The place is really nice and cozy. Nice and familiar atmosphere. I tried the special salad of the day, with pork and was really tasty. Then I had the trio of Canederli that reminded me when I was in the mountains in Italy. I had to try a dessert and they suggested me a chocolate pudding with vanilla ice cream...still dreaming about that! Strongly recommended!

Stumbled upon this gem in noho looking for an early dinner. Misirizzi reminds me of an old rail car apartment- high ceilings, white brick and a long rectangular body. They have a bar with a few tables in the front and a more "formal" dinning area in the back that will make you feel like you are sitting in a chic 1920s Williamsburg apartment. I'm not usually one to rave about interiors in my restaurants but there is something about Misirizzi that just feels special when you walk into it. It's Italian menu features a nice variety of pasta and protein based dishes- my friend had the salmon which he liked and I had the spaghetti pomodoro. One of the better versions of the dish that I've experience- perfectly aldente pasta in a flavorful sauce and not overdressed! Our server was great, and very patient with all of our questions. Overall, I will for sure be coming back here when I'm in the area. PS. The back dinning room would be perfect if you are a large group to reserve.
Great Italian restaurant. Went here for brunch, and had the Bresaola piadina and the tiramisu. Both the food and the service were great, highly recommend.
No comment
No comment

What a great place for brunch!  Came upon it for a Sunday Brunch - food was delish!  I had the soft-boiled egg on Avocado toast with roasted asparagus wrapped in prosciutto.  Service was friendly & willing to accommodate special requests or preferences. Has a cool independent vibe.  Owner took me on a quick tour of their event space in the basement which is cozy. Would work nicely for a dinner party or rehearsal dinner.  We will return for brunch again or maybe for dinner. Nice people! Hope they do well!!

I haven't had a dish in a long time that i thought was outright excellent, until I walked into this cozy restaurant. Superb food, friendly staff and beautiful ambiance. I'm glad that there is such a place close to where i live!!
Excellent dinner and service with my daughters and friend. The salmon, meatballs, parmigiana, and tortelli were all excellent. Attention to detail was impressive.

Dined here this past Sunday. We made reservations for 7 people after seeing the Blueman Group. The appetizers were amazing as were the entrees. The service was spot on and the owner made us feel like family. We will definitely visit again when in NYC.

I really enjoyed the authenticity of the food, the friendly service and the nice  atmosphere.  Everything was over the top!!! I highly recommend the Strascinati with lamb sauce, never eaten something so crazy good : )

Have never come across such miserable or apathetic wait staff. Told the owner, but she really did not seem to care either.  Shame, because I wanted to like this place. The food was OK, but I shan't be coming back.
No comment

Really nice and cozy new Italian place between the East and West Villages, great vibe. We started with their delicious octopus salad and endive, gorgonzola and pear salad. Both highly suggested!! For main course we had the mint pappardelle with duck and the ricotta cavatelli with asparagus. The food is glorious and the choice of wines very good. Service was very friendly and respectful. Definitely going back soon. Grazie!

Made a reservation for 6:30 on a Saturday night. Such a quaint, tucked away gem! The service was friendly, the food was great, and we never felt rushed. The spaghetti and meatballs were delicious. Also recommend any of the veggie side dishes!!

My husband and I came here on a Saturday night and had a delicious meal. We started with the scallops, then ordered the Strascinati and Ricotta Cavatelli. Our only complaint is that the scallop dish was quite small. The atmosphere in the back room is great--cozy and warm. And our server, Augustine, could not have been better--his wine recommendations were spot on (and wine list is very reasonably priced).

Been here many times - a real find! a neighborhood gem!  I only wish this wonderful, authentic Italian restaurant were closer to home. But I'm very willing to travel!!  The food is wonderful and I love the ambience.  Alessandro is a wonderful, thoughtful host - and his staff is so professional and accommodating.  I promised myself I wouldn't sing its praises so that everyone knows - but they deserve it...  And the name: Misirizzi - a toy with a round bottom which, when you push it down, bounces back up.  Perfect!
Delicious food, beautiful ambiance, and amazing service.  The waiter was friendly, attentive, and provided great service.  Nice trendy spot to have a great date.

We stayed here at the end of March, having dinner. The location is clean, tidy, friendly. The service is quick and efficient. The people are very courteous and helpful. The food is high quality, very good !!!

Just had a delightful dinner at Misirizzi. I had the pasta with sausage and mushrooms and my husband had the salmon.  Both dishes were delicious.  It was our first visit to this restaurant.  Alessandro is a lovely host.  He checked on us to see how everything was.   Our server, Lydia, was so friendly and professional.  We will definitely be going back here!
No comment
No comment

Hands down one of the best up and coming restaurants here in NY. Fresh pasta, delicious chocolates, and contagious smiles. It was personable and took me back to authentic Italian cuisine. A definite yes to anyone who wants to eat an amazing meal that's an experience. Incredible prices for the food they serve too. A must go and eat, I am looking forward to taking my family when they visit and all my friends.

This restaurant is probably one of my favorite Italian places in the city. We started with drinks, I had their Limoncello Spritz and my partner had some kind of Rye mixed drink, he enjoyed his a lot but I thought mine could have been better, felt like it was missing an extra element. The food however, was amazing. I lived in Italy for four months and this compares to the nicer restaurants there, in some areas. We started with the 3 cheese plate. The servings were generous for such nice cheese and they paired well with the bread and olives they put on every table. For main course I had the Strascinati and he had the Black Linguine. I was incredibly happy with my entree, it was all the flavors I adore and it was perfectly cooked and balanced. He also enjoyed his entree, squid ink pasta is a favorite of ours and this did it justice. We had the lava cake for dessert and the gelato on top was so good, it almost tasted like whipped cream but in gelato form. Our waiter was very nice and the atmosphere was cute, it was an older crowd in the back dining room but younger people we at the bar and smaller tables in the front. I can't wait to go back!

Pleasantly surprised by this small but elegant restaurant tucked away in the middle of the street. Came here to celebrate a special day with some friends and it was perfectly intimate for a group of 8. Drinks and food were good. Service was awesome.

Went here for a friend's birthday. First, the staff is super friendly. Had to call and modify the number and they were clear and nice on the phone. Second, the wait staff have a great personality. They are accommodating and very knowledgeable. Third, the food is the best I've had in awhile. The restaurant is small and intimate which makes for a great vibe for any occasion. So glad I found this place on opentable.

Excellent dining experience! Food was delicious, service was very professional, ambiance was very comfortable and cozy. Owner/hostess recommended several dishes that I enjoyed a lot. I especially liked the stuffed calamari and homemade black linguine (that was exceptionally good). This relatively new restaurant definitely offers the nabe a great restaurant for many to dine.

I have ordered from here multiple times and the food is frankly just not very good. I have had salads, the shrimp cassoulet..the shrimp in particular came in an extremely bland sauce with very few beans. Mostly carrots which didn't match the flavoring at all. They also left the tails on the shrimp, which is just a big NO for a soup.
I went here for my birthday! The staff was attentive and kind. The food was Amazing!! Highly recommend!

An outstanding dinner for seven. With a charming out of the way feel, and excellent service, we felt transported to Italy. All the dishes were simply outstanding. A wonderful wine and cocktail list also. We can't wait to go back.

My boyfriend and I ate dinner here the night of New Year's Eve. They had a wonderful price fixed menu with four courses for $75. I ordered the delicious beet salad (one of my favorites) and he got a salmon tartar which he loved. Then we ordered a delicious pappardelle pasta with Mushrooms and truffles. Next was the steak, our main course. It was cooked to perfection! We ordered sorbet instead of gelato because of my boyfriends lactose allergy which was of course no problem! We also received a complimentary glass of prosecco, most likely because it was a holiday! Fantastic service and food! wonderful aroma overall five stars!

This place is a gem.  Amazing food.   Great atmosphere.   Great.value.  Highly recommend.   This place is for anyone interested in a true dining experience with no pretense   The zucchini parm app is ridiculous.    My favorite nyc place.   Can't get enough

What a lovely place.  I was a big fan of its predecessor, Aroma, and was sad to see a new place here.  However, the two new owners seem great, too, and determined to continue the tradition of exceptional food and wine.  There's a great deal of personalized attention here.  If you're in this neighborhood, DEFINITELY choose this if you'd like Italian food, you won't be disappointed

We were lucky enough to have the back room all to ourselves over a quiet Fourth of July weekend.  Fantastic food and great service.  Very romantic on a quiet night, look forward to coming back to see how it is on a crowded night.
Amazing service and friendly staff! ramen broth was immaculate and savory. Price was very affordable for the Michelin quality. I would definitely come back again.

No comment

Came on a rainy afternoon for lunch and it wasn't too bad to get a seat. I came to try the truffle broth which I won't lie, was quite good (granted I have't had a truffle broth anywhere else before). The price point wasn't too terrible either, although it doesn't really come with many toppings. We ended up getting the extra toppings to make it a more filling ramen meal. Food came fairly quickly and portions sizes were good. I wouldn't say it was Michelin level by any means, but it was a decent meal. I probably wouldn't go back though. There are far better ramen places in NYC for similar/cheaper price range.
