I had the original truffle shio ramen, and I thought it was good. I saw the ratings before heading in (I was on my way to Arabica next door) so i had low expectations. I thought the broth was decent and the noodles were not bad. I don't know if this Michelin worthy ramen haha

We were able to sit immediately when arriving as soon as they opened on a Saturday. We ordered each of the truffle ramens, dumpling and karage. The dumplings came first. The skin was thin but the filling was a bit too firm for my preference. The chili that came with it was delicious which they said they made in-house. When we received our ramen, we asked about our karage which they said would come in 5 min. My soyu truffle ramen had a subtle flavor but I couldn't detect the truffle flavor. The noodles were thin and absorbed the broth nicely. I tasted the shio broth which had a stronger truffle flavor and seemed more flavorful. The karage arrived towards the end of our ramen and we were told they would be removed from our bill. It was worth the wait. It was dark meat only and the chicken was very juicy with a crispy exterior.

For a starred ramen restaurant, the whole experience feels underwhelming. The options are minimal and portions are very small. We came on a Friday afternoon with no wait, lots of seating available. We were seated next to the door since we had a stroller which was fine. We ordered a black truffle oil ramen and a white truffle oil ramen. Both were just okay but I think white truffle one tasted a bit more flavorful. Any additional things such as seaweed and eggs come at extra cost. We ordered an appetizer as well- sliced pork belly and it came over a small scoop of rice- I might be able to eat it in two bites. It was so small! After spending a large amount for what seemed so little, I'm not sure I'd be back.

Not sure if there are still long lines to wait for this place, but we came on a whim and got lucky it was a day they were opened later. With a couple of minutes until opening we waited and got seated right away. We ordered karaage, truffle shout soba, and spicy Mala tokatsu soba. The food came out pretty quickly. The karaage was fried well, and the chicken was not dry. The ramen portions were on the smaller side, get the large size if you are hungry I guess. Noodles were cooked well. The ramen is more similar to soba which is why they do label is as ramen I guess. The truffle flavor in the broth is subtle which is how I like it, if you're a big truffle fan then it might not be enough flavor. The mala one definitely had a spicy kick to it. Their pork is not dry like some others I've had. For the price, the portion is smaller than I would like. Worth trying? I think so. Would I line up? Probably not. But if you happen to be by here and there's not a long wait, definitely give it a try.

I'm not sure how I would rate Tsuta if I've never been to the shop in Japan because they don't taste the same. First, there's a few dings when it comes to operations. The official hours on Yelp, Google, and their front door notes that lunch is till 3:30pm. However, they start turning people away at 2:30pm so that they can close at 3:30pm. That's not how other restaurants operate. Second, the line is ridiculous. Third, messing up or missing your order is not uncommon. In terms of the ramen, it is ridiculously priced. The truffle is majorly skimped. The broth isn't that flavorful. The noodles, however, do have the right texture and chewiness. The best thing on the menu was the karaage, which was actually one of the better ones I've had.

The broth of the Truffle Shoyu Ramen tasted very clean, but not very flavorful. I also got the large size of the ramen. Can't imagine how small regular is then. The egg was the highlight.
Solid Ramen. No wait whatsoever, quick / friendly servicer. Will definitely becoming back for more.
No comment

Got here around 1245pm on a Tuesday afternoon. There were three parties ahead of us in line, but it moved fairly quick. After we got seated, the waitress told us that they ran out of the gyoza, karage and furikake veggie chips. What do you mean you ran out? We arrived about an hour after they opened. We ordered the Original truffle shoyu and shio ramen which each came with only one slice of Kurobuta chashu. So we decided to order the iberico chashu and ajitama ($4 egg) on the side. Most ramen places would have already included toppings into their ramen, but this place only gives you bamboo shoot and other unnecessary toppings (onions, leek) which they can definitely do without in my opinion. Overall, the ramen didn't wow me, it was just okay for- definitely have had better ramen elsewhere. Good thing we didn't have to wait in a long line for this. This place is definitely overhyped, but on the bright side I got to visit DUMBO :)
No comment

I had this place when I was in Japan and to be honest it wasn't very memorable so when they opened a location here I had to try it. Interior and presentation was nicely done. Staff was also nice and attentive. The kaarage is a must get- skin was nice and crispy while the meat was still tender and juicy. The ramen itself was ok- it was kinda expensive.

Pretty disappointed... I went there because they advertised by first ramen Michelle star. So my expectation was pretty much high. Group of 3, ordered Shouyu, shio, tonkotsu, vegan ramen and gyoza. Everything was pretty much disappointed.
No comment

My boyfriend and I decided to stop by the new ramen shop that is michelin over the weekend. 7:15pm on a Sunday, we were seated immediately and food was served pretty quickly to order. It is very different from the usual shoyu ramen with the truffle and garnish, but I really enjoyed the flavors. I also appreciated that the broth was hot since most place serve medium warm noodles:') My only complaint is the small portion for $21 (regular) which is  sad since there isn't a lot of toppings included (needs to be added on) and I finished my meal pretty quick. Next time I'll try out the small plates and see how those taste!
No comment
Fair, I wasn't blown away, understood it's still the opening of the place and need to find their rhythm. Hopefully will give a new try in couple of months.
No comment
No comment
La carne se veía en mal estado, me hizo daño, los platos y vasos olían a huevo, no están ni cerca de estar si quiera en la lista Michelin
The lighting was so bright, we felt like we were at a doctor's office or airport. The ramen was fine. The broth was unique.

The shoyu ramen is my favorite on the menu, if you are looking for a simple yet filling meal for lunch this is perfect. The ajitama which is an additional $4 is soft on the outside and jammy in the center. I would recommend it if you want a more thick/ rich ramen then order the tonkatsu.
No comment

The food was nothing special. Thought the ramen was very overpriced and it was lacking many of the vegetables and other add ins that add flavor. It was $27 for a large ramen with an egg, and I've spent far less for better tasting ramen. Service and ambiance were fine. I couldn't help but feel like my experience was rushed  in an effort to clear the table ASAP for the next guests. I will say the advertising is really good for this place, but ignore the hype, because hype is all it is.
Honestly very underwhelming. Service was maybe a 6/10 at best and broth of the truffle shoyu I found quite flavorless. Karaage was pretty average nothing special, not even a sauce. Overall 6.3/10

column3: Lower East Side, New York, NY
column6: No comment

Just to clarify, this place is not Michelin starred and not even Michelin starred in Tokyo; the restaurent lost it's Michelin starred rating in 2020. I don't necessarily think Michelin starred equates to better food, but Tsuta is marketed this way all over the internet, and it's not even that exciting. The soba noodles are good & different than other ramen spots, and I like how some of the ramens were made in a chicken and shrimp broth, and not pork, but the ramen could use more vegetables and a heartier broth in my opinion (I got the original truffle shoyu soba w/out pork). We also got the Karange chicken, which was pretty decent, and the barley tea, which wasn't bad but also not great. The wait to get seated was about 30 mins, and honestly I was expecting it to be worse given all the hype. The atmosphere was of the restaurant was minimalistic modern, we were seated at the bar, which made the experience a bit more authentic. Would I come back? Probably not. There are better Ramen spots in Brooklyn and Manhattan.

We ordered tonkotsu soba, vegetarian soba, yaki gyoza, and iberico chashu. First, I love iberico chasu. I should've ordered more. And the sauce that came with gyoza was good. The broth was rich, hence they were perfect cuisine for the winter. Server was attentive and the place itself is nice and clean. I'm glad I got this ramen place near my home.

Great service and really great food. We started with the Niku Meishi (pork cubes over rice) and we LOVED. The gyozas were great as well, super flavorful. We also got the peach sake which I highly recommend! For our main we got the shoyu ramen. The hint of truffle was perfectly balanced and the broth wasn't too salty. All of the food came out so fast, we were so happily surprised! Our server was Jordan - cheerful, funny, and professional. Def recommend checking it out!

On an especially cold day in Brooklyn the single thing you'd want is a hot, tasty bowl of ramen. Do not expect that from this place. Upon arrival I was not greeted by anyone. The waitstaff grudgingly pointed to a table and told me to sit. Service was mediocre and the ramen was subpar. I'm surprised this restaurant is Michelin starred. Food was extremely overpriced for the quality that was received. This might have been the worst bowl of ramen I have ever had.
Amazing ramen and toppings.  Long wait, but line moves quickly and servers are very friendly and customer service oriented.
This place being at a 3.5 doesn't make sense to me, I had the Spicy Mala Tonkotsu Soba and thought it was great

my boyfriend and i came on a friday at around 2pm, we were seated in 30 minutes. we ordered the original shio & shoyu, and we both loved it. i tried it when i was in japan, so i thought that it wouldn't be as good in comparison, but the quality definitley transferred over !

Not sure why there is a 1 star .. I get it if it's because of the wait time and it's cold outside .. but definitely worth the wait in my opinion.. the ramen was amazing .. and the appetizers were tasty! I would definitely come back again !

I DONT KNOW AHOUT THIS PLACE MAN... Broth is alright. Nothing bad, just good. Noodle is alright. Nothing bad. Everything else also nothing bad. But it is supposed to be Michelin level. It tastes like ... something is missing because boss isn't there. It's like... they followed the steps but forgot to be Shokunins. That's a term still new in USA like Unagi 10 years ago. So in general, everything is okay. Quite impressive to think tho. Ambiance is okay for real... I feel like I'm in Upper West Side ordering Cake rather than eating ramen... Service is professional, although they are still newly opened so don't expect to be treated like they have it under control. It's still a ride lol. Overall I'm not sure what I came to eat. Was this Ramen? Or is it some influencer food that is made to post on social media.... I say it's an influencer food at the moment. Hope it evolves into a Ramen soon otherwise it's another Tourist Trap!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Delicious spot w reasonable prices! Was having an intense mole craving and luckily found this restaurant. We got the enchiladas and the mole pollo. The enchiladas are made with white meat it seems, so i didn't enjoy that as much but the rest of the dish was delicious. The mole pollo was excellent, there was a very generous amount of chicken, i just wished there was a bit more mole. It even comes with two tortillas, which i really appreciated.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

The brunch deal is pretty amazing as it's both bottomless drinks and food; however, it did seem like it was a small space and scorching hot so there are limited tables inside. Luckily, I felt like our server was pretty attentive for how busy it was. Our drinks were constantly full and there was always enough food to order, so good for everyone to have a taste of everything. Honestly, it was all pretty good-ceviche too! We had the margaritas and not sure if it was the mixture or what, but couldn't tell if it was super strong or not. Would definitely come back!
No comment
No comment
I'm from California, so I'm a snob about Mexican food. But this place was truly awesome. The guacamole was amazing, and so was the mole poblano enchilada. Loved it!

Good ambiance, service & delicious flavor! This place has been on my list to try for a few months. We went on a Friday around 8:30 without a reservation and were seated outside. We split a bottle red wine and ordered enchiladas de mole and enchiladas rojas. They were both so flavorful - the rojas had a mild kick to them! The enchiladas themselves are a bit larger so you get a good portion. They come with a side of rice and beans and you get chips and 3 kinds of salsa with your table. The tomato and the salsa verde with guacamole was my favorite. Everything here had a rich and layered flavor that evolved after hitting your palate. I'll definitely be back!
Fan of the de mole" nachos as well as the tacos de nopales. With a growing Mexican community in NYC, it's great to find good Mexican food.

Delicious, you must try this pictured here the Tinga De Pollo- wow que rico! you will love this dish chicken on a crispy corn tortilla- you get three and they are enough - trust me- I also ordered the Fries with Molé- and actually it's the best Molé I've ever had!! Overall the service was very pleasant and respectful-I'll definitely plan to come back and try more on their menu!
No comment

If you're looking for a bottomless brunch spot that hits all the marks, look no further. $55 for bottomless food... & drinks. Yes, that includes bottomless Margaritas (& Bloody Mary's which I'm not a fan of, but hey - to each their own). The food, ambience, and service are top notch. Big shoutout to Layla -- you rock, thank you so much! I came here with a group of 19 people as a pre-Oktoberfest brunch and everyone enjoyed the food & the vibes were immaculate. This spot is great for large groups and De Mole really made sure we were taken care of! Also, shoutout to the chicken taquitos, ceviche, and quesadillas - straight fire. I'll be back (soon)

Found this place on a random craving for Mexican food. The inside is cute and there's a nice outside area that's a little heated. The food is okay. We ordered the guac and chips to start and had to send It back bc we got a bad avocado so not only did the guacamole taste like it was going bad but it was also a little brown in color. I got the baja fish taco which was okay. The fish is a fried mahi and lacked so much flavor. Thankfully, the mango habanero sauce that they offer with it was able to deliver some flavor. My aunt got a paloma which she said was really good so they get points for their drinks.

Food and service was excellent! I got the green enchiladas, it was delicious and the portion size was so large. I couldn't finish it. My partner and I really enjoyed our server, Jesus. He was very tentative and friendly. We will definitely return and ask for Jesus again

Restaurant was very cute, pretty packed on a Friday night. Queso was not what I expected - came with a tortilla that you used to scoop the cheese. The tacos weren't too bad, a little bland - got the Baja and chicken tacos. The dessert on the other hand was incredible. We got the tres leches cake that was the star of the show. The churros also had a yummy dark chocolate sauce. Would come back again!
No comment
Have ordered here embarrassingly probably over 25 times. Best burrito I've had. Period. I even went to a famous spot in San Diego with my husband and we both agreed De Mole is better!

this place is always poppin so decided to stop by! the ambiance and vibe were very cute, and overall they nail all the sauces/flavors. service was also great and super quick. personally given that its mexican food i feel that its a bit overpriced but i guess its typical for the area. also a sidenote is that one of my steak tacos had meat that was a bit too chewy (not clean cut) so that was a bummer
No comment
Incredible plant based food. Looking forward to eating here again. I lived the enchiladas!!

It was a very pleasant experience.  The service was awesome and very friendly. I had the salad which was very fresh and delicious and my partner in crime had the tacos. We were both very happy to dine in!

Great food and decent service! Our waitress was amazing but the rest of the staff there was a bit dismissive. No options for mocktails but a solid food menu. We got the shrimp quesadilla and spinach and mushroom enchiladas.
Food was amazing. Bottomless food and drink on a weekend was a great deal and better than expected. Ask for Leila! Service was impeccable.

Have you ever been somewhere where EVERYTHING is amazing?! This is it! My friends and I came for brunch on a weekend, we had a reservation and waited briefly to be seated. It was packed but still comfortable enough to enjoy the atmosphere and meal. We ordered just about everything to try it all - and everything - literally everything was excellent! It was authentic, perfectly seasoned, well cooked. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The music was great! We were able to have conversation yet still enjoy an upbeat brunch. Overall once of the best places to brunch in Brooklyn!
Great place for date night - phenomenal music too. Our waiter Jesus was thoughtful, thorough, and creative.

This is honestly one of my favorite restaurants in Williamsburg.   Every time I've gone it's been better. They just recently added bottomless brunch too which is a great deal. If you go for dinner definitely try their octopus tacos, probably the best around
No comment

Love this spot! I came during restaurant week for $39 3 course special. For appetizer I got the ceviche mixto and for entree I got the octopus. Both were spot on and I would highly recommend this place to others. The decor was beautiful as well and our server was delightful. I left so stuffed from here.

I came here with my girlfriends for Sunday brunch and their fix menu with unlimited drinks was the chefs kiss. The waitress was very friendly and topped us off with a final round of drinks even after we paid our bill. The music is reggaeton club vibes which I loved.
No comment
No comment
One of the best brunches I have had in NYC. It's $45 for all you can eat and drink tapas style. You have a menu and order bites off of it, it's delicious.
No comment

Best brunch in Brooklyn. Jesus have such amazing service and made our time at De Mole incredible. He made sure we were well take care of and was conscious of all dietary restrictions. Thank you Jesus.
No comment
Great atmosphere, food, and drinks! Service was also amazing - Jesus is the best! Highly recommend.
No comment

I would give this place a solid 3.5-4 stars, with the extra .5 because of how cheap it is for brunch here. The food was subpar and service was incredible slow (maybe that's why unlimited drinks and tapas works here). The waitstaff and manager were pleasant, I think they were just slammed, but I must of had 3 drinks total for my entire brunch. For an unlimited special, that's horrible.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Came for brunch! Service was amazing,  food was great and Layla our server was super attentive and an overall joy !!!!!
Great bottomless brunch option. So fun and so much food. Definitely recommend. Jesus was the best!

I went here last night with my friend to celebrate my birthday and I must say I really enjoyed the food but the service was very mediocre that I'd think twice before dining here ever again. We were seated on the patio and when we arrived to our table there was glasses of water on the table still from the previous guests! .. We told the manager and our server (a male) about it and they literally both ignored us SEVERAL times and it took a woman waiter to come out and when we told her eyes nearly bugged out her face smh. The male waiter literally did not care about our table, barely checked on us to see if we were good and he ended up leaving mid shift thankfully and we got another waiter who was much nicer. The food though I really enjoyed how season and it was cooked very well..  that's the only reason why this establishment didn't get two stars from me.  I expected much more from a restaurant with this type of prices and reputation, it was given service from McDonalds or a chicken spot, do better!

Came here for dinner on a Saturday night and we were seated outside with the heaters. Our waiter Manny was attentive, funny and polite. The Al pastor tacos were delicious, the chicken burrito was huge! And good as well. I would definitely come here for great service and great food!
No comment
Deeeeelicious omg! So flavorful. Would definitely come back a great place to go with friends.
Amazing food and drinks! Ordered the Al pastor tacos, house salsa is delicious. Wonderful hospitality from our waiter Jesus!
Came across this place while looking for New Mexican places in the city. So glad I did! The food and service here were both phenomenal and I would definitely come back again.

Looking for the perfect bottomless brunch spot!? You've found it! 45$ for all you can eat and drink. The food is incredible and we ended up ordering at least 8 rounds of drinks for the table. Our server really took the reigns and brought us a variety of different foods to try. It's located in a convenient part of Williamsburg and there's a ton of cute things to do/check out in the area. Will definitely be back!
No comment

This is my favorite Mexican restaurant in all of NYC. The food has the best presentation and is out of this world. It's hard to find a fine dining Mexican restaurant with great food. I am from down state NY and every time I go up to the city I HAVE to pass by this restaurant. My boyfriend was born and raised in Mexico City and said this food is 1000% authentic and made with pure love & thought. If your ever in Brooklyn, NY and craving Mexican food, do yourself a favor and hit this spot up. It's the best I've ever had. Love it! I'll be here next time for brunch
The mole was on point! The food was delicious and beautifully presented. Could've done better on the micheladas however. It was more beer than michelada mix.
Got place with unlimited food and drinks for brunch. Vanessa was a great server and always kept our drinks full and food coming.
No comment

Went for bottomless brunch, a really great value.  Atmosphere was lively but not overcrowded.  The staff was attentive and the food was delicious.  I had been craving chilaquiles and the ones I ordered with verde sauce hit the spot.  Loved that you can try multiple dishes and mix and match.  The red sangria was also crisp, refreshing and not overly sweet.  Will definitely be back!
Food & drinks were good, but service was really sub par. Would go back for cocktails and appetizers, but not again for a full meal.

My wife and I were craving some authentic Mexican food and we stumbled upon, De Mole. Don't get this placed mixed up with Mole.. De Moles staff and chef give care to their food. The flavors are robust and scream with freshness. Give them a go!
Great food! Very friendly service! Get the mole chicken leg with mole! Would def come back

Came for dinner and drinks a couple of weeks ago to catch up with friends. The drinks are amazing - I had two spicy mezcal margaritas and they are strong! I ordered seitan tacos and didn't enjoy them. I asked for no cilantro and it came with a lot of cilantro. I should have stuck to the vegetarian enchiladas which looked great. We ordered queso to share and those were bombs plus they give chips and salsa to start for free. Absolutely love when places do that! Overall the vibes and the drinks were good so giving it a 4 star.

the food was delicious! I had the pork belly tacos and the lobster enchiladas. I'm glad the waiter ( I believe his name is Jesus) recommended these dishes. The drinks were also pretty good, I would recommend the strawberry margarita!

Went here for dinner after my friends and I saw all the good reviews it had. We started with the guacamole, then got the tampiquena steak, the pollo con mole, and one of their specials pollo con salsa roja. The guacamole was okay. It had too much onion, cilantro and tomato and not enough avocado (pic attached). It wasn't really flavorful and not spicy at all. The mole was good and my friend loved her steak. I got the pollo with salsa roja served over a plantain mash and bacon pieces. It was good but not great. The chicken was lightly breaded and fried, not grilled as they had stated. The mash was yummy and I could taste the bacon, plus the fried onions added a nice touch. The dish was good but my only real complaint was the quality of the chicken, it was stringy and some parts were tough even though it was supposed to be chicken breast. I had to keep looking for the softer parts to get a good bite. We got the tres leches cake for dessert which was okay, not too impressive. I do wonder which milks they used because it tasted a lot like lactose rather than a sweet almost vanilla like flavor. Both the banana and blackberries it was served with as garnish were not sweet or ripe. Although the staff was very friendly service was very slow and it was very cold even though we were seated inside. The agua de tamarindo was spot on and tasted very authentic, next time I just have to ask for less ice because it was definitely too much. Overall the experience was good but the food did not live up to the hype.

Ask for Manny! He is beyond and provided amazing service, food was perfection and ambiance was very fun and fitting. Just moved into the neighborhood and will definitely be back. Manny and Uri were so so sweet and fun. Definitely ask for them!
Wonderful bottomless brunch with our waitress Vanessa! Good drinks, good food, what more

Flavors are still on point and they have added more selections to the menus so that's 5 stars. This update is for delivery only. Not sure what kind of joke it was to put three chips for an order of ceviche but it was not amusing. Then the entre came with 1/3 of rice and beans.... just don't do delivery if this is what you five to patrons. With that said now I know never do delivery. You've been warned o_O
Food was good, service was a little slow. I enjoyed my nachos and the atmosphere was nice
No comment
No comment
This place is awesome. I had the spinach enchiladas. So good. Cute place. Service is perfectly good

Surprisingly not good. Especially with the good reviews, I expected really good, well seasoned, authentic Mexican food. Instead, my guacamole was flavorless. The Tex-mex fajita was dry and under seasoned. I could not finish my meal. Service was good
No comment
Sat for 20min and didn't even receive water. Left after that. Rude staff. Completely ignored the entire time.
Meh. Prices high and food unexceptional. Guacamole was good but $17. Drinks were weak. Chicken fajitas were dry. Carnitos tacos ($7 each) were mostly fat. Nice decor but overall not recommended.

Went to De Mole for brunch with cousins and a friend. Bottomless food and drinks for 2 hours. Walked out feeling full and nice! Ordered carnitas hash, chicken tinga tostadas, sopes con pato and washed it down with more than a hand full of peach bellini's and a shot of tequila! Well worth it!!!

This place was great! My friends and I went for their bottomless brunch! The foods and drinks were great. It's rare to find a spot like this in Brooklyn so I'm so glad we chose this place! They also played reggaeton the entire time we were there which was definitely a plus!
No comment

Absolutely loved the atmosphere, music, service and drinks. However, the manager Sean was very rudely trying to kick our party out. We had stayed five minutes beyond our allotted time however we still had full drinks and a last course on the table! There were several other open tables and no line out the door. Everything else was beautiful! But the last few minutes were unfortunate. Just upper management things‍
No comment

We stumbled across this restaurant , and had the most amazing experience. Not only do they have bottomless food and drinks Sundays, But our server Uri was one of the most authentic, genuine servers I've ever had here in New York. This place cares about their customers and the quality of their Mexican food (coming from someone from Southern California who) is amazing!
Great food and great service, will definitely go again.  The Nachos and Margaritas were to die for. I tried the Tres Leches cake and churros, both delicious.
Best Mexican delivery in Brooklyn. The burritos are great. Try everything. It's always so consistent and travels well. Never ate there but would like to judging by how good the delivery is.

I don't recommend brunch here. $45 for bottomless brunch. It's cool that they have unlimited food too-however on a slow day, Sunday July 4th...order allllll of your dishes at once because they take a really long time to bring it out (you have a 2hr limit to order the tapas sized dishes). I'm Yerma of drinks...again part of the 45 dollar price-you wait really long between drinks. Oh and don't order the margaritas they are 90% acidity and the rest *maybe* tequila. I really wanted to like this place. My real score is 2.5 starts. Step your game up De Mole you do have potential. I changed it to 2 stars a few minutes later when I received  a really cold steak taco.

Bottoms up! My friend wanted to try a bottomless brunch. Luckily the first place they wanted to go was so packed we had to find another option. De mole not only has bottomless boozy brunch but also bottomless food. Whut!!? It's a steal. Drink offerings ramge from mimosas to margaritas, bloody marys and more. The food options are so delicious. I loved the queso fundido and I am not a queso lover. The tostadas, tacos and gorditas were delish. We will be back! Our server and everyone who helped up were amazing and attentive. Never an empty drink. And food came out fast.
Came in for the bottomless brunch for my birthday and I had an amazing time. The food was great the drinks were great and the music they played was also great!

Had a reservation here for a friend's birthday & the manager was so extremely rude to our party that we left before even ordering. Don't spend money on people who do not know how to treat their customers with respect. Our party was smaller than what the original reservation was for and when we KINDLY asked them to accommodate the manager yelled at us as if we aren't all adults. Disgusting behavior.
My go to for Mexican take out. Love their tamales and chicken tacos. They taste just like Mexico. Get the salsa on the side and you will be happy.
No comment

Excellent place. Enjoyable experience all around from Chef's playlist to the food! Margaritas were on point. I requested a spicy one and that's exactly what I got plus the buzz! I particularly liked the pineapple and pork tacos! Only good things!
Very bland and overpriced. Guac portion was tiny. Baja tacos had an off taste. Ceviche and enchiladas were ok. Go somewhere else.
No comment
No comment

Wow - De Mole is fantastic! It's hard to find great Mexican food and this place definitely has it. We ordered delivery last night from their website. First time ever we have eaten from here. We were both blown away with our food. The dishes were well prepared and packaged, the food outstanding! So many fresh flavors with each bite. I was so upset when we finished our food and was tempted to order more! Overall, great experience and I'm so excited to try more of their dishes. Highly recommend!

Had my friends huge group birthday brunch here (took up the entire inside space) and the service and food were IMPECCABLE! Couldn't recommend enough! Delicious amazing food and attentive service! Wonderful staff and ambience 12/10 recommend!

I really enjoyed my brunch experience here. The food choices were really good and I liked the drinks. I would say that since it was a quiet Sunday, the service was my favorite part of the day. I will def be returning to this place for brunch again!
No comment

Came here for bottomless brunch today. Manny make the experience A+. He even offered us drinks to go when our two hours ended. There was a great variety of food and I left stuffed. Will definitely be back!
No comment
No comment
No comment
Such good bright and sunny vibes here! I enjoyed the food, I ordered the chicken burrito and it tasted wonderfully authentic. Will be returning soon :)
No comment

This place quickly became our favorite Mexican restaurant- wish we could bring it back home with us. Great indoor and patio vibe. The chips and salsa are delicious. My favorite dish is the verde enchiladas. They were able to make them cheese for the vegetarian in our group.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

My meal here was good but it could have been better. It's a cute little restaurant but wasn't busy at all when we went Sunday night. Even though it was dead, the food took a long time to come out in my opinion. I enjoyed all my appetizers: chips and guacamole, chicken nachos, and calamari. They were all read tasty although for the price I wish the guacamole and nachos were bigger. I had the fish tacos for entree and it was just lacking in flavor. It was just bland fish batter. I soaked it with all the sauces they provided but it still was not quite right. Others in my party enjoyed their entrees so it could have been an off night for the fish tacos. The enchiladas looked really good. I tried the tres leche cake for dessert which was really good, probably the highlight of my meal.
No comment

Really fun brunch, great service, but only ok food. If you're from the somewhere with good Mexican food prepare to be disappointed because the food here is good for NYC, but sub-par for California-standards
They're delicious. Not a lot of vegetarian options but the stuff they did have was great
No comment
No comment
No comment

I NEVER complain, but the service was terrible and in my opinion, the food wasn't worth it. I ordered a mezcal drink with hibiscus and raspberry, but was delivered a frozen margarita. I was told this drink is "interchangeable" with their frozen margarita (which makes no sense, it is a completely different drink with different alcohol), but ok. On top of that, I was charged the wrong amount (they added an extra 5 drinks to the tab). It took at least 30 minutes for our waitress to get the manager to come over to our table to help get the check figured out. He told me I was refunded, and then charged me for the correct amount. They could not give me any kind of receipt for my refund, and when I checked my statement the next day I was never given a refund, so I was charged more than double what I should have been. I have been trying to track down someone at the restaurant to help me with this, but cannot get anyone to help. PLEASE if someone from the restaurant can help me get this sorted out I would so appreciate it and will delete my negative review and give the place another chance.

These are the BEST Al Pastor Tacos I've ever had and I'm from California so that is really saying the most. Will be ordering from this place from now on, keep doing what you're doing!! And thank you for the fire food

This restaurant is fantastic! The food is delicious (if you're a ceviche lover, like me please try all of them! They are out of this world). The service is wonderful. I've been there 4 times since July and the waiters remember my drink order and are always very accommodating and friendly. The specials are also fantastic. I was lucky enough to try the tuna ceviche with coconut milk and mango. The prices are reasonable and the atmosphere is also great. They had a bit of outdoor seating prior to the pandemic but have also built a little booth on the street that's decorated nicely and best of all...it's not near any trash! Every person I recommend this restaurant to always wants to go back for more. Go and enjoy yourself.

Honestly one of the best chicken burritos I have had because it was so flavorful. I would give it overall 4.5 just because I think they could make the burritos a little bigger for the price but I thoroughly enjoyed that they also had dairy free sour cream and cheese options - it's hard to find and makes a huge difference. They also make strong but tasty margaritas! The workers were very nice and it was an inviting atmosphere even for a takeout order. Overall, I would come back here and share this place with friends .

I think this is average Mexican food. I've had better enchiladas with more flavor but this is still good. The portions are huge. The fajita combo is nice for those that want a mix of meats and shrimp. They gave us complimentary chips and salsa - the salsa was extremely tasty. I wasn't impressed overall though (and I really wanted to be!)
Best Mexican food/burritos in Williamsburg. Slightly more expensive than the food trucks but very worth it. Also they're really nice.
No comment
Absolutely incredible! Nicest staff and the food was delicious. The mole was next level. I'll definitely be back.
Recently discovered this place and rlly love it! Food is great and staff is super friendly. Kind of become my go to spot to take people for din now!

I had a reservation for my friends birthday. Unfortunately we were late and we asked the manager to accommodate us and instead of doing that he yelled and disrespected us. We left and went to an amazing brunch spot next door. It's called Ten Hope. The service and food there was amazing. The best part was when we we're sitting down eating, the manager from De Mole actually walked past to look inside. I would never recommend De Mole to anyone. They are rude and don't deserve your money.

Visited this spot on a Monday evening and was so pleasantly surprised. The vibe is like being in a friend's home, super chill, laid back, and inviting. We sat by the window because the natural light this place gets is perfect for selfies (and I guess food pics too lol) There's tequila on tap so it's nice and cold, no need to ask them to chill your shots! But everything is super authentic, from the dishes being hand crafted by an artist back in Puebla to the food being family recipes all made with love. It's a hidden gem I'll definitely be frequenting.

I really enjoyed De Mole. This is some of the best Mexican food that I have head in New York and that says a lot considering the amount of places I have been to. This place is really comfortable and bright. I came here for brunch and was very relaxed by the ambiance. The waiter was very kind and attentive. They have a really nice menu with various selections for everyone. I decided to order the chicken verde enchiladas and my company ordered the special of the day which was duck confit enchiladas. I must say that both the chicken and the duck were delicious. The side of rice and beans was wonderful as well. I was not up for drinks that afternoon but they seem to have a really nice bar. Overall the service was fantastic the ambiance was right. I would definitely recommend you try this place out, I know I will definitely be returning myself!

The food is ok but the service is extremely slow. No joke it took 25 minutes for two margaritas then when we where dine with those it took 15 minutes for our waiter to come and ask us if we needed another round and then took another 25 minutes for us to get those. When I complained I was told sorry we are very busy!?!? Wtf?? There are like 4 waiters and only 12 tables!!! Our waiter checked on us twice during our entire time there. After placing order for apps, food and drinks two other waiters came over one after the next asking if we were ready to order. Bottom line there are better Mexican placing in WillyB. Skip this one.
The food surprised me. So good! Drinks were okay. And the staff were so friendly. I would go back again.
No comment

I had a great experience at De Mole. They have so many selections and prices are very good. OMG, their Pollo Con Mole Pablano was absolutely delightful, such a fantastic dish with amazing flavors. The crew is really a highlight of this place because they are always quick, polite, and provide service with a smile! It truly was a terrific experience.
Great food and service. I liked the outdoor seating set up. Simple, but well put together.
My friends and I came back and this time had Natalie! She made sure our party was taken care of and was extremely attentive! Highly recommend!
No comment

Celebrated my sister's bday dinner here. We all had a great time but I am giving 4 stars because food lacked flavor and drinks were on the weak side. We ordered sangria pitcher and it was watered down. Very small piece of steak. Chicken Mole was okay. Tacos and quesadilla were tasty so I guess it depends what you order.
No comment

We were excited for takeout from this restaurant based on the great reviews.  Very disappointing!  We had chicken mole and enchiladas with mole.  It all tasted like the food had sat around.  Rice and beans were good although cold.  Really nothing special at all in a neighborhood of stellar restaurants.
This restaurant was absolutely incredible. I would highly recommend the mole chicken with tortillas and beams & rice!

Tacos are good by New York standards (though not spectacular, and they're no California tacos).  But the real reason for my three-star review is that the two times I've come for takeout, the guy at the takeout window hasn't been wearing a mask.  I don't get it.  This is in clear violation of Cuomo's order.  With this happening twice, I won't be going here again until the restaurant can assure that their staff will wear PPE.
We came here when it was pouring on and off and the servers were very attentive. Dog friendly too- they helped out and gave complimentary chips when we got rained on. Food is delicious!
No comment

As a Mexican and from California this is the best authentic Mexican food in greenpoint/Williamsburg area. Every time we try a new Mexican place I am always disappointed, but every dish I've had here feels authentic and worth the price.

All the five star reviews are spot on! This place was awesome. Urie was super nice and we were excited to see that margs were $8 til 7pm! Fun surprise. We ordered nachos at the bar and they came sort of deconstructed. I was sort of bummed they didn't have any visible melty cheese til we dug in... incredible flavor and the cheese was buried underneath. The salsa that comes alongside the chips was also delish. Will def be back for more food. Thank you Urie!

We were so sad that this place wasn't what we were hoping. Our table was missing certain dishes and furniture (a chair) for our reservation, and the service while fine, was quite lackadaisical. The main issue was the food however, which was pretty expensive and tasted watered down and from the supermarket. Especially the guac which did not have fresh avocados and was priced as if it did, and the beans which were unsalted. I understand that this place has bottomless alcohol, so if that's what you want definitely come, however don't come for the food. I hate being negative and i hole they thrive moving forward
No comment
No comment
Love De Mole. Love the food. Love the staff. Quaint and authentic atmosphere. Don't hesitate.
No comment
Some of the BEST MEXICAN food I've ever had! Even though it gets busy, the wait staff is very kind and willing to accommodate. Can't wait to pay my second visit very soon.
Mahi mahi tacos were great, but the chips and salsa portions are ridiculously small - like a splash of salsa and 5 chips with charges for refills.
No comment

I moved into the neighborhood a few weeks ago and walked past De Mole a handful of times, and was always made curious by their neon lighting. After realizing that they had Delirium Tremens on draft, I insisted to my girlfriend that we had to go. We met up with some friends there the other day and we all had a great time. The drinks were affordable and the food was excellent. I had a chicken quesadilla -- which was affordable priced and extremely tasty. My girlfriend had a chicken burrito, which she also enjoyed. We look forward to returning!
No comment
I came here with three friends and we were REALLY hungry. The guacamole and chips were good. My fish tacos were incredible. We all loved our margaritas. Our waiter was friendly.

Just had brunch here and it was lovely. I think This is some of the best Mexican in the area.  Calm vibe, no music blasting so it's easy to have a conversation. The food was really good and very vegetarian friendly. I had the mushroom enchiladas and would recommend. The service was also very nice. They have a two hour bottomless brunch for 45$ with unlimited food and drink which I will defs be back to try.
No comment
bland food. everything tastes the same. nothing is seasoned. ceviche was the only good item

I want to continue supporting immigrant businesses but PLEASE MAKE SURE YOUR EMPLOYEES HANDLING TAKEOUT WEAR MASKS!!! This is a crucial time to be extra sanitary especially when the governor has even mandated people to wear masks. The food is good but nothing special. However, the portions are very generous!

The food was amazing!! They had a few vegan options, so I got the Seitan Fajitas and I highly recommend them. Our server was extremely attentive, and very friendly! One of the best I've ever had honestly. The food tasted fresh and it was hot. I'd tell anyone who visits Brooklyn to eat here.

De Mole is my all time favorite Mexican restaurant in Williamsburg! Everything I have gotten here is super tasty! You can tell that there ingredients are super fresh. The staff that work at De Mole are friendly and helpful. Out of all the restaurants in Williamsburg, I would say this is my number one go-to place! I order directly over the phone to give them the most business I can instead of ordering through seamless. My favorite item to get is the veggie burrito and my boyfriend loved the de mole chicken. Definitely try this place!!

Awesome tacos, margaritas and salads. We found this place at least a half year ago and have had a consistently great experience. Shout out to Manny, one of the most pleasant and professional waiters I've ever met. You make every visit extra special.

Decided to try this place based on the already great reviews and it didn't disappoint! It feels like a little vacation to Mexico- the music and decor is on par. But more importantly the food and the service is truly a great dining experience. I LOVE Mexican food and if I lived in Williamsburg, there is no doubt that this would be my spot!!
No comment

Came here last week to check out the new spot on the block, I was pleasantly surprise. To start with the service is very warm and welcoming but the food here is amazing. For starters I had the fish ceviche, it came out super fresh and juicy, its a must to try it out. For entrees I had the mole enchiladas, all I can say is wow. There was nothing bland about this special sauce, you can taste all the complex flavors and spices that go into it. My waiter, Uriel, explained to me how it takes them 3 days to make because it has over 20 ingredients. You could tell they put in hard work. For dessert I had the churros, they were nice and crispy on the outside and warm and soft to the bite. Overall I'm glad to have this cozy Mexican spot in the neighborhood, I'm sure you'll appreciate it too. Will sure come back to try out the rest of the menu.
No comment
No comment

Delicious food with many vegan options. Service was quick and say. Would definitely go back here for the enchiladas! Not too bad of a wait either, on a Saturday night. Slightly off the beaten path so not as packed.

de Mole is a new restaurant on my block. It's my second time here (the margs are solid). I had taqueria last time which were great, and this time the al pastor tacos, also  great. The dining room is sunny and warm and the staff is friendly. I wish this New Mexican spot the best!

This place has become one of our go to places for Mexican food.  Authentic cooking and drinks.  My wife loves the Jalapeño margarita, which is made spicy, to her liking.  Just ask for the jalapeño pepper to be muddled if you like that extra spice.  I like the cold draft beer they have on tap.  The ambience is nice as the music played is from the chef's playlist.  The service is very good.  If you want or need something, just ask, they are very accommodating and very friendly.
From the guacamole to the yummy salsa, the AMAZING SEITAN BURRITO (I got real cheese in it). SOOO GOOOOOODD!!!! Husband got the enchiladas and he scrapped it up to finish it. Please come here.
The food and drinks are amazing. The staff are friendly. This is worth the trip to Williamsburg and I will definitely be back! I'm excited to try their chilaquiles!

Finally some real authentic Mexican food in Williamsburg. Come for the food. Stay for the playlist and the sweet and attentive staff.  I want to tell everyone how good the food was and how much I enjoyed this place but I'm afraid of people discovering this hidden gem and then I'll have to wait hours for a table.

Last Sunday was my first time at Hope str "De Mole"; was hat an amazing experience!! The place was beautiful, the food was authentic; We order the seviche Salmon, an taquitos de pollo to star, then I had the carne asada sincronizada and it was delicious; let's don't forget about the drinks, REAL margaritas, let's drink every day all day!!!! Love the place, I'm sure I'll be back soon!

What a great surprise this restaurant turned out to be. We stopped for lunch recently and ordered red wine sangria (great taste and kick), ceviche Veracruzano (perfect citrus mix), and a slice of Tres Leches cake (delicious). The presentation of the food was simple and clear, and it complemented  well the mix of fresh ingredients which yield complex and sophisticated flavors. Attentive and courteous service made it a memorable meal experience. I look forward to returning for another meal.
I am not strictly vegan but their vegan burrito is SO GOOD. Ambience is cute and cozy and has a family feel.

What can I say, this place is amazing! I had the chocolate BBQ Baby Back Ribs for appetizer and it was delicious. The sauce tastes similar to the mole sauce and the meat slips right off the bone which makes it easier to eat. For entrèe, I had the Tinga De Puebla, its nice and tender especially with the fresh Avocado and cheese. The last item I had was one of the desserts called Cinnamon Foam Flan, its server warm with the caramelized apple and cookie crumbs and the foam flan on top of it. Its flavor is perfect for a chilly October day. The staff are really friendly and I gotta say, it felt like i was right at home. If you like to try something different, I recommend trying the specials that they have. You may never know what kind of surprises you might find. I will definitely come back! :)

New to the neighborhood, my girlfriend and I were looking for a new go-to spot. We're looking no longer. The service and food is A+. These folks will take good care of you. Well worth your time to visit.
The service was great and the margaritas were even better!!! Vegetarian option, and the seitan fajitas we deeeeelicious!!

Stumbled upon this hidden Williamsburg gem drawn in by  the mesmerizing scarlet neon sign like a fly to a zapper. At first glance it seems as one more establishment all neat & clean. But if you take a second look you might meet Daniel who runs the restaurant along side his father who happen to built the place. By the time you are reading this review I probably have tried about 2/3s  of the menu, but what ties dinner all together for me would be the savory yet light & fluffy tres leches cake. Daniel has to wait all year for his birthday to get a slice but you can have one for dessert. Needless to say the specials they run if you're lucky enough to have one plated are sure to leave you as I, speechless! Great food & Great service ran by family for they're Brooklyn extended family.
Our favorite spot in nyc. We live close by and go all the time. Great staff and even better food. The drinks are made fresh and the food is out of this world.

Came here a few weeks ago and just getting around to writing a review. The place is cute inside and the service was very pleasant. Boyfriend and I both ordered the enchiladas mole. While it was definitely freshly made and edible, we both found the sauce super bland - especially for a restaurant with Mole in it's name. I don't think I'd come back.
A very nice find on my last visit to the area. Fresh tasting food, great guacamole! And a welcoming staff. I'll definitely be back.
No comment

Wow!!! So so amazing. My boyfriend and I are huge lovers of Mexican food and culture. The food and mole is on point! I don't eat meat and had shrimp enchiladas with mole - they were sooo good. We were both blown away by the cocktails being lovers of good drinks. Margaritas are the best I've had so far in NY and the "Penicilina" cocktail was mind blowing - they manage there own ginger syrups and recipes. Highly recommend! We sat at the bar for a more engaging experience with the staff.
Ate here a while ago. It's a small spot but the food was delicious. Prices are very good too!

Great new Mexican restaurant in BK. Authentic tasting food and good sauces. The rice was very flavorful. The ceviche was amazing, tart but not too acidic. The creamyness of the avocados really made it and the texture of the scallops really complimented it. Also the chips were awesome. Huevos con chorizo was very good quality and tasty. The pork torta was something new I've never had but the meat was a bit dry, otherwise very good. Service was good but a little slow. Makes sense for a newer restaurant. Would come back.
Cute little place. Had the Baja Tacos, Guac and chips. Everything was fantastic. Will go back.

I don't even understand all of these other reviews. We had the most awful Mexican food ever. Service was mediocre at best and apparently the chef doesn't know what salt is. Everything was extremely bland and poor quality ingredients. The guacamole was oily like they add mayonnaise or something to it, and the fajitas were so dry, which is just mind boggling. Avoid this place.

Finally found a great Mexican spot in Williamsburg! De Mole is a large restaurant featuring an extensive menu and a nice-casual vibe. I got a chicken burrito smothered in green sauce, delicious and a good sized portion for the price. They do tend to go heavy handed on the cocktails which some will appreciate, some will not but you are for sure getting bang for your buck. Our server was nice and helpful and overall my friend and I had a really nice experience. Will be back to try some other menu items for sure.

One of the best steaks I've ever had.  Spicy and juicy.  I had the NY Steak. We also had a stuffed pepper with meat and an almond sauce with pomegranate seeds. It was a special but I hope they serve it more.
I had chicken tacos which came really dry. I would expect some salsas offer, but I had to ask for it and still it wasn't what I'd expect from tacos. :-/ shame I was looking forward to it.

some of the best mexican food I think i've ever had!! dare i say!! margaritas were also absolutely outstanding! we did takeout bc of Covid but the restaurant itself looked so nice and inviting, and we hope to go again and eat in post-covid!
No comment

Stumbled on this place the other night and my husband and I had dinner here. The food was delicious! We had the nachos to start. Then the chicken tacos and chicken enchiladas for our entree. Loved the tacos more but both were tasty and the nachos were a great way to start the meal. Very friendly waitstaff. Only complaint was there was no AC and it was a very hot summer day. But we will definitely be returning!

column3: South of Market, San Francisco, CA
column6: The chicken in their mole sauce was delicious. The mole is cooked over 3 days! One of the best lunches I have had in a while
Best Mexican food in Brooklyn. Get the chicken taquitos, any of their special drinks and coconut flan!
Very good! Fast service, quality food! We got a steak quesadilla and a chicken burrito and both were delicious.

Decided to try this place based on the already great reviews and it didn't disappoint! It feels like a little vacation to Mexico- the music and decor is on par. But more importantly the food and the service is truly a great dining experience. I LOVE Mexican food and if I lived in Williamsburg, there is no doubt that this would be my spot!!

The drink menu is impeccably crafted and quite refreshing! The food is delicious, appetizers as well as entrees! The tres leches cake is one of  the best I've ever had in a restaurant!!  We will definitely come again!!
Best new spot in town. Definitely get the mole burrito. I'm sure everything is great as well.
Excellent service and delicious food. We were surprised of how inexpensive high quality food this place offers. They also give complimentary chips and salsa. Atmosphere is very nice as well

By far the best mexican food I've had in New York - and I'm originally from LA so I know what I'm talking about. When we first walked in we were the only ones in there and I was a little suspect. But we're so glad we stayed since the food was fantastic and the margarita was also fantastic. We will definitely be back!
Decent Mexican food, not the best I've ever had but I appreciate the Vegetarian options.

The food was delicious, I ordered shrimp tacos and was not disappointed! My husband and his friend had the chicken mole and I know they absolutely loved it because there plate was completely empty. They also have really great margaritas, and I know for a fact they change it up. Which is awesome! (You get to try something new every time)

If you're looking for a quick and flavorful restaurant De Mole is not the place. Our order (Baja, Steak, Chicken Tacos along with some guacamole and calamari) took well over 45 minutes. With the wait, the food came out fresh but not juicy/flavorful at all. Would not recommend. The best part of our experience was the friendly staff.
No comment
No comment

No comment

No comment
